productType.description: Is an object that is utilized with a Pipettor.
A medical instrument used by practitioners to test deep tendon reflexes.
A narrow-necked glass container, typically conical or spherical, used in a laboratory to hold reagents or samples.
A medical device for neurological use. The wheel was designed to test nerve reactions as it rolled systematically across the skin.
Lab equipment that uses steam, pressure and time to sterilize lab media including glassware, instruments and biological waste.
A type of pump device that draws gas particles from a sealed volume in order to leave behind a partial vacuum.

A tool similar to a camera to allow for inspection of skin lesions unobstructed by skin surface reflections. The dermatoscope consists of a magnifier, a light source, a transparent plate and sometimes a liquid medium between the instrument and the skin

Reagent bottles, also known as media bottles or graduated bottles, are containers made of glass, plastic, borosilicate or related substances, and topped by special caps or stoppers. They are intended to contain chemicals in liquid or powder form for laboratories and stored in cabinets or on shelves.

An electroscope is a scientific instrument used to detect the presence of electric charge on a body. A Van de Graaff generator is an electrostatic generator which uses a moving belt to accumulate electric charge on a hollow metal globe on the top of an insulated column, creating very high electric potentials.
In laboratory equipment, a beaker is generally a cylindrical container with a flat bottom. Most also have a small spout to aid pouring.
A motor-driven precision pump that uses one or more syringes to deliver precise and accurate amounts of fluid in high-impact research environments.
Pipette Tips are disposable, autoclavable attachments for the uptake and dispensing of liquids using a pipette.
Is an object that is utilized with a Homogenizer.
A laboratory device for quantitative chemical analysis to determine the concentration of an identified analyte.
Vials are small containers, typically cylindrical, often made of glass, and generally found in laboratory or medical institution settings.
A hygroscopic substance that is used to induce or sustain a state of dryness in its vicinity

A pipettor is a pipetting aids or pipette controllers that allow you to easily draw samples into a pipette and stop contamination risk, reduce hand fatigue, and even decrease stress during long working hours.
Laboratory dispensing bottles provide a controlled means by which to apportion liquids and solutions.
Filters used in a laboratory environment.
A piece of laboratory or industrial equipment used for the homogenization of various types of material, such as tissue, plant, food, soil, and many others.

A laboratory device that employs a rotating magnetic field to cause a stir bar immersed in a liquid to spin very quickly, thus stirring it. The rotating field may be created either by a rotating magnet or a set of stationary electromagnets, placed beneath the vessel with the liquid.
X-ray film or nuclear emulsion produced by the pattern of decay emissions from a distribution of a radioactive substance.
Sealable enclosures containing desiccants used for preserving moisture-sensitive items such as cobalt chloride paper for another use.
A wash bottle is a squeeze bottle with a nozzle, used to rinse various pieces of laboratory glassware, such as test tubes and round bottom flasks. Wash bottles are sealed with a screw-top lid.
A kind of ambient air gas burner used as laboratory equipment; it produces a single open gas flame, and is used for heating, sterilization, and combustion.
Accessories used with an Autoclave.
A jelly-like substance consisting of polysaccharides obtained from the cell walls of some species of red algae, primarily from "ogonori" and "tengusa".
A classifier for items in "Lab Equipment" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A pipette is a laboratory tool commonly used in chemistry, biology and medicine to transport a measured volume of liquid, often as a media dispenser.
Systems that use a technique used to separate molecules in a gel or fluid using an electric field.
Accessories used with desiccators.
Laboratory equipment made from a container filled with heated water. It is used to incubate samples in water at a constant temperature over a long period of time.
Laboratory equipment rack or holder designed to hold multiple test tubes upright.
Containers used to collect specimens for a lab environment.
Apparatus that removes water or organic solvents from lab samples.
Objects used for distillation in a lab environment.
Lab incubator accessories are a variety of products used to customize, improve and maintain your incubator
A lab incubator is an insulated box used to grow and maintain microbiological or cell cultures
A rigid container with a typical capacity of 4 to 60 litres. Carboys are primarily used for transporting liquids, often drinking water or chemicals.
Material used to pack a Lab Chromatography Column.
Lab microplates are plates designed to hold microliter aliquots
Glassware washers used in a lab environment.
A piece of laboratory equipment used to apply heat to containers, as an alternative to other forms of heated bath.
Unevenly shaped piece of substance added to liquids to make them boil more calmly.
TLC plates in Lab Chromatography
Laboratory apparatus used to condense vapors – that is, turn them into liquids – by cooling them down.
The TLC developing tanks in Lab Chromatography.
The solid phases in Lab Chromatography
A classifier for items in "Labware" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A lab shaker is a machine used to perform a shaking action of more than one ingredient so it ends up a homogenous mixture
Lab shaker accessories are parts such as clamps, flask clamps, modular blocks that assist or work with the lab shaker
A lab vacuum chamber is a rigid enclosure from which air and gases are removed by a vacuum pump
A device which is installed in a tank or container to heat a liquid in a lab environment.
Tool for heating round bottomed flasks, tubes and vials.
A thermal cycler is a machine used to amplify segments of DNA. The device has a thermal blocks with holes where tubes holding the PCR reaction mixtures can be inserted
Labware Closures is intended to provide a collection point for the varied array of laboratory container lids, stoppers, and caps available.
Lab Chromatography paper is paper used to separate chemicals based on their different properties
A lab sample bag are tear and puncture resistant plastic bags used to collect and contain samples of solids and liquids for laboratory tests.
Chromatography columns are pieces of glassware that help you separate chemical compounds, used in liquid and gas chromatography
A device that uses centrifugal force to subject a specimen to a specified constant force, for example to separate various components of a fluid.
Furnaces used in a lab environment.
Glassware used in a lab environment.
A lab vacuum trap is a thick walled conical shaped with flat bottom flask, tapered neck and side arm used in vacuum filtration.
A lab supply dispenser is a common lab instrument used to dispense precise amounts of chemicals.
A laboratory equipment that is usually used in titration experiments to measure the amount of a chemical.
A pen recorder is a device which functions both as a pen and a recorder for audio, video, or both.
An electronic instrument that captures and displays multiple signals from a digital system or digital circuit.
Instrument that measures the magnitude of an input signal versus frequency within the full frequency range of the instrument.
Temperature indicators are installation instruments which can process signals from temperature sensors and show them on the display.

A light-sensitive device used to determine or specify colors.  It is also used for measuring the transmittance and absorbance of light.  Some colorimeters can also find the concentration of a substance in solution, based on the intensity of color of the solution.
A thermographic camera is a device that creates an image using infrared radiation, similar to a normal camera that forms an image using visible light.
Instruments used to measure resistance or capacitance in electric circuits.
Component Testers is a device that finds the defects in the module and verifies the functioning of software.
An electromechanical device that records an electrical or mechanical input trend onto a piece of paper.
A device used to make measurements or to display certain dimensional information.
A thermohygrometer is used to determine the humidity, and it can measure temperature and humidity at the same time.
A device that records the amount of sunshine at a given location or region at any time.
Metal or ceramic blocks that have been precision ground and lapped to a specific thicknesses.
A pressure transducer that converts pressure into an analog electrical signal based on the amount of pressure applied over liquids or gasses.
A test probe is a physical device used to connect electronic test equipment to a device under test (DUT).
An instrument used to make a cyclically moving object appear to be slow-moving, or stationary.
Accessories used with gage blocks.
The vibration meter is used as a hand-held measuring device for the individual assessment of vibrations on machines and systems.
Instruments used for indirect calibration methods and periodic daily inspection of hardness testing instruments.
A measuring instrument that can measure the electrical property of resistance.
Instruments that are used to measure pressure, which is the force exerted by a gas or liquid per unit surface area owing to the effects of the weight of that gas or liquid from gravity.
A device that indicates the hardness of a material, usually by measuring the surface effect of a localized penetrating force.

An electronic device that records data over time or in relation to location either with a built in instrument or sensor or via external instruments and sensors. Increasingly, but not entirely, they are based on a digital processor, and called digital data loggers.
Optical device which can be used for visual inspection of inaccessible work areas.
A chart recorder is a device that reads and draws inputs onto a rolling piece of paper. The inputs are entered onto the paper with one or more pens of varying colors.
Precision ground balls in specific accurately made diameters.
Rod shaped instruments used for checking the calibration of other measuring tools, usually calipers or micrometers.
Precision metalworking jigs typically used to hold round metal rods or pipes for performing calibration activities.

Inspection mirrors generally take the form of a mirror affixed to the end of a handle or telescopic rod.  This allows the user to position the mirror in such a manner as to make visible those areas that would otherwise be obscured or beyond normal lines of sight.  These items are often used at security checkpoints to provide visibility underneath and above vehicles.

Solar radiation sensors also known as pyranometers. A type of actinometer, these devices are used for measuring broadband solar irradiance as well as solar radiation flux density, they measure the power of the light and heat from the sun.

Bench top power supplies are commonly found in circuit design labs, educational establishments, and electronics repair facilities.
They are generally designed to provide either alternating current, direct current or a combination of both, at various voltages, with the electrical input being supplied by a domestic 110 or 240 volt ring main, depending upon region.
A classifier for items in "Test & Measurement Equipment" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Accessories for an oscilloscope.
Instruments that measure ambient electromagnetic fields using particular sensors or probes.
Instruments that locate, identify, and match wires to their corresponding circuit breakers in panel boxes.
Thermowells are cylindrical fittings used to protect temperature sensors installed in industrial processes.
Micrometer heads are precision gauges mounted to machine tools, fixtures, tables, and other positioning equipment for measuring absolute and relative length or distances.

Multifunction gas concentration analysis tool typically used to calculate the efficiency of boilers, heaters and furnaces by measuring a range of parameters such as stack temperature, flue pressure and levels of gases.
A piece of electronic test equipment or software used to generate different types of electrical waveforms over a wide range of frequencies.
A device incorporating a calibrated screw widely used for accurate measurement of components.

Frequency counters are an electronic instrument, or component of one, that is used for measuring frequency.  A pulse generator is either an electronic circuit or a piece of electronic test equipment used to generate rectangular pulses.
An oscilloscope is a type of electronic test instrument that graphically displays varying electrical voltages as a two-dimensional plot of one or more signals as a function of time.
An instrument which measures the humidity of air or some other gas.
Tattoo Ink Cups contain and assist in dispensing tattoo ink.

Tattoo needles are used to pierce the skin to create a tattoo. Tattoo needles come in many different shapes and sizes to achieve the desired effect of the tattoo design. Some of the common tattooing needles are round, flat, magnum, and bugpin.
A tattooable sheet or body part form made of either silicone or a synthetic material for tattooing practice.

Tattoo inks consist of pigments combined with a carrier, used in the process of tattooing to create a tattoo in the skin. Most tattoo inks are permanent, some are semi-permanent and temporary tattoo inks

A tattoo gun is a machine that is a hand-held device generally used to create a tattoo, a permanent marking of the skin with indelible ink. Modern tattoo machines use electromagnetic coils to move an armature bar up and down. Connected to the armature bar is a barred needle grouping that pushes ink into the skin.
A building material used for wall coverings or display fixtures made with horizontal grooves that are configured to accept a variety of merchandising accessories.

A hand dryer is an electric machine which might make use of a heating element and an air blower to dry the hands after hand washing. It is commonly used in public toilets as a cost-effective alternative to paper towels. It may either operate with the push of a button or automatically using a sensor.
A sculpture of a person's head, shoulders, and chest used to display necklaces.
A stanchion is an upright bar, post, or frame forming a support or barrier, and often with a roping to connect the other stanchions.
A poly bag dispenser is a dispenser that allows the removal of one poly bag at a time.

Janitor/housekeeper's carts are often referred to as the janitor/housekeeper's rolling office. In most cases, they are the only real workspace they have. If well-designed and well-stocked, they can carry just about every tool a cleaning worker usually needs to perform their job.
Shelving specifically designed to fit into the grooves of a slatwall.
Sanitary napkin receptacles are installed in restrooms to help ensure personal hygiene products are disposed of in the trash rather than being flushed down the toilet.

A recycling bin is a container used to hold recyclables before they are taken to recycling centers. Recycling bins exist in various sizes for use inside and outside homes, offices, and large public facilities.
A metal grid that can be hung on a wall or mounted in a base and is used for displaying goods.

A retail display case (also called showcase, display cabinet) is a cabinet, with one or often more transparent tempered glass (or plastic, normally acrylic for strength) surfaces, often specifically used to display objects for viewing within retail setting.

A wheeled cart supplied by a shop or store, especially supermarkets, for use by customers inside the premises for transport of merchandise as they move around the premises, while shopping, prior to heading to the checkout counter, cashiers or tills.

An automated machine that dispenses items such as snacks, beverages, cigarettes, and lottery tickets to consumers after cash, a credit card, or other forms of payment are inserted into the machine or otherwise made.

A display case (also called showcase, display cabinet, shadow box, or vitrine) is a cabinet with one or often more transparent tempered glass (or plastic, normally acrylic for strength) surfaces, used to display objects for viewing. A display case may appear in an exhibition, museum, retail store, restaurant, or house.
The foundation or lowest part of a structure attached to a gridwall panel.

A poly bag is a type of bag made of thin, flexible, plastic film, nonwoven fabric, or plastic textile used for containing and transporting goods such as foods, produce, powders, ice, magazines, chemicals, and waste.

Bench and booth seating is a stylish seating solution for restaurant spaces, cafes, bars, and nightclubs. Whereas Banquettes or fixed seating creates are space-saving, cosy, intimate seating booths for guests to eat, drink and enjoy their time privately.
Boxes that enable kitchen staff members to package up foods for individual purchase, bulk retail, or catering applications.
Oxygen absorbers are made to add to sealed products to minimize spoilage.
A dummy of a human form used to display clothes in a store.
Weights used to check the reading of scale, to make sure it is still accurate.
An instrument that measures weak emissions of visible light coming from a sample, by means of a photomultiplier tube.

Instruments used to measure more than one electrochemical parameter; may include methods for pH, conductivity, temperature, ion-specific concentrations, dissolved oxygen, turbidity, resistivity, mV, TDS, salinity, and barometric pressure
An instrument used for measuring density or relative density of liquids based on the concept of buoyancy.
A device for measuring the osmotic strength of a solution, colloid, or compound.
A pH meter is a scientific instrument that measures the hydrogen-ion activity in water-based solutions, indicating its acidity or alkalinity expressed as pH.
Device for the quantitative measurement of the reflection or transmission properties of a material as a function of wavelength.
A laboratory or field device for the measurement of an index of refraction. The index of refraction is calculated from the observed refraction angle using Snell's law.
An instrument for measuring atmospheric pressure, used especially in weather forecasting.
An instrument used to measure the viscosity of a fluid.
A device that measures wind speed and direction.
Ring shaped instruments used for precise depth settings when working with wood, metal or plastic.
A fluorometer is a device used to measure parameters of visible spectrum fluorescence: its intensity and wavelength distribution of emission spectrum after excitation by a certain spectrum of light.

A scientific instrument used to separate and measure spectral components of a physical phenomenon. Spectrometer is a broad term often used to describe instruments that measure a continuous variable of a phenomenon where the spectral components are somehow mixed.
A classifier for items in "Scientific Instruments" that does not have a dedicated PT.
pH strips are pieces of paper that change color depending on the pH.
An object used for calorimetry, or the process of measuring the heat of chemical reactions or physical changes as well as heat capacity.
A solid, flat plate used as the main horizontal reference plane for precision inspection, marking out, and tooling setup.
A device that applies an electrical field to cells in order to increase the permeability of the cell membrane.
A gas monitor is a device that detects the presence of gases in an area, often as part of a safety system.
Device used to measure the cloudiness or haziness of a fluid caused by large numbers of individual particles that are generally invisible to the naked eye, similar to smoke in air.

Shim stock is thin precision stock material from which custom shims can be cut. It is a versatile material that can easily be cut to specific sizes using scissors or metal shears. Shim stock is typically used for support, leveling, and fit adjustment.
A loose granular substance, typically pale yellowish brown, resulting from the erosion of siliceous and other rocks and forming a major constituent of beaches, riverbeds, the seabed, and deserts.
Stone raw, Stone, or Natural Stone, Defined. Natural stone refers to organic rock that is quarried from the earth and used for building or decorative purposes.

Textile raw materials are fibers, either naturally derived or synthetic, that are used to make clothes, blankets, towels and other textile items. Wool and silk are derived from living creatures — sheep and silkworms, respectively — and provide warmth or softness.

Foamcore, foam board, or paper-faced foam board is a lightweight and easily cut material used for mounting of photographic prints, as backing for picture framing, for making scale models, and in painting.

A ceramic is any of the various hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant materials made by shaping and then firing an inorganic, nonmetallic material, such as clay, at a high temperature. Common examples are earthenware, porcelain, and brick.
A metal is a material that, when freshly prepared, polished, or fractured, shows a lustrous appearance, and conducts electricity and heat relatively well. Metals are typically ductile and malleable.
Raw rubber, Rubber, elastic substance obtained from the exudations of certain tropical plants (natural rubber) or derived from petroleum and natural gas (synthetic rubber).

Raw plastics are materials containing the basic properties of the polymer from which they were made. Plastics are a wide range of synthetic or semi-synthetic materials that use polymers as a main ingredient.
Glass is a non-crystalline, often transparent, amorphous solid that has widespread practical, technological, and decorative use in, for example, window panes, tableware, and optics.
Graphite, is a crystalline form of the element carbon. It consists of stacked layers of graphene. Graphite occurs naturally and is the most stable form of carbon under standard conditions.
Textile machines are used in the fabrication and processing of fabrics, textiles, and other woven and non-woven materials. They are used in processes such as spinning, weaving, warping, and dyeing.
Tool for sheet metal processing ideal for detail work and designed to make various bead profiles in sheet metal work for decorative purposes or strengthening.
Also known as a surgical blade is used to cut skin and tissue during a surgical procedure.
A small and extremely sharp bladed instrument used in lab environments.
Spoons, spatulas or scoops used in a lab environment.
A kit with basic instruments to carefully cut into of organisms with tools including dissecting scissors, forceps (or tweezers), scalpels, needles (straight and curved), and pipets.
A tool used to smoothly spread cells and bacteria on a culture plate, such as a petri dish.
Replacement needs for syringes used in a lab environment.
An instrument for measuring particle size and particle size distribution.
A tube used to collect and provide transport for blood and other materials.
Syringes used in a lab environment.
Containers designed to store and dispose of sharps used in a lab environment.

Chemical standards are materials containing a known concentration of an analyte. They provide a reference to determine unknown concentrations or to calibrate analytical instruments. The accuracy of an analytical measurement is how close a result comes to the true value. A standard provides a reference that can be used to determine unknown concentrations or to calibrate analytical instruments.
Chemical solvents –which are generally in liquid form –are used to dissolve, suspend or extract other materials, usually without chemically changing either the solvents or the other materials.

Chemical Bases is a substance that can neutralize the acid by reacting with hydrogen ions. Most bases are minerals that react with acids to form water and salts. Bases include the oxides, hydroxides, calcium carbonate and potassium oxide as an example.

An electrolyte solution is a medium containing ions that is electrically conducting through the movement of those ions, but not conducting electrons. This includes most soluble salts, acids, and bases dissolved in a polar solvent, such as water.

An acid is any substance that in water solution tastes sour, changes blue litmus paper to red, reacts with some metals to liberate hydrogen, reacts with bases to form salts, and promotes chemical reactions (acid catalysis).

A chemical buffer is a solution that can resist pH change upon the addition of an acidic or basic components. It is able to neutralize small amounts of added acid or base, thus maintaining the pH of the solution relatively stable. This is important for processes and/or reactions which require specific and stable pH ranges.

A bioreagent is a reagent that has a biological origin. Enzymes are an example of a bioreagent. There are also Bioreagent Buffer Solutions. A buffer solution is an aqueous solution consisting of a mixture of either a weak acid and its conjugate base or a weak base and its conjugate acid. Bioreagents support molecular biology, protein chemistry, cell biology, and microbiology applications.
A class of balance designed to measure small mass in the sub-milligram range.
Complete systems of wind turbines.
Towers used to mount wind turbines.
Replacement blades for a wind turbine.
The internal motor of a turbine where electricity is generated.

A solar panel is a device that converts sunlight into electricity by using photovoltaic cells. PV cells are made of materials that generate electrons when exposed to light. The electrons flow through a circuit and produce direct current electricity, which can be used to power various devices or be stored in batteries.
An electronic device that converts the energy of light directly into electricity by the photovoltaic effect.
Devices that control the speed of a pneumatic cylinder.
A mechanical device which uses the power of compressed fluid to produce a force in a reciprocating linear motion.

A device designed to make and break an electric current in a circuit. In an industrial system, a flow switch is essential in monitoring and controlling the flow rate of process media - such as steam, liquids, and gases.
A classifier for items in "Hydraulics & Pneumatics" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Sensors are used to detect the linear position of a pneumatic cylinder's piston during operation.

A ceramic-like material with magnetic properties that are useful in many types of electronic devices. Ferrites are hard, brittle, iron-containing, and generally gray or black and are polycrystalline—i.e., made up of a large number of small crystals. They are composed of iron oxide and one or more other metals in chemical combination.

Object made of a piezoelectric material that produces a voltage when they are distorted in shape. A voltage applied will cause a distortion in shape. The crystal is made into a shape that will physically resonate.
Objects used to connect fiber optic cables.

A computer processor where the data processing logic and control is included on a single integrated circuit, or a small number of ICs. The microprocessor contains the arithmetic, logic, and control circuitry required to perform the functions of a computer's central processing unit.
An electric coil, or electromagnetic coil, is an electrical conductor that contains a series of conductive wires wrapped around a ferromagnetic core that is cylindrical, toroidal, or disk-like.
Switches that detect motion or body heat to control power to a device such as a light.
An electrically controlled switch used for switching an electrical power circuit.
A semiconductor device used to amplify or switch electrical signals and power.

A solenoid is a type of electromagnet formed by a helical coil of wire whose length is substantially greater than its diameter, which generates a controlled magnetic field. The coil can produce a uniform magnetic field in a volume of space when an electric current is passed through it.
A class of electronic filter, designed to operate on signals in the megahertz to gigahertz frequency ranges.
Devices that use electronic and mechanical means used to control something else.

A medium used to connect or "wire" components to one another in a circuit. It takes the form of a laminated sandwich structure of conductive and insulating layers: each of the conductive layers is designed with an artwork pattern of traces, planes and other features etched from one or more sheet layers of copper laminated onto and/or between sheet layers of a non-conductive substrate.
An electrical device that is used to start & stop a motor safely.
Input/output (I/O) instruments that provide inputs and outputs to data acquisition devices, programmable logic controllers (PLC), and other computerized machinery.
An integrated circuit used in a variety of timer, delay, pulse generation, and oscillator applications.
The electronic device that harnesses and controls the electrical energy sent to the motor.
An inductor used to block higher-frequency alternating currents while passing direct current and lower-frequency ACs in a circuit.
A specialized microprocessor chip, with its architecture optimized for the operational needs of digital signal processing.
Devices that convert the rotational movement of the shaft into an analogue or digital signal.
An electronic device that reduces the power of a signal without appreciably distorting its waveform.
Semiconductor chips that are used to control and manage the sharing of information between devices.
Electronic devices and systems that find, detect and control light.
Electronic displays that use LEDs, LCDs or other optoelectronics.
A classifier for items in "Electronic Components" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A metal rod intended to be mounted on a structure and intended to protect the structure from a lightning strike.
A device that converts energy from one form to another. Usually a transducer converts a signal in one form of energy to a signal in another.

Drum pumps are fluid transfer pumps that are specifically designed to be used with storage barrels,pails, and drums.
Typically the types of fluid that these pumps are intended to handle are specific to particular pumps.
Devices used to open and close industrial drums and pails.
A classifier for items in "Drum Equipment" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Lids used to seal or closed industrial drums & pails.
Device used to mix the contents of industrial drums or pails.
Heating device used to warm the contents of industrial drums & pails.
In photography and cinematography, a reflector is an improvised or specialized reflective surface used to redirect light towards a given subject or scene.

Photography Lighting Barn Door Frames, there are four different types elements you can use to create a frame within your shot: architectural, natural, geometric shapes, and light/shadow. These are the frame components for use within the lighting barn doors.
Photography light Mounting Hardware supports the custom lighting arrangements that bring film and photography projects to life.

A monolight is a self-contained photographic flash lighting unit usually found in a studio. Each monolight has its own independent power source. It does not depend on a centralized power supply as a "pack and head" system does.

Barn doors are metal flaps that can open and close, covering the left, right, top, and bottom of the light. They are typically used on studio strobes or hot lights. It's the tool you need when you want to create a narrow line of light, either vertical or horizontal.
A studio background, also known as a backdrop, is a surface or material placed behind the subject of a photograph or video.

Photography umbrellas are one of the simplest kinds of light modifiers to use. They are perfect for beginners as they are inexpensive, portable, and efficient. Umbrellas soften and spread the light, allowing for off-camera lighting without harsh shadows.
Constant lighting are Studio Lighting that stays on all the time (as opposed to strobes or speedlights that emit a bright burst of light when triggered).
Articles other than costumes and scenery used in a photograph to impress others or provide a false impression.
Device used to emit bright and quick flash of light that is separate for the camera.
Tables used photographing small to medium objects.

Stock photography is the supply of photographs which are often licensed for specific uses. The stock photo industry, which began to gain hold in the 1920s, has established models including traditional macrostock photography, midstock photography, and microstock photography.
Photography Lighting Weight Bags are useful for weighing down lighting and studio equipment, steadying tripods and other photo and video equipments

Boom Stands are used to hang lights over a subject. Our compact boom stand BS-01 is suitable for supporting a speedlight with softbox attachment or microphones. Our BBS-01 is suitable for a compact flash head with a softbox or constant light softboxes.

A Softbox is a light modifier that confines light from an artificial source into a wire framed box and releases it through a layer of diffusion. Softboxes are commonly used in photography as a soft source of light that minimizes harsh shadows.

The Tent is a high-quality, translucent cloth enclosure for photographing small and medium sized products. It can be lit with daylight, HMI, electronic flash, fluorescent quartz and tungsten light sources.
A lightbox is a translucent surface illuminated from behind, used for situations where a shape laid upon the surface needs to be seen with high contrast.
The user replaceable parts used to fix a drone or quadcopter.
Control system designed to remotely maneuver an aerial drone.
Decals and wraps designed to fit aerial drones.
Component propellers designed for use on aerial drones.
Headset designed to view the images sent from an aerial drone.
Replacement propeller guards for an aerial drone.

Aerial drones are generally small scale, unmanned aircraft, piloted by a remote operator.
There are multiple sub-types of drone, including those built for racing, as camera platforms, and those intended simply to be flown for fun.
The accessories used to personalize or improve a drone or quadcopter
Photo Enlarger Lens Mounts could be rotated to continuously face the light source.

A film squeegee, is a pair of tongs equipped with soft rubber blades or foam pads. Film is pulled between the blades to remove water from the surface after developing. Using a squeegee prevents water droplets from drying on the surface of the film which can cause spots, especially if using hard water for final rinse.
Transparent plastic enclosures that protect negatives and prints from moisture, fingerprints, scratching, dirt and harmful airborne pollutants.

A fan and louver are ventilation products that allow air to pass through it while keeping out unwanted elements such as water, dirt, and debris. A number of fixed or operable blades mounted in a frame can provide this functionality.
These are large closets that warm and dry film. Such dryers are generally found in professional photographic labs.

A safelight is a light source suitable for use in a photographic darkroom. It provides illumination only from parts of the visible spectrum to which the photographic material in use is nearly, or completely insensitive.

Printing tongs are used to handle prints when they are being immersed into chemistry. They are available in stainless steel, plastic or the ever-popular and inexpensive bamboo. As is the case with trays, a set of tongs should be dedicated to each particular chemical.
A darkroom film & print processor is used to process photographic film, to make prints and to carry out other associated tasks.
Developing Tray or Darkroom trays are shallow platform designed for processing of photographic development.

Analyzers quickly and accurately determine correct filtration, contrast and exposure for prints. It saves you the trouble of printing by "trial and error" thereby saving time, paper and ultimately, money.

Enlargers are vertically mounted with the head pointing downward and adjusted up or down to change the size of the image projected onto the enlarger's base, or a work table if the unit is mounted to the wall.

A focuser, also called a grain focus finder, grain focuser or an enlarging focuser, is a darkroom printing tool. It is used to verify the correct focus of the image projected on the printing easel by the enlarger. A magnifier is a specialized transparency projector used to produce photographic prints from film or glass negatives, or from transparencies.
The Photography slide holder is an important component for observing photographs by holding your slides secure and steady during observation.
A classifier for items in “Darkroom Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Enlargers are for producing a photographic print or negative larger than the original negative or transparency. The modern enlarger consists of a projection assembly attached to a vertical column that is mounted on a horizontal base.
Toners bind with the silver of a print. In most cases, this gives the photograph added stability which adds to the image's permanence.
A slide viewer is usually a small handheld device with a slot in which a slide can be inserted to see a magnified illuminated view of it.

The darkroom tanks & reels hold the chemicals and washing water for processing the X-ray films. The developer and the fixer must always be kept separate, in their own tanks, which usually stand inside the processing tank.
A slide is a specially mounted individual transparency intended for projection onto a screen using a slide projector. This allows the photograph to be viewed by a large audience at once.

Thw negative carrier supports the negative, sliding into a slot between the condenser and the main lens. The lens bend the rays so that they enlarge after passing through the negative and onto the paper.
Stop bath is a chemical used for processing black-and-white photographic films, plates, and paper. It is used to neutralize the alkaline developer, thus halting development.
A Photographic paper is a paper coated with a light-sensitive chemical formula, like photographic film, used for making photographic prints.

In the processing of photographic films, plates or papers, the photographic developer is one or more chemicals that convert the latent image to a visible image. Developing agents achieve this conversion by reducing the silver halides, which are pale-colored, into silver metal, which is black.

Shows minutes and seconds in total darkness. The 60-minute time range can be set in minutes for developing and seconds for enlarging control. Two hands permit quick setting by seconds, minutes, or combinations of seconds and minutes.
The printing easel or darkroom easel, is a fundamental darkroom accessory. Easels help you frame the enlargement properly and hold paper flat under the enlarger lens.

Print washers work by running water into the washer through pipes at the top of the bin and siphoning the contaminated water through the bottom. The Film Washer allows faster washing of film in around 5 to 10 minutes.

Safelight Filters are made to precise light-transmission and absorption standards that relate to the spectral sensitivities of photographic materials. They transmit more and more light of the colors that they absorb when they are new.

An alternative to tray processing is a roller transport system. Roller transports are automated processing machines that you load with all the necessary chemicals needed to complete a specific developing line, i.e. color or black and white.
A darkroom paper safe is an accessory used in photographic darkroom printing. It’s main purpose is to store and provide easy access to enlarging paper while printing.

An Enlarger or projection printer is a device for producing a photographic print or negative larger than the original negative or transparency. The modern enlarger consists of a projection assembly attached to a vertical column that is mounted on a horizontal base.
A panel regulates your temperature and keeps your water at a constant temperature, facilitating consistent processing.

A dry mount press is a luxury for a home darkroom. Inasmuch as some presses require high amperage, most dry mount presses, especially the larger more heavy-duty units, require their own dedicated power line.

Designed as they are to project a flat piece of film onto the flat surface of photographic paper, enlarger lenses show virtually no curvilinear distortion. Hence, they are generally standard lenses: 50mm for 35mm film, or 80mm for medium-format film.

The photo developing process happens at the photo processing sink. Since photo processing is a chemical procedure, sinks provide proper drainage when mixing chemicals. You'll also place various darkroom developing trays in the sink.

Photographic fixer is a mix of chemicals used in the final step in the photographic processing of film or paper. The fixer stabilizes the image, removing the unexposed silver halide remaining on the photographic film or photographic paper, leaving behind the reduced metallic silver that forms the image.
An instant camera is a camera which uses self-developing film to create a chemically developed print shortly after taking the picture.

A video camera is a camera used for electronic motion picture acquisition, initially developed for the television industry but now common in other applications as well.A video camera is a camera used for electronic motion picture acquisition, initially developed for the television industry but now common in other applications as well.

A movie camera or cine-camera is a type of photographic camera which takes a rapid sequence of photographs on an image sensor or on a film. In contrast to a still camera, which captures a single snapshot at a time, the movie camera takes a series of images; each image constitutes a "frame".
Digital cameras that can shoot 360¬∞, and usually provide both still image and video capability.

Disposable Cameras A disposable or single-use camera is a simple box camera meant to be used once. Most use fixed-focus lenses. Some are equipped with an integrated flash unit, and there are even waterproof versions for underwater photography.
Underwater cameras is a camera that can be used to capture images and videos under water. It can be used for shoots as one is swimming, snorkeling, or with a remotely operated underwater vehicle.

Line scan imaging uses a single line of sensor pixels to build up a two-dimensional image. For a given field of view, one line scan camera typically provides more resolution than multiple area scan cameras, at a lower cost, without image smear or the redundant processing of frame overlaps.

Dummy Cameras, also called fake security cameras are non-functional cameras designed to fool intruders, or anyone who it is supposedly watching. Those cameras are intentionally placed in a noticeable place, so passing people notice them and believe the area to be monitored by CCTV.

Film Cameras. With film cameras a film sensitive to light is placed behind the lens. When a film camera takes a picture, the camera lens briefly exposes the film strip to an image that's being magnified through the lens. Once captured, that latent image can be developed into a negative, which can, in turn, be projected onto light-sensitive photo paper to create a photograph.

Surveillance is the monitoring of behavior, activities, or information for the purpose of information gathering, influencing, managing or directing. This can include observation from a distance by means of electronic equipment, such as closed-circuit television (CCTV), or interception of electronically transmitted information, such as Internet traffic. It can also include simple technical methods, such as human intelligence gathering and postal interception.
A digital camera is a camera that captures photographs in digital memory. Most cameras produced today are digital, largely replacing those that capture images on photographic film.

Digital Camera Parts are usually a replacement parts for a camera that can include for lens, shutter, aperture, image sensor, viewfinder, body, and memory card slot. These parts work together to capture and store photographs.

Video Camera Parts are usually replacement parts for a video camera that can include for lens, shutter, aperture, image sensor, tracking, viewfinder, body, and screens or similar. These parts work together to capture and store videos.

Camera Flash Slave Trigger Units are very useful feature devices or components that enables a flash to trigger instantly when the sensor on the front of the unit registers light from another flash for DSLR, Digital, and analog cameras. By using Slave triggers you can set up as many extra flash units as you'd like that will all effectively trigger at the exact same time.
Camera Flash Adapters let you attach most standard and compact shoe-mount flashes to cameras. These mounts can also have ball joints to allow for more flexibility.

Camera Battery grips are an accessory for an SLR/DSLR (and occasionally other cameras), which allows the camera to hold multiple batteries to extend the battery life of the camera, and adds a vertical grip with an extra shutter release (and other controls), facilitating the shooting of portrait photography.

Camera Film Winders can be automatic or manual. Both of these were rectangular attachments that screwed into the bottom of the camera and, when switched on, automatically advanced the film immediately after the shutter closed. These winders had advance speeds of up to 2 frames per second (FPS).
A thin vinyl or rubber covering that covers the bulk of the outside of a camera to protect the device from scratches and other forms of light damage.

Lens Cases help protect your investment in expensive lens & the len's glass. Used to store and carry your lenses in these custom-sized camera lens cases. Specially designed as camera lens protectors, with padded construction, cap storage and protection from the elements.
A Lens Extension Tube, sometimes also called a closeup tube or an extension ring, is used with interchangeable lenses to increase magnification. This is most often used in macro photography.

A Digital Camera Back is a device that attaches to the back of a camera in place of the traditional negative film holder and contains an electronic image sensor. This lets cameras that were designed to use film take digital photographs.

Lens Supports are required when using heavy lenses to take the stress away from the lens mount of the camera. Using very heavy lenses without one of these lens supports may cause damage to the camera and/or lens.

Lens Filter Holders are placed on the front of camera lenses to accommodate light, color, and other filters for controlling the composition of photographs. Holders normally accept square or rectangular filter frames that resemble panes of glass, and the holders themselves mount to an adapter ring that screws into the threads on the existing outer lens.

On-Camera Lights is a term that refers to a compact, battery-powered light that can be mounted on the camera if a photographer or videographer chooses. This light can also be fixed on a tripod for more varied lighting effects

Follow-Focus Levers are a simple device fastens to the barrel of the lens to give much better control on focusing, or it can be used as a zoom lever. The Follow Focus/Zoom Lever consists of a reusable strap, which will attach to lenses up to 85mm in diameter, a clamp and an aluminium lever.
Surveillance Camera Housings are the physical body of the camera that protects and contains all its inner workings, and there are different kinds to protech from tampering or harsh weather.

Camera Film Backs & Holders are a type of device used in medium and large format photography cameras as a means to handle film. It works by pushing a packet into the holder, then withdrawing the cardboard sheath much like you would a dark slide from a traditional film

Conversion Lenses are designed to fit on to the end of an existing lens and change the way that lens behaves. For example, a teleconverter will adapt the lens to a longer telephoto lens, and a wide-angle converter will transform it into a wide-angle lens.

A Lens Mount Adapater, also called a Lens Adpater, is a device that enables the use of camera and lens combinations from otherwise incompatible systems. The most simple lens adapter designs, passive lens adapters provide a secure physical connection between the camera and the lens.

A Camera Flash Snoot, also called a Snoot, is a light modifier that you mount directly onto your off-camera flash or studio light. Its cone-shaped features limit light spread by eliminating any excess spill light that leaves your flash unit.
A classifier for items in “Camera Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Camera Accessory Bundles are a pre-built bundle of additional important accessories consumers will need for their cameras or camcorders. These bundles could contain an assortment of accessory component items bundled (grouped) together, like: carrying bag, batteries, straps, lens caps or filters, cleaning kits, memory cards, lights, tripods, mics.
Camera Tool Kits, are repair kits that provide tools to help maintain your camera, or assist in camera repairs.

Surveillance Camera Lenses have two main CCTV camera lens types: fixed lens (aka. monofocal lens) and varifocal lens (these include motorised lenses). A CCTV security camera that has a fixed lens is permanently set, meaning that its angle of view, focal length and level of zoom cannot be changed.

Camera Flash Diffuser is a simple light modifier that attaches to the upper part of an external flash unit. It's used to soften or spread the harsh, concentrated light that bursts out of the flash. It also creates a more even and flattering light on the subject
A Lens Cap, also called Lens Cover, provides protection from scratches and minor collisions for camera and camcorder lenses. Lens covers come standard with most cameras and lenses.

A Camera Lighting Sync Cord, also called a sync code, helps signal is sent from the camera to the flash unit via the sync chord when the shutter button is pressed. This signal instructs the flash to fire at the exact moment required to produce the required lighting within an image.
Handle (usually extendable) designed to hold a cellphone or camera at a distance away from the body, for the purposes of taking photographs or video of oneself.

A camera belt is typically a single camera sling that rests on your waist line, and a camera harness is a type of camera strap that distributes the weight of the camera evenly across your torso and shoulders.

A Camera Stabilizer, or camera-stabilizing mount, is a device designed to hold a camera in a manner that prevents or compensates for unwanted camera movement, such as "camera shake". For small hand-held cameras, a harness or contoured frame steadies the camera against the photographer's body.

Film Camera Parts are usually replacement parts for a camera that can include for lens, shutter, aperture, image sensor, viewfinder, body, and film back door. These parts work together to capture and store photographs.

A Camera Flash is a device used in photography that produces a brief burst of light at a color temperature of about 5500 Kelvin to help illuminate a scene. A major purpose of a flash is to illuminate a dark scene. Other uses are capturing quickly moving objects or changing the quality of light.
In photography and cinematography, a Lens Filter is a camera accessory consisting of an optical filter that can be inserted into the optical path.
Camera Rain Covers are piece of fabric or material used to protect and cover cameras and lens from rain and stormwater. This can range widely in applications.

Photographic film is a strip or sheet of transparent film base coated on one side with a gelatin emulsion containing microscopically small light-sensitive silver halide crystals. The sizes and other characteristics of the crystals determine the sensitivity, contrast, and resolution of the film.
Monopods, also called a unipod, is a single staff or pole used to help support cameras, binoculars, rifles or other precision instruments in the field.

A Dew Shield is a device used to prevent moisture or condensation buildup on the lens of a camera or telescope collector during night observations. The dew shield either shades the lens or provides a small amount of warm air directly in front of the lens or collector to prevent dew from collecting on the element.

Camera Docking Stations are Individual charging and offloading dock for body-worn cameras. This desktop unit connects a body-worn camera to a computer over USB, allowing rapid upload of events. It also charges your camera's battery - over USB or using its external power supply.

Camera Bag Padded Partitions are usually assortment sizes of removeable partitioned padded cushions that goes into a bag or case and act as protective dividers for housing cameras, camera bodies, lens, or other pricery electronic equipment.

A Lens Board, or lensboard, is a photographic part used for securing a lens to the front standard of a large format view camera. The lens board itself is usually flat, square, and made of metal, wood, or plastic. The lens board will have a hole of various diameters drilled dead center on the board.

A Lens Hood or lens shade is a device used on the front end of a lens to block the Sun or other light source to prevent glare and lens flare. Lens hoods may also be used to protect the lens from scratches and the elements without having to put on a lens cover

Camera Remote Controls, In definition, a remote shutter release is, as the term implies, a remote trigger that can be connected to your camera either wirelessly or by using a cable to perform its main function: to release the shutter even remotely without physically touching your camera's built-in shutter release button.
Tripod Heads is the part of a tripod system that attaches the supported device to the tripod legs, and allows the orientation of the device to be manipulated or locked down.

Camera Cleaning Equipment are cleaning kits or product items for all situations, from having a little bit of dust on the lens to greasy stains. Look for kits that provide at least a high-quality microfiber cloth, a cleaning solution, a brush or pen, and an air blower
A Tripods is a portable three-legged frame or stand, used as a platform for supporting the weight and maintaining the stability of some other object.

A Lens Filter Step Ring is an accessory used in photography to attach filters of different sizes to a camera lens. It is a circular ring with threads on both sides, one side with a larger diameter and the other with a smaller diameter. The larger side is screwed onto the lens, while the smaller side is used to attach the filter. The step ring allows the filter to fit securely onto the lens without any gaps or wobbling. This is particularly useful when using filters such as polarizers, neutral density, or graduated filters, which can enhance the quality of the image by reducing glare, increasing contrast, or balancing exposure. Step rings come in various sizes and can be used to adapt filters to lenses with different thread sizes, making them a versatile and cost-effective solution for photographers who use multiple lenses.
Underwater Camera Housings are essential for taking photos and videos underwater. They protect your camera from water damage, pressure, and other hazards.
Tripod Cases and bags ihelp protect your tripod from unnecessary scratches, scrapes, and damage during travel or storage.
Camera Straps, also called Camera Slings, is a single strap that allows a photographer to wear their camera on a single shoulder while keeping the camera easily accessible for quick shots.

Photographers use camera vests and jackets to keep their hands free while carrying equipment during long shoots. Photography apparel can also carry personal items such as cell phones or money, so that you don't need to carry a bag.

Camera bags &cases include backpacks, pouches, and rolling cases that make it easy for you to carry photography equipment to a location. These bags are more durable than traditional backpacks or purses, with added compartments and fasteners to make your accessories comfortable to carry.
A Camera LCD Hood is a type of hood that offers increased shading, especially when the sun is behind and shining directly on the camera's LCD screen.

Built for stability and precision, camera & camcorder mounts ensure a sturdy hold in any scenario, letting you focus on snapping that flawless photo or recording crisp video without the worry of wobbles or slips. Each type of camera mount has its intended purpose. These are not to be confused with Tripods or Monopods.

Camera Flash Brackets is a device that attaches to your camera and allows you to keep your flash at a greater distance than your built-in or shoe-mounted flash. The result is lighting that is more attractive and consistent. But it comes at the expense of adding quite of a bit of extra bulk to your camera
Video Camera Microphones, compared to inbuilt microphone, camera microphone records better audio and features more functions.

Light Meters is a device used to measure the amount of light. In photography, an exposure meter is a light meter coupled to either a digital or analog calculator which displays the correct shutter speed and f-number for optimum exposure, given a certain lighting situation and film speed.

A Camera Lens is an optical lens or assembly of lenses used in conjunction with a camera body and mechanism to make images of objects either on photographic film or on other media capable of storing an image chemically or electronically.
Any object or tool used to filter pond water.
Object utilized to heat and or keep ice from forming in a birdbath.
Any decorative object utilized in conjunction with a pond.

Pond netting keeps debris and predators from entering the ponds, waterfalls, and other water features. Keeping leaves and other debris out helps keep them water features clean, clear, and healthy. The netting can also be used to keep pond fish safe from predators, such as herons.

A pond liner is an impermeable geomembrane used for retention of liquids, including the lining of reservoirs, retention basins, hazardous and nonhazardous surface impoundments, garden ponds and artificial streams in parks and gardens.
A structure, often decorative, from which a jet or stream of water issues.
Device that creates continuous ripples in the water, attracting birds to it and discouraging mosquitos from laying eggs.
Removable covering for a spa or hot tub providing heat retention and a safety barrier.
The pool cover is a solution designed to prevent heat loss and pool water evaporation, also keeping the water warm whenever the facility is not in use.
A cleaner that is designed to collect debris and sediment from swimming pools with minimal human intervention.
Pool skimmers are filters that capture floating debris before it can sink to the bottom of the pool.
A large structure that is filled with water and that is used for swimming.
Pool pole designed for pool maintenance. This PT is meant to capture only the pole part, not the skimmer.
A pool heater, also known as a heat pump, works by bringing water into a heating tank and then pumping the warmed water back into the pool.
Specialized sand used to filter our small debris and sediment in a pool.

productType.productTypeName: Pool Heater & Heater Pump Parts & Accessories
productType.description: Parts or accessories for a pool heater or pump.
A pool brush is a cleaning equipment used for pool cleaning. Pool brushes, which can be used on both the floor and walls of swimming pools.
The liner makes it so the pool is able to retain water as it creates a protective barrier and the pool doesn't leak.

Saunas are a therapeutic, heated, enclosed, wood-lined room with many different options for benches, seating, design, and size/capacity. The intense heat generated within the sauna encourages detoxifying perspiration, relief from aches and pains, and deep relaxation.
Any object meant to be used on, or in a spa.
System for extending and rolling up a pool's cover.
A pool alarm is a safety feature designed to alert adults when unsupervised children enter a pool.
Floating pool lights are powered objects that float with the intent to provide a light source.
Chemicals used to clean or condition the water of a pool in order to make it safe for swimming.
Structure with a smooth sloping surface for users to slide down and into a swimming pool.
Cartridges that contain a filter utilized to remove our small debris and sediment from a pool.
A hand held device that utilizes a vacuum to collect debris and sediment from swimming pools.
A dispenser that distributes chemicals in the swimming pool for sanitization purposes.
Chemicals for spa & hot tubs to prevent algae, bacteria, and other contaminants in the water.
A large tub that is used for relaxation, hydrotherapy, warmth, and entertaining.
Object mean to provide safety of swimmers.
Assists in lifting a cover on or off a spa or hot tub.
Objects, or a collection of objects utilized to ensure that pool or pond water is chemically balanced and safe.
Pool ladders are an essential accessory for any above-ground or in-deck pool. They provide a safe and convenient way to enter and exit the pool.
An elevated board projecting over a swimming pool or other body of water, from which people dive or jump in.
Pool hoses are used primarily for vacuuming the pool, both with manual vacuuming setups and for suction-based automatic pool cleaners.
Powered devices utilized to circulate water in fountain, pond or pools
Heating device designed for use with an indoor sauna.
Valves for a pool filter.
Devices that are put in water in order to measure water temperature.
Leaf & plant cleaners are utilized to clean dirt, dust, or other undesirables off of leaves or plants.
Stakes used to support plants or used as poles for flexible pest fencing.
Composting replacement filters are used in composting bins or pails to suppress odor.
Material that is applied to soil or to plant tissues to supply one or more plant nutrients essential to the growth of plants.
An assortment of products used to build a raised garden bed.
A suspended container or pot used for growing decorative plants
Nets used as a solution to keep out problematic animal pests and large bugs from plants or trees.
An alternative container for growing plants, typically made of a thick, breathable fabric that allows for air root pruning.  Also referred to as smart pots

Compost bins are structures used to house and make compost until it can be used in the garden. Most are designed to hasten the decomposition of organic matter through proper aeration and moisture retention.
A container in which flowers or plants are cultivated and displayed.
A mixture of organic matter, minerals, gases, liquids, and organisms that together support the life of plants and soil organisms.
A plant mister is a tool used to sparingly spray your plants with water.
Herbicides, also commonly known as weed killers, are substances used to control undesired plants, also known as weeds.
Electrical ballast to operate plant germination grow light systems.

A window box is a type of flower container for live flowers or plants in the form of a box attached on or just below the sill of a window. It may also be used for growing herbs or other edible plants.
A decorative planter with a groove running through the length of the item, specifically to allow the planter to sit or rest on top of a rail or fence.

A mulch is a layer of material applied to the surface of soil. Reasons for applying mulch include conservation of soil moisture, improving fertility and health of the soil, reducing weed growth and enhancing the visual appeal of the area. A mulch is usually, but not exclusively, organic in nature.
Watering globes are blown glass globes with long thin necks. The water in the globe is slowly released into the soil, providing a steady supply of water for the plants over time.
Objects used to cover plants to protect them from the elements, such as frost, stormy weather, damaging wind, etc.
Tool used to determine the current fertility and health of soil.

Landscape fabric is a textile material used to control weeds by inhibiting their exposure to sunlight. The fabric is normally placed around desirable plants, covering areas where other growth is unwanted. The fabric itself can be made from synthetic or organic materials, sometimes from recycled sources.
Cages used as a protective barrier and / or to provide a supporting structure for plants or trees.
A set of things intended to be put together in order to grow a plant; may include soil, seeds, and a pot.
Wall planters are decorative planter designed to be mounted on a wall.
A planter saucer is a saucer-shaped object placed below a plant. The purpose of the planter saucer is to catch any water or soil that comes out of the plant when you water it.

Material used to line a plant container or planter prior to placing soil and plant(s), for a variety of purposes such as: protecting the plant container or planter from moisture damage, or to hold moisture and release water slowly to allow plant to take root.
Objects in which plant pots or containers are sat upon for display.

A terrarium is a tightly closed, clear glass or plastic container filled with small plants. It also has come to mean an open, transparent container for growing and displaying plants. Terrariums are most useful for small plants that do not adapt well to normal home atmospheres.
Electric mats which are sized to fit under germination trays. The heat prompts seeds to germinate and grow faster.
A upright metal rod,with a curved hook at one end used for hanging planters and typically features a step-in base on the other end which anchors the item in the soil, keeping it secure and upright
A type of mounted bracket, hook, or rope based netting used to suspend a plant container

A gardening tool specifically designed to hold multiple seeds, starting from the germination stage, until the seedlings are ready for transplantation. Plant germination kits are a collection of objects which provide all the necessary materials and ingredients to utilize for plant germination.
Bundled set of products that include multiple planters and stands sold together.
A type of container or box that is usually placed outdoors, and is used for the display or growth of any manner of plants, flowers, herbs, etc.
A low to the ground, wheeled platform which a plant pot can be placed upon in order to provide easier transportation or to allow the plant pot to be lifted off the ground.
Garden spade tools are used for light cultivation. The shape of the blade helps cut sod, reshape beds and digging out deeper planting holes.
Portable foam or fabric pad that designed for kneeling down on to perform a specific task.
A maintenance tool used to flatten the top one to two inches of soil surfaces, rendering them smooth and level.
Manually powered tools are designed to ease the task of removing weeds from gardens and lawns.

A machete is a broad blade used either as an agricultural implement similar to an axe, or in combat like a long-bladed knife. The blade is typically 30 to 45 centimetres long and usually under 3 millimetres thick.
Devices used to spray grass or plants.

A small, heavy duty, four wheeled vehicle, which has a tub or open ended cage mounted on top, used for hauling various items.  Typically has a handle extending out from one end for manually pulling the vehicle, and may feature mechanisms for easily dumping or unloading the contents of the tub/cage.

A mattock is a hand tool used for digging, prying, and chopping. Similar to the pickaxe, it has a long handle and a stout head which combines either a vertical axe blade with a horizontal adze, or a pick and an adze. A cutter mattock is similar to a Pulaski used in fighting fires.

A pickaxe, pick-axe, or pick is a generally T-shaped hand tool used for prying. Its head is typically metal, attached perpendicularly to a longer handle, traditionally made of wood, occasionally metal, and increasingly fiberglass.
Tools utilized to shape, cut, prune, or plant bonsai plants.
An agricultural implement consisting of a curved metal blade with a short handle fitted on a tang.
A garden fork, spading fork, or digging fork is a gardening implement, with a handle and a square-shouldered head featuring several short, sturdy tines.
Manually operated lawn mower that uses vertical, scissoring blades to cut the grass.

A garden rake is a broom for outside use; a horticultural implement consisting of a toothed bar fixed transversely to a handle, or tines fixed to a handle, and used to collect leaves, hay, grass, etc., and in gardening, for loosening the soil, light weeding and levelling, removing dead grass from lawns, and generally for purposes performed in agriculture by the harrow.
A collection of tools or objects used for gardening.

Gardening gloves are an important means of protection while gardening. Not only do they prevent dirt and soil from getting all over your hands, but they also prevent your skin from being subjected to scratches and punctures from prickly plants.
Weed torches are a tool that produces a flame which will burn away weeds.
Snow Removal Rakes is a tool used to remove snow, usually from a roof. Snow mand pusher is designed to manually push snow around.

An auger is a device to drill wood or other materials, consisting of a rotating metal shaft with a blade at the end that scrapes or cuts the wood.
A post hole clam-shell digger, also called post hole pincer or simply post hole digger, is a tool consisting of two articulated shovel-like blades, forming an incomplete hollow cylinder about a foot long and a few inches wide, with two long handles that can put the blades in an "open" position or a "closed" position.
Hatchet is a small, short-handled axe having the end of the head opposite the blade in the form of a hammer, made to be used with one hand.
Functional gardening tools designed for doing real outdoor work by kids/children.  These are NOT "pretend play" toys.
Device or material used to melt ice or snow outside.
A watering can is a portable container, usually with a handle and a funnel, used to water plants by hand.
Yard waste bags are designed for the collection and transport of leaves, grass clippings, and other garden waste.
Garden tool for the mechanical removal of debris, such as fallen leaves, pine needles, twigs, grass clippings or litter.
A hand powered garden tool designed to create holes in the soil in order to help lawn grasses grow.

Garden kneeler are objects that give you the option to either sit comfortably on a padded bench-style seat or to kneel on a padded surface to get closer to the work area. It keeps the user clean and prevents grass and dirt stains on clothing.
Bulb planters usually have depth measurements on them and simply core out the soil to the level at which the bulb should be planted.

A garden hoe is a hand tool used to shape soil, remove weeds, clear soil, and harvest root crops. Shaping the soil includes piling soil around the base of plants, digging narrow furrows and shallow trenches for planting seeds or bulbs.
Two or four wheeled carts that are specifically designed for carrying small loads in a yard or garden context.

A shovel is a tool used for digging, lifting, and moving bulk materials, such as soil, coal, gravel, snow, sand, or ore. Most shovels are hand tools consisting of a broad blade fixed to a medium-length handle. Shovel blades are usually made of sheet steel or hard plastics and are very strong.
An axe is a cutting tool that consists of a heavy edged head fixed to a handle with the edge parallel to the handle and that is used especially for felling trees and chopping and splitting wood.
A hand powered tool used to create a barrier or edge around a lawn.
A wheelbarrow is a small hand-propelled vehicle, usually with just one wheel, designed to be pushed and guided by a single person using two handles at the rear.
A protective or decorative garment worn over the front of one's clothes and tied at the back.
A shovel designed for snow removal.
A manually powered gardening tool used to cut or shape hedges.
Spreaders are used to evenly distribute fertilizer and grass seed across your lawn.
A mechanical device used for the removal of tree or shrub stumps.
A garden tool utilized to collect nuts by rolling on the ground.
A type of scissors that are strong enough to prune hard branches of trees and shrubs.
A hand powered gardening tool that is used to turn the soil where you plan on planting and for removing weeds.
A spark screen helps keep hot embers from sparking or popping out of the fire and landing on the ground or people.
Outdoor decoration and light source featuring a burning flame often fueled by using a wick and oil-based lamp fuel.
Cylinder shaped metal ring designed to contain small campfires or to be used as an accessory to a fire pit.
A fire pit is an outdoor structure (typically made of stone, brick, or metal) that contains fire and prevents it from spreading.
A chimenea, also spelled chiminea, is a freestanding front-loading fireplace or oven with a bulbous body and usually a vertical smoke vent or chimney.
An outdoor candle, which is also known a pitch torch or a garden candle is a large tealight-like candle that is lit outside.
Glass medium designed for use in fireplaces and fire pits.  Typically made of tempered glass, fire glass is shaped and colored in many different decorative styles.

An outdoor workstation or workbench, used primarily for small gardening tasks.  It will typically feature a work surface of a particular height comfortable for a standing person, with additional storage for gardening tools, pots, accessories, etc.
A rain barrel is a water tank used to collect and store rain water runoff, typically from rooftops via pipes.

A weathervane also known as wind vane, weather vane, or weathercock is an instrument used for showing the direction of the wind. It is typically used as an architectural ornament to the highest point of a building.
Also known as patio coolers, this is a cart with a built-in tub designed to be filled wit ice to keep beverages cool often featuring additional storage shelf and other features, like a bottle opener.
Wide storage and serving container for beverages intended to hold ice and multiple bottles and cans.
Realistic decorative green panels feature lifelike leaves on sturdy plastic netting that attaches easily to most structures.

Artificial turf is a surface of synthetic fibers made to look like natural grass, used in sports arenas, residential lawns and commercial applications that traditionally use grass. It is much more durable than grass and easily maintained without irrigation or trimming, although periodic cleaning is required.
A patio heater, also called a mushroom heater or umbrella heater, is a radiant heating appliance for generating thermal radiation for outdoor use.
An instrument used to gather and measure the amount of precipitation over an area in a predefined period of time.
Pieces of fabric with a distinctive design and colors. They are used as a symbol or for decoration.
Decoys used to discourage birds from disturbing and feeding on recently cast seed and or growing crops.
Wind Sculptures & Spinners are objects are kinetic garden ornaments. They utilize wind to make movement.
Stones meant to serve as decoration, typically used to provide a border or path.
Weather-resistant rug intended for use in the patio, garden, or outdoor locations.

A sundial is a horological device that tells the time of day when direct sunlight shines by the apparent position of the Sun in the sky. In the narrowest sense of the word, it consists of a flat plate and a gnomon, which casts a shadow onto the dial.
A decorative bridge found in a garden.

A wind sock is a conical textile tube that resembles a giant sock. It can be used as a basic indicator of wind speed and direction, or as decoration. Wind socks are typically used at airports to show the direction and strength of the wind to pilots, and at chemical plants where there is risk of gaseous leakage.
Moveable outdoor cart designed for serving and storing kitchen items.  Often includes a surface for serving drinks and food as well as drawers or cabinets for storage.
Electronic devices used to regulate the charge from solar PV or wind system to the battery storage.
A weather thermometer is an instrument used to measure the air temperature and to measure the highs and lows of the day, which can then be used to provide historical averages over time.
Batteries designed to be charged by solar panels.

De-icing mats are designed to be embedded in concrete or asphalt, either as part of a new installation or when re-paving. They will heat the surface area above freezing, thereby melting any snow or ice. Pedestrians and vehicles can then move securely on the protected surface.
Hanging light intended for outdoor use.  Often a decorative exterior lantern fixture, but might be intended to provide residential garden lighting.
Decor for outdoor spaces.
Wall-mounted light intended for outdoor use.  Often a decorative exterior lantern fixture, but might be intended to provide residential garden lighting.

Edging creates clean, crisp lines between beds and other areas. It's most visible between a lawn and an adjoining garden, but landscape edging can define a border, a shrub bed, a single tree, or the transition from a patio to the surrounding landscaping.
A paneled screen used to create privacy or divide a space, specifically for outdoor use.

Arbors are an outdoor garden feature forming a shaded walkway, passageway, or sitting area of vertical posts or pillars that usually support cross-beams and a sturdy open lattice, often upon which woody vines are trained

A trellis is an architectural structure, usually made from an open framework or lattice of interwoven or intersecting pieces of wood, bamboo or metal that is normally made to support and display climbing plants, especially shrubs.
A mirrored sphere typically displayed atop a conical ceramic or wrought iron stand, and sometimes the grass, as a lawn ornament.
Object that attaches to the drainage grates and prevents unwanted materials from entering.
Wind chimes are a type of percussion instrument constructed from suspended tubes, rods, bells or other objects that are often made of metal or wood.

Rain chains are alternatives to a downspout. Their purpose is largely decorative, to make a water feature out of the transport of rainwater from the guttering downwards to a drain or to a storage container.
