Lip balm or lip salve is a wax-like substance applied topically to the lips to moisturize and relieve chapped or dry lips, angular cheilitis, stomatitis, or cold sores. Products made to condition and moisturize the lips. Can be a balm, a medicated balm, a sleeping mask or ointment.

A diffuser attachment is designed to disperse the air flow of a blow dryer and spread it over a larger area. Diffusers are used principally with curly hair because the dispersed air doesn't disturb the hair's wave pattern or cause frizz when drying. These are only attachments, a diffuser dryer would fall into the Hair Dryer PT.
Hair tools (both electric and manual) that create one of the many types of braids

Hot Brushes straighten hair using heated plates and bristles that glide through the dry hair strands to relax the molecular bonds that keep hair curly. They straighten hair and add shine while maintaining volume. Hot Air Brushes are a cylinder shape, while Hair Straightening Brushes are flat.
A Hair Comb is a tool consisting of a shaft that holds a row of teeth for pulling through the hair to clean, untangle, or style it. This also includes clip and pick combs.
A classifier for items in "Hair Styling Tools & Products" that do not have a dedicated PT.

A rod-shaped instrument which is heated which a lock of hair to be curled or waved is wound. A curling wand will NOT have a clamp along it to grab on to the hair, instead you wrap the hair around it and hold the hair with your fingers. This should not include curling irons.
An automatic hair curler where hair is positioned inside a chamber. It gently pulls hair inwards where it creates that curl, then it's released
Straightening irons, straighteners, or flat irons are instruments with heated plates that press together and makes hair straight.

A hair dryer, also known as a blow dryer, is an electrical device used to dry and style hair. It uses an electric fan to blow air across a heating coil; as the air passes through the dryer it heats up. When the warm air reaches wet hair it helps evaporate the water. This includes diffuser dryers.
A Hair Brush is a handle brush with rigid or soft spokes used in hair care for smoothing, styling, and detangling human hair.

A rod-shaped (barrel) instrument which is heated which a lock of hair to be curled or waved is wound. A curling iron will typically have a clamp along it to grab on to the hair. There can also be multiple barrels. This should not include curling wands.

A hair crimper is a tool that creates wavy styles that are often in a sawtooth / zig-zag fashion. A crimping iron has parallel heated plates designed with a flat S-shaped repeating groove to create the crimpied texture
A hair tool that is a heated brush with bristles. It is brushed through the hair to straighten and add volume. Hair Straightening Brushes are flat, while Hot Air Brushes are a cylinder shape.

A hair roller or hair curler is a small tube that is rolled into a person's hair in order to curl it, or to straighten curly hair, making a new hairstyle. A hot roller or hot curler is designed to be heated in an electric chamber before one rolls it into the hair.[2] Alternatively, a hair dryer heats the hair after the rolls are in place. Hair spray can temporarily fix curled hair in place.

Hair coloring, or hair dyeing, is the practice of changing the hair color. The main reasons for this are cosmetic: to cover gray or white hair, to change to a color regarded as more fashionable or desirable, or to restore the original hair color after it has been discolored by hairdressing processes or sun bleaching. There are many processes for changing the color of hair, but for the purpose of this SOP, we will concentrate on the actual dye that is used for coloring.
A tool with bristles used to apply hair color across hair strands ensuring even application and coverage.

Hair Color Touch-Up Sticks are hair color in the form of a stick. This hair color dye can be temporary or permanent, formulated as sprays, pastes, or powders, and are applied directly to roots and act as hair color extenders.

The tool/method used to apply hair coloring dye to the hair/scalp. This ranges from a brush to nozzle/bottle, but since Hair Dye Applicator Brushes is its own PT, this PT will concentrate on other applicator tools.

A chemical technique that strips the color of your hair strands. Bleaching begins with an alkaline agent that opens up the hair cuticle. Next comes the oxidative agent that penetrates the hair cortex and dissolves the hairs natural melanin (your hair's natural color). The longer you leave this agent in your hair, the lighter in color your hair becomes. You hair can either lighten to a yellow or reddish tone depending on the your natural hair tone and then eventually lighten to platinum blonde.
Hair coloring/dye can stain skin. A Hair Color Stain Remover will clear, or get rid of, any dye left on the skin/scalp.
A classifier for items in "Hair Coloring Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A Hair Color Stain Shield protects the skin from hair chemical stains, redness and irritation. Can be a cream or physical barrier on skin.

A special paper used during the hair perming process. It helps wrap the hair around the hair perming rod, and protect the ends of the hair. The paper is thin but strong, allows for strong water absorption, good saturation of the hair perming chemicals and is usually resistant to high temperatures.

A permanent wave, commonly called a perm, involves the use of chemicals to break and reform the bonds of the hair. The hair is washed and wrapped on a perm rod and waving lotion is applied with a base. This solution creates a chemical reaction that softens the inner structure of the hair by breaking some of the cross links within and between the protein chains of the hair. The hair swells, stretches and softens, then molds around the shape of the perm rod. The perming chemicals consist of perm solution/waving lotion and a neutralizer.A texturizer is a chemical process that smooths and de-frizzes your hair while maintaining some of your natural curls. It loosens the natural curl pattern of an individual's hair without completely straightening it. Loosening the curl allows for more manipulation and in many cases, more manageability. Texturizers are ideal for someone who wants to retain natural curls but with a softer, looser pattern."
A kit comprised of tools needed for coloring hair. Usually includes a mixing bowl, application brush, application bottle, stain shield, and hair color dye (or any commbination of these products).

A hair relaxer is a lotion or cream that makes the hair easier to straighten and manage. It reduces the curl by breaking down the hair strand and chemically altering the texture, but does not result in completely straight hair.;A chemical hair straightener transforms curly hair into straight hair by breaking the natural chemical bonds found in keratin — the hair's natural way to hold curl. When the bond is broken, it forces the hair to make a new shape. In this case, the hair becomes straight.
Perming rods are used in the hair perming process. Hair is wrapped around the rods, which are of different lengths and circumferences depending on how tight the curl desired is.

Hair cream is a soft and light substance that doesn't feel greasy or stiff when applied to hair. Cream controls static and frizziness while adding a natural shine to your head of locks. Hair creams often include moisturizing ingredients such as olive oil or silk amino acids, which help conditions hair strands.

Hair loss treatments are products that stimulate hair growth and prevent hair loss. They can either be something applied to the head or in a pill form. They include a active ingredient such as Minoxidil (Rogaine).

A hair mask is a deep conditioning treatment that helps to heal damaged hair. They contain rich ingredients such as natural oils and lipids, in heavier concentrations than normal conditioners. You leave a hair mask in for an extended period of time, three minutes to overnight.

A hair serum is a silicone-based product that coats the surface of your hair. Unlike hair oil, it does not penetrate the hair cuticles or cause changes to the hair structure. Instead, it enhances the curliness and smoothness of hair.
Hair gel is a hairstyling product that is used to harden hair into a particular hairstyle.
Pomade is a greasy, waxy, or a water-based substance that is used to style hair. Pomade generally gives the user's hair a shiny and slick appearance.

Hair wax is a thick hairstyling product containing wax, used to assist with holding the hair. In contrast with hair gel, most of which contain alcohol, hair wax remains pliable and has less chance of drying out.

Shampoo is a hair care product, typically in the form of a viscous liquid, that is used for cleaning hair. Less commonly, shampoo is available in solid bar format. Shampoo is used by applying it to wet hair, massaging the product into the scalp, and then rinsing it out.
Shampoo and a conditioner that come as a set of two separate bottles, not one bottle that combines two products in one.

Hair mousse adds volume to hair and often provides both conditioning and hold, without any clumps or build-up. It is a hairstyling product which works by using synthetic resins to coat the hairs, to assist the hair in taking a certain shape.

Hair conditioner is a hair care product used to improve the feel, appearance and manageability of hair. Its main purpose is to reduce friction between strands of hair to allow smoother brushing or combing, which might otherwise cause damage to the scalp.
A product that combines shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in one product.
Hair treatment product designed to penetrate and lubricate hair.  It will replace lipids in hair, which will help prevent split ends and breakage.

Conditioning shampoos are formulated to provide the dual benefit of a shampoo as well as conditioner. It is a sophisticated hair care product, which has a shampoo and conditioner in one. In other words, a single product can be rather than using separate shampoo and conditioner.
Dry substance, typically administered from an aerosol can, that cleans the hair without use of water. Dry shampoos work by absorbing oil from the scalp and hair making it look freshly washed.

Hair spray is a common cosmetic hairstyling product that is sprayed onto hair to protect against humidity and wind. Hair sprays typically consist of several components for the hair as well as a propellant.

Scalp treatments are used to unclog the hair follicles, releasing natural conditioning oils. Plus, they stimulate blood flow, so nutrients can better reach the scalp and nourish your hair. These can be scrubs or something you put directly on the scalp.

A hairnet is a type of headgear worn to cover and hold hair in place. It is typically made of a fine mesh material that allows air circulation while preventing loose hair from falling into or contaminating food, machinery, or other sensitive areas. Hairnets are commonly used in industries such as food service, healthcare, manufacturing, and cleanrooms to maintain hygiene and safety standards. They are often required to be worn by employees who handle food or work in environments where hair could pose a risk.
Human or artificial hair that is clipped, glued, or sewn on natural hair.
Sets comprising of multiple types of hair accessories such as headbands, scrunchies, clips, hair ties, hairpins, etc.
A thin toothed strip, as of plastic, used to smooth, arrange, or fasten the hair.

Headbands that have a fashion aesthetic like fun prints, added bows, bling, or fun and trendy colors. Fashion headbands can be novelty headbands but all novelty headbands are not fashion ones such as a headband with bunny ears or reindeer ears.
An adhesive solution used to securely attach hairpieces, toupees, and wigs.

Ponytail holders and scrunchies are types of hair accessories used to secure and style hair in a ponytail or updo. 

Ponytail holders, also known as hair ties or elastics, are typically made of elastic material and come in various sizes and colors. They are used to gather hair and hold it tightly in place, creating a neat and practical hairstyle. Ponytail holders are known for their stretchability and ability to hold hair firmly without causing damage or discomfort.

Scrunchies, on the other hand, are fabric-covered elastic bands that are wider and softer than traditional ponytail holders. They are often made from materials like cotton, satin, or velvet, and come in a variety of colors and patterns. Scrunchies are known for their ability to provide a more gentle hold on the hair, reducing the risk of breakage or creases. They are also popular for adding a stylish and decorative element to hairstyles.

Both ponytail holders and scrunchies are versatile hair accessories that can be used by people of all hair types and lengths to create different hairstyles, ranging from simple ponytails to more intricate updos.
A clasp for holding hair in place. They are often made from metal or plastic and sometimes feature decorative elements.
Eyebrow conditioners are products that moisturize and strengthen eyebrow hairs.
Eye liner or eyeliner is a cosmetic used to define the eyes. It is applied around the contours of the eye. It is often used to create various aesthetic effects.
Eyelash primers coat the lashes before applying mascara to help create a fuller, more lengthened and voluminous look. It also helps keep lashes from clumping together.

Eye shadow is a cosmetic applied primarily to the eyelids to attract attention to the wearer's eyes, making them stand out or look more attractive. Eye shadow can also be applied under the eyes, on the cheeks, or to brow bones.
Mascara is a cosmetic commonly used to enhance the upper and lower eyelashes. It is used to darken, thicken, lengthen, and/or define the eyelashes.
Eyebrow & Eyelash growth enhancers help strengthen and moisturize brow hairs and/or eyelashes. They help promote growth, stop hair loss and help eye;ashes and brows to appear fuller and thicker.
Eyebrow color is applied to tge eyebrows to enhance, shape, and define brows. This can be either temporary color, or a longer lasting dye or tint.
Eyeshadow primer is a product that is applied on the eyelids to make shadows and eyeliner go on smoother and last longer.
Eyebrow Sealers are a product applied on the eyebrows that help tame, volumize and hold the eyebrows shape. It also helps eyebrow makeup longevity.

Tweezers are small hand tools used for grasping objects too small to be easily handled with the human fingers. Tweezers are thumb-driven forceps most likely derived from tongs used to grab or hold hot objects since the dawn of recorded history.
Mirrors that are held in your hand, placed on your vanity or desktop, or are mounted that give a good view while applying cosmetics and fixing your hair.
A tool, typically a tweezer with a large, curved paddle used to place false eyelashes onto the eyelid.
A classifier for items in "Makeup Brushes & Tools" that do not have a dedicated PT.

False eyelashes are a cosmetic enhancement attaching synthetic or natural fibers to the natural eyelashes to create a fuller, more dramatic look. They are available in various lengths, thicknesses, and curvatures.
Refill pads intended to be used in Eyelash Curlers.
A device like a clip placed on the bridge of the nose that claims to create the appearance of a slimmer and straightened nose.

An eyelash comb is an implement generally used to separate eyelashes after applying mascara. Eyelash combs help to keep the eyelashes from clumping together and can give them a fuller, more natural appearance.

Eyelid tape compensates for weakened levator muscles. By using adhesive material it lifts the eyelid and any sagging skin around it. Eyelid tape comes in small convenient strips. By placing the strip at the area where your eyelid folds over you can lift your eyelids.
Small sheets made of absorbent paper used for blotting the skin to remove access oil and sweat and to reduce shine while on the go without taking makeup off.
Puffs, Sponges or Wedges used to help in the application and blending of makeup. This does not include brushes.
A tool for sharpening a cosmetic pencil's application point by shaving away its worn surface.
Brushes and other miscellaneous tools (aside from sponges, wedges, and puffs) used to apply makeup.
A cleansing solution designed to remove all makeup product residue from makeup brushes.
Liquid glue / adhesive substance that holds false eyelashes and lash extensions in place.
An eyelash curler is a hand-operated mechanical device for curling eyelashes for cosmetic purposes. Usually, only the upper eyelashes are curled.
Eyebrow stencils are templates that you stick or hold on top of your brows to guide in coloring the lines of your brows with makeup.
Guards that protect brushes from dust and dirt, keeping them clean and protected on vanities and in makeup bags.
An instrument in which a beam of electrons is used to produce an enlarged image of a very small object.

A night-vision device, also known as a night optical/observation device, night-vision goggle, is an optoelectronic device that allows visualization of images in low levels of light, improving the user's night vision.
The optical microscope, often referred to as the “light optical microscope,” is a type of microscope that uses visible light and a system of lenses to magnify images of small samples.

Opera glasses, also known as theater binoculars or Galilean binoculars, are compact, low-power optical magnification devices, usually used at performance events, whose name is derived from traditional use of binoculars at opera performances.
A digital microscope is a variation of a traditional optical microscope that uses optics and a digital camera to output an image to a monitor, sometimes by means of software running on a computer.

An eyepiece, or ocular lens, is a type of lens that is attached to a variety of optical devices such as telescopes and microscopes.;Telescope filters can really help you to see more objects and their spectacular details.

A rangefinder is a device used to measure distances to remote objects. Originally optical devices used in surveying, they soon found applications in other fields, such as photography, the military, and space travel.
A telescope is a tool that astronomers use to see faraway objects. It provides a means of collecting and analyzing radiation from celestial objects, even those in the far reaches of the universe.
A magnifying glass is a convex lens that is used to produce a magnified image of an object.

A loupe is a simple, small magnification device used to see small details more closely. They generally have higher magnification than a magnifying glass, and are designed to be held or worn close to the eye. A loupe does not have an attached handle, and its focusing lens are contained in an opaque cylinder or cone.
The purposes of the eyepiece are to: produce and allow you to change the telescope's magnification. produce a sharp image.
Binoculars or field glasses are two refracting telescopes mounted side-by-side and aligned to point in the same direction, allowing the viewer to use both eyes when viewing distant objects.

A monocular is a compact refracting telescope used to magnify images of distant objects, typically using an optical prism to ensure an erect image, instead of using relay lenses like most telescopic sights.
An audio filter that isolates certain frequencies and either boosts them, lowers them, or leaves them unchanged. Equalizers are found on a wide array of electronic devices.
Speaker system that projects sound from a wide enclosure and designed for use with stereo or surround audio.
A partially automated music-playing device, that will play a users selection from self-contained media.
A type of stand-alone communication tool that provides one-way or two-way audio communication.
An electronic device that plays audio compact discs, which are a digital optical disc data storage format.
Device that converts a digital input signal into an analog output signal.

Device contains inputs for all the user's audio and video sources such as a cable TV box, Blu-ray or CD player and digital media hub (Apple TV, Roku, etc.). The receiver's video output goes to the TV via HDMI, and its several audio outputs connect to speakers and a subwoofer.

A device designed to increase the magnitude of power of a given input signal. The power of the input signal is increased to a level high enough to drive loads to a home output device such as speakers and headphones, its purpose is to increase power for output devices.
An apparatus for reproducing sound from records, comprising a turntable that spins the record at a constant speed and a stylus that slides along in the groove and picks up the sound.
Devices that produce audio output that can be heard by the listener.
Audio device that handles switching between different line level sources and boosts the signal before sending it to the Amplifier.

A audio system is usually small enough to fit on an average shelf and sold with all of the necessary components packaged together. Compact Stereo's typically include Radio, Cassette, CD, Digital Audio Player, support Bluetooth devices, USB Flash Drives, Satellite Radio, and a Turntable.
A magneto-optical disc-based data storage format offering digitized audio.
Device used for answering telephone calls and recording callers' messages.
A phone that is connected to a cellular radio tower instead of by a wire, and can be used anywhere where its signals can be received by the phone.
A phone system that is both corded and cordless.

A device that allows you to have more phones than physical phone lines and allows free calls between users. Additionally, it provides features like transfer calls, voicemail, call recording, interactive voice menus (IVRs) and call queues.
Devices that utilize a technology that allows you to make voice calls using a broadband Internet connection instead of a regular (or analog) phone line.

A scanner is a radio receiver that can automatically tune, or scan, two or more discrete frequencies, stopping when it finds a signal on one of them and then continuing to scan other frequencies when the initial transmission ceases.

You can refill credit on a prepaid account either with or without a payment being made. For a refill with payment, the refill amount is the amount that the customer paid. A refill without payment is at the expense of the service provider.

A device / accessory used with games or entertainment systems to provide input to a video game, typically to control an object or character in the game.

Device used to record or view videos sourced from a system of surveillance cameras.

small wireless or wired speaker (often battery powered) that can be moved to various locations and connected to an audio playback device.

Parts of a microscope
A telescope mirror is the principal light gathering surface of a reflecting microscope. It is a spherical or parabolic shaped disks of polished reflective metal.
These are designed to store and transport microscope objectives or other small optical assemblies.
The eyepiece, is the part of the microscope that magnifies the image produced by the microscope's objective so that it can be seen by the human eye.
Microscope carrying cases are perfect for both travel and storage of microscopes. It protects the microscope when not in use and extend the life and quality of the microscope.
A T-Adapter is a device that adapts the telescope side connection to threads you can attach accessories to on the camera side.
The slide holder on a microscope is an important component for observing specimens by holding your slides secure and steady during observation.
A microscope slide is a thin flat piece of glass, used to hold objects for examination under a microscope.

A mechanical stage or glide table is a device mounted on the stage of a microscope that holds a slide in place and allows for repositioning - lengthwise and crosswise - without touching the slide. The mechanical stage simplifies the process of observing different portions of a specimen. We carry a broad assortment of mechanical stages for use on both compound and stereo microscopes.
A classifier for items in “Optics Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Collimator, device for changing the diverging light or other radiation from a point source into a parallel beam. Three tools are commonly used to collimate Newtonian reflectors: the sight tube, the Cheshire eyepiece, and the laser collimator.
Viewfinders reduce image distortion and capture an accurate image. A digital, or electronic, viewfinder is a real time view of what the camera's imaging sensor is seeing.

A telescope mount is a mechanical structure which supports a telescope. A telescope mount does two things: one, it holds your telescope securely; and two, it allows you to move the telescope so that it can be pointed precisely at the objects in the night sky you want to observe

A substance or device used for cleaning the record and playback heads of a magnetic tape drive found in video or audio tape machines such as cassette players and VCRs.
Device that allows a phone to broadcast audio signals on FM frequencies, so that it can be tuned into a nearby FM receiver such as a a car radio.

The receiving device mounted on satellite dishes used for satellite TV reception, which collects the radio waves from the dish and converts them to a signal which is sent through a cable to the receiver inside the building.
A supportive bracket or arm designed to hold up a computer monitor or other display screen.
Devices that improve the signal quality received by TVs in locations with distant or weak signals from a TV transmitter.
A device that enables  a TV set to receive and decode digital television broadcasts which is necessary for viewers who want to use their analog television sets to receive digital broadcasts.
The mounting bracket for an antenna.
Object of a turntable that supports the cartridge in the correct position over the record and allow it to move inward to the center of the record while maintaining this position.

Shape sorting toys are educational toys designed to help children learn about shapes, colors, and problem-solving skills. These toys typically consist of a container or a box with various openings and a set of different-shaped blocks or objects that correspond to those openings.

The purpose of shape sorting toys is to encourage children to match the correct shape to its corresponding hole or slot. By manipulating and fitting the blocks through the openings, children learn to recognize and differentiate between various shapes such as circles, squares, triangles, rectangles, and more.
Objects that represent space orbital objects for educational purposes.

Device for measuring the radiant flux of electromagnetic radiation. Generally, a radiometer is an infrared radiation detector or an ultraviolet detector. Microwave radiometers operate in the microwave wavelengths.
A medieval instrument, now replaced by the sextant, that was once used to determine the altitude of the sun or other celestial bodies.
Mathematics & counting toys are toys containing the numbers and / or mathematics labeled on them to some degree. Utilized to teach children the numbers and mathematics.
An assortment of products used to create chemistry experiments.
A classifier for items in “Learning & Educational Toys” that does not have a dedicated PT.
An assortment of products that make science based models or kits.
Anatomical model of human anatomy designed to illustrate the specific parts and systems of the body.

Science sets are educational kits that provide children and sometimes adults with hands-on experiments and activities to explore and learn about scientific principles. These sets typically include a variety of materials, tools, and instructions to conduct experiments in various scientific fields, such as chemistry, physics, biology, or geology.

Science sets aim to engage and inspire curiosity in young learners by allowing them to perform experiments and observe scientific phenomena firsthand. They often include age-appropriate experiments and activities that are designed to be safe and easy to understand.

Some common components found in science sets may include:

1. Chemicals and reagents: These are substances that allow users to conduct experiments related to chemical reactions or properties.

2. Lab equipment: Science sets often include basic lab equipment like test tubes, beakers, magnifying glasses, pipettes, or safety goggles.

3. Instruction manuals: Sets typically come with detailed instructions or guides that explain the scientific concepts behind each experiment and provide step-by-step instructions for conducting them.

4. Specimens or samples: Some science sets may include specimens or samples for observation, such as rocks, minerals, insects, or plant parts.

5. Tools and measuring instruments: Depending on the type of experiments, science sets may include tools like thermometers, rulers, balances, or microscopes.
A frame with rows of wires or grooves along which beads are slid, used as a calculating tool.
Educational toy designed to help children recognize and recite the alphabet.

A Radio Control Vehicle Motor is the component that converts electrical energy into mechanical energy to drive the movement of a remote-controlled vehicle. These motors are specifically designed for use in radio control vehicles and come in various types and sizes depending on the specific application.

There are two main types of motors used in radio control vehicles:

1. Brushed Motors: Brushed motors are the most common type of motor used in radio control vehicles. They consist of a rotor with a permanent magnet and a stator with wire windings. When an electric current flows through the windings, it creates a magnetic field that interacts with the permanent magnet, causing the rotor to spin. Brushed motors are economical, easy to use, and suitable for various vehicle types.

2. Brushless Motors: Brushless motors are becoming increasingly popular in radio control vehicles due to their higher efficiency and power output. These motors use electronic commutation instead of physical brushes, resulting in reduced friction and better performance. Brushless motors are typically more expensive than brushed motors but offer smoother operation, longer lifespan, and higher power-to-weight ratio.

The motor's size and specifications will depend on the size and type of the vehicle it is intended for. Motors for smaller-scale vehicles like micro cars or drones will have lower power ratings and smaller physical dimensions, while motors for larger-scale vehicles such as trucks or airplanes will have higher power ratings and larger sizes.

It's important to consider the motor's power output, voltage compatibility, and compatibility with the vehicle's electronic speed controller (ESC) when selecting a motor. Additionally, the gear ratio and other drivetrain components should be properly matched to the motor to optimize performance and efficiency.
Miniature landscape items, buildings, vehicles, and other model scene pieces that accompany a train set.
Collection of toys consisting of vehicles and related items sold as a set.

A radio control helicopter, also known as an RC helicopter or remote control helicopter, is a miniature helicopter that is controlled remotely by a handheld transmitter. It is powered by an electric motor or a gas engine and is designed to mimic the flight characteristics of real helicopters.

RC helicopters come in various sizes and designs, ranging from small indoor models to larger outdoor models. They are typically made from lightweight materials such as plastic, foam, or carbon fiber to allow for easy maneuverability and flight.

The handheld transmitter used to control an RC helicopter sends signals to the onboard receiver, which controls the various control surfaces and rotor blades. This allows the pilot to control the helicopter's throttle, pitch, roll, and yaw, giving them the ability to perform various flight maneuvers and stunts.
Handheld unit that provides a mechanism for tactile input which is in turn translated into a radio transmission for control of a remote vehicle.
Any vehicle (planes, trains, automobiles, etc.) that is sold separately from a set.

A Radio Control Vehicle Battery Charger is a device used to charge the batteries of radio control vehicles such as remote-controlled cars, boats, airplanes, or drones. These vehicles typically use rechargeable batteries, usually Lithium Polymer (LiPo) or Nickel Metal Hydride (NiMH) batteries, which need to be recharged after use. 

The charger is designed to safely charge these types of batteries by providing the correct voltage and current for the specific battery type. It usually has multiple charging ports or slots to accommodate different battery sizes and types. The charger may also have additional features such as adjustable charging rates, balance charging capability (for LiPo batteries), and built-in safety features to prevent overcharging or overheating.

To use a radio control vehicle battery charger, you typically connect the charger to a power source (such as a wall outlet or a car battery), then connect the battery to the charger using the appropriate charging cable or adapter. The charger will then initiate the charging process and monitor the battery's voltage and temperature to ensure safe and efficient charging. Once the battery is fully charged, the charger will either automatically stop charging or notify you through an indicator light or sound.
A model train set will have more than one of the following components: train cars, locomotives, track and/or scenery in hobby form in which rail transport systems are modelled at a reduced scale.
Track specifically designed for slot cars. This track will have grooves and state that it is a slot car track.

A Radio Control Vehicle Engine is the power source that drives the movement of a remote-controlled vehicle such as a car, boat, airplane, or drone. These engines are specifically designed for use in radio control vehicles and are usually smaller and more lightweight than engines used in full-scale vehicles.

There are different types of engines used in radio control vehicles, including:

1. Nitro Engines: Nitro engines are internal combustion engines that use a fuel mixture of nitromethane, methanol, and oil. They require a glow plug to ignite the fuel and generate power. Nitro engines are known for their high power output and realistic sound but require regular maintenance and tuning.

2. Gasoline Engines: Gasoline engines, also known as petrol engines, are internal combustion engines that use gasoline as fuel. They are typically larger than nitro engines and are commonly found in larger scale models such as airplanes. Gasoline engines offer good power and fuel efficiency but may require more complex starting procedures.

3. Electric Motors: Electric motors are powered by electricity and are commonly used in smaller radio control vehicles such as cars and drones. They are simpler to operate and require less maintenance compared to internal combustion engines. Electric motors can be powered by rechargeable batteries such as LiPo (Lithium Polymer) or NiMH (Nickel Metal Hydride).

A radio control airplane, also known as an RC airplane or model airplane, is a small-scale aircraft that is controlled remotely by a handheld transmitter. It is powered by an electric motor or a gas engine and is designed to mimic the flight characteristics of full-size airplanes.

RC airplanes are typically made from lightweight materials such as foam, balsa wood, or carbon fiber to allow for easy maneuverability and flight. They come in various sizes and designs, including scale models that replicate real-life aircraft, as well as sport and aerobatic planes designed for acrobatic flying.

The handheld transmitter used to control an RC airplane sends signals to the receiver onboard the aircraft, which in turn controls the various control surfaces such as the ailerons, elevator, and rudder. This allows the pilot to control the airplane's speed, direction, and altitude.
A model train locomotive. Designed to operate on a track (this is a hobby train - not a toy, not wood material)

A radio control tank is a miniature tank that is controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter. Similar to other radio control vehicles, such as cars and boats, RC tanks are designed to mimic the performance and functionality of real tanks.

RC tanks come in various sizes, types, and designs, replicating different tanks used in military operations. They can feature realistic details, such as movable turrets, rotating gun barrels, and working suspension systems. Some RC tanks even simulate firing actions with sound and light effects.

The handheld transmitter used to control an RC tank sends signals to the onboard receiver, which controls the tank's movements, including forward and backward motion, turning, and turret rotation. Some advanced models may also have additional features such as firing simulated projectiles or emitting smoke.

RC tanks are typically operated on various terrains, including grass, gravel, or indoor surfaces. They can be used for recreational purposes, such as tank battles or military simulations, where multiple RC tanks engage in mock battles. Some enthusiasts also enjoy customizing and modifying their RC tanks with additional accessories and upgrades.

A model building kit is a set of parts and materials that are used to construct a miniature replica of a specific object or structure. These kits are popular among hobbyists, enthusiasts, and individuals who enjoy hands-on activities.

Model building kits can come in a variety of forms, including plastic model kits, metal model kits, wooden model kits, or even paper model kits. They typically include pre-cut or pre-formed pieces, along with instructions and sometimes adhesive or other necessary tools. The pieces are assembled according to the instructions to build the model, which can range from vehicles, buildings, aircraft, ships, or even fictional characters and creatures.

Model building kits cater to various skill levels, from beginner kits with simple designs and fewer pieces to more advanced kits with intricate details and complex assembly. They offer an engaging and creative experience, allowing individuals to learn about the subject matter, develop their fine motor skills, and showcase their craftsmanship.

Radio control cars, also known as RC cars or remote control cars, are miniature cars that are controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter. They are designed to replicate the performance and handling of real cars, allowing operators to race, perform stunts, or simply drive them for fun.

RC cars come in various sizes, types, and designs. They can be categorized into two main types: electric and nitro-powered. Electric RC cars are powered by rechargeable batteries and are generally easier to operate and maintain. Nitro-powered RC cars, on the other hand, run on a mixture of nitro fuel and oil and offer higher speeds and more realistic engine sounds.

The handheld transmitter used to control an RC car sends signals to the onboard receiver, which controls the car's steering, throttle, and other functions. This allows the operator to control the car's movements, including turning, accelerating, and braking.

RC cars can be operated on various surfaces, such as pavement, dirt tracks, or indoor tracks. They are popular among hobbyists and enthusiasts who enjoy racing, drifting, or performing various tricks and stunts. Some RC cars are specifically designed for racing competitions, where participants compete against each other to complete a track or reach the finish line.
Replacement parts for slot cars. These items will state "replacement parts".

Slot cars are powered miniature autos which are guided by grooves or slots in the track on which they run. Slot car sets will contain more than one of the following components: Slot Cars, Slot Car Track, Slot Car Replacement Parts

Slot cars are powered miniature autos which are guided by grooves or slots in the track on which they run. Slot cars are usually models of actual automobiles, though some have bodies purpose-designed for miniature racing.

A radio control vehicle servo is a small motorized device that is used to control the steering and throttle of a remote-controlled vehicle. It is typically connected to the receiver of the vehicle and receives signals from the transmitter to move the vehicle's wheels or control other functions. Servos are used in various types of RC vehicles, including cars, trucks, boats, and airplanes. They are essential components that allow for precise control and maneuverability of the vehicle.
A model train hobby car, caboose, or other train component that IS NOT a locomotive. Designed to operate on a track (this is a hobby train - not a toy, not wood material)
A small model of a human figure, typically one of a baby or girl, used as a child's toy. Oriented towards girls.

Radio control boats and watercraft, also known as RC boats, are miniature boats and watercraft that are controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter. Similar to RC helicopters, they are powered by electric motors or gas engines and are designed to mimic the performance and handling of real boats and watercraft.

RC boats come in various sizes and types, including speedboats, sailboats, tugboats, submarines, and even racing hydroplanes. They are typically made from lightweight materials such as fiberglass or plastic to allow for easy maneuverability and flotation.

The handheld transmitter used to control an RC boat sends signals to the onboard receiver, which controls the boat's steering, throttle, and other functions. This allows the operator to navigate the boat on water and perform various maneuvers, such as turning, accelerating, and reversing.

RC boats can be operated in various bodies of water, including lakes, ponds, and swimming pools. They are popular among hobbyists and enthusiasts who enjoy recreational boating, racing, or simply exploring the water. Some RC boats are specifically designed for competitive racing events, where participants race against each other to complete a course or reach a finish line.

Radio control vehicle batteries are the power source for operating remote control vehicles, such as cars, boats, planes, and tanks. These batteries provide the electrical energy needed to run the motor, control the vehicle's movements, and operate any additional features or accessories.

There are several types of batteries commonly used in radio control vehicles:

1. Nickel Cadmium (Ni-Cd) Batteries: These were commonly used in the past but are less common now due to their lower energy density and memory effect. They require proper care and maintenance to prevent capacity loss.

2. Nickel Metal Hydride (NiMH) Batteries: NiMH batteries are an improvement over Ni-Cd batteries. They have a higher energy density, providing longer run times. They do not suffer from memory effect and are easier to maintain. NiMH batteries are widely used in radio control vehicles.

3. Lithium Polymer (LiPo) Batteries: LiPo batteries have become increasingly popular due to their high energy density, lightweight design, and ability to deliver high currents. They provide longer run times and higher power output. However, they require proper handling, charging, and storage procedures to prevent damage or accidents.

The capacity of the battery is measured in milliampere-hours (mAh) and determines how long the vehicle can run before requiring a recharge. Higher capacity batteries provide longer run times but may also require longer charging times.

Radio control vehicle batteries are rechargeable and can be charged using a compatible battery charger. It is essential to use a charger specifically designed for the battery type to prevent damage and ensure safe charging.

A radio control vehicle speed control, also known as an ESC (Electronic Speed Controller), is an electronic device that regulates the speed and acceleration of a remote-controlled vehicle. It is typically used in electric-powered RC vehicles, such as cars, trucks, boats, and airplanes.

The speed control connects between the vehicle's battery and motor and receives signals from the transmitter to adjust the speed. It allows the user to control the vehicle's acceleration, deceleration, and braking by adjusting the throttle input.

Modern speed controls often have additional features such as programmable settings, adjustable brake strength, and reverse functionality. They also provide protection features like thermal shutdown, voltage protection, and motor stall protection.

Play housekeeping toys are toys that simulate everyday household chores and activities. These toys are designed to help children learn about and practice basic cleaning and organizing tasks, such as sweeping, mopping, dusting, and cooking. Play housekeeping toys often come in the form of miniature cleaning tools, play kitchens, and pretend cleaning products.

A play shopping cart is a toy cart designed to imitate a real shopping cart used in grocery stores. It is typically made of plastic and has wheels for easy movement. These carts are popular among young children who enjoy pretend play activities, such as playing house or grocery shopping. Play shopping carts can come with accessories such as play food items, a cash register, or a shopping basket, allowing children to simulate a shopping experience.

Play money refers to imitation currency used in games, educational activities, or pretend play. It is typically made of paper or plastic and looks similar to real currency, but it has no monetary value. Play money is often used in children's games to teach them about counting, basic math skills, and the concept of money. It can be used in pretend stores, banks, or as a tool for teaching financial literacy.

Construction Set Toys are a playset of toys with a theme of a construction site. It can constitutes pretend play to include the people, landscape, vehicles, tools, equipment, benches, safety gear, etc.

It is not to be confused with other building type Product Types such as "Interlocking Block Building Sets", "Marble Runs", or "Toy Blocks". Also it is different than "Play Construction Toys & Tools".

Play shopping baskets are small, typically plastic baskets designed for children to use during pretend play. They are often part of playsets that mimic a grocery store or market environment. Play shopping baskets are used to hold and transport play food items, such as plastic fruits, vegetables, and other groceries. They are usually lightweight and easy for children to carry, with handles for added convenience.

Play tents are small, portable structures designed for children to play and explore in. They are typically made of lightweight fabric and often feature colorful designs or patterns. Play tents are easy to set up and take down, making them convenient for indoor and outdoor use. They can be used for various imaginative play scenarios, such as camping adventures, secret hideouts, or pretend houses. Play tents provide a private and enclosed space for children to engage in creative play, allowing them to use their imagination, role-play, and interact with their peers.

A puppet theater, also known as a puppet stage or puppet show, is a miniature theater or platform used for performing puppetry. It is a dedicated space where puppets are manipulated and brought to life by puppeteers to tell stories and entertain audiences.

A puppet theater typically consists of a stage, backdrop, and curtains, along with various props and scenery to enhance the storytelling experience. The stage is usually elevated, providing a clear view for the audience to watch the puppet performances. The backdrop and curtains help set the scene and create an immersive environment for the puppets to interact.

Puppet theaters can come in different sizes and styles, ranging from small tabletop versions to larger freestanding structures. They can be made from various materials, such as wood, fabric, or cardboard. Some puppet theaters are portable and foldable, making them easy to transport and set up for performances in different locations.

Puppets are objects or figures manipulated by a puppeteer to create the illusion of life and movement. They are typically made of various materials such as fabric, wood, or foam and can take the form of animals, people, or mythical creatures. Puppets are used in various forms of entertainment, including puppet shows, theater performances, television programs, and storytelling. Puppeteers control the puppets using their hands or other mechanisms, such as strings or rods, to make them move, speak, and express emotions.
Pretend play gardening tools for use by small children as toys. These are NOT real tools for use in the garden.

Play kitchen appliances are miniature versions of real kitchen appliances that are designed for children to play with. They are typically made of plastic and are often included in play kitchen sets or sold separately. Play kitchen appliances can include items such as a stove, oven, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, blender, and coffee maker.
A pretend/fake set of police handcuffs that a child can use to mimic arresting someone.

A toy camera, also known as a novelty camera or a lo-fi camera, is a type of camera that is inexpensive, simple in design, and often made of plastic. Unlike traditional cameras, toy cameras usually lack advanced features and technical capabilities, resulting in a unique and often unpredictable photographic style.

Toy cameras are often characterized by their low image quality, light leaks, vignetting, and other imperfections. These imperfections, however, are often embraced by photographers as they can add a creative and artistic element to the images captured. The simplicity of toy cameras also encourages experimentation and a more relaxed approach to photography.

A play cash register is a toy version of a real cash register that is designed for children to play and pretend with. It typically includes features such as a calculator, a cash drawer, buttons to press, and a display screen. Play cash registers may also come with play money, coins, credit cards, and a barcode scanner.

Play tea sets and dishes are toys designed to imitate real tea sets and dishes used for serving tea or hosting tea parties. These sets are typically made of plastic, ceramic, or other child-friendly materials. They often can come with a teapot, cups, saucers, plates, and utensils such as teaspoons or sugar tongs.

A play kitchen is a toy kitchen set designed for children to play and pretend cooking. It typically includes miniature versions of kitchen appliances such as a stove, oven, refrigerator, sink, and sometimes a microwave.

Play food refers to a type of toy that is designed to resemble various types of food items. These toys are typically made of plastic or fabric and are intended for children to use during pretend play. Play food sets can include a wide variety of items such as fruits, vegetables, meats, dairy products, bakery items, and more. They are often designed to be realistic in appearance, with vibrant colors and details that mimic the actual food items. Play food sets can be used with play kitchen sets or other cooking toys to create a more immersive and interactive play experience.

Play cooking and baking toys are toys that simulate the experience of cooking and baking for children. These toys allow children to engage in imaginative play and pretend to be chefs or bakers. Play cooking and baking toys often include items such as miniature stoves, ovens, pots, pans, and utensils. They may also come with accessories like aprons, chef hats, and pretend ingredients. These toys are typically made of plastic or wood and are safe for children to use.

Play construction toys and tools are toys that are designed to mimic real construction equipment and tools. These toys allow children to engage in imaginative play and pretend to be builders, architects, or construction workers. Play construction toys often include items such as toy hammers, screwdrivers, wrenches, drills, and tool belts. These toys are typically made of plastic or wood and are safe for children to use.

Crawl tubes are structures typically made of plastic or metal that provide a tunnel-like space for children to crawl through. They are designed to encourage physical activity, exploration, and imaginative play. Crawl tubes offer a safe and enclosed space for children to navigate through, promoting gross motor skills development and spatial awareness. They can be straight or curved, and often have multiple entry and exit points to create various pathways for children to crawl and explore.

Play medical toys are toys designed to resemble medical equipment and tools used by healthcare professionals. These toys are often used to introduce children to the world of healthcare and help them become familiar with medical procedures in a non-threatening and fun way. Play medical toys can include items such as toy stethoscopes, syringes, thermometers, doctor's kits, medical playsets, and dolls or action figures dressed as doctors or nurses.
A classifier for items in “Pretend Play Toys” that does not have a dedicated PT.
An outdoor pad or mat that comes with various water spraying sprinklers, fountains, or nozzles for kids to play.

Bath toys are toys specifically designed to be used in the bathtub or during bath time. They are typically made from waterproof materials and are designed to float, squirt water, or stick to the walls of the bathtub. Bath toys can come in various forms, such as rubber ducks, boats, fish, animals, or even character-themed toys. They are intended to make bath time more enjoyable for children by providing entertainment and sensory stimulation while they play and explore in the water.

A lawn water slide is a large, inflatable slide that is designed for outdoor use and provides a fun and thrilling water play experience. It is typically made of durable materials such as PVC or vinyl and is designed to be set up on a grassy surface, usually in a backyard or outdoor space.

Lawn water slides often have a long, sloping surface that is wetted with water to create a slippery slide. They usually have built-in water sprayers or hoses that continuously spray water onto the slide to keep it wet and slippery. Users can climb to the top of the slide and then slide down, enjoying the sensation of gliding along the water.

Bath toy storage refers to various solutions and products designed to store and organize bath toys when they are not in use. Since bath toys tend to get wet and can take up space in the bathroom, proper storage is important to keep them clean, dry, and easily accessible. 

There are several options for bath toy storage, including:

1. Mesh bags or baskets: These are breathable bags or baskets made of mesh material that allow water to drain out, preventing mold and mildew. They can be hung on hooks or suction cups in the bathroom.

2. Bath toy organizers: These are typically plastic or mesh containers with multiple compartments or pockets to separate and store bath toys. They often come with suction cups or hooks to attach to the bathroom wall or shower.

3. Drainable toy holders: These are containers or baskets with small holes or slots that allow water to drain out, keeping the toys dry. They can be placed on the edge of the bathtub or hung on a showerhead.

4. Toy scoops or nets: These are large nets or scoops that can be used to collect and store bath toys. They are often attached to the bathroom wall or hung from hooks.

Bath toy storage solutions help keep the bathroom tidy, prevent toys from becoming a tripping hazard, and make it easier for children to find and access their toys during bath time.

A water gun, also known as a water blaster or squirt gun, is a toy or recreational device designed to shoot a stream of water. It is typically made of plastic and consists of a reservoir or tank to hold water, a trigger mechanism, and a nozzle or barrel for directing the water stream. To use a water gun, the user fills the reservoir with water, pumps or pressurizes it (in some models), and then pulls the trigger to release a jet of water. Water guns are commonly used in water fights or outdoor games, especially during hot summer months. They come in various sizes, shapes, and designs, ranging from small handheld pistols to larger, more elaborate models with increased water capacity and shooting range. Water guns provide a fun and refreshing way to cool down and engage in friendly water-based activities.
Small balloon designed to be filled with water and used as a projectile.
Objects meant to be played with while swimming in a pool.
A spare part, spare, service part, repair part, or replacement part, is an interchangeable part that is kept in an inventory and used for the repair or replacement of broken toys.
A toy product that consists of a non-toxic viscous, squishy and oozy green or other color material.

A glass-sided habitat box containing a live animal such a butterfly, hermit crab, and other various insects, normally used as a biological study tool. Living animal kits can also consist of life-like creature figurines for educational purposes.

Solar System toys are educational toys that aim to teach children about the planets, stars, and other celestial objects in our solar system. These toys often include models of the planets, along with other features such as a rotating sun, a model of the moon, and educational information about each planet. Some solar system toys also come with interactive features, such as lights and sound effects, to make learning about space more engaging.

Bug collecting kits are sets of tools and equipment designed for collecting, observing, and studying insects and other small creatures. These kits often include items such as nets, magnifying glasses, tweezers, containers, and field guides. They are commonly used by children and amateur entomologists to learn about different insect species and their habitats.

An ant farm is a contained environment designed for observing ants' behavior and creating a habitat for them. It typically consists of a clear plastic or glass container filled with sand or soil, with tunnels and chambers for the ants to explore and live in. The container is usually sealed with a removable lid or cover to prevent the ants from escaping.

Powered ride-ons, also known as electric ride-ons, are vehicles designed for children that are powered by electricity or rechargeable batteries. They typically resemble miniature versions of real vehicles, such as cars, motorcycles, or trucks, and are intended for children to ride and control. Powered ride-ons come with features like steering wheels, foot pedals, and sometimes even working lights and sounds. 

Not to be confused with "Hoverboards" or Electric Skateboard or Segways or "All-Terrain Vehicles" (ATVs) or "Electric Bicycles" or "Electric Scooter" or "Electric Wheelchairs".
Push & pedal ride-ons are manually powered play vehicles or objects in which kids ride on.

A wagon is a four-wheeled vehicle with a flat bed, often features a handle of sort for pulling. It allows for transport of things for indoors or outdoors. They come in various sizes, colors, and styles, and some may even have additional features or accessories such as seats or storage compartments.

Walking stilts are specialized devices or equipment designed to allow a person to walk at an elevated height above the ground. They consist of long poles or posts with footrests or platforms attached near the bottom. The user stands on the footrests while holding onto handles or straps located higher up on the poles. By gripping the handles and using their body's momentum, the user can take steps and walk with the stilts.

Walking stilts come in various sizes and designs to accommodate different heights and skill levels. They can be made of wood, metal, or lightweight materials like aluminum or carbon fiber. Stilts are commonly used for entertainment purposes, such as circus performances or street performances, where performers can showcase their balance and agility. They can also be used for recreational activities or as a form of exercise. Walking on stilts requires practice and coordination to maintain balance and stability while walking at an elevated height.

A space hopper, also known as a hop ball or a bouncy ball, is a large inflatable rubber ball with handles on the sides that allow a person to sit on it and bounce. It is a toy that provides entertainment and physical activity, particularly for children. The user sits on the space hopper, holds onto the handles, and then hops or bounces by pushing off the ground with their feet. Space hoppers are typically made of durable PVC and come in different colors and sizes. They are commonly used for outdoor play and can be a fun way to improve balance, coordination, and strength.
Rocking & spring ride-ons are objects mounted on rockers or springs in which kids rock or bounce on for enjoyment.

Pogo sticks are recreational devices that consist of a long, vertical pole with handles at the top and a footrest or footpads near the bottom. They have a spring mechanism or compressed air that allows the user to bounce up and down while standing on the footrests. Pogo sticks are designed to provide a fun and challenging way to jump and perform tricks, such as hopping, jumping over obstacles, or even participating in pogo stick competitions. They require balance, coordination, and strength to operate effectively.

A tricycle is a three-wheeled vehicle that is typically pedal-powered. It consists of a frame, handlebars, one front wheel, and two rear wheels. The rider sits on a seat located above the rear wheels and uses the handlebars to steer and control the tricycle's movement.

Tricycles are popular among children as a first step towards learning how to ride a bicycle. They provide stability and balance, as the rider does not need to worry about balancing on two wheels. Tricycles are often equipped with features such as a bell, basket, or streamers to enhance the fun and appeal for young riders.

However, tricycles are not limited to children's use. Adult tricycles are also available, often designed for recreational purposes or for individuals with balance issues or mobility limitations. They may have additional features such as gears, hand brakes, or cargo baskets for practical use.

Tricycles can be made of various materials, including steel, aluminum, or plastic, depending on their intended use and target audience. They are a popular mode of transportation or leisure activity in many parts of the world.
A bicycle without pedals that learners propel by pushing their feet against the ground.

Stuffed animals and plush toys are soft toys that are usually filled with stuffing material and covered with a fabric exterior. They are designed to resemble various animals, such as bears, dogs, cats, and more. These toys are often made with plush, fluffy, or fuzzy materials to make them cuddly and huggable.

Stuffed animals and plush toys are popular among children and adults alike. They serve as comforting companions, playmates, and decorative items. These toys come in a wide range of sizes, from small keychain-sized versions to large, life-sized ones.

Stuffed animals and plush toys can provide comfort and security to children, especially during bedtime or when they need emotional support. They also encourage imaginative play, storytelling, and role-playing, allowing children to create their own worlds and scenarios.

Sand toys are specifically designed toys or tools that are used for playing in sand, typically at the beach or in a sandbox. These toys are often made of plastic or other durable materials to withstand outdoor conditions and the abrasive nature of sand.

Sand toys come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and designs, catering to different play activities and interests. Some common sand toys include:

1. Sand shovels or scoops: These are used for digging and moving sand from one place to another. They typically have a long handle and a wide scoop or shovel at the end.

2. Sand molds or sandcastle molds: These are used to shape sand into various forms, such as castles, animals, or other objects. They come in different shapes and may have intricate details to create more elaborate designs.

3. Sand buckets or pails: These are containers used to hold and transport sand. They often come with a handle and may have a pouring spout for more controlled sand pouring.

4. Sand rakes or sifters: These tools are used for smoothing or leveling sand surfaces. They may have a rake-like design or a mesh bottom to sift out unwanted debris from the sand.

5. Sand wheel toys: These toys have a rotating wheel mechanism that can be turned or rolled on sand, creating patterns or tracks in the sand.

6. Sand trucks or vehicles: These are toy vehicles designed for use in sand. They often have large wheels or treads to navigate through the sand easily.
Toy musical instruments are any toy device for producing a musical sound.
A playground slide is a structure with a smooth sloping surface for children to slide down.
Playground merry-go-rounds is a type of amusement ride consisting of a rotating circular platform with seats for riders.
Toy sports equipment is any toy object meant to play a sport.

A kite is a flying object that is tethered to a string and controlled by the wind. It is typically made of lightweight materials such as paper, plastic, or cloth stretched over a frame. Kites are usually diamond-shaped or triangular, but they can come in various shapes and sizes. They are flown by running with the kite against the wind or by letting out the string while standing in a suitable location.

An outdoor playset, also known as a playground set or jungle gym, is a larger and more elaborate version of a swing set. It is a structure designed for children to engage in various types of play and physical activity outdoors. Outdoor playsets often include multiple components such as slides, climbing walls, monkey bars, tunnels, and swings. They are typically made of durable materials like metal or wood and provide a safe and fun environment for children to explore, climb, slide, and swing.

A Toy Phone is a plaything designed to resemble a mobile phone. It is typically made of plastic and has buttons, a screen, and other features similar to a real phone. However, unlike a functional mobile phone, a toy phone does not have the ability to make calls or access the internet. Instead, it is designed to provide a simulated phone experience for children to engage in pretend play. Toy phones often come with pre-recorded sounds, songs, and interactive features that allow children to mimic real phone conversations and engage in imaginative play.

(Playground Parachutes) are used by arranging children on the outside, who then vigorously wave the parachute up and down. They are commonly used in kindergarten and early elementary school physical education classes, gymnastics classes, and organized recess, but is aimed for people of all ages.

A playhouse is a small, enclosed structure or building designed for children to play in. It is typically constructed with child-friendly materials and scaled-down dimensions to create a miniature version of a house or building. Playhouses are often found in backyards, playgrounds, or indoor play areas.

Playhouses come in a variety of styles, ranging from simple and basic structures to elaborate and detailed designs. They can be made of wood, plastic, or fabric, and may feature windows, doors, roofs, and other architectural elements to mimic a real house. Some playhouses may also have additional features like slides, climbing walls, or swings attached to them.

Tetherball equipment typically consists of a tetherball pole, a tetherball, and a tether. 

Tetherball is a popular outdoor game that is typically played by two people. It involves hitting a ball, known as the tetherball, in opposite directions around a pole. The objective of the game is to wrap the tetherball completely around the pole in one's own direction.

Pickleball equipment refers to the specific items and gear needed to play the sport of pickleball.

Pickleball is a paddle sport that combines elements of tennis, badminton, and ping pong. It is played on a court with a paddle and a plastic ball, similar to a wiffle ball. The game can be played in both indoor and outdoor settings.

The rules of pickleball are fairly simple. The game is played with either two players (singles) or four players (doubles). Players hit the ball back and forth over a net, aiming to score points by making their opponents miss or hit the ball out of bounds.

A seesaw, also known as a teeter-totter or a teeterboard, is a playground equipment or recreational device that consists of a long plank or board balanced on a fulcrum or pivot point. It is designed for two or more individuals to sit on opposite ends of the plank and take turns pushing off the ground with their feet to create an up-and-down motion.

When one person pushes down on their end of the seesaw, the other end rises up, creating a see-sawing motion. This back and forth movement allows the participants to experience the feeling of going up and down in a controlled manner.
Swing set accessories are any objects or attachments designed to go with a swing set.
Playground balls are a solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
Ground sheet (mat or pad) designed to mark a landing area for drones, helicopters, etc.

An inflatable bouncer, also known as a bounce house or moonwalk, is a large inflatable structure that is designed for children to jump, bounce, and play in. It is typically made of durable PVC or nylon material and is filled with air using a blower or pump. Inflatable bouncers often feature walls and a roof to provide a safe and enclosed space for children to enjoy.

Sand and water tables are interactive play tables designed for children to explore and experiment with sand and water. These tables typically have two compartments, one for sand and one for water, though some models may have multiple compartments or interchangeable bins.

The sand and water compartments are usually made of durable plastic and are often removable for easy cleaning and refilling. The tables are typically designed at a height suitable for young children to access and play comfortably.

A ball pit is a recreational play area. It consists of an enclosed space filled with a large number of plastic balls. The balls are usually brightly colored and are designed to be soft and safe for children to play with. Kids can jump, dive, swim, or bury themselves in the ball pit, creating a fun and sensory experience. Ball pits provide a safe and engaging environment for children to develop their motor skills, coordination, and social interaction.
Playground climbers are stationary objects meant for children to climb on.

Playground balance beams are designed to help children develop balance and coordination skills. They are narrow, elevated beams that children can walk or crawl across. The beams can vary in length and height, and are often made of durable materials.
A swing set is a piece of playground equipment that typically consists of a frame supporting one or more swings. It is designed for children to sit on the swing and swing back and forth.
A footbag is the term for a small, round bag usually filled with plastic pellets or sand, which is kicked into the air as part of a competitive game or as a display of dexterity.

A sandbox is a shallow container or designated area filled with sand that is used as a play space for children. It is typically made of wood, plastic, or metal and can come in various shapes and sizes. 

Children use sandboxes for imaginative play, sensory exploration, and social interaction. They can build sandcastles, dig, mold shapes, and create landscapes using various sand toys such as shovels, buckets, and molds. Sandboxes provide opportunities for children to develop fine motor skills, problem-solving abilities, and creativity.

A play parachute is a large, circular piece of fabric with handles around the edge. It is typically made of nylon or polyester and comes in various sizes, ranging from small ones for individual use to large ones that can accommodate a group of people. Play parachutes are often used in group activities and games. Participants hold onto the handles and manipulate the parachute to create different movements, such as raising and lowering it, shaking it, or making waves. These activities promote coordination, cooperation, and physical fitness.

Ball pit balls are small, lightweight, and typically made of plastic. They are specifically designed for use in ball pits and are often brightly colored to attract children's attention. These balls are usually around 2 to 3 inches in diameter, though sizes may vary. They are made to be soft and safe for children to play with, with rounded edges and no sharp parts. The plastic material used in ball pit balls is typically non-toxic and easy to clean, ensuring a hygienic play environment.

Marbles are small spherical objects typically made of glass, clay, or stone. They come in various colors and designs and are used in a variety of games and activities. The objective of many marble games is to shoot or roll the marbles in order to knock other marbles out of a designated area or to hit a target.

Magnetic toys are toys that utilize magnets to provide a unique play experience. These toys typically consist of magnetic pieces that can be attached or connected to one another, allowing children to create structures, shapes, and patterns. The magnets in these toys are usually embedded within the pieces or enclosed in a way that ensures they are not accessible to children. Magnetic toys can come in various forms, such as building blocks, puzzles, construction sets, and even educational kits.

A stick horse, also known as a hobby horse, is a toy that resembles a horse's head mounted on a stick or pole. It is typically used by children for pretend play, imitating riding a horse. The stick horse usually has a fabric or plush head with eyes, a mane, and reins. The stick or pole represents the horse's body and is held by the child while they "ride" the stick horse around. Some stick horses also make sounds, such as neighing or clip-clopping, to enhance the imaginative play experience.

Hula Hoops are large, circular toys that are typically made of plastic. They are designed to be spun around the waist, hips, or other parts of the body. The goal is to keep the hoop rotating around the body using various techniques and movements.
A prism is a transparent body of this form, often of glass and usually with triangular ends, used for separating white light passed through it into a spectrum or for reflecting beams of light.
A toy consisting of an axle connected to two disks, and a string looped around the axle, similar to a spool.

A Toy Viewfinder is a small handheld device that allows users to view images or scenes through a small window. It is typically made of plastic and has a rotating disk inside with different images or scenes printed on it. By looking through the window and rotating the disk, users can see different images or scenes appear in the viewfinder.
A novelty item is designed and sold for its uniqueness. Gag toys are toys mean to produce humor, or a prank.
A toy that produces different colored patterns when a person looks through it. The change in pattern occurs when a person rotates the cylinder, causing a new image to appear.
Push & pull toys are toys designed to be pulled or pushed by the user (but not rode upon).

Flying discs, commonly known as Frisbees, are disc-shaped objects that are designed to be thrown through the air and caught by the recipient. They are popular recreational toys that can be used for various games and activities.

Flying discs are typically made of plastic and have a smooth, rounded edge. They are lightweight and aerodynamically designed to achieve stable flight when thrown. The shape and weight distribution of the disc enable it to glide through the air with ease, allowing for long-distance throws and accurate catches.

Flying discs can be used for casual throwing and catching games among friends and family, but they are also commonly used in organized sports like Ultimate Frisbee, Disc Golf, and Freestyle Frisbee. These sports involve different rules and techniques, adding an element of competition and strategy to the use of flying discs.

A juggling toy is an object used for juggling, which is the art of keeping multiple objects in the air simultaneously. Juggling toys can include balls, clubs, rings, scarves, and diabolos. These toys are designed to be easy to grip and manipulate, allowing jugglers to perform a variety of tricks and patterns.
A spinning top with 4 sides played with during the Jewish holiday, Hanukkah.

A fidget spinner is a small handheld toy designed for fidgeting or relieving stress and anxiety. It typically consists of a central bearing with two or more prongs or arms that spin around it. The user holds the center of the spinner with their finger and gives it a flick, causing it to spin rapidly. Fidget spinners gained popularity in the early 2010s as a fad toy, especially among children and teenagers. Some people claim that fidget spinners can help improve focus, reduce stress, or serve as a tool for individuals with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) or anxiety. However, scientific research supporting these claims is limited.

Bubble blowing solution, also known as bubble mixture or bubble solution, is a liquid solution used to create bubbles. It is typically composed of a mixture of water, dish soap or detergent, and sometimes other ingredients such as glycerin or corn syrup.

The soap or detergent in the solution helps to lower the surface tension of the water, allowing it to form thin films that trap air and create bubbles when blown through a bubble wand or other bubble-blowing device. 

It is commonly used for recreational purposes, such as blowing bubbles in the backyard or at parties, and is enjoyed by children and adults alike.

A wind-up toy is a mechanical toy that is powered by a spring mechanism. It typically consists of a key or knob that can be turned to wind up a spring inside the toy. When the spring is fully wound, releasing the key or activating a switch causes the stored energy in the spring to be released, which in turn powers the toy's movements or actions. The most common types of wind-up toys include animals, cars, robots, and figurines that walk, hop, or perform other simple motions. They are often made of metal or plastic and can be found in various shapes, sizes, and designs.

Magic tricks are small, often handheld, devices or props that are designed to perform simple magic tricks. These toys are typically marketed towards children or beginner magicians who are learning and practicing magic tricks. Some popular magic trick toys include:
