A complete list of items, typically one in alphabetical or other systematic order.
A printed publication (usually issued daily or weekly) consisting of folded unstapled sheets and containing news, feature articles, advertisements, and correspondence.

A paper doll is a two-dimensional figure cut out of paper or cardstock, usually depicting a person or character. The figure typically has various outfits and accessories that can be cut out and attached to the main figure using folding tabs.
Books for children or adults full of outlined images for the artist to color inside our outside the lines.

A medium for recording information in the form of writing or images, typically composed of many pages bound together and protected by a cover. A book generally has an ISBN number or similar ancillary information.
Sheet music is a type of printed music. The sheet or sheets of paper that contain(s) the written notation of what the musician are to play is called printed music notes.
A periodical publication containing articles and illustrations, typically covering a particular subject or area of interest.
A jumpsuit is a garment incorporating trousers and a sleeved top in one piece, worn as a fashion item, protective garment, or uniform.
A dress is a one-piece garment for a woman or girl that covers the body and extends down over the legs. Dresses can extend down over the legs as short, midi, or maxi (to the feet).

Unitards are tight-fitting one-piece garment of stretchable fabric which covers the body from the neck to the knees or feet, while a leotard is a close-fitting one-piece garment, made of a stretchy fabric, that covers a person's body from the shoulders to the top of the thighs and typically the arms, worn by dancers or people exercising indoors.

Tuxedos are a man's jacket for semiformal evening dress, traditionally of black or dark-blue color and characteristically having satin or grosgrain facing on the lapels. the complete semiformal outfit, including this jacket, dark trousers, often with silk stripes down the sides, a bow tie, and usually a cummerbund.
An outfit set, typically comprised of a top and bottom, made of a particular style or material conducive to athletic use.

A bodysuit is a one-piece form-fitting or skin-tight garment that covers the torso and the crotch, and sometimes the legs, hands, and feet, and cannot be used as a swimsuit. The style of a basic bodysuit is similar to a one-piece swimsuit and a leotard, though the materials may vary.
A pantsuit or pant suit, also known as a "trouser suit", is a man or typically woman's suit of clothing consisting of pants and a matching or coordinating coat or jacket.

A catsuit is a woman's jumpsuit, typically close-fitting and covering the body from the next to the feet. A catsuit is usually made from stretchable material, such as lycra, chiffon, spandex, latex, stretch mesh, or velour, but may use less elastic materials, such as leather or PVC.

A wedding dress or bridal gown is the dress worn by the bride during a wedding ceremony. The color, style and ceremonial importance of the gown can depend on the religion and culture of the wedding participants.
Outfit sets are a set of usually matching or harmonious garments and accessories worn together; coordinated costume; ensemble: a new spring outfit, or a set of articles pieces for any purpose.
A snowsuit is a one-piece garment consisting of trousers and a sleeved top, designed to keep a child or an adult warm in very cold weather.

A romper, is a one-piece combination of shorts and a shirt. It is also known as a playsuit, its generally short sleeves and pant-legs contrasting with the typical long ones of the adult onesie or jumpsuit.
Rain suits consist of pants and a usually hooded jacket made of waterproof material, worn the rain usually over ordinary clothes.
Sweatsuits are a suit consisting of a sweatshirt and sweatpants, worn when exercising or as leisurewear. These can be considered two piece set.

Overalls are a garment consisting of trousers with a front flap over the chest held up by straps over the shoulders, made of sturdy material and worn especially as casual or working clothes. Overalls are typically a loose-fitting coat or one-piece garment worn over ordinary clothes for protection against dirt or heavy wear.

Bib Snow Pants, or also called "ski bibs" feature a bib similar to overalls, you can adjust them using straps and buckles for a secure fit. Because of their style, they offer more upper body protection and warmth. Both will offer protection and warmth when worn with base (and mid) layers and your jacket.
A skirt suit is typically woman's suit of clothing consisting of a skirt and a matching or coordinating coat or jacket.

A Cravat is a wide band of fabric or scarf worn around the neck.;A Bow Tie is a short necktie tied in the form of a bow or a knot with two loops;A Skinny Tie is a long piece of cloth worn for decorative purposes around the neck resting under the shirt collar and knotted at the throat
A large and usually colorful ribbon or band of material worn around the body, draping from one shoulder to the opposing hip, or else running around the waist.
A hat, scarf and glove set, are commonly grouped items that cover the head, neck, and hands to help keep warm against cold or harsh weather.
Sunglasses or sun glasses are a form of protective eyewear designed primarily to prevent bright sunlight and high-energy visible light from damaging or discomforting the eyes.

A workwear uniform apron is a garment worn over clothing to provide protection and functionality in various work environments. It is specifically designed to shield clothing from spills, stains, and other potential hazards while also serving as a practical tool for carrying tools, utensils, or other work-related items.

Here are some key features and characteristics of a workwear uniform apron:

1. Protection: Workwear uniform aprons are made from durable and often water-resistant materials such as cotton, polyester, or a blend of fabrics. They are designed to protect clothing from spills, stains, and other potential hazards encountered in the workplace, such as grease, chemicals, or heat.

2. Functionality: Workwear uniform aprons often have pockets, pouches, or loops to provide storage and easy access to tools, utensils, or other items needed for the job. These pockets or compartments may be specifically designed to hold items like pens, notepads, thermometers, or kitchen utensils, depending on the industry or job role.

3. Adjustable fit: Workwear uniform aprons typically feature adjustable straps around the neck and waist, allowing for a customizable and comfortable fit. This ensures that the apron stays securely in place during work activities and can be adjusted to accommodate different body sizes.

4. Style options: Workwear uniform aprons come in various styles and designs to suit different industries and job roles. Some common types of aprons include bib aprons, waist aprons, cobbler aprons, or bistro aprons. The specific style chosen may depend on factors such as the level of protection required, industry standards, or specific job requirements.

5. Branding: Workwear uniform aprons may feature company logos, names, or branding elements to promote a consistent and professional image for the organization. This branding can be displayed through embroidery, patches, or printed details on the apron.

Wristbands are accessories worn around the wrist for various purposes. They are typically made of a flexible material such as silicone, fabric, or plastic. Wristbands come in different sizes, colors, and designs to cater to different needs and preferences.

Wristbands serve a range of functions, including identification, promotion, awareness, and support. Here are a few common types of wristbands:

1. Identification Wristbands: These are often used in events, parties, or venues to identify individuals, such as attendees, staff, or VIPs. They may have unique patterns, colors, or codes to differentiate between different groups or access levels.

2. Promotional Wristbands: Companies or organizations often use wristbands as a promotional tool. They may feature a brand logo, slogan, or message to raise awareness or advertise a product, event, or cause.

3. Awareness Wristbands: These wristbands are often associated with particular causes or social issues. For example, the yellow Livestrong wristbands became popular in support of cancer awareness and fundraising efforts. They help spread awareness and unite people in support of a specific cause.

4. Medical Wristbands: In medical settings, wristbands are used to identify patients and provide essential medical information. They may include the patient's name, date of birth, allergies, or other relevant medical details to ensure proper and safe care.

5. Tracking Wristbands: Some wristbands are equipped with technology, such as RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) or NFC (Near Field Communication), to track attendance, access control, or monitor movement in certain environments.

Wristbands are versatile and can be customized to serve different purposes. They are popular due to their ease of use, visibility, and ability to convey a message or identify individuals in a convenient and stylish manner.

When choosing sunglass replacement lenses, you're provided with lens options of different shapes, colors, and types to best match your needs or optical prescriptions. Replacement lenses can also be used to replace stratched, cracked, or outdates lenses.

A bolo tie (sometimes bola tie or shoestring necktie) is a type of necktie consisting of a piece of cord or braided leather with decorative metal tips (called aiguillettes) and secured with an ornamental clasp or slide.

A cummerbund is a pleated waist sash worn with single-breasted tuxedo jackets. Traditionally black, they are also available in other colors, most notably burgundy, bottle green, rich gold, and even white. They are widest around the front and were adopted as a warm-weather alternative to the black tie waistcoat.

Athletic Gloves are more specifically used to give protection against friction, heat, cold, or other activities that can cause harm to a bare hand. Many sports use gloves to protect the players from injuries.

A belt is a flexible band or strap, typically made of leather, plastic, or heavy cloth, worn around the natural waist or near it (as far down as the hips). The ends of a belt are free; and a buckle forms the belt into a loop by securing one end to another part of the belt, at or near the other end.
Cloth headgear designed to expose only part of the face, usually the eyes and mouth.

A glove is a garment covering the hand. Gloves usually have separate sheaths or openings for each finger and the thumb. A mitten is a type of glove that covers the hand but does not have separate finger openings or sheaths. Generally, mittens still separate the thumb from the other four fingers.Mittens provide greater thermal insulation than gloves, as they have a smaller surface area exposed to the cold, but have less dexterity that gloves provide.

A cummerbund is a piece of fabric that wraps around your waist, similar to a sash. A cummerbund is a pleated waist sash worn with single-breasted tuxedo jackets. It is only worn as part of formalwear, which means you can only wear it with a tuxedo

Fashion Cover-Ups is a cover-up style garment worn accessory that often is used as a layering piece to accompany a style or for short covering wear. Not for swimwear. If for swim or beach, use PT=Swimwear Cover-Up.
A belt buckle is a buckle, a clasp for fastening two ends, such as of straps or a belt, in which a device attached to one of the ends is fitted or coupled to the other.

In clothing, a collar is the part of a shirt, dress, coat or blouse that fastens around or frames the neck. Clothing Collars are typically a detachable material or fabric used in a more decorative matter to dress up a top or blouse for special occasions or everyday use.
A classifier for items in "Worn Fashion Accessories" that do not have a dedicated PT.

A workwear uniform badge is a small emblem or accessory that is worn on the clothing as part of a work uniform. It serves as a form of identification and helps to distinguish employees in various industries.

Here are some key features and characteristics of a workwear uniform badge:

1. Identification: Workwear uniform badges typically display important information such as an employee's name, job title, department, or company logo. They help to identify individuals and promote a sense of professionalism and accountability within the organization.

2. Branding: Workwear uniform badges often incorporate the company's logo, name, or branding elements. This helps to reinforce the company's identity and maintain a consistent image among employees. The badges may be customized with specific colors, fonts, or designs to align with the company's branding guidelines.

3. Attachment methods: Workwear uniform badges can be attached to clothing in various ways. Common attachment methods include pins, clips, magnetic fasteners, or adhesive backing. The chosen attachment method should be secure and durable to ensure that the badge stays in place throughout the workday.

4. Material and design: Workwear uniform badges are typically made from durable materials to withstand regular wear and tear. Common materials used include metal, plastic, or fabric. The design of the badge may vary depending on the industry or company requirements. It can be a simple rectangular shape, a circular shape, or a custom shape that reflects the company's branding.

5. Placement: Workwear uniform badges are usually worn on a visible area of the clothing, such as the chest, collar, or sleeve. The specific placement may depend on the company's uniform policy or industry standards. The badge should be positioned in a way that is easily recognizable and legible to others.
Undershirts for your hands worn under regular gloves. They are typically smaller and thinner than most outer gloves, but provide extra protection and warmth for your hands.
A length or square of fabric worn around the neck or head.
Suspenders, known as braces in Britain, are a fashionable alternative to belts. They are what happens when fashion meets function in an effort to hold your pants up.

A button pin, also known as pin-back button, pinback button, pin button, button badge, or pin badge, is a button or badge that can be temporarily fastened to the surface of a garment using a safety pin, or a pin formed from wire, a clutch or other mechanism.
A watch is a portable timepiece intended to be carried or worn by a person. It is designed to keep a consistent movement despite the motions caused by the person's activities.

A global positioning device worn on a users wrist that can help the user navigate the golf course as well as record and save your golf scores and statistics. It may integrate with a users smart phone via an app or be a stand alone device.
Nurse watches, also known as "Fob watches", are timepieces that clip onto the pocket of a nurses uniform or scrubs, with the dial upside down meaning that only the wearer can tell the time.
A pocket watch is a watch that is made to be carried in a pocket, as opposed to a wristwatch, which is strapped to the wrist.
Watch repair tools are hand tools used to repair a watch. Other kits, such as those for watch repair or specific engine components, and parts, which are typically are used by professionals.
A bezel is a top ring on the watch which surrounds the crystal. All watches have some sort of a bezel, whether it is a thin ring around the crystal or a piece of ceramic holding a scale.
A watch chain is the metal chain that connects a pocket watch to a fastener that attaches to clothing.
A watch winder is a device used to keep automatic watch running when not worn. Automatic watches operate on the principle of winding themselves using a moving weight inside the watch.

Spring bars are the tiny little bars that you use to hold watch straps in place.They have a tiny spring inside them and the ends are telescopic so you can push them in, put the strap into place, and then when you release the tension, they will spring out and they hold the watch strap back in place.
Watch crystals, also known as "watch glass", are concavo-convex glass covering the dial of a watch.
Movement, also known as a caliber, is the mechanism inside a watch or timepiece, as opposed to the case, which encloses and protects the movement, and the face, which displays the time.
A watch case is the metal case in which the works of a watch are housed. A case, is a portable container for carrying several objects.
A Case, the "housing" of the watch, which houses the crystal, bezels, and movements of a watch.

A watch strap, watch band, or watch bracelet is a bracelet that straps a wrist watch onto the wrist. Watch straps may be made of leather, plastic, rubber, cloth, or metal, sometimes in combination. It can be regarded as a fashion item, serving both a utilitarian and decorative function.
Watch & Clock hands, are the hands inside the watch. Consists of the hour hand and the minute hand of a watch.
A watch face is the part of an analog clock that displays time through the use of a flat dial with reference marks, and revolving pointers turning on concentric shafts at the center, called hands.
Watch parts are Individual component parts of a watch to be replaced.A watch kit or service kit is a set of items used to repair a device, commonly comprising both tools and spare parts.
Jackets of a particular style or material conducive to athletic use.
Sweatshirts of a particular style or material conducive to athletic use.
A polo shirt is a form of shirt with a collar, a placket neckline with three buttons, and an optional pocket. Polo shirts should be buttoned to the top and are usually short sleeved
Capes Tend to be Shorter; Cloaks are Full-Length or Calf Length. Cloak  and “cloche” suggest a wrap narrower at the top and flaring out at the bottom

A sleeveless upper-body garment. It is usually worn over a dress shirt and necktie and below a coat as a part of most men's formal wear. It is also sported as the third piece in the traditional three-piece male lounge suit.
A sweater vest (known as a tank top or sleeveless sweater in the UK) is an item of knitwear that is similar to a sweater, but without sleeves, usually with a low-cut neckline
An upper body garment with a sports team logo worn by fans.

A very cropped jacket, and has more structure than a shrug - which is also a cropped jacket. Shrugs are often made of knit or crochet. Boleros may be made out of silk, lace, chiffon, fur, and other fine materials, often tailor-made as a form of evening wear couture.
A garment with a collar and a full-length opening at the front, which is fastened using buttons or shirt studs

Blouses and tops are both types of women's upper body garments, but they have some differences in terms of style and formality.

1. Blouses: Blouses are typically more formal and feminine in style. They are often made of lightweight, flowing fabrics such as silk, chiffon, or satin. Blouses can have various necklines, such as V-neck, scoop neck, or button-down styles. They may also feature details like ruffles, pleats, or lace. Blouses are commonly worn for professional or dressier occasions, such as office settings, formal events, or when a more polished and elegant look is desired.

2. Tops: Tops are a broader category that encompasses a wide range of women's upper body garments. They can be more casual or versatile in style compared to blouses. Tops can be made from different materials, including cotton, jersey, or knit fabrics. They come in various styles, such as T-shirts, tank tops, crop tops, camisoles, or tunics. Tops offer more flexibility in terms of casual or everyday wear and can be paired with jeans, skirts, or shorts for a more relaxed or casual look.

The main difference between blouses and tops lies in their formality and style. Blouses are typically more formal and often worn for professional or dressier occasions, while tops are generally more versatile, casual, and suitable for everyday wear.

A sweatshirt is a loose, heavy shirt, typically made of cotton, worn when exercising or as leisurewear. A hoody is a sweatshirt with a hood. Hoodies often include a muff sewn onto the lower front, and a drawstring to adjust the hood opening.

A suit jacket, blazer, and sport coat are all types of outerwear that are worn for formal or semi-formal occasions. While they may appear similar, there are some subtle differences between them.

1. Suit Jacket: A suit jacket is the key component of a traditional two- or three-piece suit. It is designed to be worn with matching suit pants and often made from the same fabric. Suit jackets are typically more formal and structured with a tailored fit. They have a matching lapel and buttons, and they are usually worn for formal events, business meetings, or professional settings.

2. Blazer: A blazer is a versatile jacket that can be worn with a variety of pants, not necessarily matching ones. It is typically less structured compared to a suit jacket and can be made of different fabrics, including wool, cotton, or linen. Blazers often have metal buttons, patch pockets, and a wider range of color options. They are generally considered less formal than suit jackets and can be dressed up or down depending on the occasion.

3. Sport Coat: A sport coat is similar to a blazer but typically made of more casual fabrics such as tweed, herringbone, or other textured materials. Sport coats often have a more relaxed fit and may feature patterns like checks or plaids. They are designed for more casual or outdoor activities and can be worn with dress pants, chinos, or even jeans.

The key distinction between these three types of jackets lies in their formality, construction, and intended use. Suit jackets are more formal and intended for matching suits, blazers are versatile and can be dressed up or down, while sport coats are more casual and suitable for outdoor or leisure activities.
A shirt with no sleeves, collar, or buttons.

A ski jacket is a garment that covers the arms and torso. Its main function is to keep a person warm while participating in winter sports, especially Nordic (cross-country) or Alpine (down-hill) skiing. It is generally a unisex garment and can also be part of a ski suit.

A jacket is a mid-stomach–length garment for the upper body. A jacket typically has sleeves, and fastens in the front or slightly on the side. A jacket is generally lighter, tighter-fitting, and less insulating than a coat, which is outerwear. Some jackets are fashionable, while others serve as protective clothing
A shirt or top designed specifically for sports and physical activities.
A snow jacket is sometimes called a "winter jacket" and the definition of being insulating is the main quality of a snow jacket, A warm coat, often an overcoat, fit to be worn in winter.

A rugby shirt, also known as a rugby jersey.. It usually has short sleeves, though long sleeves are common as well. Rugby shirts have a buttoned opening at the top, in a similar style to polo shirts but with a stiffer collar.
A long-sleeved upper garments, often worn over a t-shirt or under a coat made out of knitted or crocheted material.

An undershirt is an article of underwear worn underneath a dress shirt intended to protect it from body sweat and odors. It can have short sleeves or be sleeveless. The term most commonly refers to upper-body innerwear worn by males. A "camisole" is a female version of a undershirt

A T-shirt, or tee shirt, is a style of fabric shirt named after the T shape of its body and sleeves. Traditionally, it has short sleeves and a round neckline, known as a crew neck, which lacks a collar. T-shirts are generally made of a stretchy, light and inexpensive fabric and are easy to clean.
A garment with a collar and a full-length opening at the front, which is fastened using buttons or shirt studs.
Outerwear is clothing worn outdoors, or clothing designed to be worn outside other garments, as opposed to underwear. It can be worn for formal or casual occasions, or as warm clothing during winter.
A raincoat or slicker is a waterproof or water-resistant coat worn to protect the body from rain. The term rain jacket is sometimes used to refer to raincoats that are waist length

A scrimmage vest, sometimes referred to as a pinny or bib, is a piece of clothing or sportswear, often made of mesh, used in practices as a substitute for a sports team's usual uniform or to differentiate temporary teams in informal scrimmages. Some teams elect to have benched players wear them during a game.

Outerwear is clothing worn outdoors, or clothing designed to be worn outside other garments. A jacket is a mid stomach length garment for the upper body. A jacket typically has sleeves, and fastens in the front or slightly on the side. A jacket is generally lighter, tighter-fitting, and less insulating than a coat, which is outerwear.
Outerwear Vests is a sleeveless lose-fitting waist-length garment worn over a shirt, typically having no collar and buttoning down the front and worn outdoors during colder months

A workwear uniform dress is a type of clothing that is worn as part of a work uniform in certain industries or job roles. It is specifically designed to provide a professional and cohesive appearance while offering comfort and functionality.

Here are some key features and characteristics of a workwear uniform dress:

1. Professional appearance: Workwear uniform dresses are designed to maintain a polished and professional look. They often have a tailored or structured silhouette that creates a neat and put-together appearance. The dress may have specific design details such as a collar, lapels, or buttons to enhance its formal appearance.

2. Comfort and functionality: While maintaining a professional appearance, workwear uniform dresses prioritize comfort and functionality. They are typically made from durable and breathable materials such as cotton, polyester, or blends that allow for ease of movement. The dress may have features like pockets, adjustable waistbands, or stretch panels to enhance comfort and practicality.

3. Identification and branding: Workwear uniform dresses often incorporate company logos, names, or branding elements. This helps to identify employees and promotes a consistent image for the organization. The branding may be displayed through embroidery, patches, or printed details on the dress.

4. Compliance with industry standards: Workwear uniform dresses may need to comply with specific industry standards or regulations. For example, in healthcare or food service industries, dresses may need to meet certain hygiene or safety requirements, such as being made from antimicrobial fabric or having a specific length.

5. Style options: Workwear uniform dresses come in various styles and designs to suit different industries and job roles. Some common styles include shift dresses, wrap dresses, shirt dresses, or A-line dresses. The specific style chosen may depend on factors such as the level of formality required, industry standards, or specific job requirements.

A workwear uniform vest is a sleeveless garment that is typically worn over a shirt or blouse as part of a work uniform. It is commonly used in industries such as hospitality, retail, transportation, construction, and security. Workwear uniform vests serve several purposes, including identification, branding, and functionality.

Here are some key features of workwear uniform vests:

1. Identification: Workwear uniform vests often have a company logo, name, or employee identification patch or badge on the front or back. This helps customers or clients easily identify and differentiate employees from others.

2. Branding: Uniform vests can also serve as a branding tool for businesses. By incorporating company colors, logos, or other design elements, the vest can help promote and reinforce the brand image.

3. Functionality: Workwear uniform vests are designed with functionality in mind. They typically have multiple pockets, both inside and outside, providing convenient storage space for tools, pens, notepads, or other necessary items. This allows employees to have easy access to essential tools while keeping their hands free.

4. Safety: In certain industries, workwear uniform vests may include reflective tape or high-visibility colors to enhance the visibility of employees, especially in low-light conditions or hazardous work environments. This helps improve safety and reduces the risk of accidents or collisions.

5. Comfort and Durability: Workwear uniform vests are usually made from durable and comfortable materials, such as polyester or cotton blends, that can withstand the demands of a work environment. They are designed to be breathable, lightweight, and easy to move in, ensuring that employees can perform their tasks comfortably.

6. Customization: Workwear uniform vests can be customized to meet specific industry or company requirements. This may include features like adjustable straps, zippers, or additional pockets based on the needs of the job.
A scrub set is a set consisting of a shirt piece and a pant piece together. Scrubs are protective garments designed to be worn by the doctor, nurse, and others in the operating room.

A military uniform is a standardized outfit worn by members of the armed forces to signify their affiliation with a particular branch or unit and to maintain discipline and order. Military uniforms serve several purposes, including identification, protection, and functionality.

Components of a military uniform can vary depending on the country and branch of the armed forces but generally include:

1. Jacket or blouse: This typically includes a tailored jacket or blouse with specific features like rank insignia, unit patches, and other distinctive markings.

2. Trousers or skirts: Military uniforms may include pants or skirts designed for durability and functionality. These are often made from sturdy and easy-to-maintain materials.

3. Boots or shoes: Military personnel wear specialized footwear designed for comfort, protection, and durability. The type of footwear can vary depending on the terrain and purpose of the uniform.

4. Headgear: Military uniforms usually include headgear such as caps, berets, helmets, or hats. These items often display insignia or emblems to identify the wearer's rank or unit.

A scouting uniform is the standardized attire worn by members of the scouting movement, such as Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, or other similar youth organizations. It serves as a symbol of identification, unity, and a sense of belonging within the scouting community. The specific design and components of a scouting uniform can vary depending on the country, organization, or level of involvement.

Components of a scouting uniform typically include:

1. Shirt or blouse: This is usually a button-up shirt or blouse in a specific color or pattern that represents the scout organization. It may feature badges, patches, or insignia representing the scout's achievements, rank, or troop affiliation.

2. Pants, shorts, or skirt: Scouts typically wear bottoms that are appropriate for outdoor activities, such as durable pants or shorts made of a specific material. Skirts may be an option for female scouts. The color and style may also be specified by the organization or troop.

3. Scarf or neckerchief: Scouts often wear a scarf or neckerchief tied around their neck, which is typically in a specific color or pattern that represents their scout group or region. This accessory may feature knots or other symbols that denote achievements or rank.

4. Belt: A belt is commonly worn to secure the pants or shorts and may have a specific buckle or design associated with the scout organization.

5. Footwear: Scouts are usually required to wear appropriate footwear for outdoor activities, such as sturdy hiking boots or shoes.

6. Badges and insignia: Scouts earn and display badges, patches, and insignia on their uniform to signify accomplishments, skills, community service, leadership roles, or other achievements within the scouting program.

The scouting uniform is not only a means of identification but also promotes a sense of equality, teamwork, and discipline among scouts. It helps foster a sense of pride, camaraderie, and belonging within the scouting community. The specific guidelines for the scouting uniform may vary based on the organization's policies, local traditions, or specific events or activities.

Long underwear, also known as thermal underwear or base layer, is a type of undergarment that is worn beneath clothing to provide insulation and warmth in cold weather conditions. It is specifically designed to trap body heat and wick away moisture, keeping the wearer comfortable and protected from the cold.

Here are some key features and characteristics of long underwear:

1. Material: Long underwear is typically made from synthetic materials such as polyester or merino wool, or a combination of both. These materials are chosen for their thermal properties, moisture-wicking abilities, and comfort against the skin.

2. Insulation: Long underwear is designed to provide an additional layer of insulation to the body. The fabric traps air close to the skin, creating a layer of warm air that helps to retain body heat. This insulation is crucial in cold weather conditions or when engaging in activities that expose the body to low temperatures for extended periods.

3. Moisture-wicking: Long underwear is designed to wick away moisture from the skin, keeping the wearer dry and comfortable. The fabric pulls sweat away from the body, allowing it to evaporate more quickly, which helps regulate body temperature and prevent clamminess.

4. Fit: Long underwear is typically form-fitting to ensure maximum contact with the skin and efficient heat transfer. It is designed to be worn as a base layer, snugly fitting against the body without restricting movement or causing discomfort.

5. Styles: Long underwear comes in various styles and weights to cater to different activity levels and weather conditions. Lightweight versions are suitable for milder temperatures or high-intensity activities, while heavyweight options provide extra warmth in extreme cold conditions. Styles include long-sleeve tops, crew neck or zip-neck options, and full-length bottoms or leggings.

A bra strap cushion, also known as a shoulder strap cushion or bra strap pad, is a soft, padded accessory that is designed to provide comfort and relieve pressure on the shoulders caused by bra straps. A luggage cart, also known as a baggage cart or trolley, is a wheeled device used for transporting luggage or other heavy items. It is designed to make it easier to move multiple suitcases or bags at once, especially in places like airports, train stations, or hotels.

Luggage carts typically consist of a sturdy frame made of metal or plastic, with two or more wheels attached to the bottom. The frame is equipped with a platform or basket where the luggage can be placed. Some carts also have handles or grips to allow for easier pushing or pulling.

They can be found in various sizes and capacities to accommodate different amounts of luggage. Luggage carts are often designed to be collapsible or foldable, making them convenient to store when not in use.

Using a luggage cart can help reduce the physical strain of carrying heavy bags and make it more convenient to transport luggage over long distances. They are especially useful for travelers with multiple bags or individuals who may have difficulty lifting or carrying heavy items.

A luggage lock is a small device designed to secure and protect the contents of a suitcase, backpack, or other types of luggage. It is used to prevent unauthorized access to the belongings inside the luggage, providing an additional layer of security during travel.

Luggage locks come in various forms, including key locks, combination locks, or padlocks. Key locks require a physical key to unlock, while combination locks have a dial or keypad that requires a specific numerical code to open. Padlocks typically have a shackle that is secured with a key or combination.

These locks are usually made of durable materials such as metal or hardened plastic to withstand rough handling during travel. Some locks also have a cable or flexible shackle that can be looped around suitcase handles or zippers to prevent them from being easily opened or tampered with.

Luggage locks are commonly used to secure checked baggage while traveling, as well as to secure luggage in hotel rooms or other public spaces. They can deter theft, prevent unauthorized access, and provide peace of mind to travelers.

It is important to note that some countries and airports have regulations or restrictions regarding the use of luggage locks, particularly for checked baggage. It is advisable to check with the specific airline or travel authorities to ensure compliance with any guidelines or requirements.

A luggage scale is a small portable device used to measure the weight of luggage or other items. It is designed to provide travelers with an easy and convenient way to check the weight of their bags before or during travel.

Luggage scales typically consist of a handle or strap that attaches to the luggage, and a display unit that shows the weight. The scale is usually compact and lightweight, making it easy to carry and use while on the go.

To use a luggage scale, you attach the strap or handle to the luggage's handle or strap, and lift the bag off the ground. The scale will then display the weight of the bag on the screen, allowing you to see if it meets the weight restrictions imposed by airlines or other transportation providers.

Luggage scales are especially useful for travelers who want to avoid overweight baggage fees or ensure that their bags are within the weight limits set by airlines. They are also handy for those who want to distribute the weight evenly between multiple bags or simply keep track of the weight of their belongings.

Luggage scales are available in various models and can have different weight capacities.
A stand that can be used to put a bag on top to easily unpack and pack rather than placing a bag on a bed or the floor.

A luggage tag is a small identification label or card attached to luggage or bags to provide information about the owner. It serves as a means of easily identifying and distinguishing one's luggage from others, especially in crowded or busy travel settings.

Luggage tags typically consist of a card or paper insert where the owner can write down their contact information, such as their name, address, phone number, or email address. This information allows the luggage to be easily returned to the owner in case it gets lost or misplaced during travel.

Modern luggage tags often come in a variety of materials, including plastic, leather, or fabric, and may have a clear plastic window to hold the identification card securely. Some tags also feature a privacy flap or cover to protect personal information from being readily visible.

In addition to personal identification, luggage tags can also have other useful features. For example, some tags may have a barcode or QR code that can be scanned to retrieve the owner's details electronically. Others may have a unique design or color to make the luggage easily recognizable or to reflect the owner's personal style.

A travel pillow is a specially designed pillow that provides support and comfort while traveling, especially during long journeys by plane, train, or car. It is intended to help alleviate discomfort, promote relaxation, and improve sleep during travel.

Travel pillows are typically compact and portable, designed to be easily carried and used on the go. They come in various shapes and styles, but the most common type is the U-shaped pillow. This style wraps around the neck and provides support to the head and neck, helping to maintain a more comfortable and ergonomic position while sitting.

The primary purpose of a travel pillow is to provide neck support and prevent the head from falling forward or to the side, which can lead to neck pain or discomfort during sleep. The pillow helps to maintain proper alignment of the neck and spine, reducing strain and promoting a more restful sleep.

Travel pillows are often made of soft, plush materials, such as memory foam, microbeads, or inflatable materials. Memory foam pillows conform to the shape of the neck and provide customized support, while microbead pillows offer a more flexible and adjustable feel. Inflatable pillows are lightweight and can be easily deflated and packed when not in use.

In addition to the U-shaped style, there are also other types of travel pillows available, such as rectangular-shaped pillows or pillows that can be attached to the headrest of a seat. These variations offer different levels of support and may be better suited for specific travel preferences or sleeping positions.

A luggage handle wrap is a protective and decorative covering that is placed around the handle of a suitcase, backpack, or other types of luggage. It is designed to provide a comfortable grip and prevent the handle from digging into the hands while carrying or pulling the luggage.

Luggage handle wraps are typically made of soft and cushioned materials such as neoprene, foam, or fabric. They are often adjustable and can fit various handle sizes and shapes. Some wraps have Velcro or snap closures to secure them in place, while others may be slip-on or have a zipper.

In addition to providing a comfortable grip, luggage handle wraps can also add a touch of personal style to luggage. They are available in a wide range of colors, patterns, and designs, allowing travelers to customize and easily identify their bags.

Luggage straps, also known as suitcase straps or travel straps, are adjustable straps designed to secure and hold luggage or bags together during travel. They are typically made of durable materials such as nylon or polyester and feature a buckle or clip mechanism for fastening.

Luggage straps are used to provide extra security and stability to bags, particularly in situations where the bags may be subjected to rough handling or when multiple bags need to be secured together. They can help prevent the accidental opening of zippers or clasps, as well as deter theft or tampering.

These straps are usually adjustable in length and can accommodate different sizes and shapes of luggage. They are often equipped with a buckle or clip that allows for easy and quick release when needed.

Besides securing the contents of the luggage, luggage straps can also serve as a visual identifier for your bags. Many travelers use brightly colored or patterned straps to make their bags easily recognizable on luggage carousels or in crowded areas.

Luggage straps are available in various colors, designs, and widths to suit different preferences and needs.

A refillable travel bottle is a small container, typically made of plastic, silicone, or glass, that is designed for carrying and dispensing liquids while traveling. These bottles are specifically designed to meet the travel regulations for carrying liquids in carry-on luggage, which typically restricts the size of the container to 3.4 ounces (100 milliliters) or less. Refillable travel bottles can come in a set with different sizes and types of bottles, such as spray bottles, pump bottles, or squeeze bottles, to accommodate different types of liquids like shampoo, conditioner, lotion, or hand sanitizer. The bottles are usually leak-proof and have tight-fitting caps or lids to prevent spills during travel.

Packing organizers, cubes, and folders are tools designed to help organize and compartmentalize your belongings when packing for travel. They are typically made of lightweight, durable materials like nylon or polyester.

1. Packing Cubes: These are rectangular or square-shaped containers with zippers on one or more sides. They come in various sizes and are used to separate and compress clothing items, such as shirts, pants, socks, or undergarments. Packing cubes can keep different types of clothing separate, making it easier to find items in luggage and minimizing wrinkles.

2. Packing Folders: These are similar to packing cubes but are specifically designed to neatly fold and organize clothing items that need to be kept wrinkle-free, such as dress shirts, blouses, or skirts. They usually have folding boards or panels that help a person fold clothes to the correct size and shape, and then secure them with straps or zippers.

3. Packing Organizers: These are versatile tools that come in various shapes and sizes, including zippered pouches, toiletry bags, shoe bags, or laundry bags. They are used to store and separate different items like toiletries, shoes, electronics, or dirty laundry, keeping them organized and easily accessible during a trip.

Overall, packing organizers, cubes, and folders help maximize space in luggage, keep belongings organized, and make unpacking and repacking more efficient while traveling.

Travel sleep collars typically have a U-shaped design that wraps around a neck, providing support to both sides of a neck and the back of the head. They are often filled with soft materials like memory foam, microbeads, or inflatable air chambers to conform to the shape of the neck and provide cushioning.

The purpose of these collars is to prevent the head from falling to the side, forward, or backward while sleeping or resting in a seated position. They help keep the neck aligned and reduce strain, stiffness, and discomfort that can result from sleeping in an unsupported position during travel.

Travel sleep collars come in different sizes, materials, and designs to suit individual preferences. Some have adjustable straps or closures to ensure a secure and comfortable fit. They are usually lightweight and portable, making them easy to carry and pack in a travel bag or carry-on luggage.

In addition to providing comfort during travel, travel sleep collars can also be used in other situations where neck support is needed, such as while reading, watching TV, or lounging in a recliner.
A classifier for items in “Travel Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Baptism gowns and outfits are special clothing worn by infants or young children during their baptism or christening ceremony. These garments are typically white or light in color and are meant to symbolize purity and the new life that the child is entering through the sacrament of baptism.

Baptism gowns for girls often resemble traditional dresses or gowns, with long sleeves, flowing skirts, and intricate lace or embroidery details. They may be made of satin, silk, organza, or other soft fabrics. Some gowns may also include a bonnet or a matching hat.

For boys, baptism outfits often consist of a white or light-colored shirt, pants, and a vest, sometimes paired with a matching cap or hat. These outfits may also feature delicate embroidery or lace accents.

Baptism gowns and outfits are usually chosen by the child's parents or guardians and are often considered heirlooms that can be passed down through generations. They are worn specifically for the baptism ceremony and are meant to be a symbol of the child's entrance into the Christian or Catholic faith community.

A kurta is a loose-fitting tunic or shirt that originated in South Asia, particularly in India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. It is commonly worn by both men and women as a traditional garment. The kurta is typically knee-length or longer and has long sleeves. It is usually made of lightweight fabric, such as cotton or silk, and can be plain or adorned with embroidery, prints, or other decorative elements.

Kurtas are versatile and can be worn for both casual and formal occasions. They are popular as everyday attire in South Asian countries, and they are also commonly worn during festivals, weddings, and other cultural celebrations. 

For men, kurtas are often paired with loose-fitting trousers called pajamas or with loose-fitting pants called salwars. Women may wear kurtas with matching or contrasting bottoms, such as leggings, churidars (skinny pants), or skirts. Kurtas can be styled in different ways, depending on regional and personal preferences, and can be accessorized with scarves, jewelry, or other embellishments.

A jingle dress is a traditional Native American dress worn by women in certain Indigenous communities, primarily in the Ojibwe and Anishinaabe tribes. The jingle dress is known for its distinctive sound created by metal cones or jingles attached to the dress. 

The dress is typically made of fabric adorned with rows of metal cones or jingles, which are often made from snuff can lids or other metal materials. The jingles are attached in such a way that they create a pleasant sound when the wearer moves or dances. The number of jingles on a dress can vary, but they are usually evenly distributed across the dress. 

The jingle dress is often worn during powwows, traditional dances, and other cultural celebrations. The dress holds significant cultural and spiritual significance and is believed to have healing powers. The jingle dress dance, performed by women wearing the dress, is an important part of Indigenous cultural traditions and is often accompanied by singing and drumming.

A djellaba is a traditional long, loose-fitting robe or tunic worn by both men and women in North Africa, particularly in countries like Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia. It is a traditional garment that reflects the cultural heritage and practical needs of the region. Djellabas are typically made from lightweight fabric, such as cotton or wool, and are commonly worn in hot climates. They often have a hood and long sleeves, with the length varying from ankle to knee level. Djellabas can be plain or decorated with patterns, embroidery, or decorative buttons. They are often worn as everyday clothing, particularly in rural areas, and can also be seen during religious and festive occasions.

A huipil is a traditional garment worn by indigenous women in various countries in Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Mexico. It is a loose-fitting tunic or blouse that is typically made from handwoven fabric using traditional techniques. Huipils are known for their vibrant colors and intricate designs, which often reflect the cultural and symbolic meanings of the community they come from. They can feature geometric patterns, floral motifs, or even represent mythological stories and religious beliefs. Huipils are usually made with a rectangular shape and have openings for the head and arms. They can vary in length, from reaching the waist to extending down to the ankles. Huipils are an essential part of indigenous identity and cultural heritage, and they are worn in daily life, as well as during festivals, ceremonies, and other special occasions.

A kimono is a traditional Japanese garment that is known for its distinctive T-shaped silhouette and wide, flowing sleeves. It is a long robe that is typically made of silk or other fine fabrics and is worn wrapped around the body, with the left side overlapping the right and secured with a sash called an obi.

Kimono designs can vary greatly, with different patterns, colors, and motifs representing various seasons, occasions, and personal tastes. Traditional kimono often feature intricate hand-painted or dyed designs, such as flowers, landscapes, or geometric patterns. 

Kimono are worn by both men and women in Japan, although the styles and patterns may differ. They are typically reserved for special occasions, such as weddings, tea ceremonies, festivals, or formal events. However, in modern times, kimono are also worn as fashion statements or as a way to appreciate and preserve Japanese cultural heritage.

In addition to the kimono itself, wearing a kimono often involves various accessories, such as obi belts, obijime cords, geta (wooden sandals), and kanzashi (hair ornaments).

A dirndl is a traditional dress worn in German-speaking countries, particularly in Bavaria and Austria. It is associated with the cultural heritage and folk traditions of these regions. The dirndl is a three-piece outfit that typically consists of a bodice, a blouse, and a full skirt. The bodice is typically tight-fitting and may feature a low-cut neckline, while the blouse is usually white and has puffed sleeves. The skirt is often full and falls to the knee or slightly below. Dirndls are usually made from high-quality materials and can be adorned with decorative elements such as embroidery, lace, or ribbons. They are commonly worn during Oktoberfest, a famous beer festival in Munich, Germany, as well as other traditional events and celebrations.
A traditional Cheongsam is the English version of a long dress but is a type of tight-fitting Chinese dress worn by women.

A salwar kameez is a traditional outfit worn by both men and women in South Asia, particularly in countries like India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. It is a two-piece ensemble consisting of a tunic-style top called a kameez or kurta and loose-fitting pants called salwar.

The kameez is a long, loose-fitting tunic that can vary in length, reaching anywhere from the knees to the ankles. It can have different necklines, sleeve lengths, and decorative elements, such as embroidery, sequins, or prints. The salwar, on the other hand, is a comfortable and relaxed fit pant with a drawstring waist. It is typically loose and has a baggy appearance, providing ease of movement.

Salwar kameez outfits are made from various fabrics, including cotton, silk, georgette, chiffon, or synthetic materials, depending on the occasion and personal preference. They come in a wide range of colors, patterns, and designs, reflecting the diverse cultural traditions and fashion trends of the region.

Salwar kameez is a versatile outfit that can be worn for both casual and formal occasions. It is popular as everyday wear, as well as for festivals, weddings, or other cultural celebrations. It can be accessorized with jewelry, scarves, or dupattas (long stoles) to enhance the overall look.

A sporran is a traditional Scottish accessory that is worn with a kilt, the traditional Scottish garment. It is essentially a pouch or a small bag that hangs from a strap or chain around the waist. The sporran is typically made of leather or fur and is often adorned with decorative elements such as tassels, metal embellishments, or clan badges.

The sporran serves both a practical and aesthetic purpose. Historically, it provided a convenient and secure place for men to store personal belongings, as kilts do not have pockets. It also helped to weigh down the front of the kilt and maintain its shape. Today, the sporran is still used for its practicality, allowing individuals to carry small items like wallets, keys, or mobile phones, especially during formal events or Highland gatherings.

There are different types of sporrans based on the occasion and formality. Day sporrans are typically smaller and less ornate, suitable for informal or casual events. Dress sporrans, on the other hand, are more elaborate and often made with luxurious materials such as fur, adorned with decorative metalwork or other embellishments. They are typically worn for formal occasions like weddings, ceremonies, or Highland balls.

The design of the sporran can vary depending on the region or clan affiliation. It is worn with the kilt and other traditional Scottish attire, completing the overall Highland dress ensemble.

A sari, also spelled saree, is a traditional garment worn by women in South Asia, particularly in countries like India, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka. It is a long piece of fabric, typically ranging from 4 to 9 yards in length, that is draped around the body in various styles, creating an elegant and graceful attire.

The sari consists of three main components: the pleated section, the pallu, and the blouse or choli. The pleated section is wrapped around the waist and forms the skirt portion of the sari. The pallu is the loose end of the sari that is draped over the shoulder and can be worn in different ways, either hanging loose or pinned up. The blouse or choli is a fitted top that is worn underneath the sari.

Saris are available in a wide range of fabrics, patterns, colors, and embellishments. Each region and community has its own unique styles and traditions associated with sari draping and designs. Different draping styles, such as the Nivi, Bengali, Gujarati, or Maharashtrian style, can be chosen based on personal preference or the occasion.

Saris are worn for various occasions, including weddings, festivals, religious ceremonies, and formal gatherings. They are considered to be a symbol of femininity, grace, and cultural heritage in South Asian societies. Accessories such as jewelry, bangles, bindis, and hair ornaments are often worn with saris to complete the traditional look.

A traditional Boubous an African garment worn by men and women and generally consists of up to three pieces: a long-sleeved shirt, a pair of tie-up trousers that narrow at the ankles, and an open-stitched overflowing wide sleeveless gown worn over these two; all three are usually the same color.

A choli is a traditional garment worn by women in the Indian subcontinent. It is a fitted blouse or bodice that is typically cropped and worn with a saree or lehenga, which are traditional Indian attire. 

The choli exposes the midriff area and is usually short-sleeved or sleeveless. It can be adorned with various embellishments like embroidery, beads, sequins, or mirrors, depending on the regional and cultural preferences. The choli is an important part of traditional Indian attire and is often worn during festivals, weddings, and other special occasions.

A religious vestment is a ceremonial garment worn by clergy and other religious officials during religious services and rituals in various faith traditions. These vestments hold symbolic significance and are often made from rich fabrics and adorned with ornate designs.

In Christianity, various vestments are used by different denominations and for specific roles within the clergy. Common Christian vestments include the alb, a long white robe worn by priests and deacons; the stole, a long narrow strip of fabric worn around the neck and hanging down in front; and the chasuble, a sleeveless outer garment worn over the alb by the priest during the celebration of the Eucharist.

In the Catholic Church, additional vestments include the cassock, a long black robe worn by clergy; the surplice, a loose white garment worn over the cassock; and the mitre, a ceremonial headdress worn by bishops.

In other religious traditions, such as Judaism and Islam, there are also specific vestments worn by clergy or during ritual ceremonies. For example, in Judaism, a tallit is a prayer shawl worn by Jewish men during prayer, and in Islam, the imam may wear a kufi, a round cap, or a thobe, a long robe.

Religious vestments serve to distinguish clergy and other religious officials, accentuate the solemnity and sacredness of religious rituals, and convey the symbolic role and authority of those who wear them.

Lederhosen are traditional Bavarian garments that are typically worn by men in Germany, particularly in the southern regions like Bavaria and Tyrol. The term "lederhosen" translates to "leather breeches" in English. 

Lederhosen are made of leather and consist of a pair of shorts or knee-length trousers with suspenders. They are often adorned with decorative embroidery, metal buckles, and buttons. Traditionally, lederhosen were worn by farmers, hunters, and workers in rural areas, but they have become associated with folk festivals, such as Oktoberfest, and are now worn for celebratory events, cultural gatherings, and traditional dances.

Lederhosen are usually worn with a shirt, typically a white or checkered button-up, along with knee-high woolen socks called "Trachtensocken" and sturdy leather shoes known as "Haferlschuhe." Accessories such as a hat or feathered cap called "Tirolerhüte" and a belt with a decorative buckle may also be worn.

Lederhosen have become a symbol of Bavarian and German culture, and they are often seen as a traditional and festive attire. They have also gained popularity as a fashion trend, with modern variations and designs now available.
Traditional abayat are black and may be either a large square of fabric draped from the shoulders or head or a long kaftan. The abaya covers the whole body except the head, feet, and hands.

A kilt is a traditional Scottish garment that is worn by men. It is a knee-length skirt-like garment that is typically made of tartan fabric, which consists of a pattern of crisscrossed horizontal and vertical stripes in various colors. Kilts are pleated, with the pleats usually at the back, and are fastened around the waist with a wide leather belt called a sporran.

Kilts are a symbol of Scottish culture and are associated with Scottish Highland dress. They are commonly worn for formal events, such as weddings, Highland games, and other traditional gatherings. The tartan pattern of the kilt often represents a specific clan or family, and wearing the appropriate tartan is seen as a way to honor one's heritage.

In addition to the kilt, traditional Scottish attire may include other accessories like a sporran (a small pouch worn at the front of the kilt), a sgian-dubh (a small knife tucked into the top of the kilt hose), a jacket, a sporran chain, and knee-high socks called hose.

A swimwear cover-up is a garment that is worn over a swimsuit to provide extra coverage. It is typically made of lightweight and breathable materials such as cotton, chiffon, or linen. Swimwear coverups come in various styles, including dresses, tunics, sarongs, kaftans, and robes. They are designed to be easily worn and removed, making them convenient for beach or poolside activities. Swimwear coverups are available in different lengths, from short and mini to long and maxi, and they often feature vibrant patterns or colors to complement swimwear outfits.

One-Piece Swimsuits are an item of clothing designed to be worn by people engaging in a water-based activity or water sports, such as swimming, diving and surfing, or sun-orientated activities, such as sun bathing. One-piece swimsuits can be defined by it's close-fitting one-piece garment, made of a stretchy fabric, that covers a person's body from the shoulders to the top of the thighs and sometimes can cover the arms.

A swim parka can be really useful, especially when swimming outside in cold weather. This great piece of clothing keeps you warm and comfortable, before you go for a swim or right after you get out of the water.

Fitness swimsuits are swimsuits used in the aquatic sports of swimming, diving, synchronized swimming, triathlon and water polo. They are designed specifically for competitions where they may be constructed of a special low resistance fabric that reduces skin drag. These suits are typically made from spandex and provide little thermal protection, but they do protect the skin from stings and abrasion. Unlike regular swimsuits, which are designed mainly for the aesthetic appearances, swimsuits designed to be worn during competitions are manufactured to assist the athlete in swim competitions. They reduce friction and drag in the water, increasing the efficiency of the swimmer's forward motion. The tight fits allow for easy movement and are said to reduce muscle vibration thus reducing drag.

Designed for working lifeguards, Ligegaurd swimsuits are designed to perform well in the water, stay comfortable during long lifeguard shifts, and clearly communicate that the wearer is a professional lifeguard. Usually in red, blue, or black, with a GUARD logo across the chest, lifeguard suits come in a wide variety of styles ranging from traditional one-pieces to minimalist bikinis.

A swimsuit set typically refers to a combination of a swimsuit top and bottom that are sold together as a matching set. It is a complete swimwear ensemble designed to be worn together. Swimsuit sets can come in various styles, such as two-piece bikinis, tankinis, and they are often available in different colors, patterns, and sizes to suit individual preferences and body types.

Swimwear bottoms are a type of clothing worn as the lower part of a swimsuit. They are designed to cover the lower body, including the hips, buttocks, and groin area. Swimwear bottoms come in various styles, including bikini bottoms, briefs, shorts, skirts, and more. They are typically made of materials that can withstand exposure to water, such as nylon, spandex, or polyester, and are designed to provide comfort, support, and freedom of movement while swimming or engaging in water activities.

A bikini top is a garment worn by women as part of a two-piece swimsuit. It typically covers the breasts and is designed to provide support and coverage while allowing for sun exposure and freedom of movement. Bikini tops come in various styles, including triangle tops, bandeau tops, halter tops, and push-up tops, among others. They can be tied or fastened at the back or neck, depending on the design.

A tankini top, on the other hand, is a swimwear top that combines a tank top style with the functionality of a bikini. It is longer in length, covering the torso and often overlapping with the swim bottoms. Tankini tops provide more coverage than a traditional bikini top and are popular among those who prefer a more modest beach or poolside look. They are available in various necklines, such as scoop neck, V-neck, and high neck, and can be paired with different types of swim bottoms for a customizable swimsuit ensemble.

An athletic rash guard is a form-fitting garment typically made of a stretchy and lightweight fabric like nylon or spandex. designed to be worn during athletic activities to provide protection against rashes, abrasions, and sunburns.

Maternity Support Belts - The support belt for pregnant bellies that wrap around the abdomen to help support the lower back, pelvis, hips, and abdomen during pregnancy. Belly belts typically sit on top of clothing, although some people may wear them underneath. ... People may also refer to belly belts as maternity or pregnancy belts, braces, or straps

Maternity Belly Prosthetics - Belly Prosethetic that physically have a round shape to simulate a pregnant abdomen. Common to use form to replicate a round pregnant belly. Can be often found in skin colors.
Supportive belt or wrap that is worn around the belly and supports recovery after childbirth.
Pants of a particular style or material conducive to athletic use.

Shorts are a type of garment that covers the lower body from the waist to the upper thighs or knees, depending on the length. They are designed with the intent to wear in warm weather or for activities that require freedom of movement.

Shorts are typically made from lightweight fabrics such as cotton, linen, or polyester, which allow for breathability and comfort in hot conditions. They come in various styles and lengths, including mid-thigh, knee-length, or even shorter for more casual or athletic purposes.

Shorts are commonly worn by both men and women for casual or recreational activities, such as sports, outdoor adventures, or simply to stay cool in hot weather. They are popular for their comfort and flexibility, allowing for unrestricted movement of the legs. Shorts can be paired with t-shirts, tank tops, or blouses, and are often worn with sandals, sneakers, or flip-flops.

While shorts are generally considered casual attire, there are also dressier styles available, such as tailored or high-waisted shorts, that can be worn in more formal or semi-formal settings. Overall, shorts offer a practical and comfortable option for warm-weather clothing.

Snowboard Pants, are similar to "ski pants:, are pants worn for snowboarding. Snowboard pants have the legs more relaxed or boot cut fit with elastic inner siding at the ankle to fit snugly at the ankles. These pants sometimes having a strap going under the arch, often made of a stretch or waterproof fabric.
Leggings are tight-fitting stretch pants, typically worn by women or girls. Leggings is a covering for the leg, usually extending from the ankle to the knee but sometimes higher.
Shorts of a particular style or material conducive to athletic use.

A skort is a combination of a skirt and shorts, hence the name "skort." It is a garment that appears to be a skirt from the front but has a pair of shorts attached underneath. This design provides the appearance of a skirt while offering the practicality and comfort of shorts.

Skorts are typically made from the same fabrics as skirts, such as cotton, denim, or polyester. They come in various lengths, from mini to knee-length or longer, and can feature different styles and details, similar to skirts. Some skorts have pleats, ruffles, or asymmetrical hems, while others may have a more streamlined or sporty look.

Skorts are popular for their versatility and functionality. They are often worn for activities that require more movement or modesty, such as sports, outdoor activities, or casual occasions. Skorts provide the freedom to move and participate in physical activities without the worry of revealing too much or feeling uncomfortable.

Overall, skorts offer a practical and stylish alternative to both skirts and shorts, combining the best of both worlds. They provide the appearance of a skirt while offering the comfort and mobility of shorts, making them a popular choice for various activities and casual wear.
Snow pants are insulated waterproof trousers worn for outdoor activities in the winter.

Sweatpants are a type of loose-fitting, comfortable pants made from soft, stretchy fabric. They are typically made from materials like cotton or polyester and have an elastic waistband and cuffs at the ankles. Sweatpants are designed to be worn during casual or leisure activities, providing warmth and comfort. They are often associated with loungewear or athletic wear and are popular for activities like exercising, lounging at home, or running errands.
Jeans are a type of pants or trousers, typically made from denim or dungaree cloth. Includes Jeggings.

Pants, also known as trousers, are a type of garment that covers the lower body from the waist to the ankles. They are typically worn by both men and women as a staple of everyday clothing. Pants are designed to provide comfort, protection, and freedom of movement.

Pants are usually made from various fabrics, such as denim, cotton, polyester, or wool, depending on the desired style and purpose. They come in different cuts and styles, including straight-leg, bootcut, skinny, wide-leg, and more. Pants may have various features like pockets, belt loops, zippers, buttons, or elastic waistbands.

Pants are versatile and can be worn in various settings, from casual to formal. They are commonly paired with shirts, blouses, t-shirts, or sweaters, and can be combined with different types of footwear, such as sneakers, boots, or dress shoes. Pants provide coverage and protection for the legs and offer a practical and fashionable option for everyday wear.
Ski pants are pants worn for skiing, having the legs tapered to fit snugly at the ankles and sometimes having a strap going under the arch, often made of a stretch or waterproof fabric.

A skirt is a type of garment that covers the lower part of the body, starting from the waist and extending to various lengths, from mini to knee-length or longer. Unlike pants or shorts, skirts are typically free-flowing and do not have separate leg coverings. 

Skirts can be made from a variety of fabrics, including cotton, denim, silk, chiffon, or wool, and they come in different styles, cuts, and designs. Some common types of skirts include A-line, pencil, maxi, mini, flared, wrap, pleated, or skater skirts. Skirts can also feature various details like ruffles, pleats, patterns, or embellishments, adding to their aesthetic appeal.

Skirts are versatile and can be worn by all ages and for various occasions. They can be part of casual or formal outfits, depending on the style and how they are paired with other garments.

Skirts can be dressed up or down, depending on the occasion, and offer a wide range of options for creating different outfits and styles.
Tapered pants that are often close-fitting and cut to mid-calf length or just above the ankle.

The traditional use of an extender chain is, as the name implies, to extend the length of a necklace or bracelet. Most often this is achieved by adding the extender chain to other chain by attaching a jumpring onto one of the end loops.

To remove tarnish from silver, gold, or any kind of metal, jewelry cleaning, and polishing cloths are soft cloths that are specifically designed for that. Generally, there are two sides of the cloth. One side, soft side, is used as polishing and another side is used as removing the tarnish.
A type of box or small stand object, to display hanging or holding jewelry, this can be small bags or boxes specific for jewelry to case for travel.

Gem scales and balances are used to determine the weight of the metals used in jewelry making projects. It can also be used to weigh scrap metals, precious stones, or gold when selling. Gem scales typically can weigh in carats, grams, and more.
Defined as the Indivial or raw object, in this case, for all beads.
Ring sizer is a measurement device used to denote the circumference of jewellery rings and smart rings.

Is a cleaner that uses chemicals in an aqueous media and ultrasound waves to remove foreign particles and contaminants like oil, dirt, and tarnish and can even remove mold release agents and polishing compounds like rouge and Tripoli from your delicate pieces of jewelry.

Sometimes you'll hear jewelers refer to the overall ring as the setting when describing the ring that you choose to have a diamond set into. Technically, a ring is made up of two parts: the shank, or body of the ring, and the head or gallery — the metal that sets the diamond into place.
Kit consisting of tools for ear piercing such as piercing guns, storage case, clamps, earring holder, studs etc.
A type of display or ornament object, usually with glass or clear casing, used to house jewelry to be visible to the eye, without touching.
A jewelry box is a special container used to store jewelry items, including rings, necklaces, brooches, bracelets and other small trinkets.

Also known as "ultrasonic jewelry cleaners", is a machine or device using ultrasound to vibrate a piece to be cleaned while the piece is immersed in a cleaning fluid. The process produces a very high degree of cleanliness, and is used for jewelery and ornately shaped items.
Defined as the Indivial or raw object, in this case, for all gemstones.
Defined as the Indivial or raw object, in this case, for all pearls.
Jewelry cards are small heavyweight paper/cardstock with precut slots or holes to hold jewelry to use for custom or handmade jewelry to be sold.

A piercing retainer is worn in place of body jewelry, either to hide or disguise the piercing, or to keep it open and viable when a regular piece of jewelry cannot be worn. Typically, retainers are clear, plastic "tools" made to wear in the body.
Body piercing jewelry is jewelry manufactured specifically for use in body piercing.

Necklace pendants; translates as "to hang down" in old french pendant is a form of a loose-hanging piece of jewelry, generally attached by a small loop to a necklace, in United States it typically is known as a pendant necklaces.
A type of jewelry usually placed horizontally through the nipples.
A type of body piercing jewelry worn at the tip of the tongue.
An earring is a piece of jewelry attached to the ear via a piercing in the earlobe or another external part of the ear.

A product specially formulated body adhesive that is ideal for festive events which can be similar to jeweled patterns;glitter prints; or temporary body jewelry that is considered a form of body art, but is of an adhesive back, and doesnt stick after washes like temporary tattooes.

A ring is a round band, usually made of metal, worn as ornamental jewelry. The term "ring" by itself always denotes jewelry worn on the finger; when worn as an ornament elsewhere, the body part is specified within the term, e.g., earrings, neck rings, arm rings, and toe rings.
Novelty charms feature popular symbols such as the peace symbol, an anchor and a key, or other object symbols that may relate to the customer to wear as an adornment for bracelets, necklaces.
A accessory made of metal or other chain material worn on your body.
A toe ring is a ring made out of metals and non-metals worn on any of the toes.
Ornamental jewelry that holds a tie in place.
A wedding ring or wedding band is a finger ring that indicates that its wearer is married. It is usually forged from metal, and traditionally is forged of gold or another precious metal.
A collar clip is one of a small handful of men or women's jewelry items that can be worn to add a bit of visual interest while still remaining true to classic style.
A hoop-like piece of jewelry worn on the nose.

A bracelet is an article of jewelry that is worn around the wrist. Bracelets may serve different uses, such as being worn as an ornament. When worn as ornaments, bracelets may have a supportive function to hold other items of decoration, such as charms.
A jeweled ornamental or floral band or headpiece worn on the front or top of a head. A tiara is a semi-cirle, and a crown and wreath are full circles.
A grill, also known as fronts or golds, is a type of dental jewelry worn over the teeth. Grills are made of metal and are generally removable.
An engagement ring is a ring indicating that the person wearing it is engaged to be married, especially in Western cultures.
A necklace is an article of jewelry or an ornamental chain or string of beads, jewels, or links worn around the neck.

A set or collection of specific jewelry sets that consist of bracelets, necklaces, earrings, or other jewelry items. "Mixed" could include a bracelet, necklace, and ring or earring that typically worn together as a matching set.
An anklet, also called ankle chain, ankle bracelet or ankle string, is an ornament worn around the ankle.
A belly button ring is an ornamental ring or piece of jewelry attached to the skin around the navel.

Body piercing jewelry is jewelry manufactured specifically for use in body piercing. The jewelry involved in the art of body piercing comes in a wide variety of shapes and sizes in order to best fit the pierced site.

In the jewelry world, a wedding set includes the engagement ring, matching band for her and a band for him. A bridal set consists of an engagement ring and matching band for the bride, leaving the groom on his own for his band. Outside of the jewelry industry, the term wedding set is commonly used for both.

In the United States, a class ring is a ring worn by students and alumni to commemorate their graduation, generally for a high school, college, or university. Today class rings can be customized, from the material and style that the ring is made of to the color and cut of the gem in the center.
