Cufflinks are items of jewelry that are used to secure the cuffs of dress shirts. Cufflinks can be manufactured from a variety of different materials, such as glass, stone, leather, metal, precious metal or combinations of these.

Pins or Boorches are a decorative jewelry items designed to be attached to garments, that is held by a pin or clasp and is worn at or near the neck, often to hold them closed. It is usually made of metal, often silver or gold or some other material.

A shirt stud is a decorative fastener that fits onto a buttonhole on the front of a pleated shirt, or onto the starched bib of a stiff-front shirt. Such shirts have special buttonholes solely for shirt studs.
A ring through which the ends or corners of a scarf are threaded in order to hold the scarf in position.

Ring enhancers, often called Ring Guards, Ring Wraps, or Curved Rings are uniquely designed rings, created to be worn with solitaire diamond rings. ... When worn together, the two rings appear to be a single, multi-stone ring.

The Rosary, also known as the Dominican Rosary, refers to a set of prayers used primarily in the Catholic Church, and to the physical string of knots or beads used to count the component prayers.
Prayer beads are a form of beadwork used to count the repetitions of prayers, chants, or mantras by members of various religions.

A charm bracelet is a type of bracelet which carries personal jewelled ornaments or "charms", such as decorative pendants or trinkets. The decorative charms usually carry personal or sentimental attachment by the owner.
A holder that securely holds business cards or credit cards in a case, pouch, sleeve or folding type of item.
A cover to protect and hold a bank book containing blank checks issued by a bank. Checkbook covers can have slots for cards, or pockets to store pens or other items.
A coin purse or pouch, called coin purse for clarity, is a small money bag or pouch, made for carrying coins.

A small, zippered fabric pouch on an strap that fastens around your waist to carry money and a few personal items. Many times it is intended to be worn under a shirt to protect valuables from thieves and pickpockets.
Credit card holders are a device like wallet or case that protects and holds credit cards.

Lightweight athletic wear belt designed to hold items (e.g. small water bottles) while running.  It is specifically designed for athletic activity.  For fashion oriented, non-running assortment please use the Fanny Packs product type.
A wallet is a flat case or pouch used to store and carry cash, coins, credit cards, IDs, and personal documents or belongings.
A money clip is a device typically used to store cash and credit cards in a very compact fashion for those who do not wish to carry a wallet.

A passport holder is a protective cover or case specifically designed to hold and safeguard a passport. It is a small, often wallet-like accessory that provides an organized and secure way to store and carry your passport while traveling.

Passport holders are typically made of durable materials such as leather, synthetic leather, or fabric. They come in various sizes, shapes, and designs to suit individual preferences. Some passport holders are simple and functional, while others may have additional features such as compartments for credit cards, boarding passes, or travel documents.

The primary purpose of a passport holder is to protect your passport from wear and tear, spills, or accidental damage. It helps prevent the passport from bending, getting scratched, or getting exposed to moisture. Additionally, a passport holder can help keep your passport easily accessible and visible within your belongings.

Many passport holders also feature a clear plastic or transparent sleeve where you can slide in the front cover of your passport. This allows for easy identification of your passport and quick access to the necessary information, such as your photo and personal details.

Using a passport holder can enhance the security and organization of your travel documents. It can also add a personal touch or style to your passport, making it stand out from others.
Sweatbands worn by athletes or those that pretend to be athletes.
a covering for the head made of real or artificial hair, typically worn by people for adornment or by people trying to conceal their baldness.
A wig cap is a cap that acts as protective barrier to a sensitive scalp and keep a wig comfortable and secure to scalp during everyday use.

Fire hoods are pieces of personal protective equipment (PPE) worn as coverage for the head and extending into the upper chest area.  The hoods are designed to be utilized as a component of a structural fire fighting protective ensemble, and should comply to all appropriate certifications and standards.

A workwear uniform hat is a headwear accessory that is worn as part of a work uniform in various industries. It serves both functional and aesthetic purposes, providing protection, identification, and a cohesive appearance for employees.

Here are some key features and characteristics of a workwear uniform hat:

1. Identification: Workwear uniform hats often feature company logos, names, or branding. This helps to identify employees and promotes a consistent and professional image for the organization.

2. Protection: Depending on the work environment, workwear uniform hats can provide protection against various elements such as sun, heat, cold, or falling objects. They may have wide brims or visors to shield the face and eyes from the sun, or they may be made from materials that offer insulation in colder conditions.

3. Functionality: Workwear hats may have functional features that cater to specific job requirements. For example, some hats may have built-in sweatbands to absorb moisture and keep the wearer comfortable, or they may have adjustable straps or closures for a secure fit.

4. Material and construction: Workwear uniform hats are typically made from durable materials that can withstand the demands of the job. Common materials include cotton, polyester, canvas, or blends. The hats may be constructed with reinforced stitching or additional features like ventilation holes for breathability.

5. Style options: Workwear uniform hats come in various styles and designs to suit different industries and job roles. Some common styles include baseball caps, bucket hats, hard hats, beanies, or wide-brimmed hats. The specific style chosen may depend on factors such as the level of formality required, safety regulations, or job-specific needs.
Ear Warmers are personal protective equipment designed to cover a person's ears for warmth or hearing protection

A veil is an article of clothing or hanging cloth that is intended to cover some part of the head or face, or an object of some significance. Usually a veil is made of fine material a person can see through.
A device to secure glasses via a chain or cord which is worn around your neck.
Bandanas are a large handkerchief, typically in colorful patterns, with multiple wear functions, worn tied around the head or neck

A fascinator is a decorative headpiece typically worn by women as an accessory for special occasions, such as weddings, parties, or horse races. It is usually attached to a headband, clip, or comb and is designed to be worn on the side or front of the head. 

Fascinators can come in various shapes, sizes, and styles, but they are generally characterized by their ornate and eye-catching designs. They often feature feathers, flowers, beads, ribbons, veils, or other embellishments, creating a visually appealing and elegant look. 

Fascinators are popular for adding a touch of glamour and sophistication to formal outfits. They can be worn with hairstyles ranging from updos to loose hair, and they provide an alternative to traditional hats or headscarves. Fascinators are often chosen to complement and enhance an outfit, and they can be customized to match the color scheme or theme of a particular event.

A hat is a head covering which is worn for various reasons, including protection against weather conditions, ceremonial reasons such as university graduation, religious reasons, safety, or as a fashion accessory.
Real or artificial feathers that can be clipped, glued, or sewn on a persons natural hair.
Devices used to thoroughly remove the build-up of mud, clay or grass on the bottom of the cleats.

A shoe horn is a tool with a short handle that flares into a longer spoon-like head meant to be held against the inside back of a snug-fitting shoe so that a person can slide the heel easily along its basin to the inner sole.

A boot jack is a small tool that aids in the removal of boots. It consists of a U-shaped mouth that grips the heel of the boot, and a flat area to which weight can be applied with the opposite foot.
Is a brush used to apply shoe polish to shoes, work the polish in and bring up a shine.

Shoe Care Kits, are a collection of accessories that are used to shine shoes. The most basic shoe shine kits will contain a tin of polish and a brush as well as a cloth or buffer to achieve the desired shine. There are, however, more comprehensive shoe care kits that can be used with a variety of different shoes and materials.
Cleaning product that removes dirt and scuff marks from footwear.

Shoe polish, also called "boot polish" is a waxy paste, cream, or liquid used to polish, shine, and waterproof leather shoes or boots to extend the footwear's life and restore, maintain and improve their appearance. Shoe polishes are distinguished by their textures, which range from liquids to hard waxes. Solvent, waxes, and colorants comprise most shoe polishes.
A pair of strings or cords used to secure shoes, boots, and other footwear.
A machine used for drying shoes, and usually functions by blowing air on the inside of the shoes. The airflow causes the shoes to dry faster.
A bag intended to carry and protect shoes. It also keeps shoes from dirtying other items within a bag or car when traveling.
Posts for added strength and durability that are made to replace existing cleats on Football shoes.
A replacement sole (bottom shoe) or heel (for heel shoes) to replace on shoes & boots.
High Heel Protectors are made from plastic or pvc materials which are designed to prevent heels from sinking into grass or falling into cracks and grates.
A product that is an alternative to wrapping a players cleats in tape, these covers stretch over cleats and wrap from the bottom of the foot to the top of their ankle.

Shoe Odor Control is a product, typically a spray, but can be other type of product that helps prevent and eliminate foot odor caused by bacteria and dead skin cells. Used to help maintain good foot hygiene.
Shoe Ice & Snow Grips, also known as "Ice cleats" are a contraption, affixed to a shoe or boot, with small spikes underneath. They are used to avoid sliding on slippery surfaces like ice or snow.
Shoe decorative charms are small ornaments or jewelry like pieces that are worn on shoes or to cover shoelaces.

Shoe inserts are any kind of non-prescription foot support designed to be worn inside a shoe. Pre-packaged, mass produced, arch supports are shoe inserts. 
Insoles: Insoles slip into your shoe to provide extra cushioning and support. Insoles are often made of gel, foam, or plastic.
Shoe measuring device, or also known as a "Brannock Device" is a measuring instrument for measuring a person's shoe size.
Is a brand of compond glue, adhesive and sealant intended for repairs of footwear.

A shoe tree is a shaped block inserted into a shoe when it is not being worn to keep the shoe in shape. A boot shaper, on the other hand, has wooden or plastic formers with centre support or wedge that expands to provide the ideal tension for your boots. Some boot shapers come with a trigger that allows easy fitting and hanging.
Shoe and boot accessory worn over the lower pants leg and shoe.  It is designed to keep dirt, snow, and other objects from falling into footwear.
Shoes worn by soccer players with studs or cleats on the sole.
Baseball and softball cleats come with a toe spike intended to help players dig in while throwing, taking off from the bases, and running in dirt.
Shoes meant for various types of dancing due to the non-slip soles, flexibility and support. Does not include ballet shoes.
Footwear worn by volleyball players.
Footwear with studs or cleats on the sole worn by lacrosse players
Slipper are a comfortable slip-on shoe that is typically worn indoors.
A durable covering for the foot that usually reaches above the ankle,section, or much of the leg, and usually made of leather, fabric, plastic, or rubber.
Sandals are an open type of footwear, consisting of a sole held to the wearer's foot by straps going over the instep and around the ankle. Sandals can also have a heel.
Waterproof boots made of rubber or plastic that are designed to be worn in the rain.

These boots usually have a high arch, chunky and moderately high slanted heel, rounded to pointed toe, along with decorative stitching. Historically worn by cowboys or meant as a riding style. But they are often work as fashion footwear.
The footwear worn by tennis players.
A lightweight shoe designed specifically for ballet dancing.

Casual shoes are footwear options that are designed for everyday wear in relaxed or informal settings. They are typically comfortable, versatile, and suitable for various casual occasions. Here are some common types of casual shoes:

1. Sneakers: Sneakers, also known as athletic shoes or trainers, are popular casual shoes that offer comfort and support. They come in a range of styles, including low-top, high-top, slip-on, or retro designs. Sneakers are versatile and can be paired with jeans, shorts, skirts, or casual dresses.

2. Loafers: Loafers are slip-on shoes that are easy to wear and offer a classic yet casual look. They are often made of leather or suede and feature a low heel or no heel at all. Loafers can be worn with trousers, chinos, jeans, or even dresses for a more sophisticated casual look.

3. Boat shoes: Boat shoes, also known as deck shoes, are traditionally made with leather uppers and rubber soles. They are designed for boating but have become popular as comfortable and stylish casual shoes. Boat shoes are often worn without socks and pair well with shorts, khakis, or jeans.

4. Espadrilles: Espadrilles are lightweight casual shoes with canvas or fabric uppers and a characteristic rope or jute sole. They are typically slip-on or have ankle ties and are popular for warm-weather wear. Espadrilles go well with shorts, sundresses, or casual skirts.

5. Sandals: Sandals are open-toe footwear options that provide breathability and comfort. They come in various styles, such as slides, flip-flops, or gladiator sandals. Sandals are suitable for hot weather and can be paired with shorts, skirts, or casual summer dresses.

6. Slip-on shoes: Slip-on shoes, like canvas or leather slip-ons, offer convenience and easy wearability. They are often lightweight and have a minimalistic design. Slip-on shoes can be paired with jeans, chinos, or casual trousers for a laid-back look.

These are just a few examples of casual shoes, and there are many other styles available to suit personal preferences and fashion trends. The choice of casual shoes depends on individual style, comfort, and the specific occasion or activity.

Dress shoes are a type of footwear that is specifically designed for formal or dressier occasions. They are typically made from high-quality materials and feature a more polished and sophisticated appearance compared to casual shoes. Dress shoes are often worn with suits, dress pants, or formal attire. Here are some common types of dress shoes:

1. Oxfords: Oxfords are classic dress shoes characterized by their closed lacing system, where the shoelace eyelets are stitched under the vamp. They have a sleek and streamlined design, featuring a low heel and a rounded or pointed toe. Oxfords are versatile and can be worn with a variety of formal outfits.

2. Derby Shoes: Derby shoes, also known as bluchers, are similar to Oxfords but have an open lacing system. The shoelace eyelets are sewn on top of the vamp, allowing for a slightly more relaxed fit. Derby shoes are often considered less formal than Oxfords, but they still maintain an elegant and polished appearance.

3. Brogues: Brogues are dress shoes that feature decorative perforations, known as broguing, along the edges and sometimes on the toe cap. They can come in Oxford or Derby styles and add a touch of sophistication and detail to formal outfits. Brogues are available in different levels of broguing, ranging from full brogues (wingtips) with extensive perforations to semi-brogues and quarter brogues with more subtle detailing.

4. Monk Strap Shoes: Monk strap shoes are characterized by their unique buckle strap closure instead of traditional laces. They can have a single monk strap (one buckle) or a double monk strap (two buckles). Monk strap shoes offer a stylish and slightly unconventional look that works well with both formal and semi-formal attire.

5. Loafers: Loafers are slip-on dress shoes that are known for their comfort and versatility. They can feature various designs, such as penny loafers with a strap across the vamp or tassel loafers with decorative tassels. Loafers are often made from leather or suede and provide a more relaxed and contemporary option for dressier occasions.

Dress shoes are typically made from high-quality materials like leather or suede and are designed to provide a polished and sophisticated appearance. They are an essential part of formal attire and add a touch of elegance to dressier occasions.
Boots designed to be used for athletic purposes.

Safety shoes and boots are specialized footwear designed to provide protection and safety in various work environments. They are typically worn by workers in industries or occupations that involve potential hazards, such as construction, manufacturing, mining, or any other job that involves working with heavy machinery, chemicals, or on slippery surfaces.

Key features of safety shoes and boots include:

1. Toe protection: Safety footwear often includes a reinforced toe cap, commonly made of steel, composite materials, or aluminum, to protect the toes from impacts or crushing injuries from falling objects or heavy equipment.

2. Slip-resistant soles: The outsoles of safety shoes and boots are designed to provide excellent traction and prevent slips and falls, especially on wet or oily surfaces.

3. Puncture resistance: Some safety footwear includes a puncture-resistant midsole to protect the feet from sharp objects, such as nails or shards of glass, that may penetrate the sole.

4. Electrical hazard protection: Certain safety shoes and boots are designed to provide electrical hazard protection. They have non-conductive materials that prevent electrical currents from passing through the footwear, reducing the risk of electric shocks.

5. Chemical resistance: In environments where workers are exposed to hazardous chemicals, safety footwear may be made from materials that are resistant to chemical spills or corrosive substances.

Safety shoes and boots are essential for maintaining the safety and well-being of workers in high-risk environments. They help prevent injuries, such as crushes, punctures, slips, and electrical shocks, and provide support and stability to the feet. It is important to select safety footwear that complies with relevant safety standards and regulations to ensure proper protection for the specific workplace hazards.

Waders denotes a waterproof boot or overalls extending from the foot to the thigh, the chest or the neck. They are traditionally made from vulcanised rubber, but available in more modern PVC, neoprene and Gore-Tex variants.
Athletic shoe are shoes designed to be worn for running, basketball, tennis, exercising, or recreational activity, as racquetball, jogging, or aerobic dancing.
Shoes or boots with cleats or protrusions on their soles used for athletic purposes.
Ankle boots are boots that reaches to or just above the ankle.
A hat box is usually a round or strong box or luggage designed to hold and protect hats when being transported or stored.

Gown dress preservation is a series of special cleaning and/or packaging techniques to ensure the style will retain its quality over time. A preserved dress is typically stored in an airtight box where the oxygen has been sucked out and replaced with nitrogen. This is meant to prevent oxidation (aging, discoloration, etc.), which may happen to clothes that have been stored for several years as a keepsake.
Leather and Suede Care is specialized cleaners for leather, suede, or nubuck items to help protect, condition, or clean to help preserve and protect suede and leather type goods.

Leather dyes have a lot of pigment and usually strong dyes. Suede Dyes are lighter in pigment and use a slightly different formula to keep the suede soft. If you use Leather dye on Suede it will make the nap of the leather harder.

A handheld fan, or simply hand fan, is any broad, flat surface that is waved back-and-forth to create an airflow. Generally, purpose-made handheld fans are folding fans, which are shaped like a sector of a circle and made of a thin material (such as paper or feathers) mounted on slats which revolve around a pivot so that it can be closed when not in use. Hand fans were used before mechanical fans were invented.
Handkerchiefs are a square of cotton or other finely woven material, typically carried in one's pocket as a fashion accessory, and/or intended for blowing or wiping one's nose.

Parasols are a light umbrella, used to give shade from the sun. A parasol, however, (in Latin para for “shelter or shield” and sol “sun”) is typically constructed from more delicate fabrics such as lace, cotton, silk, linen, canvas, plastic, etc.
Key Cases are typically a small case in which keys are carried. They can be an individual key case, a case that holds a multitude of keys, or a case specific for remote style keys.
An umbrella is a folding canopy supported by wooden or metal ribs that is usually mounted on a wooden, metal, or plastic pole. It is designed to protect a person against rain or sunlight

A keychain (also key fob or keyring) is a small ring or chain of metal to which several keys can be attached. The length of a keychain allows an item to be used more easily than if connected directly to a keyring. Some keychains allow one or both ends the ability to rotate, keeping the keychain from becoming twisted, while the item is being used.
A bag that is carried from the shoulder on one side of the body or across the chest.

A bag carried on a persons back that has many pockets and straps that go over their shoulders, used to carry things. These bags can help distribute the total weight evenly across a persons back and shoulders.
A product designed to hold or protect a laptop.
A shopping bag used to carry purchased products from a store or market to home. These type of bags are used instead of plastic or paper bags making it environmentally friendly.
A bag designed to carry a laptop.
A bag made of fabric which you pack and grab by the straps or handle and can be carried over the shoulder.

A waist bag, or fanny pack, moon bag, belly bag, waist bag, is a small fabric pouch worn like a belt around the waist by use of a strap above the hips that is secured usually with some sort of buckle. The straps sometimes have tri-glide slides, making them adjustable in order to fit properly.
A bag of flexible material, usually used to ease transporting suits, jackets or clothing in general, and also to protect clothes from dust by hanging them inside with their hangers.
A handbag, commonly known as a purse in North American English, is a handled medium-to-large bag used to carry personal items.
A bag that is used to pack clothing and other personal belongings when traveling.
a flat, rectangular bag with a handle, typically made of leather, for carrying books and papers.
An open-ended flat pocket cover designed to protect a laptop during non-use.
A purse hook (also known as a handbag hook or handbag hanger) is a type of hook meant to temporarily secure a purse or handbag to a table, sink or armrest.
Charms that accompany any type of bag. A type of accessory for decorative purpose that clips on or off. Not for keychains.

Handbag Organizers & Inserts, also called "purse organizers" is inserted into the purse, and typically, has several pockets that can be used to group different items into separate groups, for example, electronics, make-up, and food and drinks pockets, thus, making it easier to find them.
Purse Handles can be added to a purse or used to replace handles on a purse.

Baby Bodysuit Extenders is a fabric or material extension with snaps to expand the life of baby bodysuits & onesies. The fabric swatch snaps to the bodysuit bottom snaps to expand the size restriction of bodysuits for long or large babies.
Reusable Training Pants are toddler underwear with extra padding or waterproof protection, used during the transition period from diapers to undies.

A set of clothes for a newborn. It can include a combination or all of the following pieces: bodysuits and/or pants, pajamas, swaddle or receiving blanket, socks, mittens, hats or hair bows, bibs, burp clothes, stuffed animal or even toiletries like baby’s first shampoo and lotion set.

A bodysuit made of a soft material with a hole for baby’s head and two holes for their arms. It is a loose fitting “sack”, a baby or toddler  is able to move their arms and legs more freely while still somewhat restricting their mobility and keeping warm. A baby sleepsack is often called a wearable blanket.

A baby bodysuit, also known as a onesie or one-piece, is a garment designed for infants and young children. It is a one-piece garment that covers the torso and typically has snaps or buttons at the crotch for easy diaper changes. Baby bodysuits are usually made of soft, comfortable materials such as cotton and come in various designs, colors, and patterns. They are a popular choice for both everyday wear and as a base layer under other clothing.
A stroller is a small carriage with wheels meant for pushing a baby or toddler around.
A car seat base is used in conjunction with an infant car seat. They are usually purchased when the parent uses the same car seat in multiple vehicles.

A seat designed specifically to use in a vehicle to protect a baby or child from a collision. There are different seats appropriate to age for the baby or child and are known as any of the following, child safety seat, baby car seat, infant car seat, child restraint system, or a booster seat.
A supporting device worn by an adult for holding an infant close to the torso.

A device that safely hangs over a babies crib or bassinet. It can soothe the baby to sleep and keep them entertained while they are awake. A baby mobile is an educational tool to help a baby's overall development.

A baby activity centers is a play station equipped with attached toys that expose children to new textures, sounds and other sensory stimuli. This is meant for a baby that has head control and will sit inside a seat within the center. Some centers are meant for a child to walk around it or pull up on it and play.

Not to be confused with a baby gyms that are meant to be used when babies are still at the point of just starting out on their backs and only learning to roll over.

An arch with suspended dangling toys that may or may not include a mat. Baby gyms are designed for babies that are still at the point of just starting out on their backs and only learning to roll over.
A soft book is a type of children's book intended for pre-readers aimed primarily at babies. They are typically made of fabric, although they can also by made of soft plastic and used in the bath.
A device that holds a baby in sling seat with a spring or elastic. The device either comes in a standalone frame or can be attached to a door frame.

A baby rattle is a rattle meant to stimulate a babies senses. A rattle is a percussion instrument consisting of resonant objects strung together and set in a sliding frame or enclosed in a container such that when it is shaken the parts strike against each other, producing sounds.
A silicone, wood, or rubber device given to teething infant or baby to put in their mouth to chew on. It helps reduce pain of developing teeth.
A mat meant for babies to play on during early stages of development. Not to be confused with baby gyms which may or may not include a mat in addition to dangling toys hanging from an arch.

A baby bouncer and baby rocker are both lightweight framed devices covered by soft, padded fabric to form a chair that supports your little one’s entire body. It is powered by baby’s own movements or by giving it a quick nudge with your hand or foot. Both can be manual or power operated.

A baby in a bouncer will go up and down. And in a rocker a baby will rock front to back.

A device can do one or the other or both bounce and rock.
Baby swings are free-standing, elevated seats that let an infant sit at a semi-reclined angle. They're basically baby pedestals that make it easier for adults and siblings to interact with the baby.

A baby walker is a device that can be used by infants who cannot walk on their own to move from one place to another. They have a base made of hard plastic sitting on top of wheels and a suspended fabric seat with two leg holes.
Hands-Free Breast Pump Bras are bras that are worn during pumping. This allows the mother to pump her breastmilk freeing her hands up to do anything else.
A cream used as a moisturizer for breastfeeding mothers to heal, soothe and nourish the nipple area.
Breast pumps are machines, manual or electric, that extract milk from a mother's breast in order to bottle feed an infant.
Nursing covers are worn by the mother to help cover the baby while nursing in public.

Breast shells can have multiple uses based on the style of the shell. It can provide a barrier between the nipple and bra to prevent any painful rubbing or contact for breast feeding moms. It can also be used to catch and collect breast milk while a mom breastfeeds, pumps or in between pumping or feeding sessions.
A breast pump valve and membrane acts as a barrier between breast milk and the pump tubing and works together with other pump parts to create strong suction.

productType.productTypeName: Baby Bottle & Breast Pump Part Sterilizers
productType.description: An electric or steam device that is used to sanitize and clean bottles, nipples, pacifiers, sippy cups, breast pump parts, and other feeding gear. The device ensures the pieces are free from germs and bacteria.
Breastmilk Storage bags are bags that are used to store breast milk that is extracted using a breast pump
These are sets that contain various pump accessories such as breast shields, flanges, valves, membranes, additional bottles, ice packs, adapters, coolers, etc.
A classifier for items in “Breastfeeding & Pumping Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A nipple shield is a nipple-shaped sheath worn over the areola and nipple during breastfeeding. Modern nipple shields are made of soft, thin, flexible silicone and have holes at the end of the nipple section to allow the breast milk to pass through.
Nursing pillows are contoured pillows specifically designed to help with the comfort of mother and baby during breastfeeding. It helps position the baby in the right position.
Pregnancy Pillows are pillows designed to help expectant mothers be more comfortable during pregnancy. They are usually meant for help positioning during nighttime rest.
A slipcover for pregnancy or nursing pillows.
A cloth or disposable pad worn against the nipple and breast of a nursing mother to absorb any milk that may leak between feedings. It is inserted between the bra and the breast.
Breast shields, also called flanges, are the pump part that that connect to the breast where the milk is extracted.
Replacement tubing is used to replace the told tubing from which the suction passes through from the breast pump, which allows the breastmilk to flow from the breast into the bottle.

A baby crib bumper, or a crib liner, is a fabric pad that's designed to surround the interior sides of a crib to prevent baby from accidentally slipping their limbs through the slats or banging their head on the side of the crib.
Sound machines help to lull babies to sleep and keep them asleep. The noise also helps drown out other sounds in the household that could potentially wake your baby up, too.
An item for play or for stimulating a baby that is often attachable to the rails of a crib or playpen.

Crib rail covers fasten along the upper rails of a baby crib, and may be intended for: providing additional comfort to the infant, aesthetic enhancement, preventing the chewing of the crib rail while teething, or any combination of these things.
A special-purpose lock for cabinets, drawers, bottles, etc. that is designed to help prevent children from getting at any dangerous things or contents.
Baby Sleep Positioners keep babies under six months old in a specific position while sleeping.
Nasal aspirator is a device you use to create suction and safely suck out mucus and clear your baby's nose so they can breathe without obstruction.
A classifier for items in “Baby Safety Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A scale designed for a baby to lay in or sit on to measure their weight.
A device used by parents or caregiver to remotely listen and or watch and monitor a baby or child.
Rails that attach and fitted to a bed that prevents a toddler from rolling and falling out of bed.
A cover or guard that goes over corners and or edges of tables, dressers, fireplaces, & many more surfaces used to protect a child from getting hurt.
Covers that plug into or go over outlets to prevent a baby and toddler from inserting their fingers (or anything else for that matter) into the slots and getting an electrical shock.
A safety device that provide safety for a child when walking by preventing them from being separated from their parent or caregiver.

Fetal doppler is a device that uses sound waves to check a baby's heartbeat when in mother's womb. It's a type of ultrasound that uses a handheld device to detect changes in movement that are translated as sound.

Add on or extension gate pieces and kit is used with a larger or full size safety gate. These pieces help ensure a gate fits a door frame or room opening perfectly if the gate in itself does not fit the allocated area. The extension gate is a smaller piece relative to an original safety gate.
Cushions that support a baby's head and body.

A protective barrier designed to prevent babies and toddlers from accessing areas of a home, such as stairways and kitchens. Baby gates are typically constructed of metal, plastic and/or wood. It can be expanded to fit in a range of doorway widths, strairways, or room openings.
Electronic device that monitors and sends an alarm when wetness in bed sheets is detected.
Booster seats are an extra seat or cushion placed on an existing seat for a small child to sit on.
A bassinet is a bed specifically designed to accommodate babies from 0-months to about 4-months old.
A Diaper changing table is a small raised platform designed to allow a person to change a baby's diaper.
Components and accessory products intended for cribs, bassinets, and baby bed furniture.

A piece of furniture used for feeding older babies and younger toddlers. The chair is small in size to fit a older baby or toddler and usually has straps and buckles to keep baby or toddler in place and safe.

A baby play yard is a framed enclosure with mesh or fabric sides. Play yards are intended for use in or around the home, for travel, and other purposes. Play yards provide sleeping and playing accommodations for a baby or child who cannot climb out.
A portable sleep space for a baby up to 4 months old. They typically have a maximum weight limit of 15-20 lbs.
Rigid piece of furniture or accessory style surface that supports a baby while changing its diaper.
A piece of furniture used for a baby or toddler to sleep in. It is a bed with high barred, slatted or latticed sides so a baby or child cannot fall out.

This is specifically for drinks that are formulated to provide the body with electrolytes. These are for use during and after exercise or when you have been sick and depleted your electrolytes. An example if pedialyte.
Food that is geared for older babies or toddlers as an add on or in between milk or meals.
Baby food is any soft, easily consumed food (excluding breastmilk or infant formula) that is made specifically for human babies between four months and two years old.
Nutrient-dense shakes specially designed for use with children.
Manufactured food specially designed as a nutritional supplement for toddlers usually age 1 - 3 years old.
Baby cereal is a blended/mostly pureed form of a grain or pseudograin like oats or quinoa. Cereal will likely be on the image, in the product name, or description.

Baby formula or infant formula is  manufactured food designed and marketed for feeding to babies and infants under 12 months of age, usually prepared for bottle-feeding or cup-feeding. It can come in powder form that is prepared into a liquid or ready to feed liquid formula.
A beverage (fruit and/or vegetable-based) formulated with additional nutrients and/or less sugar designed for babies and toddlers.
Pacifier holders are devices that attach a baby pacifier to the baby to keep it close to them at all times.
A garment worn hanging from the neck on the chest to protect clothing from accidentally spilled food, milk, beverage or drool.
A bottle liner (often disposable) is an insert to store breast milk or formula inside a bottle.
A classifier for items in “Baby Feeding Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A sippy cup is a drinking cup designed for toddlers which prevents or reduces spills. Sippy cups, as opposed to an open cup, have a top which prevents spills, and the child drinks either through a spout or straw.

These are drying racks that are specifcally designed to dry baby bottles and their respective parts/accessories. They typically contains rods that stand upright allowing the bottle to placed on them upside down to fully dry a bottle allowing air to flow in at the bottom.

Shopping cart and high chair covers are pieces of fabric that are placed over a high chair or shopping cart to protect the baby from the germs living on the shopping cart/high chair. They can also help contain messes that babies can make.
A piece of material mainly intended to absorb babies' spit after meals. It is also used for absorbing burps, vomit, drool, and fluids.
A baby formula mixer and dispenser is an electronic or manual device that does all or a combination of mixing, warming, and pouring into a bottle at the push of a button.

A baby bottle nipple is made from silicone or latex designed to let milk flow through a hole at the top of the bottle nipple based on a baby's development stage and drinking rhythm. Baby bottle nipples come in different shapes, sizes and styles.
Baby bottle brushes are brushes that are specifically designed to clean baby bottles. They typically have a combination of bristles and a sponge head to thoroughly clean bottles.
Baby bottle warmers are devices that warm the baby's milk/formula to the right temperature.
Loose, apron-like clothing designed to cover a baby's upper body while feeding.

Baby food storage are containers used to hold baby food at room temperature, in the refrigerator, or in the freezer.

Baby food dispensers are containers that store baby food that are dispensable from it usually used for powered formula or snacks.
Baby food makers are devices that are used to puree and steam a baby's food.
Baby snack feeders are snack containers that are specifically designed to store snacks while also allowing the baby/toddler to eat the snack while also not spilling it.

A container with a nipple attached to it, which creates the ability to drink via suckling. It is typically used by infants, babies and young children, or if someone cannot drink from a cup, for feeding oneself or being fed.

A baby pacifier is a small device, typically a rubber, plastic or silicone nipple substitute that is given to an infant/toddler to suckle on between feedings. It can calm a baby and satisifies the need to scuk when the baby doesn't need to eat.
Lotions specifically formulated for baby use as these have milder ingredients and tend to be less abrasive.
Diaper rash treatments are creams, ointments or pastes that help prevent diaper rashes and applied to a baby or toddlers bottom before putting on a clean diaper.
A cake-shaped gift that's made of diapers used for decoration to give to parents at a baby shower or for babies nursery. The diapers are useable and not a permanent decoration.
Diaper liners are layers of material you add to your cloth diaper to make solid waste cleanup easier. They are also utilized to help prevent stains in your cloth diapers.
A diaper changing pad is used to place a baby when changing the baby's diaper or even for changing the baby's clothing. It's a soft space to be comfortable to the baby.
Diaper fasteners help keep cloth diapers together and from falling off/apart.
A small sectioned-off basket, bin or bag that allows you to store diapers, wipes, and creams.

Diaper pail liners also known as diaper pail refills are used for reusable or disposable diapers. 

These liners are inserted inside a diaper pail. They are made of plastic or out of reusable material.
A diaper sprayer is used for cloth diapers and is typically a toilet attachment. It uses a high pressure spray of water to wash solid messes out of diapers and straight into the toilet.
A peepee cone is used during diaper changes for baby boys to prevent any potential urine from escaping before the new diaper is placed on the baby.

These are undergarments that function like diapers to be used by children that are going through potty training. It helps them learn how to pull up their own underwear and pull it down when they need to go potty. They can be reusable or disposable.
Baby wipes are moistened pieces of synthetic fibers used to cleanse the sensitive skin of infants, babies or toddlers.
A cloth baby diaper also known as a reusable diaper, is a diaper made from synthetic or natural fibers, or a combination of both.

Disposable baby diapers contain absorbent chemicals and are thrown away after use. Diapers are primarily worn by infants and toddlers who are not yet toilet trained, and by children who experience bedwetting.

A diaper changing pad cover is the covering for a diaper changing pad. These can be washed or wiped down and used again. Some are made of a cloth material and others are made up of a waterproof material.
A diaper pail is a container that is meant to store dirty diapers until they are ready to be disposed of. They keep the smell contained as well with a sealed lid.
Baby diaper covers or wraps are made of waterproof material. They are used with diapers that are not waterproof on their own, specifically for cloth diapers also know as reusable diapers.
Baby wipe holders are containers that hold baby wipes and dispense them when you need them.
An electronic device used to keep baby wipes warm and moist for a little one’s comfort.
Bags that are designed to hold used diapers and then to be disposed; they provide a more sanitary and convenient way of disposing used diapers.

A diaper wet bag is meant to store dirty cloth diapers when away from the home. They are typically reusable, waterproof, and leak resistant. They typically zip shut to help keep odors (and liquids) from escaping.
A diaper bag is a bag in which diapers and other baby necessities are stored while out of the home.
Fabric seat liner designed for use with a baby and toddler car seat to add extra padding, comfort, and protection to the car seat.
An insulating pad that resembles a sleeping bag that is installed on the stroller during winter. It is made of layers of cotton or fleece from the inside that will keep a baby warm.
Stroller Accessories add more options to the stroller to hold bottles, bags and other items.
A device that snaps onto stroller tubes to turn two single strollers into a double stroller.
Accessories and parts for a baby or toddler stroller that attaches to the stroller frame.
Baby accessory holder or organizer bag designed to contain individual items on a baby stroller.

A piece of fabric that is used to put over an infant carseat when outside. Based on the thickness and material of the fabric, the cover acts as an extra layer of insulation, shield from rain, protection against other elements, and a barrier from light.

A baby car seat mirror is a secondary mirror, larger than a rearview mirror that is placed on the back-seat headrest in a vehicle and angle it towards baby. It allows the driver to see the baby without taking eyes off the road.

A bag to protect a car seat when checking the car seat as luggage, bringing the seat for use on an airplane, or even for cruises and travel by train. The bag usually has features to help carry or roll the bag like luggage or wear as a backpack.
Loose or attachable toys safe for a stroller or car seat that have various elements to keep baby engaged and entertained. These toys also help the child with sensory development.
A car seat adapter is an attachment that connects an infant car seat to a stroller converting the two pieces to be an easy to use travel system.
A tray designed to attach to a forward facing car seat. It usually has compartments for toys, snacks, sippy cups, coloring books and more to keep toddlers occupied during car rides and flights.
Baby Car Seat Angle Adjusters are devices that help the car seat sit at the correct angle to keep the baby safe.
A car seat protector is a device that is designed to protect the car's upholstery from stains, scratches, tears and indentations.
A cover to hide the release button and deters children from opening their seat belts while riding in a motorized vehicle.

Accessories that help guide the Lower Anchors and Tethers for Children (LATCH) systems in a car. LATCH systems is a way to secure a child safety seat – rear-facing or forward-facing – to a vehicle without the vehicle's seat belts.
A cover that protects baby from rain, wind, snow and sleet, and bugs. These covers are usually see-through that allows baby to see while providing the caregiver a clear view of baby.
A removable seat that sits right on top of a regular toilet seat. It's sized for a toddler's bottom and may have features such as handles or a splash guard to provide added security for a toddler.

A tub, enclosure, or other similar product intended to hold water and be placed into an adult bath tub, sink, or on top of other surfaces to provide support or containment, or both, for an infant in a reclining, sitting, or standing position during bathing by a caregiver. It minimizes the risk of injuries to a baby when bathed in a baby tub.

Thermometers designed specifically to measure the temperature of the water in a baby's bath.
Generally designed in a 'toy-like' fashion, these products often contain visual and/or audible indication if the water temperature is above generally accepted safe boundaries, and will sometimes provide a similar alert should the temperature drop below the 'comfortable' range of an infant.
A cover that goes over a bath faucet that protects a child from bumps to the head while bathing in the tub.

A small chair with a hole and a removable pot for cleaning. It is more proportionate in size to a toddler than a regular toilet. It allows a child to easily sit on the toilet training potty vs. a regular toilet which requires a step stool or an adult to help reach the toilet seat.

Baby bath seats and rings are devices used to hold babies in an upright position while in the bathtub. Baby bath seats or rings are used to free up the caregivers hands while washing a child. This occurs as suction cups fasten the seat or ring to the bottom of the tub, holding the baby in a stable position in the water.

In pottery, a potter's wheel is a machine used in the shaping of clay into round ceramic ware. The wheel may also be used during the process of trimming excess clay from leather-hard dried ware that is stiff but malleable, and for applying incised decoration or rings of color. Wikipedia

Pyrometric cones are used worldwide to monitor ceramic firings in industrial kilns, pottery kilns, and small hobby kilns where consistent temperature is important to the quality of the final product being fired. Pyrometric cones measure heatwork, the effect of time and temperature.

Most clay pasta machines are the same tool you would use to make homemade pasta. Clayers discovered they could use pasta machines to quickly and easily condition polymer clay instead of using rolling pins, acrylic rollers or their hands.
A machine for mixing and working clay and other materials into pug.

Decals for glass fusing are low fire and high fire and are fired on the top layer. Fusible decals can be used with any COE glass and they come in white, black, silver, gold and multicolor. Fusible paper can be fired as is or cut into various shapes and fired between layers of glass.
Re-usable, non-drying modeling clay designed for play/non-serious crafting, usually for children and schools.
A classifier for items in "Ceramic & Pottery Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Wedging Boards & AnglesWedging Boards. One essential tool that everyone should have in a potters' studio are wedging boards. These large boards allow you to wedge your clay before throwing it on the pottery wheel.
Dough clay is basically a modeling compound that is used for creating different shapes and models.
Accessories used while using a pottery wheel.

Ceramic glaze, or simply glaze, is a glassy coating on ceramics. It is used for decoration, to ensure the item is impermeable to liquids and to minimize the adherence of pollutants. Glazing renders earthenware impermeable to water, sealing the inherent porosity of biscuit earthenware. It also gives a tougher surface. Wikipedia
A Slab Roller is a piece of studio equipment that rolls out perfect slabs of clay for hand-building pottery and ceramics.

A kiln is a thermally insulated chamber, a type of oven, that produces temperatures sufficient to complete some process, such as hardening, drying, or chemical changes. Kilns have been used for millennia to turn objects made from clay into pottery, tiles and bricks. Wikipedia

Clay extruders (also called ceramics extruders) are used with dies to make shapes for hand-building and decorating pottery pieces. Choose a smaller hand-held clay extruder that works like a dough extruder to create and add decoration to smaller pieces of work.
A group of related products that are sold together for the craft of airbrushing.

An airbrush hose is a flexible tube or pipe that connects an airbrush to an air source, such as an air compressor. It allows for the passage of compressed air from the air source to the airbrush, enabling the airbrush to function properly.

The airbrush hose is an essential component of an airbrush setup, as it delivers the compressed air needed to atomize paint or other mediums and spray them onto a surface. It typically has connectors at each end, one that attaches to the airbrush and the other that connects to the air source.

Airbrush hoses are usually made of a flexible and durable material, such as PVC or braided nylon, to withstand the pressure of the compressed air. They come in various lengths, typically ranging from a few feet to several yards, allowing for flexibility and ease of movement while using the airbrush.

It is important to choose the appropriate airbrush hose for your specific airbrush and air compressor setup, ensuring that the connectors are compatible and the hose is the correct length for your needs. Proper maintenance and care of the airbrush hose are also important to ensure its longevity and optimal performance.
A mild cleaner made of water, concentrated detergent, and alcohol to rinse color from an airbrush or spray gun more effectively than by using only water.
A small, air-operated tool that atomizes and sprays various media, most often paint, but also ink, dye, and foundation to a surface.
A classifier for items in "Airbrush Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Knitting & crochet stitch markers is a device used to distinguish important locations on a work in progress. Patterns have a mathematical basis, so stitch markers serve as a visual reference that takes the place of continuous stitch counting and reduces a user's error rate.
A spindle is a straight spike, usually made from wood, used for spinning, twisting fibers such as wool, flax, hemp, cotton into yarn.
Often a rectangle or circle-shaped frame or board with evenly spaced pegs onto which someone knits.

Stitch holders are tools that are used in knitting and crocheting to hold open stitches when not being used by the needles. The two most common types of stitch markers are locking and ring. They are commonly used when finishing a side of an item, such as a sweater, and preparing for the kitchener stitch.

Weaving warping tools are objects utilized in warp knitting. Warp knitting is a family of knitting methods in which the yarn zigzags along the length of the fabric; i.e., following adjacent columns, or wales, of knitting, rather than a single row, or course. These tools include (but are not limited to) cone stands, cone holders, and wooden raddles.

Knitting & crochet needle gauge checks is a tool, usually a flat metal or wood piece with various sized holes marked with gauge sizes. The user inserts the needle into the holes to determine the gauge size.

A weaving loom is a device used to weave wool into cloth. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the warp threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads. The precise shape of the loom and its mechanics may vary, but the basic function is the same.
Weaving ball winders are a type of winder that wind yarn up from skein form into balls.
A weaving spinning wheel is a device for spinning thread or yarn from fibers.

A weaving shuttle is a tool designed to neatly and compactly store a holder that carries the thread of the weft yarn while weaving with a loom. Shuttles are thrown or passed back and forth through the shed, between the yarn threads of the warp in order to weave in the weft.

Knitting & crochet stitch counters are a manual, hand held row counter for counting rows or courses worked, for counting stitch pattern repetitions, or for counting increases or decreases of the number of stitches in consecutive rows.
Weaving loom clips hold the weave in place to the loom.
A small hole designed to receive a cord or used for decoration.

A sticker is a type of label: a piece of printed paper, plastic, vinyl, or other material with pressure sensitive adhesive on one side. They can be used for decoration or for functional purposes, depending on the situation. Stickers can come in many different shapes and sizes and also vary widely in color and design.
A machine that applies edge-to-edge adhesive to an image to create a sticker.
Adhesive / glue dots are used in various applications provide a clean and instant bond leaving much less mess, residue, and odor.
Stamp that are typically engraved with a design that leaves an impression when stamped in wax.
A block of absorbent material saturated with ink; used to transfer ink evenly to a rubber stamp. synonyms: inking pad, inkpad, pad.
A piece of soft material that is soaked with ink and used to get ink onto a rubber stamp.
An instrument or combination of instruments for stamping a pattern or mark, in particular an engraved or inked block or die.
Raw materials that can be melted down to form the base ingredient of soaps.
A collection of items that provide the basic items and ingredients for soap making.
A lye is a metal hydroxide traditionally obtained by leaching wood ashes, or a strong alkali which is highly soluble in water producing caustic basic solutions.
Sewing is the craft of fastening or attaching objects using stitches made with a needle and thread. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.
Needlepoint is a type of canvas work, a form of counted thread embroidery in which yarn is stitched through a stiff open weave canvas. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.
Embroidery is the craft of decorating fabric or other materials using a needle to apply thread or yarn. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.

Knitting is a method by which yarn is manipulated to create a textile or fabric; it is used in many types of garments. Knitting may be done by hand or by machine. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.

Cross-stitch is a form of sewing and a popular form of counted-thread embroidery in which X-shaped stitches in a tiled, raster-like pattern are used to form a picture. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.
Crochet is a process of creating textiles by using a crochet hook to interlock loops of yarn, thread, or strands of other materials. Kits contain all the supplies needed to complete a project.
A sewing cabinet is a work table or desk used for sewing. Generally it has large amounts of space for a full set of sewing tools.
A serger is a type of sewing machine designed to produce an overlock stitch and to cut the fabric as it stitches.
A sewing machine is a machine used to sew fabric and materials together with thread.
A knitting machine is a device used to create knitted fabrics in a semi or fully automated fashion.
Plate located under under the needle and above the throat plate and feed dogs of a sewing machine.
Sewing Machine Parts & Accessories are parts to replace damaged or broken pieces in / on the machine, or to enhance its functionality.

A dress form is a three-dimensional model of the torso used for fitting clothing that is being designed or sewed. When making a piece of clothing, it can be put on the dress form so one can see the fit and drape of the garment as it would appear on a body, and make adjustments or alterations. Dress forms come in all sizes and shapes for almost every article of clothing that can be made. Dress forms in standard clothing sizes are used to make patterns, while adjustable dress forms allow garments to be tailored to fit a specific individual.

A seam ripper is a small sewing tool used for cutting and removing stitches. The most common form consists of a handle, shaft and head. The head is usually forked with a cutting surface situated at the base of the fork. In some designs, one side of the fork tapers to a sharp point to allow easier insertion in tight stitching.
A stand for one or more spools of sewing thread, on which the spools are mounted on pins, so as to turn freely as the thread is unwound.
A classifier for items in "Needlework Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

A thimble is a small hard pitted cup worn for protection on the finger that pushes the needle in sewing. Usually, thimbles with a closed top are used by dressmakers but special thimbles with an opening at the end are used by tailors as this allows them to manipulate the cloth more easily. Finger guards differ from tailors' thimbles in that they often have a top but are open on one side.

Sewing patterns and templates are a shaped cut out pieces(s) of paper, paperboard, or cardboard used for sewing. The pattern or template are shaped as parts of a garment that are traced onto fabric before being cut out and assembled.
A bobbin winder is a machine for winding thread or yarn upon a bobbin, spool, or shuttle, having a device for distributing the thread in such a manner as to form in winding any desired shape.
Fabric punch is a forming process through which a tool is used to shear though fabric to make a pre-made template or pattern.
Marking & tracing tools are instruments are used to transfer markings from sewing patterns onto fabric.

A pincushion is a small, stuffed cushion, typically 3–5 cm (1.2–2.0 in) across, which is used in sewing to store pins or needles with their heads protruding to take hold of them easily, collect them, and keep them organized.

A threader is a device for helping to put thread through the eye of a needle. Many kinds exist, though a common type combines a short length of fine wire bent into a diamond shape, with one corner held by a piece of tinplate or plastic. The user passes the wire loop through the needle eye, passes the string through the wire loop, and finally pulls both the loop back through the needle by the handle, which pulls the thread through.
Tool used to keep fabric taut while working embroidery or other forms of needlework. Wikipedia
Sewing baskets are storage devices utilized to house sewing material.
A classifier for items in "Sewing Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A pom pom maker is a devise utilized to craft pom pom embellishments.
Sewing fasteners are objects sewn on to fabric to create a method of opening and closing a section of fabric. Items include (but are not limited to): Hooks and eyes, snap on buttons, and buckles.
A group of materials used for mold and casting projects.
Tools or solutions that help release sculptures from their mold.
Wax (typically paraffin, soy, beeswax, palm) used in the process of candle making.
Materials used for the craft of wax molding.
Tools used for the craft of wood burning.
Molds that help form a shape or design.
Shapes and forms of wood that hasn't been treated to be used for a craft project.
A classifier for items in "Candle Making Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Assortment of tools used for carving.
Various products sold together to create a candle.
A group of tools used to assist in three demensional projects.
Product that is moldable but then hardens.
Tool used to hold all the elements (top, batting, back) in place and helps pull the layers taut as you work.
A basting gun is a hand-held tool that can be used in place of pins, basting spray, or other basting methods. Holds fabric layers in place as you prep to sew.
Quilting basting gun tacks are the objects used in a quilting basting gun to hold materials in place until they can be sewn or stitched.
A classifier for items in "Quilting Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Clips used to hold together large quilts, blankets, etc. while sewing.

Quilling strips and kits come in various styles and sizes. They include various tools and paper for the art of quilling paper which is cutting paper into long thing strips, rolling and pinching the pieces into different shapes, and then gluing the shapes together to for decorative art.
Tools used to help with the art of quilling.
A classifier for items in "Scrapbooking Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A combination of scrapbooking tools to help create scrapbooks.

Scrapbook kits come in many different styles and sizes. Some are quite simple with just what you need to finish one scrapbooking project while others come with enough materials for multiple albums. Some kits include and album but many have the items needed to put into your own book.
Decorative used to embellish scrapbooks.
A printing press is a mechanical device for applying pressure to an inked surface resting upon a print medium, thereby transferring the ink.
A plate typically made of iron, copper, zinc or stone that is used in the printmaking process of etching and lithography.
Items added to a printing press to make it more useful, versatile, or attractive.
Tools used in the printmaking process of etching and lithography.

Printmaking inks are made specifically for block printing, etching, screen printing, lithography, and monotype techniques. They're created to be used with the specific materials used for each technique.
A classifier for items in "Etching & Lithography Materials" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Materials used for relief printing.

productTypeGroup.description: Photo Albums and Photo Album Accessories

productType.description: Photo album refills are extra pages sold separatley to add to an exsiting photo ablum when space has run out.
Triangular adhesives used to mount photos in craft projects.
A series of photographic prints collected by an individual person or family in the form of a book.
Objects used to mount photos.
Baby memory books are guided baby photo albums / scrapbooks used by parents to track a child's development and milestones.

A thin piece of paper coated with wax and pigment. Often, an ink-jet or other printer is used to print the image on the transfer paper. A heat press can transfer the image onto clothing, canvas, or other surface. Transfer paper is used in creating iron-ons.
Scratchboard or scraperboard, is a form of direct engraving where the artist scratches off dark ink to reveal a white or colored layer beneath.

Chipboard is a thick fiber paper that is typically made from recycled paper. It is similar to cardboard and is non-corrugated, so it is not hollow. In scrapbooking, it is used to make scrapbook pages.
Boxes that come in various shapes and sizes. They are unfinished and ready to paint, cover or decorate with your favorite medium.
Various tools sold together that help with decoupaging.

Construction paper is a colored paper used for arts and craft projects. The texture is slightly rough, and the surface is unfinished. Due to the source material, mainly wood pulp, small particles are visible on the paper's surface. It is used for projects or crafts.
A tool or combination of tools used for scratchboards.
Craft kits for making paper by hand using screens, frames, and other tools.
Supplies that help create a hand made book.
A shape that has been cut out from paper or cardboard, especially a flat one that can stand vertically.

Paper craft is a collection of crafts using paper or card as the primary artistic medium for the creation of two or three-dimensional objects. Paper and card stock lend themselves to a wide range of techniques and can be folded, curved, bent, cut, glued, molded, stitched, or layered.
A craft kit for making greeting cards, invitations, thank you cards, etc.
Raffia is a natural fiber that is perfect for basket weaving; it is strong, holds dye superbly, and is easily malleable.

A knitting needle or knitting pin is a tool in hand-knitting to produce knitted fabrics. They generally have a long shaft and taper at their end, but they are not nearly as sharp as sewing needles. Their purpose is two-fold.
A classifier for items in "Knitting & Crochet Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Felting needle tool has barbed needles that catches the wool roving fibers and pushes them into the bottom of the fabric. The wool roving fibers stay permanently without using glue or sewing it.

Yarn & ribbon needles are basically a larger version of a traditional sewing needle but with a few important differences. They can be made of metal or wood, but most commonly are made of plastic. They are available in different sizes to fit the various weights of yarn or ribbon, and are used any time a crochet hook or knitting needle won't accomplish what you need.
A crochet hook is an implement used to make loops in thread or yarn and to interlock them into crochet stitches. It is a round shaft pointed on one end, with a lateral groove behind it.
A sewing pin is a device used for fastening objects or material together. It is a long slender sharp tool with a pointed tip at one end usually a piece of material (usually plastic) at the other end.
A hand-sewing needle is used for hand-sewing. It is a long slender sharp tool with a pointed tip at one end and a hole (or eye) at the other.
A sewing machine needle is used in sewing machines. It is a long slender sharp tool with a pointed tip at one end and use to join two pieces of material.
Assortment of products used to make rugs or latch hook crafts.
An object used in the craft in which short segments of yarn are tied to the horizontal strands of a small- or medium-sized canvas grid. It can be used to make small rugs, wall hangings, or pillows.

productType.productTypeName: Other Rug Making & Latch Hook Supplies
productType.description: A classifier for items in "Rug Making & Latch Hook Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Mesh material used as the base for latch hook crafts.
Solid material in stick form that is inserted into a glue gun, then heated. The melted glue is applied to a surface to bond materials together.
A device that heats up glue sticks until they melt. The melted glue is applied to a surface to bond materials together. Once applied, the glue cools and hardens quickly for a durable bond.
Supplies used to facilitate floral arranging.
Decorative floral design accessory that is added to flower arrangements or displayed as home decor.
Device used as a base for flower arranging, often with holes or spikes to hold flowers in place.
A bobbin is a spindle or cylinder, with or without flanges, on which wire, yarn, thread or film is wound. Bobbins are typically found in sewing machines.
Wool roving generally refers to wool fiber that has been processed but not yet spun into yarn. It is used on a spinning wheel to create yarn. Wool roving is sometimes called spinning fiber or top.
Sewing bias tape is a narrow strip of fabric, cut on the grain of a piece of woven fabric. It is used in making piping, binding seams, finishing raw edges, etc.
Sewing thread is a type of yarn but similarly used for sewing. It can be made out of many different materials including cotton, linen, nylon, and silk.
Batting is the layer of material between your quilt top and your backing to give it weight and warmth.

Sewing and craft elastic is an object which is sold in narrow strips and generally serves to increase the ability of garment to stretch, either to accommodate movement or to make the garment suitable for wearers of many different physical sizes.
Yarn is a long continuous length of interlocked fibers, used in sewing, crocheting, knitting, weaving, embroidery, ropemaking, and the production of textiles.
Quilting fabric assortments is fabric utilized to make quilts, coming in a variety of patterns and / or shapes.
A Fabric stabilizer is an essential for machine embroidery. It is used to support the fabric during the stitching process to keep puckering or stretching from occurring.
Fabric balls used in craft and textile projects.
Precut quilt squares are sections of pre-cut fabric utilized to make a quilt.
Embroidery floss is a loosely twisted, slightly glossy 6-strand thread, usually of cotton but also manufactured in silk, linen, and rayon.
Sewing and craft fabric is a material made through weaving, knitting, spreading, crocheting, or bonding that may be used in production of further goods (garments, etc.).
Fashion shoulder pads are a type of fabric-covered padding used in men's and women's clothing to give the wearer the illusion of having broader and less sloping shoulders.

Sewing patches are small bits of fabric used either to cover a hole, or for decoration. Appliques are ornamental needlework in which pieces or patch of fabric in different shapes and patterns are sewn or stuck onto a larger piece to form a picture or pattern. It is commonly used as decoration, especially on garments.
Sewing trim and embellishments are ornamental objects sewn onto garments as decoration, which include (but are not limited to): gimps, passementeries, ribbons, or ruffles.
Sewing hem tape is double-sided adhesive, which serves and an alternative in hemming garments without the use of needle and thread.

Fabric Interfacing is the inner construction material that lies between layers of fashion fabric. It adds shape, strength, and body to every project and many garments require some type of interfacing. You can find it in collars, cuffs, waistbands, lapels, necklines, button holes, and any opening that needs additional stability or support.
Specially formulated thread for crafting decorative crochet items such as doilies or filet crochet.

Aida cloth is an open, even-weave fabric traditionally used for cross-stitch embroidery. This cotton fabric has a natural mesh that facilitates cross-stitching and enough natural stiffness that the crafter does not need to use an embroidery hoop.
Leather cut into strips or various shapes for leather crafting.

A substance used to resist or prevent the dye from reaching all the cloth, thereby creating a pattern and ground. The most common forms use wax, some type of paste made from starch or mud, or a mechanical resist that manipulates the cloth such as tying or stitching.
Various leathercraft tools and products that contribute to leathercraft projects.

Screen printing kits are the supplies and tools that is used for screen printing. Screen printing is a printing technique where ink is forced through a fine mesh screen onto a surface, creating a design by using a stencil that blocks ink from passing through certain areas, essentially transferring the design onto the material below
Products that help with cleaning or repairing fabrics.
A substance used to chemically bond a dye to natural fibers to ensure fastness.
A device used for the purpose of making a stencil consisting of a light source and some means of holding a screen in place against a film positive.

A screen printing chemical refers to any substance used in the screen printing process to prepare, clean, or modify the printing screen, including the most crucial component, emulsion, which acts as a light-sensitive stencil that creates the image on the screen by hardening when exposed to light in specific areas, allowing ink to pass through only where the design is intended.
Tools and equipment to help with dyeing fabric.
Various leather, leathercraft accessories and leathercraft tools sold together to create a project
A leather punch is a hole punch specifically for making holes in leather. The working tip of the punch is a hollow steel cylinder with a sharp circular knife-like edge.

Screen printing accessories are the various tools and supplies used alongside a screen printing press to facilitate the printing process, including items like squeegees, ink scoops, buckets, spreaders, scales, scoop coaters, cleaning cards, and specialized chemicals used for cleaning and preparing the screens and inks, essentially anything needed to effectively apply ink through a screen onto a substrate.
A classifier for items in "Fabric Painting & Dyeing Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Dye that is designed to be applied on fabric or textiles.
A leverpress, in which die and follower are jointed together to form a toggle, used for stamping leather.
Paint that is designed to be applied on fabric or textiles.
A classifier for items in "Embossing Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Pens contain a specially formulated ink that stays wet on paper, providing the tack needed to attract and retain embossing powders until they are cured with heat.

Embossing machines are a great example of a modern take on classic manufacturing methods. Typically, creating an embossed tag uses a die set to press a full design into metal. In comparison, a metal tag embossing machine uses a set of striking heads to add each character into the material individually.

They are translucent white plastic folders that have a design embedded into the plastic. When you place a piece of paper between the pages of the folder, then press the folder in an embossing machine, you get the image or design on your paper.
A fast-melting powder often used in heat embossing.
Tools used to create a raised patterned on a material.
Supplies used in purse making.
Assortment of products used to make toys.
Kits and supplies used in the creation of mosaics.
Kits with various pieces and items used to craft a doll.

Mannequin head form intended for use as a display model, crafting, accessory storage, or as a stand. The head form can be made of various material, with or without hair, and include the shoulders with the head form.
A mechanical device used to soften edges, round out, and shine rocks and minerals.
Metal leaf foil or flake material and the accessories used to decorate objects.
A tool used to dry and store artwork, such as paintings, paper, cardboard, or canvas.
Cutting mats are used to protect surfaces like tables, benches, and glass tables from damage caused by cutting tools.
A machine that applies the die to the surface being cut (paper, chipboard, etc.), with enough force to cut or form the shape into said surface.
Replacements for a cutting blade which is a part of tools or machines for cutting, chop, slice, or scrape surfaces or materials of a workpiece.
Storage bags and cases that are used to store craft supplies to keep them organized and help transport with ease.
Real or artificial bird feathers designed for use in craft projects or decorative arts.
Used to fill items to add density and weight.
Framed bases designed to contain and support the creation of decorative, floral, and craft objects.
Wire used in crafting. Different to Modeling Wire.
Metal bells intended for craft, sewing, and textile projects.
Vinyl sheets or rolled material for use in craft projects or decorative building uses.
Dyes used to change the color of something.
A small plastic craft supply that imitates eyeballs.
Wax used to seal edges or a container in crafting.
Real or artificial sea shells or otherwise, used in crafting.
Wood or plastic sticks designed for use in craft projects or as decorative building supplies.
Wire used to create strength within a crafted model, like an internal skeleton or frame.
Tape used to hold things together while crafting.
Styrofoam made for use in arts and crafts.
Tools that are used to make a shallow score in one surface of a piece of glass (normally a flat one) that is to be broken into pieces.
Crafting item (created using a "die cutting" process) that is designed for cutting craft materials into precise, usually decorative shapes.
Provides the backing surface to crafting dies to cut a piece of material according to shapes on the die.
Tools used with die-cutting machines for cutting materials into specific shapes and sizes, such as paper, cardstock, vinyl, and more.

Machines that use metal dies or blades to cut shapes out of paper, cardstock, fabric, and other materials. The die is placed on top of the material, and then the die and material are run through the machine, which presses the die into the material to create the desired shape.
Scissors that cut a decorative edge instead of a straight line. They are perfect for edging stationary, photographs, rubber stamp projects, stencil designs, and other creations.

Beauty Supply Making Extracts and herbal extracts are primarily added to the cosmetic formulations due to several associated properties such as antioxidant, anti inflammatory, antiseptic and antimicrobial properties. Even today, people in rural and urban areas depend upon herbs for traditional cosmetics.
Exfoliants are popular additives for scrubs and soaps. The gritty and coarse texture sloughs off dead skin leaving the body soft and smooth.
