Botanical extracts that support the health, texture, and integrity of the skin, hair, and nails are widely used in cosmetic formulations. They form the largest category of cosmeceutical additives found in the marketplace today due to the rising consumer interest and demand for natural products.
A glass dropper and/or a dropper bottle used for health & beauty purposes.
A group of products sold together to create mineral makeup.
A classifier for items in "Cosmetics Making Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

productType.productTypeName: Beauty Supply Making Fixed Oils & Waxes
productType.description: A fixed oil is often referred to as a carrier oil and does not evaporate. These can be blended with essential oils. Some common fixed oils include Coconut, Olive, Argan and Jojoba.
A group of products sold together to create lotion.

Some of the more common materials used in basketry include cedar bark, cedar root, spruce root, cattail leaves and tule. Elements used for decoration include maidenhair fern stems, horsetail root, red cherry bark and a variety of grasses. These materials vary widely in color and appearance.
A flexible but firm cord that is used for making coiling baskets.
The bottom of the basket.
Kits the provide supplies to create a finalized basket or weaving piece.
Jewellery findings are the parts used to join jewellery components together to form a completed article.
Metals intended for jewelry casting.
A bead board is used to lay out your designs and make any changes easily before you string them.
A bead loom is a tool used to weave beads together.
Various components that make up a finished earring. Earring components may be made of any number of materials, including metal, plastic, glass, precious stone, beads, wood, bone, and other materials.

Head pins feature a flat head on one end and can be used to create dangles or to turn beads into pendants. Eye pins feature a loop on one end and can be used to create dangles and pendants, as well, or can be used as links. Both can be finished with simple and wrapped loops.
An engraver is someone who cuts designs or words on metal, glass, or wood.

A jewelry clasp, or jewelry fastener, is the mechanism that allows a necklace or bracelet to easily be put on and taken off without causing any damage. Some fasteners are meant to be hidden, while others are a key element to the design.

Bead aligners and bars provide a unique way to showcase your favorite large-hole beads. Dangle your large-hole beads or use them along with beads featuring thinner stringing holes with the help of these findings. Bead bars are designed for creating unique dangles with components that are too large for head pins, such as lampwork, porcelain, and other specialty beads. Bead aligners fit inside the stringing hole of a large bead and allow you to incorporate it into any jewelry design, preventing unnecessary movement on your stringing material. Browse through a variety of styles and finishes to find the perfect options for your projects.

Chains are interconnected links in a series used to create flexible necklaces, bracelets and fasteners in a variety of styles. They have been used as jewelry items by themselves but also as a way to suspend all kinds of other ornaments such as pendants, watches, medals, keys and so on.

Jump rings are most commonly defined as a circle of wire that meets at the end and is not welded together. A split ring consists of two complete turns of a helix and pressed flat together where objects can be strung on them. This makes each ring be associated with a different type of security level.

Embellishments are those decorative pieces that every beader loves to play with. Stylish and easy to incorporate into jewelry designs, craft projects, and home decor, these embellishment options are great for all kinds of styles.
Bead caps are used to enhance the style of beads, either with one on one end or one on both ends of a bead.
Pin backs are the essential jewelry findings for a whole host of wearable art, from hat pins to tie bars to lapel pins and more
Machines used for jewelry casting.
A classifier for items in "Beading & Jewelry Making Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Spacer beads are used to create texture and complexity in bead patterns. They are typically used between the main beads in a design.
Various components sold together to create a finished jewelry product.
A bead reamer is a pointed, round file that is used to either smooth the edges of the drill hole in a bead or to widen the hole itself.
Used for opening and closing jump rings, holding small items and shaping wire. The tapered nose helps get into awkward places and is ideal for using with crimps.

An essential tool for off-loom bead-weaving and embroidery projects, beading needles are designed with a smaller eye and finer shaft than regular sewing needles. There are a variety of designs and sizes to choose from, so make sure you pick the right one.

Polishes are used to give sheen on the surface from which the light is reflected evenly. They do this by smoothing out any unevenness on the surface of the article, as in the polishing of the metals. They also provide a protective layer as in the case of floor and furniture polishes.
Tools that set jewels in place.

Stringing means putting beads on a “string” and adding a closure so it can be worn as a bracelet or a necklace. It almost always starts this way. You decide you can string up the beads and make jewelry too. Then you are in a quandary wondering what to use and how to finish the piece off.
Jewelry making metal blanks are pre-cut pieces of metal that are used in the first stage of metal forming.
Crimps are little tubes of metal designed to be 'squashed' together to secure the design for jewelry making. Covers and ends also are used to secure a design for jewelry making.
A paper coated with a special preparation for transferring a design or imprint to another surface by heat, pressure, or moisture.

A bail is a component of certain types of jewelry, mostly necklaces, that is used to attach a pendant or stone. The bail is normally placed in the center of the necklace where the pendant hangs. Some bails are made so a pendant can be attached after the necklace production is completed.

Bead tips are designed to conceal and protect knots and create a secure connection to jumprings and clasps. Bead tips terminate jewelry designs with a clean and professional finish. When finished, bead tips look like small, metal beads at each end of the strand.
Any type of set containing a variety of art supplies.

Sand art supplies are objects and materials utilized to create sand art. Sand art is the practice of modelling sand into an artistic form, such as a sand brushing, sand sculpture, sandpainting, or sand bottles.
A classifier for items in "Art Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Dry art medium made of carbon or charred wood. Less permanent than graphite, charcoal is more easily erased and blended.

Sparkly particles mostly made from aluminum polyethylene terephthalate, claimed to take a thousand years to degrade. The world's supply is mostly made in New Jersey, in an air of scintillant secrecy, luminous metallization, and iridescent precision, sometimes to the tune of half the wavelength of light.
Replacement easel trays are trays that attach to an easel, which can be replaced if they become too soiled or damaged.
Paint, usually claiming to be non-toxic, that is intended to be applied to a surface with the fingers, often by children.
Art finish or sealer that is sprayed, painted, or somehow applied to a piece of art in order seal it.
A stand for artwork, often used for paintings in process.
A loose, lightweight overgarment worn by artists to protect the clothing from incidental stains and marks.
Art tool cleaners are generally solvents or liquid utilized to clean art tools.

Drawing rubbing wax is wax that is used to create a rubbing. A rubbing is a reproduction of the texture of a surface created by placing a piece of paper or similar material over the subject and then rubbing the paper with something to deposit marks.
Coating applied to the ground material of a painting for better adhesion of subsequent art paint, to deter rust, or prevent seepage.
Any type of board, canvas, or other non-paper base upon which art can be created.
Non-mechanical pencils intended to be used for art, such as drawing, sketching, coloring, architectural design, and so on.
Artwork cases & portfolios are objects utilized to store art items or works of art.
Typically smooth, a board that provides a solid, stable surface upon which to draw, write, and create art.
Brushes, as in art paint brushes, intended to be used for creating paintings or other art.
Powder or prepared paint used for creating art of any type.
Art medium consisting of pigment powder along with a binder, typically shaped into the form of a stick.
Sidewalk chalk is typically large and thick sticks of chalk that come in multiple colors and are mostly used for drawing on pavement or concrete sidewalks.
A 3D form, often of a human shape, with moveable parts that can help people learn to draw and shade distinct poses of a figure for portraiture and other art forms.
Card stock, cardboard, or firm paper intended to provide a stiff backing for framing (matting) artwork or photos.  Also used as backing support for comic book and magazine collector bags.
Tube Wringers are devices utilized to squeeze all if the usable material or product out of a tube.
Art finish or sealer that is sprayed, painted, or somehow applied to a piece of art in order seal it.

A medium is a substance that is added to paint to change one or more of its properties. In acrylic mediums, these mixtures can be incorporated into the pigment to lengthen its drying time, make it thicker, or change the texture. Mediums are bought in addition to paints.
Tool used for mixing, applying, or moving paint around on the pallet or directly on the work of art. Also used to clean and scrape dried paint off the art piece.
Tool used for blending, smoothing, and smudging the strokes of a variety of art mediums.
Rigid surface used for mixing art paints. May be a flat surface or may contain wells to separate or contain each color.

A stencil is usually a thin sheet of material, such as paper, plastic, wood or metal, with letters or a design cut from it, used to produce the letters or design on an underlying surface by applying pigment through the cut-out holes in the material. A template is a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Liquid solvent, often used with oil paints, in order to thin the paint and make it easier to apply. Common art paint thinners include turpentine, mineral spirits, and linseed oil, among others.
A piece of garment worn over the front of artist's clothes and tied at the back to protect from incidental stains and marks.
Art & blueprint tubes are objects used to store drawings, maps, artwork, posters, or blueprints.
Individual sheets of paper or pads with any type of binding with paper intended to be used for creating art.

A crayon (or wax pastel) is a stick of pigmented wax used for writing or drawing. Wax crayons differ from pastels, in which the pigment is mixed with a dry binder such as gum arabic, and from oil pastels, where the binder is a mixture of wax and oil.
Art & craft kits are a collection of all the necessary objects and / or materials required to create and art or craft project.
Sponges intended to be used for painting, blending, and other arts or crafts.
A set that includes calligraphy pen(s) and various accessories. A calligraphy pen is a fountain pen used as a writing instrument that uses a metal nib to apply water-based ink to paper.

Stained glass kits are objects and materials utilized to create stained glass art. Stained glass is colored glass used to form decorative or pictorial designs, notably for church windows, both by painting and especially by setting contrasting pieces in a lead framework like a mosaic.
Tools used in picture framing.
Frame parts and pieces used to make picture frames.
Used to mount a picture on before being framed.
A set off supplies and tools used to make picture frames.
Stained glass are colored pieces of glass joined together to make a decorative object
A drawing is a visual art that uses a pencil, crayon, or pen to mark paper or another two-dimensional surface.
Enclosed frame or display box containing art works or objects presented in a thematic, artistic way.

A picture frame is a protective and decorative edging for a picture, such as a painting or photograph. It makes displaying the work safer and easier and both sets the picture apart from its surroundings and aesthetically integrates it with them.
Textile fabric art piece with designs made from weaving or embroidering colored thread onto the piece.
A sculpture is a visual art form that is three-dimensional made by carving stone, wood or plaster, or by pouring the metal or plaster into a mold.

A sun catcher or light catcher is a small reflective, refractive, and/or iridescent ornament. It may include glass or nacre pieces and be hung indoors near a window to "catch" sunlight. A suncatcher is like the optical equivalent of a wind chime.
Visual art in which more than one medium is used to create a wall-hung or free-standing art piece.
Textile arts are arts and crafts that use plant, animal, or synthetic fibers to construct practical or decorative objects. They are commonly hung on the wall or from the ceiling.
Folk art is a classic decorative, musical, or practical art of different cultures or regions.  The art tells stories about daily life or the culture of their community.

Printed visual art that contains a graphic image that is reproduced onto paper (or some other material) using various methods. In general, these are considered fine or decorative art and use higher quality materials than mass-produced posters. Does not include art printed on canvas.
Wall art or decorative piece that features a photographic image as the main subject.  The image may represent a variety of styles, ranging from fine art to abstract to children's designs.

A poster is a large mass-produced printed wall art featuring photographic images or illustration with or without text on a sheet that is placed either on a public space to promote something or on a wall as decoration.
Wall art that features an image printed onto canvas. Canvas prints are often used in interior design and feature stock images or personal photographs.

Fine or decorative painted wall art pieces that are typically some type of portrait, landscape, abstract image, or any subject that is applied to a base using a painted-on material (oil, acrylic, etc.).
Portable reading light designed to be lightweight and easily clamp to a book.
A classifier for items in “Lights & Light Fixtures” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Lights designed and sold for no purpose other than they are fun.
Timers used to automatically turn on/off lights. Timer controls can range from digital to dials.
Cords or cables to be utilized in conjunction with a light fixture.
Flameless candles are an electronic alternative to traditional wick candles. They are typically utilized as aesthetic lighting devices and come in a variety of shapes, colors and sizes.

Handheld lamps that emit specific wavelengths of ultraviolet light, in turn causing certain materials to fluoresce. This can reveal biological material that would otherwise remain invisible to the naked eye, such as urine, blood, saliva and semen.
Novelty lamp with a high-voltage electrode that reatcts with the noble gas inside the clear glass container.
Lighting equipment designed to illuminate a stage area at performance venues and live events.
Wall plates, also known as switch plates, cover outlets and light switches, keeping wires out of sight and away from fingers.
Decorative lamp with a mixture of liquid and a suspended, wax-based substance.
A classifier for items in “Lighting Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

As its name suggests, under cabinet lighting refers to lights that are installed under a cabinet, resulting in illumination of the area immediately below a row or section of cabinets. It is most commonly used in kitchen areas, where additional lighting is useful for food preparation.
Pool table lights are lights designed to hang over pool tables.
A salt lamp is a decorative lamp that is often carved out of Himalayan salt.
Color lighting primarily used to add effects to a dance party.
Illuminated sign with customizable letters or large signs with individual letters, traditionally used on a building (or as a stand alone sign).
A night light is a small light fixture, usually electrical, placed for comfort or convenience in dark areas or areas that may become dark at certain times, such as at night or during an emergency.
Neon signs are electric signs lighted by long luminous gas-discharge tubes that contain neon or other gases, used to display various messages, often for commercial use.
Strips or tubes of light bulbs.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Lamps and Light Bulbs Lighting & Light Fixtures
productTypeGroup.description: Lamps and Light Bulb Lighting & Light Fixtures

productType.description: Floor lamps are tall fixtures with a weighted base that are designed to sit on the floor and provide light higher within a room. A staple of interior home decor, the floor lamp offers a functional way to light your space without the need for overhead lighting. The Spruce
Ring shaped lamp that is commonly used for portraits and other types of photography.
Light on the end of a length of cord.
Holder to fix light fixtures or a lamp shade.

A device used to convert electricity into light, consisting of a source of illumination (e.g. an electric filament or one or more LEDs) enclosed within a transparent or translucent shell, typically having a rounded shape and designed to be fitted into a socket in a lamp/light fixture.

A lightbulb socket is a device which mechanically supports and provides electrical connections for a compatible electric lamp. 

A light bulb extender provides extra length for a recessed lighting socket.
Portable work light are specifically designed to temporarily brighten the working area of a particular space.

Set of matching lamps that is a combination of a floor lamp, desk lamp, table lamp, etc. This is not intended to be used for a set of two table tamps or a set of two floor lamps, however, it should be used for sets that include both floor lamps and table lamps.
The portion of the shade holder through which the glass lampshade actually passes and makes physical contact with the lamp.
A table lamp is a source of light that stands on a table or any piece of furniture.

A lamp shade is a fixture that envelops the lightbulb on a lamp to diffuse the light it emits. Lampshades can be made out of a large variety of materials like paper, glass, fabric or stone. Often times conical or cylindrical in shape, lampshades can be found on floor, desk, tabletop, or suspended lamps.

An artificial light source designed to stimulate plant growth by emitting a light appropriate for photosynthesis. Used in applications where there is either no naturally occurring light, or where supplemental light is required
Telescopic poles used to change hard to reach light bulbs without a ladder.
Home lighting device specifically designed for use with a table.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Kitchen Mixing, Grinding, and Crushing Utensils & Tools
productTypeGroup.description: Kitchen Mixing, Grinding, and Crushing Utensils & Tools

productType.description: Devices used to manually mix and beat eggs, sauces and dressings.
A multi-purpose mincing tool, fitted with cross-cutting teeth.
A nutcracker tool is a specially designed tool for cracking hard nutshells.

A garlic press, also known as a garlic crusher, is a kitchen utensil to crush garlic cloves efficiently by forcing them through a grid of small holes, usually with some type of piston. Many garlic presses also have a device with a matching grid of blunt pins to clean out the holes.

A meat grinder is a kitchen appliance for mincing and/or mixing of raw or cooked meat, fish, vegetables or similar food. It replaces tools like the mincing knife. The food to be minced is placed into a funnel, which sits on top of the grinder.
The meat cutting blade used in a meat grinder.
Manually powered mechanism to crush spices, salt, and pepper to the desired grind.

A whisk is a cooking utensil which can be used to blend ingredients smooth or to incorporate air into a mixture, in a process known as whisking or whipping. Most whisks consist of a long, narrow handle with a series of wire loops joined at the end.

A mortar and pestle is a set of two simple tools used to prepare ingredients or substances by crushing and grinding them into a fine paste or powder in the kitchen, laboratory, and pharmacy. The mortar is characteristically a bowl, typically made of hard wood, metal, ceramic, or hard stone such as granite.
Ice crusher is an appliance that is specially used to crush ice.
The shape or size forming plates used in a meat grinder.

A meat tenderizer or meat pounder is a hand-powered tool used to tenderize slabs of meat in the preparation for cooking. Although a meat tenderizer can be made out of virtually any object, there are three types manufactured specifically for tenderizing meat.

A potato masher, tater masher, bean masher, pea masher, masher, or crusher is a food preparation utensil used to crush soft food for such dishes as mashed potatoes, apple sauce, or refried beans.

A potato ricer is a kitchen implement used to process potatoes or other food by forcing it through a sheet of small holes, which are typically about the diameter of a grain of rice.
A food grinders or mill is a gadget that grinds or mills spices or food.
Attachments specifically designed to work with stand mixers.
Cleaners for meat grinders.
Handheld juicer shaped like an inverted cone with a broad, blunt handle at the base. The cone has a ridged surface designed to get the greatest amount of juice from halved citrus fruits.
Devices that are used to extract liquid from fruits and vegetables.
Accessories that work with a meat grinder.
A kitchen tool designed to remove cleanly file or hone the cutting edges on the steel blades of knives and other utensils with cutting edges.
Devices used to ensure the user is sharpening the correct angle of a knife's bevel.

Ice packs are commonly used to keep food cool in portable coolers.  There are several distinct types, with hard and soft shell varieties, and those that contain a refrigerant gel or other liquid, rather than water.
A bottle opener is a device that enables the removal of metal bottle caps from glass bottles.
Tool designed to simplify the process of rolling and cutting noodles, or other kinds of pasta.
Beverage pod holder is an organizer that could be a rack, carousel, drawer, etc., specifically designed to hold and display various beverage or coffee pods.

A salad spinner, also known as a salad tosser, is a kitchen tool used to wash and remove excess water from salad greens. It uses centrifugal force to separate the water from the leaves, enabling salad dressing to stick to the leaves without dilution.
Brining bags are large bags that are made to securely hold the weight of both the food item and the liquid during the brining process.
Oils or wood conditioners protect a butcher block surface.
S'mores Maker offers a great setup for your graham crackers, milk chocolate bars and marshmallows. The kit features an electric flameless heater and stainless steel roasting forks to enjoy s'mores.
Parts and accessories intended for use with a deep fryer appliance.
A salad shaker is a container used to mix salad with dressing.
A classifier for items in “Cheese Making Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Kits for DIY home cheese-making.
A heat-resistant, non-stick bag into which you can place bread, waffles, sandwiches, pizza slices, chicken nuggets, etc., and then place them in the toaster.
A can opener or tin opener is a mechanical device used to open metal tin cans.
Gadgets used to make popsicles.

A wire basket made out of usually large-weave mesh used for grilling and keeping vegetables, seafood, or small pieces of meat contained that otherwise might fall through the grate of a grill down into the flames or coals .
A kitchen scale is a kitchen device used to measure the weight of ingredients and other food.
Device used to sprout seeds.
A bag clip is a small clamp used to reseal snacks, thus preventing them from going stale. Sometimes called chip clips, they have jagged “teeth” that chomp down on the top of open bags.

A butane torch is a tool which creates an intensely hot flame using a fuel mixture of LPGs typically including some percentage of butane, a flammable gas. Consumer air butane torches are often claimed to develop flame temperatures up to approximately 1,430 °C.
Timer is a device that can be set for several minutes (usually up to one hour) that sounds an alarm such as a bell or buzzer when the specified amount of time has elapsed
A can crusher is a device designed to compress aluminum or steel cans.

productTypeGroup.description: Home Brewing Line Assemblies are tubes in which liquid flows though.

productType.description: The flowers of the hop plant used primarily as a bittering, flavoring, and stability agent in beer, to which, in addition to bitterness, they impart floral, fruity, or citrus flavors and aromas.
Instrument used to measure the gravity of the wort to determine the ABV value of beer and the health of your brewing yeast and the effectiveness of your overall beer fermentation process.
Objects or devices needed to provide filtration in the home brewing process.
Containers which hold material in which the fermentation process takes place.
Objects in which bottles are hung on protruding arms in order to dry.
Device designed to transfer fermented liquids from one container to another without disturbing the sediment or solids.
A closure for the top opening of a bottle when bottling home brew.
A false bottom lays in the bottom of a mash tun preventing grain from leaving while letting your wort flow freely to your boil kettle.
An instrument used for measuring the relative density of liquids based on the concept of buoyancy in the home brewing process.
Mesh bags which are used to steep grains or hops in the home brewing process.
Pots where wort is boiled in the home brewing process.
Ingredients utilized for home brewing.
A collection of objects needed to start home brewing.

productType.productTypeName: Home Brewing Kettle False Bottom Adapters
productType.description: Adapter assembly to connect different types of false bottoms to a brew pot to convert an ordinary brew pot into a mash tun.
Tubes in which liquid flows though in the home brewing process.
Instruments used to measure or control temperature while home brewing.
A valve or spigot to be utilized with home brewing equipment.
Device utilized to place caps on bottles when bottling home brew.
Objects which connect two or more lines of a home brewing setup.

productType.productTypeName: Other Home Brewing & Wine Making Supplies
productType.description: A classifier for items in “Home Brewing & Wine Making Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Device used in beer brewing and wine making that allows carbon dioxide released during fermentation to escape the fermenter, while not allowing air to enter the fermenter, thus avoiding oxidation.
A heat exchanger designed to cool your wort to yeast pitch-able temperatures at a rapid rate, forming the cold break.
Cleaning agents utilized to clean home brewing equipment
Assortment of products used to sanitize home brewing equipment.
Container made from plastic or glass and used for fermenting various drinks such as beer, cider, wine and mead.
A device used to mix in your strike water and breaking up  dry pockets of malt during the mashing process.

A keg is a small barrel utilized for home brewing.
Keg supplies are objects or devices to be utilized in conjunction with a keg.
Vessel used for mixing the ground malt with temperature-controlled water in the home brewing process.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Ceiling and Wall Lighting & Light Fixtures
productTypeGroup.description: Ceiling and Wall Lighting & Light Fixtures

productType.description: Light fixtures designed to mount on the ceiling.
The track to fix series of track lights to support & fix  on ceiling and wall.
A ceiling fan downrod is a pipe that connects the motor housing to the mounting hardware, stabilizing the ceiling fan and reducing the potential for wobbling.
Remote controls intended to be used with ceiling fans or ceiling lights.

A shop light fixture is a lighting fixture mounted to or hung from a ceiling and are designed have "wings" on the sides of the fixture to direct light downward making them more suitable to light utility work areas with ceiling heights of less than 15 feet.
Component that connects a fan blade to a fan.
A classifier for items in “Ceiling Fan Parts & Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Powerful ceiling mounted light fixtures designed to provide the appropriate foot-candle levels to adequately illuminate large indoor vertical as well as horizontal space like manufacturing facilities, gymnasiums, warehouses, large department stores, factories, and more.
A chandelier is a branched ornamental light fixture designed to be mounted on ceilings or walls.
Light fixture installed into a hollow opening in the ceiling (also known as can lights).
Wall mounted lights installed directly onto the wall above the artwork to provide light on the piece.
Ceiling fan scrolls are decorative hooks for ceiling fans.

A ceiling fan is a fan mounted on the ceiling of a room or space, usually electrically powered, that uses hub-mounted rotating blades to circulate air. They cool people effectively by increasing air speed.
Light fixture mounted on a wall and styled so that the light beam is directed vertically up or down.
Light fixture set installed on a track with adjustable heads.
Vanity lights are a particular subset of lighting fixtures designed to be mounted above the bathroom vanity.

Emergency lighting is a battery-backed lighting device that switches on automatically when a building experiences a power outage. In the United States, emergency lights are standard in new commercial and high occupancy residential buildings, such as college dormitories, apartments, and hotels.
Light fixtures mounted to a wall or other vertical surface.

A ceiling fan lighting kit is an add-on for a ceiling fan that was designed with the capability to accept it.  It will generally consist of a replacement base cap (with capacity to support a shade or shades and bulb holders), necessary mounting hardware and wiring, and sometimes the required light bulbs.
A wraparound light fixture is a rectangular shaped ceiling mounted light fixtures featuring a prismatic lens covering the bulb(s) to distributes the light evenly in all directions.
A strip light fixture is a rectangular shaped light fixtures mounted to or hung from a ceiling without "wings" to allow for broad lighting angles.
Hanging light fixture designed to be mounted on the ceiling.
A ceiling light that is mounted flush to the ceiling surface.
The lighting fixture in a track lighting system.
Flat blades are the actual fan component that rotate to give air in a ceiling fan.

Primarily designed to protect mattress from stains and wear, mattress pads usually fit like a fitted sheet covering not just the top, but all four sides of the mattress and may additionally include a filled top layer to provide extra comfort.
Bed canopies are typically a fine-mesh curtain used to help keep the bed warmer, screen it from light, and/or protect from insects. They can also be used for decorative purposes only.
A mattress toppers is typically thick and designed to sit on top of the mattress providing an extra layer of comfort.
A bedding set includes a combination of sheets or pillowcases and bedding covers (bedspread, blanket, comforter, coverlet, duvet cover, quilt).
A wedge pillow is used to elevate the upper or lower body to help improve circulation, reduce snoring, and relieve pressure on sensitive areas.
Provides protection from accidental waterbed mattress leaks.

A bed sheet is a rectangular piece of cloth used either singly or in a pair as bedding, being placed immediately below or above bed occupants. Bed sheets can be flat, fitted, etc and can be sold sperately or as a sheet set.
Pillow that is designed to support the neck and keep the upper body aligned during sleep.
A quilt is a blanket that is usually used as a top covering on a bed, and has been made from sewing different pieces of fabric together in a decorative pattern.

Slumber bags are meant for indoor use and are typically found at a child's sleepover.
A nap mat is a comfy and cozy cocoon for your little one to sleep in. A majority of models come with an attached blanket and most have removable pillows, too.
Pillow that has a curved design to adapt to the contours of a sleeper's neck and shoulders.

An electric blanket is a blanket that contains integrated electrical heating wires. Types include underblankets, overblankets, throws, and duvets. An electric underblanket is placed above the mattress and below the bottom bed sheet.

A soft blanket intended for multiple uses related to a baby's comfort and warmth.  It is typically a lightweight blanket and can measure one square yard. It is used to wrap or swaddle a baby. Or it is used as play mat, to give the baby space to roll and crawl and play while keeping them out of direct contact with the floor.

A comforter is made to be used as is — it’s one complete piece. 
A duvet/duvet insert   is meant to be used with a duvet cover, coverlet, or top quilt.
A duvet cover is to a duvet as a pillow sham is to a pillow. You simply slip the duvet inside the duvet cover and close up the end with the attached buttons, ties or zipper. They’re meant for easy removal and washing so that you don’t have to bother washing and drying the thick duvet.
A classifier for items in “Bedding & Bedroom Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A bed-in-a-bag is a bedding ensemble that comes in a bag, usually containing a fitted and a flat sheet, two pillow cases, a bedspread, comforter, coverlet or duvet cover, and decorative shams/pillows. The can also contain curtains, valances, etc.
A bed runner is a decorative bed linen designed to be draped toward the bottom of the bed.

A bed skirt, sometimes spelled bedskirt, is a piece of decorative fabric that is placed between the mattress and the box spring of a bed. The purpose of a bed skirt is to give a stylish appearance to a bed without exposing the sides of the box spring or any space under the bed that may be used for storage.
Pillow protectors are designed to protect your pillows from spills, stains and wear and tear.
Help keep the temperature of your waterbed at a pleasing and constant level of temperature.

A throw blanket is smaller than most blankets. They are not sized for mattresses like bedspreads, quilts and duvet covers are. This is because throw blankets aren't just for beds. They're meant to be used in any room.

Bed blankets are normally used only for beds or other sleeping areas since their size corresponds to the sizing of sheets. They are the alternative to the duvet. Their primary function is for warmth and they're seldom used for decoration, but often under bedspreads or a duvet.
A bed rest pillow is a contoured type of pillow that is thick and structured enough to give you the support you need while sitting up in bed. They often contain armrests.
A bed pillow provide support for your neck and upper back while sleeping. Typical bed pillows sizes: Standard 20" x 26"; Standard Queen 20" x 28"; Queen 20" x 30"; King 20" x 36"
Used to cover the pillows that are used for actual sleeping. Pillowcases are often open at one end and contain a flange on opening.
Bedding fasteners help hold fitted sheets, flat sheets, mattress pads, duvet inserts in place. Items included: bed sheet fasteners, comforter clips, etc.

A bedspread is a single-layer bedding toppers that cover the entire bed right down to the floor and often cover the pillows as well.
 
A coverlet is smaller, designed to cover the top of the bed and to hang just past the boxsprings.
Unlike with pillowcases, shams are used to cover pillows for decorative purpose. Typically pillow shams contain a tuck flap on the back and all four sides are finished with flange or cording.
A body pillow is an oversized cushion typically used by side-sleepers during the night for comfort and pain relief. They help cradle you while you sleep. Typically measure 20" x 54".
A mattress encasement completely covers and protects all six sides of the mattresses. Usually zippered around one side. Protects against allergens, bed bugs, etc.

A bed bridge is a piece of foam that is used to connect two mattresses, making them into one large mattress. The bed bridge fills the gap in-between the two mattresses so that the sleeper does not end up falling into the crack in the middle of the beds.
Window covering that does not use slats or vanes and are often a softer item, often made with fabric.
Rods in which a curtain is hung.
Wall shelves that are mounted using brackets and hardware that is hidden within the shelf, giving the appearance of "floating" on the wall.
An architectural element consisting of a gable, usually of a triangular shape, placed above the horizontal structure of the lintel, or entablature, if supported by columns.
A curtain ring is a small clip for suspending a curtain.

A curtain is a piece of cloth or other material intended to block or obscure light.

A window valance is a form of window treatment that covers the uppermost part of the window and can be hung alone or paired with other window blinds, or curtains. Valances are a popular decorative choice in concealing drapery hardware.
A sticker that is affixed to a wall or other smooth surface for decoration and informational purposes.
Decals that help prevent wild birds from accidentally striking windows.
A wall growth chart is a chart used to measure a child's growth over time.
Curtain rod holders are hardware utilized to hold up a curtain rod.

Curtain holdbacks, also called curtain pullbacks, come in various forms, from tiebacks made of fabric to metal hooks or knobs that are installed in the wall next to a window. Usually placed about halfway down the wall, they all function to keep curtains swept to the side of a window.
Track in which a curtain is hung and operated.
Wall sculptures are decorative sculptures and artistic shapes designed to be hung on a wall.
These are slats utilized to repair a vertical window blind.
A thin laminate film that can be installed on a glass surface to either darken the light the permeates the glass, provide UV protection or safety by hold the glass in place if shattered.

A window shutter is a solid and stable window covering usually consisting of a frame of vertical stiles and horizontal rails. Set within this frame can be louvers, solid panels, fabric, glass and almost any other item that can be mounted within a frame.
Window blinds is a covering with long slats often made of a hard material. They are often adjustable to allow different amounts of light through the window.
Cake serving sets come with more than just a cake server. These sets include additional cake serverware (e.g., serving utensil(s), knives, cake platters, etc.).
A grapefruit utensil is usually similar in design to a teaspoon that tapers to a sharp edge or teeth, the intent of the front serration being to separate the flesh of a grapefruit from its rind.
Table utensil with a grip and skewers designed to hold a corn cob without getting your fingers greasy.

A flatware set is a collection of utensils used for eating, including knives, dinner fork, spoons, and sometimes other specialized pieces such as serving spoons and forks, seafood forks, and spreaders.
Kitchen flatware and serving utensils intended for salad, fruit, appetizers, desserts, etc.
Tableware spoons are cutlery or kitchenware, consisting of a set of spoons setting in dining table for serving and eating food
A cheese spreader, also known as a spatula knife, is made for applying cheese spreads and creamy, spreadable cheeses onto bread and crackers.
A long handled spoon used in bartending for mixing and layering of both alcoholic and non-alcoholic mixed drinks.

A tableware knife is an item of cutlery with a single cutting edge, and a blunt end – part of a table setting. Table knives are typically of moderate sharpness only, designed to cut prepared and cooked food.
A large spoon used to serve out individual portions of food.

A tableware fork is a utensil, usually made of metal, whose long handle terminates in a head that branches into several narrow and often slightly curved tines with which one can spear foods either to hold them to cut with a knife or to lift them to the mouth.
Utensils for serving salads.
A cake server is a serving utensil used in the cutting and serving of pies and cakes.
A large fork used to serve different kinds of food.

Chopsticks are shaped pairs of equal-length sticks that have been used as kitchen and eating utensils in most of East and Southeast Asia for over three millennia. They are held in the dominant hand, secured by fingers, and wielded as extensions of the hand, to pick up food.
A chopstick rest is tableware, similar to a knife rest or a spoon rest, used to keep chopstick tips off the table and to prevent used chopsticks from contaminating or rolling off tables.
A large shallow dish or plate, used for serving food.
Bowls that come in a variety of sizes and can be used for soup, cereal, pasta, etc.
A board used for serving or cutting cheese. Cheese boards come in a variety of shapes and sizes and can be made of wood, stainless steel, marble, or glass.
Tableware plates are plates used for setting a table, serving food and dining.
Dishware used to serve condiments.

Sized somewhere between a regular dinner plate and a salad plate (depending on the manufacturer, typically around 8.75 - 9.5 inches ), an accent plate is a decorative term for a bread, salad, or a side dish plate that usually has an ornate, complimentary, but not exactly matching to the original dishes pattern.
Square Sugar Packet Holders help to keep sweeteners at hand on every table at your cafe or restaurant. It can hold standard sugar packets.
Gravy Boats are vessels used to serve hot gravy, broth, au jus, or more.
A smaller size plate and will be found in sizes ranging from 6 inches to 8 inches.

A butter dish is defined as "a usually round or rectangular dish often with a drainer and a cover for holding butter at table". Before refrigerators existed, a covered dish made of crystal, silver, or china housed the butter.
A serving dish where chips and dips are served together, but each food gets its own compartment.
Decorative bowl specifically for use at parties and festive occasions.
A plate measuring five to six inches in diameter for individual servings of bread and butter.
A large plate usually 10 inches in diameter used for the main course of a meal.
A saucer is a small dishware with a round indentation in the center designed to accompany a cup or mug.
Small plates (approx. 6 inches in diameter) designed for individual servings of appetizers and hors d'oeuvres.
Tableware designed to serve creamer or hold sugar.
A large bowl used to serve a variety of foods.
A flat, shallow container or receptacle made of wood, metal, glass etc., usually with slightly raised edges and handles used for carrying, holding, and serving food.
Plateware that is slightly larger than a dinner plate (11–14 inches).
A salad serving set is a big deep dish used to serve a salad that comes with either matching individual salad bowls and/or a server set.
Tableware are the dishes or dishware used for setting a table, serving food and dining.

A serving bowl set is a set that includes a large serving bowl along with either a serving utensil and/or smaller or different size bowls. For a set that consists of the very same serving bowls in multiples, use "Serving Bowls" PT.
Charger plates are large flat base plates used for multi course meals or to dress up special events like parties, weddings, etc..
A small plate used chiefly for serving an individual portion of salad.
Decorative plate specifically for use at parties and festive occasions.
Includes a board used for serving cheese and additional cheese tools and/or knives.
Pads for seating surfaces that provide comfort or posture support.
Pad designed to protect a dining table.
Tableware Storage Chest is an organizer to used to house tableware.
Napkin rings are small objects used to hold a single folded or rolled cloth napkin.
Provide a secure hold to prevent your tablecloth from slipping or blowing away in the wind.
A salt and pepper mill is a device used to grind coarse ingredients (mainly salt and pepper) so you can sprinkle them over dishes.
A piece of cloth or paper used at a meal to wipe the fingers or lips and to protect garments.

A napkin holder is a device used to hold napkins. A napkin holder can be made from virtually any solid material and is built so that the napkins do not slip from its hold, either by way of sandwiching them between two surfaces, or simply enclosing them on their sides in a horizontal design.

A coaster, drink coaster, beverage coaster, or beermat is an item used to rest drinks upon. Coasters protect the surface of a table or any other surface where the user might place a glass. Coasters on top of a beverage can also be used to show that a drink is not finished or to prevent contamination.
Table skirts are the material which is used for the sides of your table to help it look more beautiful and complete. Its main purpose is to hide the legs of the table.

A narrow length of cloth placed on top of tablecloths or on a bare table. Table runners are used in a variety of ways: laid down the center of the table for decoration, across the table to define seating, or to carry out a theme.
A salt and pepper shakers are condiment dispensers used in Western culture that are designed to allow diners to distribute grains of edible salt and ground peppercorns.
A toothpick is a small thin stick of wood, plastic, bamboo, metal or other substance with at least one and sometimes two pointed ends to insert between teeth to remove detritus, usually after a meal.

Device (think bucket) used to keep your wine at the perfect temperature. They are often placed on/near the table while dining, so that people have easy access to refill their wine glasses without leaving the table to retrieve the wine from the refrigerator.
A piece of cloth used at the table to wipe the mouth and fingers while eating. It is usually small and folded, sometimes in intricate designs and shapes.

A drinking straw is a utensil that is intended to carry the contents of a beverage to one's mouth. Straws are commonly made from plastics but environmental concerns and new regulation have led to rise in reusable and biodegradable straws. These straws are often made of silicone, cardboard, or metal.
Tablecloth is a cloth spread over a table, especially during meals.
A classifier for items in “Dining Table Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A table place mat is also known as a placemat or table mat is a covering or pad designating an individual place setting, unlike the larger tablecloth that covers the entire surface. Placemats are made from many different materials, depending on their purpose: to protect, decorate, entertain or advertise.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Refrigerator, Dishwasher, Washer and Dryer Parts & Accessories
productTypeGroup.description: Refrigerator, Dishwasher, Washer and Dryer Parts & Accessories

productType.description: Objects in which water and detergent is moved though in a dishwasher to clean dishes and utensils.
Wheels upon which a dishwasher rack slides.
Objects utilized to adjust a dishwasher rack.
Objects in which dishes and or utensils are placed in or on in a dishwasher.
Door gaskets for a refrigerator.
Various accessories for washers and dryers.
Replacement door springs for dishwashers.
Piece designed to help connect the dishwasher to the plumbing drainage system.
Replaceable refrigerator water valves.
Instruments used to measure temperature of an refrigerator.
Ducting used with a dryer to vent the warm moist air out of a home.
Dishwasher installation kit includes necessary pieces to set up a dishwasher (e.g., connectors, fittings, power cord, etc.).
Replacement detergent dispenser for dishwashers.
Minor replacement parts and accessories for refrigerators.
Filters that collect lint and debris within a clothes dryer vent.
Bins, shelves or baskets for a refrigerator.
Various accessories for dishwashers.
Replaceable water filter that works with a refrigerator's drinking water and ice maker supply system.
A furnace is an appliance used to generate heat for all or part of a building. Furnaces are mostly used as a major component of a central heating system.

An ice maker also known as an ice generator, or ice machine may refer to either a consumer device for making ice, found inside a home freezer; a stand-alone appliance for making ice, or an industrial machine for making ice on a large scale.
Appliance that is specially engineered for long-term wine storage, are generally of larger capacity, and feature a more furniture-styled appearance than wine refrigerators.
A refrigerated compartment, cabinet, or room for preserving food at very low temperatures.

A garbage disposal unit is a device, usually electrically powered, installed under a kitchen sink between the sink's drain and the trap. The device shreds food waste into pieces small enough—generally less than 2 mm in diameter—to pass through plumbing.

A refrigerator is a home appliance consisting of a thermally insulated compartment and a heat pump (mechanical, electronic, or chemical) that transfers heat from its inside to its external environment so that it's inside is cooled to a temperature below the room temperature.
A device that compresses and crushes waste material, reducing its size and volume.

A humidifier is a household appliance or device designed to increase the moisture level in the air within a room or an enclosed space. It achieves this by emitting water vapor or steam into the surrounding air, thereby raising the humidity levels.
A air purifier is a device that removes contaminating particles (such as dust, pollen, and dander) from the air.
Device that purifies the air in a room by electrically charging air molecules.

A dehumidifier is an air conditioning device which reduces and maintains the level of humidity in the air. This is done usually for health or thermal comfort reasons, or to eliminate musty odor and to prevent the growth of mildew by extracting water from the air.
A machine used to cool down the temperature in an inside space by removing the existing heat and moisture from the space.
Refrigerator meant for commercial / industrial use; not a conventional home appliance.
Air conditioning device that cools air via the transition of liquid water to water vapor which can cools air using much less energy than refrigeration.

productType.productTypeName: Other Range, Stovetop & Oven Replacement Parts
productType.description: A classifier for items in “Range, Stovetop & Oven Replacement Parts” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Thermometers that are integrated with a range.

A range hood filter is a charcoal or metal accessory for your range hood that filters grease, dirt, and other contaminants out of the air above your cooktop. The three most common types of filters are stainless steel baffle filters, aluminum mesh filters, and charcoal filters.
A classifier for items in “Range, Stovetop & Oven Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Covers or heat diffusers for a range.
Replacement heating elements of a range.
A small metal shallow bowl that sits underneath your stove's burners or elements to catch drips and liquids.
Timers that are integrated with a range.
Gas head, valve, or electric replacement burner for a cooktop or range appliance.
Backguards shield the wall from intense heat, steam, sprays, and spatters.
Framework of parallel or latticed bars utilized to place dishes or food above a range or cooktop burner.

Flood lights are outdoor lighting fixtures that emit light in a broad beamed pattern. 

Security Lights are exterior lighting fixtures that are motion sensing or otherwise triggered to improve the security of the building.
A tall pole with a light at the top; a street light.
Lighting designed to be installed in underwater locations.
A lamp constructed with durable materials specifically for weathering outdoor conditions.  Some may feature a UL rating for wet locations.
Deck lights provide a soft glow that lights the deck for easier wayfinding. They can be installed into the railing, stair risers or the deck itself.
Outdoor light holders are light fixtures meant for outside. Ground stakes are metal or plastic stakes to hold or secure something down outside.

Any light designed specifically to illuminate the underside of a patio umbrella. This come in numerous forms, but most commonly a discus that attaches to the central pole or a series of rope(string)-type lights that attach to the umbrella's canopy spars.
Outdoor lighting that is installed just above the ground to accent walkways, gardens, or lower portions of a home.
Devices that support window a/c units.
Hoses used on various appliances.
A classifier for items in “Small Kitchen Appliance Accessories" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A classifier for items in “Microwave Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Door latches or latch kit for appliance doors.
A panel containing switches, dials, buttons, etc. for manipulating settings and functionality of the appliance.
Replacement appliance water valves designed to regulate, direct or control the flow of water by opening, closing, or partially obstructing various passageways.
A classifier for items in “Household Appliance Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Air filters used in appliances.
Moves heated or cooled air through a blower assembly via centrifugal fan.
A classifier for items in “Air Conditioner Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Kits that include the sleeve for a through the wall a/c unit.
Appliance control board is a central communications backbone connectivity point, through which all electronic components  and external peripherals of the appliance connect.
Replacement parts and components for an electric blender appliance.
Igniters for a an oven.
Furnace filters are designed to keep the air circulating through the house cleaner by reducing various particles, pollen, molds, and dust depending on the design and rating system of the filter.
Microwave turntables are the glass trays that sits on the plastic support ring. The turntable rotates constantly during the cooking process.
Replacement handles for an appliance.
Gaskets designed to be installed on an appliance door.
A classifier for items in “Household Appliance Replacement Parts” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Knobs for appliances.
Covers for air conditioners.
Replacement appliance part that often controls or drives another component through a rotating (i.e. spinning) motion.
Appliance cover designed to keep appliances clean and safe.
Monitors and detects specific conditions in the overall appliance (e.g. moisture level, load balance).
A grilled vent used to allow external venting for microwaves installed in cabinetry.
Replacement appliance part that guides other components through circular or linear motion.
Pitcher for an electric blender, frequently made of glass or plastic.
Replacement trays for toaster ovens.
Electric Buffet Servers are appliances in which food is stored in pans or trays which are warmed via a heat source in order to keep the food warm.
An appliance used to produce fine shavings of ice from blocks or cubes of ice.

A yogurt maker is a kitchen appliance that by heating milk and leaving it to ferment, in a controlled environment at a controlled temperature, allows you to make homemade yogurt in a fairly simple, quick and cost-effective way.
An electric knife sharpner is an electric powered kitchen gadget that sharpens knives.
Electric wine bottle opener is a powered kitchen gadget that open wine bottles.

Typical machines used to make cotton candy include a spinning head enclosing a small "sugar reserve" bowl into which a charge of granulated, colored sugar (or separate sugar and food coloring) is poured. Heaters near the rim of the head melt the sugar, which is squeezed out through tiny holes by centrifugal force.

An ice cream maker is a machine used to make small quantities of ice cream for personal consumption. Ice cream makers may prepare the mixture by employing the hand-cranking method or by employing an electric motor.
A vacuum sealer removes the air from the space around your food and then uses a heated seal bar to fuse the sides of the bag, preventing the air from leaking back into the bag.
A food warmer is a small appliances for warming food products. This item might be intended for use in a restaurant, home kitchen, or in a food display context.
A electric food slicer is an electric powered kitchen gadget that slices food.

Electric can openers operate with just the pull of a lever or press of a button; the gear mechanism pulls the can in tight while it spins under a dull blade, removing the top. These units are designed to accommodate a variety of can sizes.
A hand mixer is an electric device that mix foods or ingredients.
A stationary electric mixer for heavy-duty mixing, whipping, or kneading of various foods, typically having a flat beater, dough hook, and whisk attachments.
A food dehydrator is a device that removes moisture from food to aid in its preservation. Food drying is a method of preserving fruit, vegetables and meats that has been practiced since antiquity.
A electric food chopper is a small kitchen appliance designed to chop, mince, and grind food.

A food processor is a kitchen appliance used to facilitate repetitive tasks in the preparation of food. Today, the term almost always refers to an electric-motor-driven appliance, although there are some manual devices also referred to as "food processors". Food processors are similar to blenders in many forms.
An electric popcorn popper is an electric powered kitchen gadget that pops popcorn.
A portion control tool that allows to measure and scoop out various foods.

A honey dipper (also called a honey dripper, honey wand, honey stick, honey spoon, or honey drizzler) is a kitchen utensil used to collect viscous liquid (generally honey or syrup) from a container, which is then dispensed at another location.
Food grabbing and turning tool with long handles designed for use with outdoor grills.

A pizza peel is a tool used by bakers to slide loaves of bread, pizzas, pastries, and other baked goods into and out of an oven. It is usually made of wood, with a flat surface for carrying the baked good and a handle extending from one side of that surface.
Ice tongs have two handles and either hooked points for lifting large blocks of ice or claw-shaped ends for handling ice in an ice tub.
A kitchen utensil that is used for several purposes, such as stirring, serving and transferring food.
A cooking skimmer is a flat, sieve-like scoop or spoon used for skimming cooking liquids or lifting ripened cream from milk.
A utensil used to lift and flip food items during cooking.
Melon ballers are utensils to make balls of melon from a scoop with a diameter from around 1 centimeter to 3 centimeters (about 3/8 inch to 1 inch). They are generally used to make fruit salad.

A meat hook is any hook normally used in butcheries to hang meat. This form of hook is a variation on the classic S hook.

Meat flippers are devices with a sharp, curved (like a pig's tail) metal tip that allows the cook to easily grab, flip, and then smoothly extract the tip from the meat.
Ladles are used to dish soups of all kinds from the pot to the soup bowl.
A kitchen utensil that is made to form ice cream into a slightly rounded or a well-rounded ball shape as the ice cream is taken from the container and placed into a cone, a bowl or onto a dessert.

A type of kitchen utensil that help users grab onto foods to lift, flip, toss, or serve without hand contact. They can help keep hands away from hot cooking surfaces and flames as well as prevent cross-contamination.
A thin vinyl or rubber covering that covers the bulk of the outside of drinkware to decorate or protect the device from scratches and other forms of light damage.
A large glass, ceramic, or stainless steel jug used to transport draft beer and cider.
Water filtration system that is installed on the faucet nozzle.
Drinkware accessories - usually travel mug lids, cup holders, etc.
Replacement water filters designed for systems installed on the faucet nozzle.
The LED Ice Cubes are artificial reusable ice cubes to lit up your drink.
Systems designed to placed under a sink or on a countertop that filter water.
Carbonating bottles are bottles specifically designed to handle the pressure of carbonation.
Insulating storage vessel that greatly lengthens the time over which its contents remain hotter or cooler than the vessel's surroundings.
Water filters that can be exchanged in various devices or appliances.
Parts and accessories for use with an electric juicer product.

The soda siphon, also known as the seltzer bottle, siphon seltzer bottle, or just siphon is a device for storing and dispensing carbonated beverages while maintaining the internal pressure, thereby preventing it from going flat.
Substances that clean water filters.
A thin flask for holding liquor.
Objects that can be used to carbonate different types of liquid, primarily water.
Pitcher designed for dispensing water after it has passed through a filter cartridge.
Material added to the outside of a coffee cup as an additional layer of protection to reduce heat conduction between the coffee and your hands.
Metallic canisters that hold in carbon dioxide gas.
Water filtration system that is installed at the entry point of the home's water supply.
Objects used to hold or dispense toothpicks.
Dispensers or shaker for sugar or spices.
Water dispenser machine that cools or heats up water using an electric refrigeration unit.

An airpot is a portable vacuum insulated hot drink dispenser with a glass or stainless steel internal liner. Airpots can be filled with a hot beverage such as tea and coffee and used to keep a drink warm for hours.
Jug or pitcher shaped beverage dispenser designed for serving hot drinks.
Dispensers for water cups.
Batter dispenser is a manually operated kitchen gadget that drops consistently measured amounts of batter onto a cooking surface.
Devices designed to dispense liquor.
This is the cap or covering that goes on top of a bottle pourer.
Dispensers for condiments.
Containers designed to dispense oil & vinegar.
A beverage dispenser is used to hold and dispense pre-made drinks, such as iced tea and juices.

Bottle pourers are primarily used in bartending to pour spirits and liqueurs into a spirit measure or glass. A liqueur pourer may also be used to layer shots and cocktails. Bottle pourers are usually made from metal or plastic and come in a variety of speeds including free flow pourers, fast pourers and slow pourers.
Dispensers for dried food.
A food chopper usually has one blade to chop, purée and mix smaller batches. A food processor is larger and has a feed tube along with multiple blades that make a variety of cuts.
Kitchens shears usually have one serrated blade and one sharp. They are often used for snipping herbs, cutting open food packaging, and breaking down poultry.

A mandoline slicer is a device made up of a flat surface fitted with a sharp blade, that lets you slice vegetables and fruits quickly, precisely and (ideally) safely. You simply slide the item back and forth across the blade and your perfect, uniform slices emerge below.
A utensil designed to remove the core, or center from fruit or vegetables.
A tool designed to make cutting pasta quick and easy. To include ravioli stamps - tool designed to cut and seal at the same time.
Either single kitchen knives or complete kitchen knife sets.
A bagel slicer is a kitchen tool which is designed to facilitate the slicing of bagels, ensuring that they are evenly and uniformly sliced.

A fillet knife is a kitchen knife used for filleting. It gives good control and aids in filleting. It is a very flexible member of the boning knife family that is used to filet and prepare fish. Fillet knife blades are typically 15 to 28 cm long.
A pastry cutter, also known as a pastry blender or dough blender, is used to work solid fats like butter, shortening, or lard into flour to create a dough.

An electric knife or electric carving knife is an electrical kitchen device used for slicing foods. The device consists of two serrated blades that are clipped together. When the appliance is switched on, the blades continuously move lengthways to provide the sawing action.
A device that removes the peel or skin from fruits and vegetables.

Spiralizers are kitchen appliances used for cutting vegetables, such as zucchinis, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, apples, parsnips, and beetroots, into linguine-like strands which can be used as an alternative to pasta.
A kitchen utensil that can be used to grind, crush, mince, or cut herbs into smaller pieces.
Knives designed to split or cut coconut.
A long handled fork designed to handle or hold cooked meat.
A pizza cutter is a handheld kitchen utensil that is used to cut various items into sections or slices. The typical pizza cutter has a wheel-shaped blade that is attached to a handle.
This kitchen tool is made to easily remove the scales attached to the skin of a fish that will be prepared and cooked.
Tool used to pry shells open and make quick work of the connective muscle that keeps the flesh connected to its shell.

A grater and zester is a kitchen utensil used to grate or zest foods into fine pieces.
A zester (also, citrus zester or lemon zester) is a kitchen utensil for obtaining zest from lemons and other citrus fruit.
A cheese slicer is used usually to cut semi-hard and hard cheeses. It produces thin, even slices. There are different styles of cheese slicers, designed for cheeses of varying hardness.
A kitchen utensil made to remove the stone or pit from small round fruits and vegetables, such as cherries or olives.
Rack placed next to the sink, to allow washed dishes set within to drip into the sink and air dry.
A banana hanger is a device use to hang bananas - allowing them to ripen evenly and bruise less, so they stay fresh longer.
Holders for hanging mugs to dry, storage or for display.
Jar used to store honey and/or syrup. They often contain a honey dipper (a kitchen utensil used to collect viscous liquid from a container, which is then dispensed at another location).
Lunch carrier that is reusable.
Trays that are made to help defrost food quickly in microwave.

A strainer, also sometimes called a sieve, is a kitchen tool made with fine mesh that catches solids and particles. Instead of the large holes in a colander, the fine mesh of a strainer can be used for greater filtration. Strainers often have a long handle that can be used with one hand.
A colander is a perforated bowl that usually features two handles and a base. The main purpose of a colander is to drain liquids from foods or to rinse foods.
Mats that absorb the moisture that drains off your clean dishes and utensils and keeps countertops free of puddles.
A set that includes a bucket designed to hold ice along with tongs.
Decanter drying stand holds a decanter upside down and aloft, which increases air flow while letting gravity help remove water droplets.

A cutting board is a durable board on which to place material for cutting. The kitchen cutting board is commonly used in preparing food; other types exist for cutting raw materials such as leather or plastic. Kitchen cutting boards are often made of wood or plastic and come in various widths and sizes.

A butcher block or butcher's block is a heavy duty chopping block, typically laminated of hardwood. Traditionally made of hard maple, it was commonly used in butcher shops and meat processing plants but has now become popular in home use.
Stands to dry up washed plastic bags.
An ice bucket is a container which holds ice cubes or cold water and ice.
Food covers are used to protect food from bugs and contamination when entertaining outdoors.

A spice rack is an organizational tool that is used to store bottles of seasonings and spices. Spice racks are available in a variety of materials, sizes and styles. A spice rack is used to organize bottles of spices and seasonings.
Objects or shelves utilized to place dishes or food inside of an oven.
Boxes or containers used to store individual recipes.
Device used to cover the cutting edge of a knife.
A salt box, also referred to as a salt pig or salt cellar, is a storage container for salt that is usually kept near the stove for easy access while cooking.

A breadbox or a bread bin is a container for storing bread and other baked goods to keep them fresh. They were a more common household kitchen item until bread started being made commercially with food preservatives and wrapped in plastic.
A bento box is a compartmentalized food storage box, often used for lunches.
Liners of various shape and/or material specifically made for Air Fryer use.
A product designed to hold a roll of paper towels.
Holder used to organize and display drinkware glasses that have stems.
Jars or containers for food storage.
An item used to hold and organize kitchen utensils.
Straw Dispenser keeps straws organized and quickly within reach.
A popcorn bucket is a cylindrical open container designed to serve popcorn.

A lazy Susan is a turntable placed on a table or countertop to aid in distributing food. Lazy Susans may be made from a variety of materials but are usually glass, wood, or plastic. They are circular and placed in the center of a table to share dishes easily among diners.

A pot rack is a functional piece of kitchen furniture that is used to hang or store cooking pots and pans. Steel, wood, wrought iron, and a few other metals are the most common types of materials used for pot racks. Pot racks also usually have some type of finish or stain to help them match pots and decor.

Cooking utensil bars will help get your cookware, utensils, pots, pans, towels or tools out of the drawer and up on the wall where you can access them easily.
Blocks of wood or other hard material having slits in which kitchen knives be stored safely.
Racks with a series of arms over which you drape pasta.
A carton designed for transporting and storing whole eggs.
Cylindrical container designed for food storage.
An electric wok is a deep round-bottomed cooking appliance which utilizes electricity to generate heat.

A microwave oven is a relatively small, boxlike oven that raises the temperature of food by subjecting it to a high-frequency electromagnetic field. The microwaves are absorbed by water, fats, sugars, and certain other molecules, whose consequent vibrations produce heat.
An Electric Rotisseries & Roasters electric powered kitchen gadget that roasts or rotisseries food.

A deep fryer, is a kitchen appliance used for deep frying. Deep frying is a method of cooking by submerging food into oil at high heat, typically between temperatures of 350 °F and 375 °F. While commonly used in commercial kitchens, household models are available and have become increasingly prevalent.
A cooking range that extends from the rear of the counter to the front.  It generally has knobs located on the front of the unit and is often combined with a wall oven.
Electric griddles have a large, flat cooking surface and have a heating element built in. The surface is usually has a nonstick coating. Does not have a hinged cover as in a contact grill.
Ovens with a narrow openings from about 7 to 12 inches in height, and cavities that are wide and deep used primarily for bread baking.

A wall oven is its own cooking appliance that can be built into your wall space and placed separately from your cooktop. Or as a "built-in" unit in kitchen cabinets. Wall ovens are easier to install and most wall ovens are placed around eye-level, cutting back on bending, kneeling, or crouching to place food into the oven.

An oven, often of restaurant grade use, featuring a conveyor belt which moves food through a heating chamber at a constant speed, providing efficiency and consistency in the cooking of a target food product.

A warming drawer, sometimes called a baking drawer, can be used to help bread dough rise, keep dishes warm until serving, and can sometimes be used as a slow cooker. Warming drawers are available as a stand-alone appliance built into kitchen cabinets or as a kitchen range feature.
A countertop burner is a stand-alone cooking burner small appliance that is used on top of a counter.
A contact grill is a small tabletop grill with a lid that closes over the top. It's also known as a flattop grill, hibachi, portable stovetop grill, or camping grill.
A toaster is a small electric appliance that uses radiant heat to brown sliced bread into toast.
An electric cooking pot that is used especially for cooking foods at a relatively low temperature over a long period of time.

A range hood or kitchen hood, exhaust hood, hood fan, or extractor hood is a device containing a mechanical fan that hangs above the stove or cooktop in the kitchen. It removes airborne grease, combustion products, fumes, smoke, heat, and steam from the air by evacuation of the air and filtration.
A small kitchen appliance used to cook or prepare various foods with steam heat.

Electric skillets are versatile cooking appliances that are suitable for pan-frying, sautéing, roasting, steaming, and even baking. And with enough depth, you can also stew, braise, and deep-fry. These appliances are designed to sit on the countertop.

A toaster oven is a small electric countertop appliance that looks like a mini oven but functions as an oven-toaster hybrid. Toaster ovens are mainly used for reheating leftovers, cooking frozen foods, toasting breads and baking in small batches.

A hot plate is a portable, self-contained small appliance with a heating surface or gas burner. A hot plate can be used as a stand-alone appliance, but is often used as a substitute for one of the burners from an oven range or a kitchen stove.
A cooking surface with burners that is installed as a "drop in" appliance with a countertop completely surrounding it.
An electric hot pot is an electric powered kitchen gadget that boils water.

A pressure cooker is an airtight cooking device that cooks food under high pressure steam and water or a water-based cooking liquid. High pressure limits boiling and creates higher cooking temperatures which cook food far more quickly.

A canning pot for water bath canning is a specialized pot used for home food preservation. It can only be used when processing high-acid foods through the water bath method. High acid foods include fruit, jams jellies, pickles and salsas.
Small kitchen appliance that fries items by circulating hot air around the food at high speeds.
Absorbent and durable towels intended for use in the kitchen.
Padded mitten used to handle hot dishes and pans and intended for kitchen, indoor cooking.
Sets of linen used while cooking or clearing up after a meal.
A pot holder is a piece of padded fabric or heat-resistant material used to handle hot dishes and pans.
A garment covering part of the front of the body and tied at the waist, for protecting the wearer's clothing while cooking.
A trivet is an object placed between a serving dish or bowl, and a dining table, usually to protect the table from heat damage.
Small decorations made to fit on or around the stems of your wine glasses. Allow guests to keep up with their glass in case they set it down and walk away.
Cheesecloth is a loose-woven gauze-like carded cotton cloth used primarily in cheesemaking and cooking.
Heat-resistant glove used to handle hot dishes and pans while grilling and barbecuing.
Picnic Baskets & Bags allow people to easily collect loose materials such as berries or food grains, and to transport more items than could readily be carried in the hands.
Basket liner is a material that is used to cover the inside surface of a basket.

A pastry brush, also known as a basting brush, is a cooking utensil used to spread butter, oil or glaze on food. Traditional pastry brushes are made with natural bristles or a plastic or nylon fiber similar to a paint brush, while modern kitchen brushes may have silicone bristles.
Objects designed to be filled water in a freezer to mold water into various shapes of ice.
Cups that make it easy to delete fat stock for gravies and sauces.
Pasta & Dumpling Molds & Stamps are cooking accessories to give good shape of dough cutting out in perfect professional look.
A utensil that consists of a tube with a bulb at one end that draws in and ejects liquid for basting food.
Gadget used to separate egg yolk from the egg white.

A pastry brush, also known as a basting brush, is a cooking utensil used to spread butter, oil or glaze on food. Traditional pastry brushes are made with natural bristles or a plastic or nylon fiber similar to a paint brush, while modern kitchen brushes may have silicone bristles.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Ironing, Vacuuming, and Steaming Parts & Accessories
productTypeGroup.description: Ironing, Vacuuming, and Steaming Parts & Accessories

productType.description: Objects in which clothing or cloth items are hung from to be steamed.
pressing pads or pressing clothes are used to absorb the heat as you press your items.
Ironing Sets are a collection of objects utilized for ironing.  Ironing centers is a self-contained object which provides storage for all ironing necessities.
Fasteners used to attached an ironing board cover to a ironing board.
Replacement  or supplementary pads and brushes to use with a steam mop.
Vacuum cleaner filters prevent dust from getting back into the air while vacuuming.
Cover for the ironing board. Allows for the easy transfer of heat and steam from the iron into your clothing.
Objects that hold ironing boards.
An ironing board is a long narrow board covered with cloth on which you iron clothes.
Device to place iron plate down without scorching ironing surface.
A classifier for items in “Vacuum Cleaner Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Items that attach to a vacuum cleaner which aid in cleaning. Examples include crevice tool, upholstery brush, mattress brush, dusting brush.
A flexible ironing surface that can be placed on a table top or similar surface.
Device to keep the cord out of the way while ironing.
A replaceable bag used as a filter to trap the dirt while allowing air to flow through the cleaner.
Products utilized in the cleaning of a clothes iron.
Hat washer or baseball cap frame or cage protects the shape of the hat in the washer or dryer.
