Pads that are placed under a floor polishing machine, which are used to polish or clean the surface.
A vacuum belt is a critical part in most upright vacuums. The belt rotates the brusher bars which are used to beat and agitate dirt out of carpeting so that the vacuum can suck it out.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Humidity Appliance and Evaporative Air Cooler Parts & Accessories
productTypeGroup.description: Humidity Appliance and Evaporative Air Cooler Parts & Accessories

productType.description: Fitted cover for evaporative air conditioner intended to protect the appliance from dust and weather exposure.
Valve (or float valve) specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
Absorbent pads specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
A humidifier absorption sleeve is a material in which moisture is collected within a humidifier.
Pump specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
Motor drive belt specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
Products that are used in dehumidifiers. Examples include moisture absorber, dehumidifier adaptor, dehumidifier controllers
Motor specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
Parts to be utilized in an Evaporative Air Cooler, NOT inclusive of Belts, Covers, Motors, Pads, Pulleys, Pumps, or values which are their own product types.
Pulley (or blower pulley) specifically designed for an evaporative air conditioner appliance (aka swamp cooler).
Device fixed outside a door that is rung to announce the presence of a visitor or caller.
Rod for securing a carpet in the angle between two steps.
Electric Household Fans are used to regulate interior temperatures with the souce of electricity.
Replacement parts for a clock's internal and external component pieces.
Draft blocks are placed across cracks under doors and around windows to prevent cold air from blowing inside, as well as keeping warm air from escaping.
Devices used to prevents objects slipping through into the pipes, but it also doesn't block the flow of water.
Device used to control the flow of water in a sink, tub, or vessel.

Anti-fatigue mats are mats designed to reduce fatigue caused by standing for long periods on a hard surface (e.g., cement floors). Fatigue-reducing mats can be made of various materials including rubber, carpeting materials, vinyl, and wood.

A rug pad is a sheet of material that serves as a buffer between your area rug and the floor. The purpose of a rug pad is to protect both the rug and the floor. It also protects you by making the rug less slippery. A rug pad holds the rug in place, softens the floor, makes cleaning easier, and dampens sounds.
Doormat is a mat placed before or inside a door for wiping dirt from the shoes.  A floor mat is any kind of mat you put on a floor.
Temporary carpet covering designed for high use areas often made of vinyl or plastic.
Floor mats intended for use in the kitchen.
A rug used in front of a fireplace or stove and designed to protect nearby flooring from sparks and other types of damage.
An area rug is intended to fill a large area of floor space of a room for either comfort and usability of the space or design impact in the space.
Long and narrow rugs designed to be used in hallways, staircases and other high traffic areas.
Accent rug with hair-on-hide construction and available in a variety of shapes, but often with an animal hide style.
A bath rug is an absorbent floor rug placed outside of a shower or bath tub.

A slipcover is a fitted protective cover that may be slipped off and on a piece of upholstered furniture. Slipcovers are usually made of cloth. Slipcovers slip on and off, they come fresh, and may be removed for seasonal change, cleaning, moving, or storage.
Clocks used for the purpose of decoration.
A yard sign is a outdoor sign that can feature inspirational quotes, colorful accents or a useful detail, like hooks, a bottle opener or a place to write notes.

An umbrella stand is a storage device for umbrellas and walking sticks. They are usually located inside the entrance of a home or public building, and are sometimes complemented by a hanger or mirror, or combined with a coat rack. The stand is used to hold umbrellas when they are not in use. This is not to be confused with an outdoor umbrella base.
A finial or hip-knob is an element marking the top or end of some object, often formed to be a decorative feature.
A tall, freestanding clock.

A decorative pillow cover is a small, decorative soft furnishing item made from a wide range of textiles including cotton, linen, silk, leather, microfibre, suede, chenille, and velvet. Decorative (or throw) pillow covers are a commonly used piece in interior design and come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes and decorative elements such as tassels and piped edges. The most common decorative pillow cover designs are square and range from 16 inches to 24 inches.

Decorative pillows are small, decorative soft furnishing items made from a wide range of textiles including cotton, linen, silk, leather, microfibre, suede, chenille, and velvet. Decorative (or throw) pillows are a commonly used piece in interior design and come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes and decorative elements such as tassels and piped edges. The most common decorative pillow designs are square and range from 16 inches to 24 inches.
Object utilized to house or display corks, usually wine corks.

An ornamental tablet that is fixed to a wall or other surface in commemoration of a person or event. A sign can feature inspirational quotes, colorful accents or a useful detail, like hooks, a bottle opener or a place to write notes.

A globe is a three-dimensional scale model of the Earth or other round body. Because it is spherical, or ball-shaped, it can represent surface features, directions, and distances more accurately than a flat map.

An alarm clock or alarm is a clock that is designed to alert an individual or group of people at a specified time. The primary function of these clocks is to awaken people from their night's sleep or short naps; they can sometimes be used for other reminders as well.
Dollies are ornamental mats, typically made of paper or fabric, and variously used for protecting surfaces.
A home décor mask is a mask that is used for decoration.

A refrigerator magnet or fridge magnet is a small magnet, often attached to an artistic or whimsical ornament, which may be used to post items such as shopping lists, Christmas cards, child art or reminders on a refrigerator door, or which simply serves as decoration.
Plates used for the purpose of decoration.
Decorative bowl is a bowl used for decoration or storage of random household items. While bowl may be food-grade, it is not advertised to be used for food.
High quality, decorative stones designed for use in the home.
A mirror or looking glass is an object that reflects an image. It is used for viewing oneself.
Piggy bank (sometimes penny bank or money box) is the traditional name of a coin container normally used by children. Money jars are jars designed to house money.

A centerpiece is an important item of a display, usually of a table setting. Centerpieces help set the theme of the decorations and bring extra decorations to the room. A centerpiece also refers to any central or important object in a collection of items.

A figurine or statuette, is a small, three-dimensional sculpture that represents a human, deity or animal, or, in practice, a pair or small group of them. Figurines have been made in many media, with clay, metal, wood, glass, and today plastic or resin the most significant.

Knick-knacks are small objects which people keep as ornaments or toys, rather than for a particular use.
A magazine rack or holder is a piece of furniture designed for holding newspapers, magazines, etc.
A vase is an open container. It can be made from a number of materials, such as ceramics, glass, non-rusting metals, such as aluminum, brass, bronze, or stainless steel.
Decorative pillow insert is a pillow designed to be used with decorative pillow covers and pillow shams.
Container used to hold or carry items and designed for a variety of household and decorative situations.
A tray used for decorative purposes (not intended to be food-safe).
An object used in process or art of decorating or adorning something.
A quilt rack or blanket holder is a stand or display that holds your quilt or blanket in a hanging position. It can be a wall mounted rack, a ladder style rack or a rack that sits on the floor

A music box or musical box is an automatic musical instrument in a box that produces musical notes by using a set of pins placed on a revolving cylinder or disc to pluck the tuned teeth of a steel comb.
A holder for a globe or other circular object, usually decorative.
A pouf is a backless cushioned footstool or low seat with no back or sides. Differ from ottomans in that they sit flat on the ground (no legs).
Bottles used for the purpose of decoration.
High quality colored or patterned decorative balls designed for use in the home.
Boxes used for decoration.
The bookend is an object tall, sturdy, and heavy enough, when placed at either end of a row of upright books, to support or buttress them.
A hot dog machine is an appliance that cooks multiple hot dogs by applying even heat to produce a fully heated, ready-to-eat hot dog.
A classifier for items in “Small Kitchen Appliances” that does not have a dedicated PT.
An electric egg cooker is a small countertop appliance that allows you to cook eggs in a multitude of ways, including hard-boiled for salads or deviled eggs, poached for eggs benedict, or scrambled.
An electric crepe maker is a cooking device used to make crepes, galettes, pancakes, blinis or tortillas.
A cupcake maker is a small appliance that makes cupcakes and other small baked items.
A doughnut maker is a small electric appliance that makes doughnuts.

A bread maker is a home appliance for turning raw ingredients into baked bread. It consists of a bread pan (or "tin"), at the bottom of which are one or more built-in paddles, mounted in the center of a small special-purpose oven.

Small electric appliance that features two metal grill surfaces that can be pressed onto a sandwich top and bottom simultaneously. Also included are panini (a sandwich made with Italian bread, usually toasted) makers.

A electric waffle maker or waffle iron is a kitchen utensil used to cook waffles between two hinged metal plates. Both plates have gridded indentations to shape the waffle from the batter or dough placed between them. The plates are heated and the iron is closed while the waffle bakes.
A cake pop maker is a small appliance that makes cake pops and doughnut holes.
A pizza maker is a small appliance designed to cook a pizza in an oven or electric cooker.
A quesadilla maker is a small appliance, similar to an electric grill or griddle, but is specifically designed for quesadillas. It usually has a round shape with marks for easier cutting.

An electric rice cooker is an automated kitchen appliance designed to boil or steam rice. It consists of a heat source, a cooking bowl, and a thermostat. The thermostat measures the temperature of the cooking bowl and controls the heat.
Large oven appliance specifically designed to cook pizza.
Apparatus or appliance for deep-frying a whole turkey in oil.  This item often comes in a kit and is available for use in outdoor or indoor settings.
Regulator to control the amount of pressure that can be built up in the canner
Kits include everything that  need for canning and all the specialty tools included.
Accessories for use with a food processor.
The lid of a canning jar and and ring that goes around the lid.
Collections of canning equipment and supplies.
Tools used in the canning process.
A glass jar with an airtight screw top used for preserving fruit and vegetables.
A classifier for items in “Canning Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Gelatinous substance used as a fuel.
Fireplace unit designed for outdoor spaces and patios.
Devices designed to be placed on the hearth to help keep logs from rolling out onto the floor.
Bellows are handy fireplace tools that allow you to blow gusts of air into the fire to reignite the flames if they begin to go out.

Fireplace tools contain items like: 
Fireplace tongs - Used to add firewood to a burning fire or move burning logs to control the fire.
Fireplace poker - Used to shift wood so that more oxygen reaches the fire and the fire burns better. 
Fireplace shovel - Used to control the ash layer in the fireplace.
Fireplace brush - Used to sweep the ashes blown out of the fireplace back into the fireplace.
These can be sold individually or in sets.
A device (typically made of canvas fabric) that allows you to easily carry multiple pieces of firewood from location to another.
A Fireplace Screens is a form of furniture that acted as a shield between the occupants of a room and the fireplace.
In general, this product is wood-based, firewood packs bundled together for use in a fireplace or outdoor fire ring.
Fireplace doors put a barrier between the fire and your home. They also keep embers and crackling logs safely in the firebox.
Flammable material used to help start a fire.
The fireplace insert is a device that can be inserted into an existing masonry or prefabricated wood fireplace.
Fireplace designed to be installed in a wall.
Fireplace Back Plate is plate sized in proportion to fireplaces and are placed against the wall at the back of the fireplace.
A heating appliance that doubles as a stove.
A firelog is a manufactured log constructed to be used as wood fuel. Firelogs are designed to be inexpensive, while being easier to ignite, and burn longer, and more efficiently than firewood.
The cast iron, or metal, stand that your fire wood sits on.

A match is a tool for starting a fire. Typically, matches are made of small wooden sticks or stiff paper. One end is coated with a material that can be ignited by friction generated by striking the match against a suitable surface.

A fireplace mantel or mantelpiece, also known as a chimneypiece, originated in medieval times as a hood that projected over a fire grate to catch the smoke. The term has evolved to include the decorative framework around the fireplace, and can include elaborate designs extending to the ceiling.
A device that blocks the movement of air up or down your chimney to help prevent cold drafts.
Electrically powered imitation logs designed to resemble actual fireplace logs.
A classifier for items in “Fireplace Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A fireplace andiron or firedog, fire-dog or fire dog is a bracket support, normally found in pairs, on which logs are laid for burning in an open fireplace, so that air may circulate under the firewood, allowing better burning and less smoke.
Imitation logs that can be inserted into a gas-powered fireplace.
A device used to hold split firewood in a tidy pile so air can circulate around, keeping it dry.

A fan mounted on the exterior of the fireplace or inside the unit but outside the firebox itself. It is used to circulate air around the unit's hot exterior before pushing it back into the room. Fireplace fans help to circulate warm air and increase heat penetration into the room.
A frying pan, frypan, or skillet is a flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and browning foods.
Lid for a pot or pan.

Egg/pancake rings are ring-shaped molds made to be placed on a pan. Eggs/pancake batter are dropped into the molds and allowed to cook for a few minutes, then the rings are lifted off, and voila—a perfectly round egg/pancake.
Toaster Oven Broilers or Broiler Sets are a piece of cookware that is used to broil foods in the oven such as steaks, roasts, or various cuts of meat, poultry and vegetables

A Dutch oven or casserole dish is a thick-walled cooking pot with a tight-fitting lid. Dutch ovens are usually made of seasoned cast iron; however, some Dutch ovens are instead made of cast aluminium, or ceramic. Some metal varieties are enameled rather than being seasoned, and these are sometimes called French ovens.
Stovetop Waffle Irons are designed to be put directly on your stovetop, and they usually work on gas and electric cooktops, as well as camping stoves or open fires.
A boiling pot is a large stockpot intended for boiling water for seafood and other foods.
Large pot sold with with multiple insert items including a large strainer pot and smaller steaming basket.
Handles for a pot or pan.

A double boiler is a type of cookware that uses steam as a heat source to melt or cook food. They are made up of two pieces, a large pot that is filled with hot or boiling water and a smaller pot that fits inside to trap the steam from below.
Heavy metal press used on a grill to distribute heat evenly by flattening meat and sandwiches as they cook.
A braiser is like a cross between a Dutch oven and a skillet. It is often made from enameled cast iron, has a wide base and sloped sides, a lid, and two handles for easy transport.
A cooking utensil that is traditionally a cast iron, short walled pan that is used to prepare searing hot ingredients such as meat, seafood, fish, and vegetables for making fajitas or quesadillas.
A classifier for items in “Cookware” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A set of cookware that comes with an assortment of pieces. Common pieces included are frying pans, sauté pans, saucepans, stock pots.
A butter warmer is a small cooking vessel used specifically for warming or melting butter.
In its simplest form, a fondue pot is a vessel that sits atop a direct heat source — either a heating element (the kind you would plug in) or an open flame (like a tealight or a fuel burner).
Kitchen device that presses ground meat into a patty-shaped mold.
A tagine is an earthenware pot with a flat base and conical lid, long used in north African cooking

Steamer baskets are used to hold food (often ingredients like vegetables, fish, frozen dumplings, etc.) just above simmering water, allowing it to cook quickly and gently in the steam that builds up in a covered pot.

A chafing dish is a metal cooking or serving pan on a stand with an alcohol burner holding chafing fuel below it. It is used for cooking at table, notably in Gueridon service, or as a food warmer for keeping dishes at a buffet warm.

Stockpot is a generic name for one of the most common types of cooking pot used worldwide. A stockpot is traditionally used to make stock or broth, which can be the basis for cooking more complex recipes.
A cooking pot that have a crank in the lid that stirs the kernels in the pot, moving them around to prevent burning, distribute the oil evenly, and help the majority of pieces pop.
A large cooking vessel used for cooking fish.

A roasting pan is a piece of cookware used for roasting meat in an oven, either with or without vegetables or other ingredients. A roasting pan may be used with a rack that sits inside the pan and lets the meat sit above the fat and juice drippings.

A roasting rack is a formed metal rack that is placed in the bottom of a roasting pan in order to keep foods raised above the bottom of the pan.
A saucepan is a deep cooking pan with a long handle that is often sold with a lid.
A griddle is a flat skillet or pan used in cooking.  A grill pan is a skillet with raised ridges across its cooking surface.
A wok is a deep round-bottomed cooking pot.

A stovetop kettle performs the same function as an electric kettle. Instead of having a heating element, they derive their heat source for making hot water from a gas or electric stove, or, if you so wish, a camp fire. They are flat-bottomed with heat-resistant handles which are usually on top of the appliance. Quite often, they come with a steam whistle which goes off when your hot water has reached boiling point.
A wok ring is a metal circle that fits over the gas burners on a cooktop. It helps support the round bottom of the wok and keeps it steady while cooking.
An egg poacher is actually a tool used for coddling eggs in a dish set in a water bath.
Tools used for dipping food into a sauce or other topping.
Fondue forks are used to cook/dip the food (meat, cheese, fruit, etc.) in the fondue pot.

A cream whipper is a steel cylinder or cartridge filled with nitrous oxide that is used as a whipping agent in a whipped cream dispenser. The narrow end of a charger has a foil covering that is broken to release the gas. This is usually done by a sharp pin inside the whipped cream dispenser.
Crepe spreaders are designed with long handles that prevent your hands from getting burned on the hot cooking surface and wide blades that help to spread the batter thinly
A salt block is a slab of pure, most frequently pink Himalayan salt designed for cooking and serving food that adds additional flavors.

A splatter screen also known as a splatter guard is a device placed over a frying pan to prevent hot oil from spitting out of the pan, which often happens when pan frying at a high temperature. This has two main purposes: droplets of hot oil can cause dangerous burns if they land on the skin, and, if they land elsewhere, can cause stains.
Sets of hand held tools used for food preparation.
A big syringe that allows you to inject your marinade throughout the tissue of your meat, from the inside out.
A board with raised lines used to texture gnocchi with the classic ridged shape that helps the sauces stick better to the pasta. Typically made of wood or plastic.

A measuring cup is a kitchen utensil used primarily to measure the volume of liquid or bulk solid cooking ingredients such as flour and sugar, especially for volumes from about 50 mL upwards. Measuring cups are also used to measure washing powder, liquid detergents and bleach for clothes washing.
Sausage casing encloses the filling of a sausage. Can be artificial casings, typically made of collagen and cellulose, or natural, usually made from animal intestines or skin.

A wok brush is a type of kitchenware that is used to clean a wok. It is made of a bundle of split bamboo stalks tied at the top. It is used with the wok still hot and with hot water or water added to a heated wok to clean without degreaser so the wok does not rust.
A tool used to verify that food has reached a safe minimum internal temperature, and consequently, prevent foodborne illness.

A utensil used when preparing and serving various types of strand, ribbon or noodle pasta. The fork is spoon-shaped with upward pointing pieces, either dowel-like or prong-shaped, separated around or on the fork and lifter tool.

They were originally made from wood and used in combination with a traditional Japanese “Hangiri” which is a wood rice bowl used for serving freshly made rice. Rice paddles are also commonly used for mixing vinegar with rice for making sushi.
Serving sets or utensils designed for seafood. Generally are shell crackers, small forks and special knives.
Long, sharpened rods (usually made of steel or bamboo) that can be used to hold pieces of food together. They're often used to cook meat and/or vegetables on a grill, over a fire, or above hot coals.
Device to spritz oil while preparing food.
Goggles aimed to create a comfortable foam seal around your eyes and nose to block potent onion fumes from making your eyes water.
A classifier for items in “Cooking Utensils & Gadgets” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Sausage stuffer tube is a funnel or attachment that connects a sausage casing to the meat grinder.
A mat woven from bamboo and cotton string that is used in food preparation. Makisu are most commonly used to make a kind of rolled sushi called makizushi.
Instruments used to measure temperature of an oven.

A measuring spoon is a spoon used to measure an amount of an ingredient, either liquid or dry, when cooking. Measuring spoons may be made of plastic, metal, and other materials. They are available in many sizes, including the teaspoon and tablespoon.

A spoon rest is a piece of kitchenware that serves as a place to lay spoons and other cooking utensils, to prevent cooking fluids from getting onto countertops, as well as keeping the spoon from touching any contaminants that might be on the counter.
Grilling tools and utensils sold as a bundled set of items.
Sausage stuffer and stuffing kit is a gadget used to stuff sausage meat into casings in order to make homemade sausages.
Tool used to remove the dark-colored membrane you see along the outermost curvature of the shrimp.
A steel cartridge filled with nitrous oxide (N2O).

A kitchen utensil that is used to pour liquids and small-grained ingredients from one source into another. Funnels have large open tops that slope down and decrease in size forming a small diameter outlet.

A tea infuser is a device in which loose, dried tea leaves are placed for steeping or brewing, in a mug or a teapot full of hot water; it is often called a teaball or tea maker, and sometimes a tea egg.
A plunger-looking device that's used to lightly pack or "tamp" the coffee grounds into the espresso machine's portafilter.
Device to steam milk and or froths it by forcefully spinning the milk with a coiled whisk or by pushing steam through it creating bubbles and giving it a creamy mouthfeel.
Combination of coffee and espresso maker.
The lid that allows coffee to drip into it while it is being brewed into a carafe.

You use a teabag coaster, also known as a tea bag buddy, when making a cup of tea. The idea behind these tea accessories is to keep the tabletop and/or tablecloth clean. Rather than just putting your teabag on the benchtop, making a mess of your kitchen, or using a clean dinner plate, you can use a small teabag coaster to hold your used teabag.

An air press coffee maker is a cylindrical chamber, airtight silicone seals, and with a plunger that is used to push coffee through the airtight chamber and into the cup to create hot coffees and cold brew coffees.
Machine that prepares only enough coffee for a single portion.

The drip coffee machine will heat the water to boiling or near-boiling, and the steam will rise through a tube system until it reaches a drip area where it is dispersed. The heated water evenly flows through the grounds and filter then into the waiting coffee pot.

A teapot is a vessel used for steeping tea leaves or a herbal mix in boiling or near-boiling water, and for serving the resulting infusion which is called tea. It is one of the core components of teaware.
Large containers generally used for making large quantities of coffee & tea.

A vacuum coffee maker operates as a siphon, where heating and cooling the lower vessel changes the vapor pressure of water in the lower, first pushing the water up into the upper vessel, then allowing the water to fall back down into the lower vessel. ... The prepared coffee is then poured off from the top.
Object used to backflush and clean an espresso machine.

A coffee French press, also known as a cafetière, cafetière à piston, caffettiera a stantuffo, press pot, coffee press, or coffee plunger, is a coffee brewing device. The modern French press consists of a narrow cylindrical beaker, usually made of glass or clear plastic, equipped with a metal or plastic lid and plunger that fits tightly in the cylinder and has a fine stainless steel wire or nylon mesh filter.
An espresso machine brews coffee by forcing pressurized water near boiling point through a "puck" of ground coffee and a filter in order to produce a thick, concentrated coffee called espresso.
A teapot warmer is used for keeping the tea warm in a teapot. The teapot is placed on the tea warmer. Teapot usually has a candle inside to lit for keeping the tea warm.
Receptacle used to store tea.
Small kitchen machine or appliance for grinding roasted coffee beans.
A bowl and a whisk used to prepare Matcha tea.
A coffee decanter is a vessel with a wide, flat bottom and a spout at one end, used to prepare and serve coffee.

Strainers usually fit into the top of the cup to catch the leaves as the tea is poured. Some deeper tea strainers can also be used to brew single cups of tea, much as teabags or brewing baskets are used – the strainer full of leaves is set in a cup to brew the tea.
Replacement parts for a coffee or espresso machine.
A device with perforations used to infuse tea in a cup of boiling water
A coffee filter is a filter used for various coffee brewing methods including but not limited to drip coffee filtering. Filters made of paper, cloth, or plastic, metal or porcelain are used.

A tea cozy or tea warmer is a cover for a teapot, traditionally made of cloth. It insulates a teapot, keeping the contents warm. Their use predates the invention of vacuum flasks as a means of keeping hot liquids hot.
Device that holds ground coffee where hot water is poured over to make coffee.

A coffee percolator is a type of pot used for the brewing of coffee by continually cycling the boiling or nearly boiling brew through the grounds using gravity until the required strength is reached. It consists of a pot with a chamber at the bottom where water is heated from a heat source.
Machines used to make iced tea.
It defines a coffee maker that brews coffee by passing boiling water pressurized by steam through ground coffee.
Cleaning products specifically designed for coffee makers.

productType.productTypeName: Stovetop Espresso Pot Replacement Gaskets & Filters
productType.description: Replacement Gaskets & Filters for Stovetop Espresso Pot

Meant to prepare Turkish Coffee which is a typical drip coffee: Turkish coffee is actually cooked with sugar rather than adding the sweetener later. Also, the coffee is served in small cups and sits for a few moments before serving, to allow the grounds to sink to the bottom of the cup and settle.
The replacement filter screen mesh for French press coffee devices.
Basket shaped filter that holds the coffee grounds when preparing espresso.

A washing machine is a home appliance used to wash laundry. The term is mostly applied to machines that use water as opposed to dry cleaning or ultrasonic cleaners. The user adds laundry detergent, which is sold in liquid, powder, or dehydrated sheet form, to the wash water.

A machine that is designed to clean floor surfaces. Primarily for hard surfaces like tile, wood, and linoleum. Specific cleaning method varies and can include scrubbing and mopping. Examples include robotic moppers, and combination scrubber/polishers. Not to include vacuum cleaners.
Vacuums meant for commercial / industrial use; not a conventional home appliance.
Washing machine and a dryer - two separate laundry cleaning machines that are sold together as a set.

Machines designed to polish/wax/buff hard surface floors. Typically these floor care machines have horizontally rotating head which attaches to a large, round pads. that produce a glossy finish to the surface of hard floors. These polishing machines include polishers, buffers, and burnishers. There is a difference between a polisher and burnisher. Burnisher motor is higher rev, uses different products, used for high traffic areas (malls and grocery stores vs offices)
Dishwashers designed for a commercial use; not a conventional home appliance.
A clothes iron is a small appliance that, when heated, is used to press clothes to remove wrinkles.
A vacuum cleaner is a device that causes suction in order to remove debris from floors, upholstery, draperies, and other surfaces. It is generally electrically driven.
Heavy duty washers and dryers designed for commercial use; not a conventional home appliance.

These machines are able to roam freely around the home, sucking up any small mess in its way. They are typically cordless, round, and low to the ground. These characteristics allow them to reach places that larger vacuums can't. Most common function is that of a vacuum, but robotic machines have more cleaning modes like scrubbing and mopping.
A carpet sweeper is a mechanical device for the cleaning of carpets. They were popular before the introduction of the vacuum cleaner and have been largely superseded by them.
The towel warmer is a bathroom heater suitable for both drying and heating towels and the environment.

A garment steamer or clothes steamer or simply a steamer, is a device used for quickly removing wrinkles from garments and fabrics with the use of high temperature steam. They can for example be used to straighten wrinkles on shirts by releasing tension in the fabric so that it straightens itself.

A steam mop uses steam to clean floors. Unlike a regular mop, which requires cleaning agents such as bleach or detergent, a steam mop uses heat from steam to disinfect the floors. A microfiber pad is often placed right underneath the steam jet to trap dirt.

A clothes dryer, also known as tumble dryer or simply dryer, is a powered household appliance that is used to remove moisture from a load of clothing, bedding and other textiles, usually shortly after they are washed in a washing machine. For residential use.
A washer-dryer combo is a washer and dryer combined in a single washer-sized unit, containing a washer as well as a condenser dryer.
Steam cleaner is a powerful cleaning machine that can eliminate dust mites, germs, mold, and fungus that can be used to clean a variety of surfaces; not to confuse with steam mops.
A dishwasher is a machine that is used to clean dishware, cookware, and cutlery automatically.
A candle snuffer, candle extinguisher, or douter is an instrument used to extinguish burning candles, consisting of a small cone at the end of a handle.

A candle wick is usually a braided cotton that holds the flame of an oil lamp or candle. A candle wick works by capillary action, conveying the fuel to the flame. When the liquid fuel, typically melted candle wax, reaches the flame it then vaporizes and combusts. The candle wick influences how the candle burns.
A classifier for items in “Candle Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A candle holder is a small device using a cup or spike to hold a candle in place.
A wick trimmer is a device (similar to scissors) used to trim down the wicks of candles.
A small device using a cup or spike to hold a candle in place. This PT is intended for candle holders designed for use in outdoor settings.
Lamp oil generally refers to liquid paraffin. It's in the same chemical family as kerosene but has been purified to make it burn more cleanly.

A candle shade is a fixture or cover that is positioned over a candle's flame to protect it. It enhances the light from a candle while minimizing the glare.
A candle cover or topper is typically a metal “lid” that sits on top of jar candles while they burn.
A large container, typically earthenware, glass, or plastic, with a handle and a lip, used for holding and pouring liquids.
Bundled set of products related to serving coffee or tea.  Set items may include drinkware, saucers, trays, tea bags, and other accessories.
A Mason drinking jar is a molded glass jar with a handle used for drinking purposes.
A martini glass is a long stemmed glass with an inverted cone bowl. In contrast to typical cocktail glasses, martini glasses generally have larger, wider bowls which are fully conical at the bottom.

A decanter is a vessel that is used to hold the decantation of a liquid which may contain sediment. Decanters, which have a varied shape and design, have been traditionally made from glass or crystal. Their volume is usually equivalent to one standard bottle of wine.
Bundled set of products related to general cups and saucers.  Set items may include drinkware, spoons, cup holders, and other accessories.

Barware sets include various items and tools used in preparing and serving alcoholic beverages (e.g., shakers, jiggers, strainers, muddlers, utensils, etc.). This is usually not inclusive of glassware.
Cup for drinking tea, generally of smaller size and often made of ceramic.

Glasses comprised of the drinking vessels made of glass designed or commonly used for drinking beer. Different styles of glassware exist for a number of reasons: they may reflect national traditions; legislation regarding serving measures; practicalities of stacking, washing and avoiding breakage; promotion of commercial breweries; folk art, novelty items or use in drinking games; or complementing different styles of beer for a variety of reasons, including enhancing aromatic volatiles, showcasing the appearance, and having an effect on the beer head. Several kinds of beer glassware have a stem which serves to prevent the body heat of the drinker's hand from warming the beer.
A vessel intended to contain beverages or liquid foods for drinking or consumption.
The margarita glass is slightly larger than a cocktail glass and has a broad-rim for holding salt. It is also used in daiquiris and other fruit drinks.
Sets that include mixed drinkware of various sizes and/or shapes and NOT of identical pieces.
Jug or pitcher shaped beverage dispenser / container usually made of glass designed for serving drinks like water or wine.
Punch bowl set is a bowl with ladle to dispense punch.
A cup lid is a cover that goes on top of a cup.
A drink stirrer (also known as a cocktail stirrer, swizzle stick or stirstick) is a long stick usually made from plastic or glass and is served with a cocktail.

A shot glass is a glass originally designed to hold or measure spirits or liquor, which is either imbibed straight from the glass or poured into a cocktail. An alcoholic beverage served in a shot glass and typically consumed quickly, in one gulp, may also be known as a "shooter" or “shot”.
General type of drinkware designed for containing beverages and typically used for drinking hot drinks, such as coffee, hot chocolate, or tea.
A flat-bottomed beverage container usually made of plastic or glass with straight sides and no handle or stem.
Type of glass stemware that is used to drink and taste wine generally composed of three parts: the bowl, stem, and foot.

A champagne glass is stemware designed for champagne and other sparkling wines. The two most common forms are the flute and coupe, both stemmed; holding the glass by the stem prevents warming the drink.
Typically used for drinking hot beverages, a travel mug has a cover with an opening for sipping as well as other features that accommodate portability.
Signature copper mug used to serve Moscow mules.
Small cup designed for drinking individual servings of espresso.  Sold without a saucer.

A beverage warmer typically used to maintain the temperature of hot beverages, such as coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. Available in various forms, shapes, and functions, beverage warmers carry a warmer plate that is designed to handle a cup/mug.
Small countertop appliance designed to distill water.
A frozen drink maker is a machines used to make frozen drinks.

An electric kettle is an electrical appliance, that has a self-contained heating unit, for heating water, and automatically switches off when the water reaches boiling point or at a preset temperature below 100 °C.

An electric juicer will extract the juice from fruits and vegetables, separating them from the pulp by crushing, grinding or squeezing the liquid out, leaving behind just the thin juice without any of the fiber.
A milkshake maker or milkshake machine or drink mixer is a kind of countertop electric mixer used to make milkshakes, flavored milk, frappés, and other blended beverages.
A chocolate fountain is a device for serving chocolate fondue. Typical examples resemble a stepped cone, standing 2–4 feet tall with a crown at the top and stacked tiers over a basin at the bottom.

A blender is a kitchen and laboratory appliance used to mix, crush, purée or emulsify food and other substances. A stationary blender consists of a blender container with a rotating metal or plastic blade at the bottom, powered by an electric motor that is in the base.
A classifier for items in “Bar Tools” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A tray, sometimes with a slotted cover, designed to catch drips, as under a beer tap.

A corkscrew is a tool for drawing corks from wine bottles and other household bottles that may be sealed with corks. In its traditional form, a corkscrew simply consists of a pointed metallic helix attached to a handle, which the user screws into the cork and pulls to extract it.
Machines that are used to separate the fruit from the stems and then to split open the fruit in order to get at the sugary juice inside that is going to be fermented.
A tool to remove the protective foil around the top of wine bottles,
Cocktail picks or garnish picks are a vital accessory to the final presentation of any cocktail. They are ideal for spearing fruits such as limes, lemons, cherries or any other garnish.

A bottle stopper is a small accessory used to close a wine or beer bottle after it has been opened. A bottle stopper can seal a bottle before refrigeration, which helps preserve an opened bottle of wine.
A muddler is a bartender's tool, used like a pestle to mash—or muddle—fruits, herbs and spices in the bottom of a glass to release their flavor.

A wine rack is a set of shelves for the organized storage of wine. Wine racks can be built out of a number of different materials. The size of the rack and the number of bottles it can hold can vary widely.
A utensil that pumps out excess oxygen remaining in an opened bottle of wine in order to preserve the flavor of the wine for a longer length of time.
Cocktail chilling stones are small stones that you store in the freezer and add to your drink to cool it while not diluting it.
A cocktail shaker is a device used to mix beverages by shaking. When ice is put in the shaker, this allows for a quicker cooling of the drink before serving.

The purpose of a wine aerator is to force wine to interact with air to accelerate oxidation and evaporation. It does this by sending the wine through a funnel of pressurized oxygen.
A wine pourer is simply a device that aids in the wine pouring process.

This handy rubber cap fits right over the opening of any domestic or European beer faucet to keep the faucet covered when not in use. Also referred to as a keg tap nipple, or a draft faucet. The beer Tap Cap Brush helps remove residue build up inside the tap and helps to prevent bacteria build up.

A glass rimmer is a bar accessory used to apply salt or sugar to the rim of a glass. It usually consists of one or more shallow plastic or metal discs that the glass is turned upside down into. The discs can be filled with either the rimming salt or sugar, or sometimes something to moisten the rim of the glass such as lime juice.
A tag used to keeping physical track of bottles stored in open-rack storage

Consists of concentrated wine-grape juice and various additive packets used to steer the wine through to completion. In general, a wine kit includes all of the consumables needed to make the wine but does not include any of the winemaking equipment.

A cocktail strainer is a metal bar accessory used to remove ice from a mixed drink as it is poured into the serving glass. A type of sieve, the strainer is placed over the mouth of the glass or shaker in which the beverage was prepared; small holes in the device allow only liquids to pass as the beverage is poured.
A jigger is a hourglass-shaped measuring device.
A device used to extract juice from crushed fruit during wine making process.
Bags, backpacks or totes specifically designed to carry wine.
A vacuum pump removes any air inside the wine when you open it. This tool comes with a reusable rubber stopper that re-seals the bottle after usage.
A swizzle stick is a small stick used to stir drinks.
Instruments used to measure temperature of wine.

A wine stopper is a device used to seal a bottle of wine after it has been opened, helping to preserve its freshness and prevent oxidation.
Wine corks are a stopper used to seal wine bottles.

Beer Tap Handles is an attachment that connects to a tap faucet and is pulled to open or close the faucet. While tap handle is the most common term for the attachment it may also be called a pull, knob, ball, or it may be abbreviated to just a handle or tap.

A hollow cylindrical container that is longer than it is wide and has a rounded, bulging middle. Wine barrels are made of wooden “staves” that are bound by wood or metal hoops and made for storing wine.
A wineskin is a bag that is made from the skin of an animal (such as a goat) and that is used for holding wine.

A towel is a piece of absorbent cloth or paper used for drying or wiping a surface. Towels draw moisture through direct contact. In households, several types of towels are used, such as hand towels and bath towels.

Washcloths are small bath linens that are primarily used to wash the face and/or body.
Toilet Seat Covers can either be a decorative object that slips over a toilet seat, or a disposable cover that is used to create a sanitary barrier between the toilet and user.
Pump is used on containers of soap or lotion to help dispensing.
Plastic or rubber mat placed inside a shower or bathtub floor that helps prevent your feet from slipping when wet. This is **NOT** the absorbent bath rug that belongs *OUTSIDE* the bathtub or shower.
Bundled variety pack sets of generally non-consumable products like loofahs, wash cloths, and pumice stones.
A bathroom tumbler, or bathroom cup, is an accessory often used for drinking water after brushing teeth.
A container or rack in a bathroom where toothbrushes are kept when not in use.

Bathtub splash guards are typically made from plastic and function as a dam to prevent water from escaping the bathtub and pooling on the floor. These devices are installed to fill the intersecting void between the top ledge of the bathtub and the perpendicular wall.
Bathroom canisters and sets are containers that are used to organize items on a bathroom countertop.
A classifier for items in “Bathroom Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Clips, rings, or hooks used to hang a shower curtain and/or liner from the shower curtain rod.

A bathroom linen & accessory set is a set of items used in the bathroom such as towels, linens, rugs, mats, trash bin, canisters, tumblers, shower curtains, soap & lotion dispenser, toothbrush dispenser, etc.
A classifier for items in “Toilet Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Bathroom butler is a racks, stands, or organizers that hold towels and bathroom accessories.
Designed to protect your tissue boxes while at the same time providing a decorative element.
A rod that extends from wall to wall used to hang shower curtains and/or liners.
Adhesive decal that attaches to a shower or bathtub floor and helps prevent your feet from slipping when wet.
Toilet Lid & Tank Covers are decorative objects that slip over a toilet tank or lid.
Used for preventing water and moisture from leaving the bath or shower area and adding privacy while showering.

A toilet-roll holder, also known as a toilet paper dispenser, is an item that holds a roll of toilet paper. Common models include a hinged length of wire mounted horizontally on a wall, a thicker axle either recessed into a wall or mounted on a frame, or a freestanding vertical pole on a base.
Bath pillows are small pillows that provide head and neck support for people using bathtubs or therapeutic whirlpools.
Items used to hold spare rolls of toilet paper. Not to be confused with toilet paper holder which are meant to hold the active roll of toilet paper.
A soap & lotion dispenser is a container which is designed to release a specific amount of its content, usually liquid soap, cream or lotion.

A soap dish is a shallow, open container or platform where a bar of soap may be placed to dry after use. Soap dishes are usually located in or near a sink, shower, or bathtub. Most soap dishes are made from waterproof materials such as plastic, ceramic, metal, or glass, though some are made from bamboo.

A rolling pin is a cylindrical food preparation utensil used to shape and flatten dough. Two styles of roller pin are found: rollers and rods. Roller types consists of a thick cylinder with small handles at each end; rod type rolling pins are usually thin tapered batons.
A pie crust shield is a thin silicone or metal rings are placed around the edges of the pie without covering the center. This allows the center to cook evenly while heat is deflected from the crust.
A classifier for items in “Baked Goods Decorating Tools” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A pie iron—also called pudgy pie iron, sandwich toaster, snackwicher, toastie maker or jaffle iron—is a cooking appliance that consists of two hinged concave, round or square, cast iron or aluminium plates on long handles.
A classifier for items in “Baking Tools & Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Cake pans can be round, square, or rectangular and are available in several sizes. Probably the most popular is the 9 x 13 x 2 inch rectangular cake pan that is used to bake cakes, bars, and savory dishes, such as lasagna.

A cake board or cake circle is a thick piece of material designed to support cakes (or cupcakes) to improve your presentation and make transportation easier.
A cake circle is a round cake board that is typically thin in construction, about 1/8”.
A bakeware set is a set containing varying pieces of bakeware (cookie sheet, muffin pan, loaf pan, etc.).
A ramekin, also known as a soufflé dish, is a small bakeware vessel often used for preparing and serving individual portions.

A baking dish is typically a square, rectangular, or oval cooking vessel made of a material that distributes heat evenly–like glass, porcelain, or ceramic.
A casserole is a kind of large, deep pan or bowl used for cooking a variety of dishes in the oven; it is also a category of foods cooked in such a vessel. To distinguish the two uses, the pan can be called a "casserole dish" or "casserole pan," whereas the food is simply "a casserole."

A baking stone is a portable cooking surface used in baking. It may be made of ceramic, stone or, more recently, salt. Food is put on the stone, which is then placed in an oven, though sometimes the stone is heated first.

Pizza pans are typically round pans that allows pizza makers to bake, slice, and serve pizza on the same pan.

A sheet pan, also referred to as baking tray, baking sheet, or baking pan, is a flat, rectangular metal pan placed in an oven and used for baking pastries such as bread rolls, cookies, sheet cakes, Swiss rolls, and pizzas. These pans, like all bakeware, can be made of a variety of materials.

Icing smoothers are tools used to go around the sides of your cake to quickly and easily smooth out your icing.

A frosting spatula or palette knife is a kitchen utensil designed especially for the use of spreading a substance onto a flat surface, such as frosting on a cake.

A baking sifter is a kitchen device that looks like a cup with a handle and a mesh strainer on the bottom. Some sifters have mechanical blades that help push the flour through the mesh, while others don't.
An object in which cotton candy is put upon and is utilized as handle.

A naking stencil is a thin sheet of plastic, metal or stiff paper that has cutout patterns or letters. These templates are used to produce designs on cakes, cupcakes, and other baked goods. The stencil is placed on the cake and colored icing, colored sugars, cocoa, confectioners' sugar or other decorative items are applied on top on the stencil.
A collection of items utilized for making cupcakes.
A cookie press is a device for making pressed cookies. It consists of a cylinder with a plunger on one end, which is used to extrude cookie dough through a small hole at the other end.

A cake box is a type of packaging made for cakes. However, these boxes can also be used for storing other baked goods such as cupcakes and muffins. While in transit from the bakery to the consumer, the said items protect various bakery goods.

A cake stand is a type of tableware used for serving cake and other pastries, or a type of kitchen equipment used for holding cakes while they are decorated. The most common form is a plate on a pedestal; sometimes there are multiple plates in a tower.
Cupcake corer creates a perfect hole in the center of a baked cupcake for filling with icing.
A container used in various techniques of food preparation to shape the finished dish into a specific shape.
Dough and empanada presses are presses that mold dough into a specific shape and allow for the creation of dumplings or dough filled with other food material.
A mixing bowl is a deep bowl that is particularly well suited for mixing ingredients together in. These come in many materials, such as stainless steel, ceramic, glass, and plastic.

A pastry bag is an often cone- or triangular-shaped bag that is squeezed by hand to pipe semi-solid foods by pressing them through a narrow opening at one end often fitted with a shaped nozzle, for many purposes including in particular cake decoration and icing.
Handles to lollipop and other candy or  treats.

A kitchen utensil that is used for placing cooked foods onto a surface that will enable the food to be cooled on all sides after being baked, either food still in a hot pan or food removed from a baking sheet or pan and placed directly onto the rack.

A muffin or cupcake tray is a mold in which muffins or cupcakes are baked. A single cup within a regular muffin tin is 100 millilitres and most often has room for 12 muffins, although tins holding 6, 8, 11, 24, and 35 muffins do exist.

A mold, or mould, is a container used in various techniques of food preparation to shape the finished dish.

A cake turntable is like a lazy Susan, but with a stand that is elevated above the base. After baking a cake, put it onto a cake turntable, and you can spin the cake in order to get at it from any angle without actually walking around the cake yourself.
Cake toppers are small figurines or decorations that are placed on top of cakes.

Cupcake liners are small, disposable cups made of paper that are designed to hold baked goods like muffins, cupcakes, and mini cakes. They come in various sizes and are often used to create uniform shapes and sizes for baked goods.

Cupcake liners are also known as baking cups or muffin cups.

A pie pan or pie plate, as it is sometimes called, is a round baking dish with shallow, outwardly-slanted sides about 1 inch to 1 ½ inch deep. They are available in a variety of sizes, but the most common sizes are 8-inch, 9-inch, and 10-inches in diameter. Pie pans are usually made of, Glass. Aluminum.
A tart pan is a curved, rectangular, or oblong shallow pan with either smooth or fluted sides which are generally available built of stainless steel, nonstick alloy, elastic silicone, glass, or ceramic. There are two sorts of tart pan features comprising removable bottoms and mended bottoms.
The dough docker is a food preparation utensil used to uniformly pierce the dough of cracker, pizza, pie or pastry dough to prevent over rising or blistering and also to aerate the dough.

A cookie cutter is a tool to cut out cookie/biscuit dough in a particular shape.

Cookie stamps are small, engraved plates typically made from metal, acrylic, wood, or silicone, and they generally come in festive designs—think geometric patterns, snowflakes, dinosaurs, pumpkins, and more—that you simply press into your favorite unleavened cookie.

A bread pan, also called a loaf pan, is a kitchen utensil in the form of a container in which bread is baked. Its function is to shape bread while it is rising during baking. The most common shape of the bread pan is the loaf, or narrow rectangle, a convenient form that enables uniform slicing.

Baking cups are small, disposable cups made of paper, silicone, or aluminum that are designed to hold baked goods like muffins, cupcakes, and mini cakes. They come in various sizes and are often used to create uniform shapes and sizes for baked goods.

Baking cups are also known as muffin cups or cupcake liners.

A baking mat is designed to create an even, nonstick surface on standard baking sheets, silicone baking mats come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and colors. The mat goes on a baking sheet and bake like usual without having to worry that the cookies will stick to the pan or have burnt bottoms.
Icing decorating tips & sets are the nozzles on the end of a pastry bag that the frosting or filling is forced through to apply it to cakes, cookies, or pastries.
Artificial (fake) plants are generally made of plastic or fabric and  are intended to resemble living plants.  These items often include a vase or hanging pot.
Shaped and sculpted artificial trees (topiary) that appear living, but require no maintenance, water or sunlight.
Artificial fruits and vegetables are fake objects intended to resemble edible fruit or vegetables.
Artificial (fake) flowers are generally made of plastic or fabric and are intended to resemble live cut or potted flowers.
Artificial trees and shrubs are designed to appear living, but require no maintenance, water or sunlight.

The cabasa, similar to the shekere, is a percussion instrument that is constructed with loops of steel ball chain wrapped around a wooden cylinder. The cylinder is fixed to a long, wooden or plastic handle.

The tambourine is a musical instrument in the percussion family consisting of a frame, often of wood or plastic, with pairs of small metal jingles, called "zills". Classically the term tambourine denotes an instrument with a drumhead, though some variants may not have a head.

A cymbal is a percussion instrument made from metal alloys, which creates a sound when hit by a drumstick or crashes against another cymbal. Cymbals have been used since ancient times, and they play quite a big role in the overall sound of a drum set.
A pair of plain or notched wood sticks that are struck or rubbed together to produce various percussive sounds.

Castanets, percussion instrument of the clapper family, consisting of two hollowed-out pear-shaped pieces of hardwood, ivory, or other substance hinged together by a cord. Castanets are usually held in the hand and struck together. They are played in differently pitched pairs by dancers primarily in Spain, the Balearic Islands, and southern Italy.

Temple blocks are a type of percussion instrument consisting of a set of woodblocks. It is descended from the muyu, an instrument originating from eastern Asia, where it is commonly used in religious ceremonies.
The washboard is used as a percussion instrument, employing the ribbed metal surface as a rhythm instrument.

The güiro is a percussion instrument consisting of an open-ended, hollow gourd with parallel notches cut in one side. It is played by rubbing a stick or tines along the notches to produce a ratchet sound.

This is a simple instrument made with two blocks covered with sandpaper (80 or 100 grit works best). As the paper wears out, the scraping sound produced will diminish. This sound is usually associated with "soft-shoe" effects in musicals and dance numbers, but can also be utilized for rhythmic effects.

A woodblock is a small slit drum made from a single piece of wood. The term generally signifies the Western orchestral instrument, though it is descended from the Chinese woodblock. Alternative names sometimes used in ragtime and jazz are clog box and tap box.

Claves are a percussion instrument consisting of a pair of short, wooden sticks about 20–25 centimeters long and about 2.5 centimeters in diameter. Although traditionally made of wood many modern manufacturers offer claves made of fiberglass or plastic. When struck, claves produce a bright, penetrating clicking noise.

The chocalho, chapinhas or rocar, is a percussion instrument. In Portuguese, the word "chocalho" is a generic term for shaken instruments, which also covers seed-filled Ganzás (or shakers). It consists of a frame or neck on which rods support small bells. The rocar is mainly used in samba drums.

A clapper is a basic form of percussion instrument. It consists of two long solid pieces that are struck together producing sound. They exist in many forms in many different cultures around the world. Clappers can take a number of forms and be made of a wide variety of material.
A cajón is a box-shaped percussion instrument originally from Peru, played by slapping the front or rear faces with the hands, fingers, or sometimes implements such as brushes, mallets, or sticks.

The word shaker describes various percussive musical instruments used for creating rhythm in music. They are called shakers because the method of creating the sound involves shaking them – moving them back and forth in the air rather than striking them. Most may also be struck for a greater accent on certain beats.
A rhythm band instrument consisting of a handheld usually slotted block of wood struck by a rod or drumstick.
A jam block is a percussion instrument developed as a modern, hard plastic version of the woodblock. They are popularly used for their durability when compared to the traditional woodblock.

The vibraslap is a percussion instrument consisting of a piece of stiff wire connecting a wooden ball to a hollow box of wood with metal “teeth” inside. The percussionist holds the metal wire in one hand and strikes the ball.
A maraca, sometimes called shaker or chac-chac, is a rattle which appears in many genres of Caribbean and Latin music. It is shaken by a handle and usually played as part of a pair.
Spoons can be played as a makeshift percussion instrument, or more specifically, an idiophone related to the castanets. They are played by hitting one spoon against the other.
An electron tube containing a near-vacuum that allows the free passage of electric current.
A turntable headshell is a component of a record player that attaches to the tonearm and holds the cartridge.

The harmonica, also known as a French harp or mouth organ, is a free reed wind instrument used worldwide in many musical genres, notably in blues, American folk music, classical music, jazz, country, and rock. The many types of harmonica include diatonic, chromatic, tremolo, octave, orchestral, and bass versions.

A pan flute (also known as panpipes or syrinx) is a musical instrument based on the principle of the closed tube, consisting of multiple pipes of gradually increasing length (and occasionally girth). The pipes are typically made from bamboo, giant cane, or local reeds. Other materials include wood, plastic, metal and ivory.

The ocarina is a wind musical instrument; it is a type of vessel flute. Variations exist, but a typical ocarina is an enclosed space with four to twelve finger holes and a mouthpiece that projects from the body.

The clarinet is a single-reed musical instrument in the woodwind family, with a nearly cylindrical bore and a flared bell. Clarinets comprise a family of instruments of differing sizes and pitches. The clarinet family is the largest woodwind family, ranging from the BB♭ contrabass to the E♭ soprano.

The flute is a member of a family of musical instruments in the woodwind group. Like all woodwinds, flutes are aerophones, producing sound with a vibrating column of air. Unlike woodwind instruments with reeds, a flute produces sound when the player's air flows across an opening.

An instrument that produces sound usually from a player's breath. The player blows into a mouthpiece attached to a tube with/without button holes, and the pitch of the sound changes by either pressure or the lengthening/shortening of the pipe (some whistles have a sliding piece to elongate the instrument).

A musical instrument with reed pipes that are sounded by the pressure of wind emitted from a bag squeezed by the player's arm. Bagpipes are associated especially with Scotland, but are also used in folk music in Ireland, Northumberland, and France, and in varying forms across Europe and western Asia.
The recorder is a family of woodwind musical instruments in the group known as internal duct flutes: flutes with a whistle mouthpiece, also known as fipple flutes.

The piccolo is a half-size flute and a member of the woodwind family of musical instruments. Sometimes referred to as a "baby flute" or piccolo flute the modern piccolo has the same type of fingerings as the standard transverse flute, but the sound it produces is an octave higher.

The cor anglais, or English horn is a double-reed woodwind instrument in the oboe family. It is approximately one and a half times the length of an oboe, making it essentially an alto oboe in F. The cor anglais is a transposing instrument pitched in F, a perfect fifth lower than the oboe.

The saxophone is a type of single-reed woodwind instrument with a conical body, usually made of brass. As with all single-reed instruments, sound is produced when a reed on a mouthpiece vibrates to produce a sound wave inside the instrument's body.

A shofar is an ancient musical horn typically made of a ram's horn, used for Jewish religious purposes. Like the modern bugle, the shofar lacks pitch-altering devices, with all pitch control done by varying the player's embouchure.

The bassoon is a woodwind instrument in the double reed family, which plays in the tenor and bass ranges. It is composed of six pieces, and is usually made of wood. It is known for its distinctive tone color, wide range, versatility, and virtuosity.
The oboe is a type of double-reed woodwind instrument. Oboes are usually made of wood, but may also be made of synthetic materials, such as plastic, resin, or hybrid composites.
A small, simple musical instrument consisting of a hollow pipe with a hole in it, over which is a thin covering that vibrates and adds a buzzing sound when the player sings or hums into the pipe.
The didgeridoo is a wind instrument, played with vibrating lips to produce a continuous drone while using a special breathing technique called circular breathing.

Drum machines are electronic musical instruments that create percussion. They may imitate drum kits or other percussion instruments or produce unique sounds. Moreover, most modern drum machines allow users to program their rhythms. Drum machines may create sounds using analog synthesis or play prerecorded samples.

A DI box, also called a direct box, converts the unbalanced, high impedance signal output of an instrument to a balanced low impedance mic-level signal. This enables the signal to travel distances of 100 meters (300 feet) without adding appreciable noise.
A channel strip combines a mic preamp with additional processing to emulate the signal path of a mixing console.

Compressors and limiters are music production tools used to reduce the span between the softest and loudest parts of an audio signal. They allow you to control levels, and when used properly, result in louder, more professional sounding recordings.
A patch bay is a central hub that connects all the inputs and outputs of a studio's audio or MIDI equipment, allowing the user to control and route signals between devices.

A sound pressure level meter (SPL meter), also known as a sound level meter (SLM), is a device that measures sound levels in a standardized way. SLMs are often portable, battery-operated, and can be used to measure sound levels in a variety of settings, including industrial plants, construction sites, and airports.

A keyboard synthesizer is a piano alternative that creates sound through electrical currents. There are three types of keyboard synthesizers: analog, digital and software. There are also hybrid synthesizers, which use a combination of two or more of these technologies.

An audio feedback suppressor is a device that prevents audio feedback in live sound systems, such as at concerts, conferences, and worship services. Feedback occurs when a microphone or instrument creates a sound loop with a speaker, resulting in a high-pitched, loud tone. Feedback suppressors are often used in situations where there are multiple microphones or when speakers are close to instruments or microphones.

An audio crossover is a filter that separates an audio signal into different frequency ranges and sends each range to a different speaker driver. This allows each speaker to play the frequencies it's designed to play most efficiently, and it helps create a high-fidelity sound experience
A sequencer in music is a tool, either hardware or software-based, designed to arrange and play back a sequence of musical events such as notes, rhythms, and control changes.

Modular synthesizers are electronic musical instruments made up of a variety of components (modules) that are used and combined to create electronic sounds. The modules are connected to one another via cables, switches, and controls to configure different connection options. 
https://www.samplesoundmusic.com/
A sound diffuser is a device that scatters sound waves to improve the acoustics of a space. They're often used in recording studios, music production rooms, and live music venues

A utility plugin that can dim a monitoring setup in response to a sidechain signal. It can be used for ducking music under voiceover, remote collaboration, and preventing people's voices from being fed back to them

An acoustic damper is a device used to reduce the intensity of sound waves. It is typically installed in walls, ceilings, or floors to absorb sound and minimize echoes or reverberations. These devices can be made of various materials, such as fiberglass, mineral wool, or open-cell foam, and are designed to dissipate sound energy and improve sound quality in a room.

An audio sampler is a device or program that captures, stores, and plays back audio samples, or portions of sound recordings. Samplers are used to create new sounds by manipulating audio sources, such as blending samples with other instruments or sounds.

A compressor is used to reduce a signal's dynamic range—that is, to reduce the difference in level between the loudest and quietest parts of an audio signal. Compression is commonly used to attenuate loud transient peaks (e.g., when a singer suddenly belts out a high note) to help maintain a consistent level.
Audio loop controllers can refer to a variety of devices that can be used for audio looping, including hearing loops, audio playback controllers, and audio loop switching systems.
Acoustic reflectors provide clarity in large venues by evenly dispersing sound and controlling late reflections.

An audio mixer is a piece of hardware that combines and adjusts audio signals from multiple sources, such as microphones, instruments, and playback devices. It allows the user to control the volume, tone, balance, and effects of the audio sources to create a high-quality sound.
A crossfader is a control on a DJ mixer that allows a DJ to fade in one source while fading out another. It's a small horizontal fader that allows the DJ to control both decks' volumes with one hand

The banjo is a stringed instrument with a thin membrane stretched over a frame or cavity to form a resonator. The membrane is typically circular, in modern forms usually made of plastic, originally of animal skin. Early forms of the instrument were fashioned by African Americans and had African antecedents.

The bouzouki is a musical instrument popular in Greece. It is a member of the long-necked lute family, with a round body with a flat top and a long neck with a fretted fingerboard. It has steel strings and is played with a plectrum producing a sharp metallic sound, reminiscent of a mandolin but pitched lower.

A lute is any plucked string instrument with a neck and a deep round back enclosing a hollow cavity, usually with a sound hole or opening in the body. It may be either fretted or unfretted. More specifically, the term "lute" commonly refers to an instrument from the family of European lutes.
The veena, also spelled vina, comprises various chordophone instruments from the Indian subcontinent. Veena is a traditional South Indian stringed musical instrument.
A large, long-necked Indian lute with movable frets, played with a wire pick.
Zithers are a class of stringed instruments. Zithers are typically played by strumming or plucking the strings with the fingers or a plectrum.

The ukulele, also called a uke, is a member of the lute family of instruments of Portuguese origin and popularized in Hawaii. It generally employs four nylon strings. The tone and volume of the instrument vary with size and construction. Ukuleles commonly come in four sizes: soprano, concert, tenor, and baritone.

The Appalachian dulcimer is a fretted string instrument of the zither family, typically with three or four strings, originally played in the Appalachian region of the United States. The body extends the length of the fingerboard, and its fretting is generally diatonic.

The double bass, also known simply as the bass, amongst other names, is the largest and, therefore, lowest-pitched chordophone in the modern symphony orchestra. Similar in structure to the cello, it has four, although occasionally five, strings.

The cello, or violoncello, is a bowed string instrument of the violin family. Its four strings are usually tuned in perfect fifths: from low to high, C₂, G₂, D₃ and A₃. The viola's four strings are each an octave higher.
The classical guitar (also known as the nylon-string guitar or Spanish guitar) is a member of the guitar family used in classical music and other styles.
The hammered dulcimer is a percussion-stringed instrument which consists of strings typically stretched over a trapezoidal resonant sound board.
An acoustic guitar is a musical instrument in the string family. When a string is plucked, its vibration is transmitted from the bridge, resonating throughout the top of the guitar.
The acoustic bass guitar is a bass instrument with a hollow wooden body similar to, though usually larger than a steel-string acoustic guitar.

The viola is a string instrument that is bowed, plucked, or played with varying techniques. Slightly larger than a violin, it has a lower and deeper sound. Since the 18th century, it has been the middle or alto voice of the violin family, between the violin and the cello.
Sarangi is a bowed stringed instrument with a skin-covered resonator. The typical sarangi is made by hand, usually from a single block of wood.
Sarod is a stringed musical instrument of the lute family that is common to the Hindustani music tradition of northern India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh.

A mandolin is a stringed musical instrument in the lute family and is generally plucked with a pick. It most commonly has four courses of doubled strings tuned in unison, thus giving a total of eight strings. A variety of string types are used, with steel strings being the most common and usually the least expensive.

The oud is a Middle Eastern short-neck lute-type, pear-shaped, fretless stringed instrument, usually with 11 strings grouped in six courses, but some models have five or seven courses, with 10 or 13 strings respectively.

The violin, sometimes known as a fiddle, is a wooden chordophone in the violin family. Most violins have a hollow wooden body. It is the smallest and thus highest-pitched instrument in the family in regular use.

The tanpura is a long-necked, plucked, four-stringed instrument originating in India, found in various forms in Indian music. Visually, the tanpura resembles a simplified sitar or similar lute-like instrument, and is likewise crafted out of a gourd or pumpkin.
The lap steel guitar, also known as a Hawaiian guitar, is a type of steel guitar without pedals that is typically played with the instrument in a horizontal position across the performer's lap.

The harp is a stringed musical instrument that has individual strings running at an angle to its soundboard; the strings are plucked with the fingers. Harps can be made and played in various ways, standing or sitting, and in orchestras or concerts. Its most common form is triangular in shape and made of wood.

A psaltery is a fretboard-less box zither and is considered the archetype of the zither and dulcimer. Plucked keyboard instruments such as the harpsichord were also inspired by it. Its resonance box is usually trapezoidal, rectangular or in the form of a "pig's head" and often richly decorated.
An autoharp or chord zither is a string instrument belonging to the zither family. It uses a series of bars individually configured to mute all strings other than those needed for the intended chord.
An implement appended to a guitar to mute or dampen the vibration or sound. Guitar mutes can be placed on the frets or even on the guitar body.
A tensioned stick with stretched hair between both ends used to move across the strings of string instruments such as violins, violas, cellos, etc to create musical sound.
On string instruments, the mute is usually a small three-prong rubber or felt implement that attaches to the top of the bridge with one prong between each pair of strings.

The purpose of applying rosin is to coat the bow hairs in a powdery, sticky substance that will "grip" the strings and cause friction as the bow slides across the string. This is what causes the string to vibrate and produce sound.
Musical Instrument Strap is an accessory that allows players to hold and support an instrument while playing

A capo is a device a musician uses on the neck of a stringed instrument to transpose and shorten the playable length of the strings—hence raising the pitch. It is a common tool for players of guitars, mandolins, mandolas, banjos, ukuleles and bouzoukis.
A device that turns string vibrations into electricity, and is embedded in the body of the guitar right beneath the strings. Pickups are components of electric guitars.
Specially fitted cases for bows for string instruments designed to protect from moisture or dents.
A catch-all product concept used to designate various specific part components for all keyboard and piano category instruments.
The neck is the part of certain string instruments that projects from the main body and is the base of the fingerboard, where the fingers are placed to stop the strings at different pitches.

A chinrest is a shaped piece of wood (or plastic) attached to the body of a violin or a viola to aid in the positioning of the player's jaw or chin on the instrument. The chinrest may be made of ebony, rosewood, boxwood, or plastic.

Musical instrument strings are long, flexible structures that vibrate to produce sound on stringed instruments. They are typically made of materials like nylon, steel, gut, vegetable fiber, silk, or artificial materials like plastic

A guitar pick is a plectrum used for guitars. Picks are generally made of one uniform material, such as some kind of plastic, rubber, felt, tortoiseshell, wood, metal, glass, tagua, or stone. They are often shaped in an acute isosceles triangle with the two equal corners rounded and the third corner less rounded.

A guitar slide is a smooth tool usually made of glass, brass, or ceramic that you place on your finger as you play guitar. It allows you to manipulate the sound of the strings to achieve a glissando or vibrato sound.
The main physical piece of an instrument, typically sold as a body if being constructed piece by piece.
A catch-all product concept used to designate various specific part components for all string category instruments. Guitar-specific parts should use Guitar Replacement Parts.
A catch-all product concept used to designate various specific part components for all guitar category instruments.
