A Cat Toy is an item that is made specifically for cats to play with. Cat Toys ranging from strings, to small furry items resembling prey (e.g. mice), to feathers that hang from sticks or ropes. Cat toys are designed for cats to serve different purposes like playing, exercising and distraction.
A classifier for items in “Cat Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A classifier for items in “Dog Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.

A Dog Toy is an item that is made specifically for dogs to play with. Dog Toys come in many varieties, including bones, balls, tug toys, squeaky toys, discs and frisbees, plush toys, and sticks. Dog toys serve different purposes like playing, exercising and distraction.
Pet collar charms are a great way to personalize a pet's collar. It can either be slid onto a collar or a pendant can be used to attach to the d-ring on the collar.

Equipment consisting of straps of webbing that loop nearly around the torso of an animal. They often fasten using side release buckles. Harnesses generally are made to have both a strap on the chest in front of the forelimbs, and a strap around the torso behind the forelimbs, with straps in between connecting these two for reinforcement.
A pet muzzle is a device that goes over the nose and mouth of a pet.

A pet collar is a piece of material put around the neck of an animal. A collar may be used for restraint, identification, fashion, or protection. Identification tags and medical information are often placed on pet collars. Collars are often used in conjunction with a leash for restraining a pet. Does not include Flea & Tick or medical collars.
A metal identification tag attached to a pet's collar.

A leash (also called a lead, lead line or tether) is a rope or similar material used to control an animal by attaching to it or to a separate object on it; some leashes clip or tie to a collar, harness, or halter, while others go directly around the animal's neck or head.
Clothing, shoes and accessories worn by pets.
A lightweight pack that is designed specifically to be worn on a dog's back and lets them carry food and gear for a hike.
A birdcage stand is a type of stand to support birdcages.
Birdcages are structures made of bars or wires in which pet birds are confined and live.
A classifier for items in “Bird Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A bird perch is a rod or a branch serving as a roost for a bird.

Chicken Coop Accessories are various items and add-ons designed to enhance the functionality, safety, and comfort of a chicken coop, which is a housing structure for keeping chickens and other poultry. These accessories aim to improve the living conditions for the birds, facilitate their care, and promote their overall well-being. 

Some common chicken coop accessories include the following: nesting boxes, roosting bars or perches, feeders and wateres, ventilation and insulation, predator protection, litter and nedding, and lighting.
A birdcage cover reduces distractions for birds and allows for uninterrupted sleep.
Bird Seed Guards & Catchers keeps seed hulls and feather dander off of your floor.
A bird ladder may be rope ladders, bamboo ladders, or climbing nets and could be resting on the cage floor or may be hanging from above.
An artificial puddle or small shallow pond, created with a water-filled basin designed for a birdcage.
A bird nest is where birds lay their eggs and raise their young.
Bird toys are designed for birds to serve different purposes like playing, exercising and distraction.
A bird swing is a swing for birds, generally suspended inside a cage.
An incubator is a device that simulates avian incubation through provision of a controlled environment (primarily temperature and humidity) in order to bring eggs to hatching.

Pet Styptic Gels & Powders are antiseptic clotting agents that are most often used in pet grooming. The powder or gel stops bleeding by contracting the blood vessels. This is most common in nail or claw clipping accidents.
Pet Cologne is a perfumed liquid, cream or paste composed generally of alcohol and fragrant oils, formulated for use on pets.
Shampoo that is specially designed to clean animal skin and hair.
Pet dematting tools help to detangle mated hair and remove loose dead mat-causing hair.
Animal Grooming Scissors are used to cut and shape an animal's hair or fur.
Pet Hair Removal & Grooming Mitts are special gloves or mittens that have rubber bristles or pins on the palm side. These serve as brushes that remove hair from, groom and massage the pet.
A classifier for items in “Pet Grooming Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.

An animal grooming electric clipper blade is a detachable blade that is used in electric pet clippers for grooming and trimming the fur of animals. It is specifically designed to cut through the thick and coarse hair of animals such as dogs, cats, horses, and other domesticated animals. The blades are typically made of high-quality steel or ceramic materials and come in various sizes and styles to accommodate different coat lengths and textures. The clipper blade attaches to the clipper body and moves back and forth rapidly to cut the hair efficiently and smoothly. Regular maintenance and sharpening of the blade are necessary to ensure optimal cutting performance and to prevent pulling or snagging of the fur during grooming sessions.
A pet grooming wipe is used to remove tear stains and bacteria that accumulates around eyes and ears of pet. It prevents infection as well.
A pet deodorizer is used to eliminate or prevent the offensive odor of pets.  Typically this product is applied to pets and their surroundings.
Pet Grooming Baths are large tubs in which an animal can be washed and/or bathed. These are different than portable pools used for recreation.
Hair blow dryer specifically designed for animal grooming.
Pet grooming brushes removes loose hair and stimulates capillaries and natural oil production for healthy skin and coats. Regular grooming effectively reduces shedding.
Animal Grooming Electric Clippers are powered cutting implements used to cut or shave animal hair and fur.
A pet dander reducer helps to reduce dander and other allergens that cause people to have allergic reactions around pets.
Pet Claw Care items are intended to help in the grooming of an animal's claws. These items generally include nail clippers or grinders and accessories that help in grooming a pet's nails or claws.
Help reduce back strain for the groomer while providing a secure, stable grooming environment for the pet.
Animal Conditioners restore moisture, add shine and help detangle an animal's hair or fur. This item is usually used after shampooing.
Pet shower and bath accessories are all the accessories associated with pet shower and bath.
A pet stroller is a small vehicle with four wheels in which a pet is pushed around.
A dog sling is a piece of cloth that supports small dogs, puppies from a human body.

Pet Booster Seats are seats that fasten securely to your car's seatbelt system or the seat itself and include fittings that attach your pet's harness to provide safety when riding in the car. They typically provide elevation so the pet can see outside the window.
A pet carrier is a ventilated crate with a handle on the top for transporting small or medium size pets.

A pet vehicle harness is a safety device designed to secure and restrain pets inside a vehicle while traveling. It is similar to a seatbelt for humans but specifically designed for pets. The harness typically consists of straps, buckles, and connectors that attach to a pet's body, allowing them to be secured to a seatbelt or vehicle anchor point. 

The purpose of a pet vehicle harness is to prevent pets from roaming freely in the car, which can be dangerous for both the pet and the occupants of the vehicle. Unrestrained pets can be a distraction to the driver, and in the event of a sudden stop or accident, they can be injured or may even become projectiles that can harm themselves or others.

Pet vehicle harnesses are available in various sizes and styles to accommodate different breeds and sizes of pets. It is important to choose a harness that is specifically designed for use in vehicles and has been tested for safety. When using a pet vehicle harness, it is essential to follow the manufacturer's instructions to ensure proper installation and use.
Pet Bicycle Carriers are carriages typically attached to the handlebars or frame of a bicycle and are used to transport smaller pets.

Pet Bicycle Trailers are carriages typically attached to the back wheel or rear frame of a bicycle and are used to transport multiple or larger pets. These do not have handlebars and cannot function unless they are connected to a bicycle or some other sort of transportation. They are meant to be pulled.

Pet Ramps are sloping walkways designed to help animals access high surfaces like beds, couches and cars or trucks. While they are useful for pets of any age, they are especially useful for senior pets and small animals that can't jump.

Pet Car Seat Covers are layers of material that are secured to car seats with straps or clips and are intended to protect the car seat or cargo area from damage or dirt caused by the transporting of animals.
A pet travel barrier is a great way to minimize distraction while one is driving. Most pet travel barriers are adjustable and designed to fit in a variety of vehicles.

Small animal tubes & tunnels are especially made for petite creatures such as the hamsters, guinea pigs, mice and gerbils. It consists of rings, plugs and plastic tubes that helps to create a plastic tunnel which can be easily set up inside or outside the
Small animal exercise wheels are used as running wheels inside a cage and can allow a pet to get the exercise it needs to be healthy and happy.
Small Animal Habitat Décor refers to the interior furnishings, decorations and/or other items inside a small animals dwelling (habitat, cage, etc).
Small animal toys are designed for small animals to serve different purposes like playing, exercising and distraction.
Small Animal Habitats & Cages are the fully, or partially, enclosed dwellings for small animals such as hamsters, mice, guinea pigs, rabbits, etc.
A classifier for items in “Small Animal Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Cat Litter Mats are specially designed mats that are placed in front of or around a cat's litter box to help control and minimize the spread of litter particles outside the box. These mats are typically made of materials such as PVC, rubber, or foam and feature a textured or grooved surface that captures litter particles as the cat walks across the mat after using the litter box. Cat Litter Mats make it easier to maintain a clean and hygienic environment by reducing the amount of litter tracked throughout the home, and they can be easily cleaned by shaking, vacuuming, or rinsing with water.
Absorbent mat or pad designed for house training a pet to eventually go potty outside.
A pooper scooper is a device used to pick up pet feces from public places and yards, particularly those of dogs.
A dog waste bag dispenser is a type of dispenser that dispenses dog waste bags.

Cat Litter Scoops are slotted utensils used for removing solid waste or clumped litter from a litter box. They have a handle, and resemble small shovels with slots where the sifted litter can pass through.

Cat Litter Box Liners are bags (usually made of plastic) that serve as a barrier between the litter and the box. The liner sits inside and over the edges of the empty box before the litter goes in the box. The litter then goes on top of the liner for easy clean up and disposal.
Cat Litter is an absorbent material, often in a granular form, that is used to line a receptacle in which a domestic cat can urinate and defecate indoors.
A cat litter box is an indoor feces and urine disposal box for cats that are permitted to roam freely in a home and cannot always go outside to relieve themselves.
Cat litter disposal container that stores old cat litter until it can be thrown away.
A dog waste bag is an alternative to pooper scoopers and is simply a bag, usually turned inside out, to carry the feces to a proper disposal area.
Holder or tray for a pet training pad.

Pet Repellents are items that drive back or make a pet turn away from something. It can help keep pets away from dangers or undesired areas, or keep them from doing an undesired behavior like chewing something they shouldn't. It can also be used to keep the user safe from stray or charging dogs (like a bear repellent in camping gear).
A pet training collar is a simple device that gives pet owners a safe and reliable way to control their pets off leash.
Dog agility equipment is designed for agility, discipline and exercise for a pet.
Bark control training aid is used to refrain a dog from barking. It emits a safe, high-pitched sound that only a dog can hear and safely trains the dog to stop barking.
A pet training clicker is a method used for modifying a pets behavior and enhancing his training experience. It helps to teach a pet to repeat behaviors that lead to rewards.

Pet Doorbells are bells or ringing devices that are used by pets. They are used in potty training. The pet rings the doorbell to signal that it wants to either go outside or come inside. It functions like any other doorbell but is exclusively intended for pets to use.
Dog Whistles are high-pitched whistles used to train dogs, typically having a sound inaudible to humans.

A pet door flap is a hinged flap set into a door to allow pets to enter and exit a house on their own without needing a human to open the door, while offering a degree of protection against wind and rain entering the dwelling.
Pet tie-outs are cables used for restricting a pet's outdoor mobility while granting room to roam, romp and investigate.

Pet Kennel & Crate Pads are thin flat mats or thin cushions a pet can lay on while confined to their kennel or crate. The mat protects the pet's feet from the often hard or wired crate bottoms, while a cushion makes laying in the kennel more comfortable.
Pet tie-out stakes are spiral stakes with arrowhead design screws that goes into the ground and stays firmly anchored.

A Pet Radio & Wireless Fence is an electronic system designed to keep a pet or other domestic animal within a set of predefined boundaries without the use of a physical barrier. A mild electric shock is delivered by an electronic collar if its warning sound is ignored. Can be indoor or outdoor, or wired in-ground or wireless.

Pet Playpens are portable, usually collapsible, enclosures in which a pet can play, exercise or rest. These are not intended to be a permanent house or habitat for the pet. These typically have open tops, or if used for small or young animals, are covered and have multiple levels.

A Pet Crate is usually a box-shaped container or cage that has openings for airflow and that is used for temporarily confining or carrying animals (such as dogs or cats). They are typically used indoors and should only be a little bigger than the pet's size, providing a sense of safety and security. Small crates or kennels can be used to transport pets for travel. A Pet Kennel, which is much bigger than a crate, is a semi-permanent outdoor structure used to house and shelter pets. Animals can spend a majority of time in their kennels, since they are big enough to sleep, move around, play, or run in.
Pet Gates are movable barriers that keep your pet separated or confined in a particular area, either for their safety or for the safety of others. These are similar to baby gates.
Pet Doors are small, framed openings cut into doors, walls, or windows that allow pets to enter and exit a room/building on their own without needing a human to open the actual door.
Pet Kennel & Crate Covers are products that drape over and/or fully enclose an animal's kennel or crate in order to block out light or provide insulation or protection from the elements.
Hanging fabric hammock designed for cats.
A pet bed is a piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically with raised sides or a small frame with a mattress and covering.
Small, mountable platforms designed for cats to climb onto and sit or lay down.

A Pet Sofa & Chair Protector is a piece of material (typically fabric or plastic) that covers & protects a piece of furniture from pet spills, accidents, scratches and/or fur. These are different than slipcovers (which have their own PT) because these lay on the furniture, but do not encase the furniture.
A pet bed cover is a cover for pet beds. It prevents the bed from getting dirty.
Rigid post covered in rough material designed to encourage cat scratching.

Pet Bedding & Litter is used in animal habitats (like rabbits, hamsters, ferrets, chinchillas, etc) to keep pets comfortable and clean. The bedding provides them with comfy place to nest and sleep. Plus, it gives them warmth and protection, especially when they want to burrow into the bedding. And, it absorbs waste and keeps your pet's cage dry and odor free in between cleanings. It is usually comprised of paper, granule, or wood.

A Pet Pillow is a type of pet bed that is used for sleep or rest. It resembles a typical pillow in that it has a plush filling and can have an interchangeable covering. It does not have a mattress or raised sides - which would be considered a Pet Bed.
Pet sofa and chairs are the upholstered furniture for pets.
Vertical structure intended to encourage cats to climb, play, and sleep on.
A cat scratching pad is flat pad covered in rough material that cat owners provide so their cats have an acceptable place to scratch.
A pet blanket is a type of bedding, generally speaking, a large piece of cloth intended to keep the pets warm especially while sleeping.
A Pet Bed Liner is an extra layer of material that is placed over the bed/mattress and under the replaceable outer cover.
Pet Stairs & Steps are pieces of furniture that are like step ladders intended to aid pets to climb on top of existing furniture like sofas, beds or cars.
A classifier for items in “Backyard Wildlife Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Small shelter for cats that provides protection from the elements and enough space for a cat bed.
A structure meant to provide a safe environment for bats. Bat houses/shelters give females a safe, warm place to raise their young.

A bird house is also known as a nest box is a man-made enclosure provided for animals to nest in. Bird houses are most frequently utilized for birds, in which case they are also called birdhouses or a birdbox/bird box, but some mammals such as bats may also use them.

Butterfly hibernation boxes are long, skinny boxes with thin slits (usually on the front). The intent of the butterfly box is to give butterflies a dry place to go during inclement weather or a place to hibernate during the winter.
Bee hotels are the insect equivalent of a birdhouse. Also known as bee condos, bee houses, or nest blocks, these structures provide nesting spaces for certain solitary bees and wasps.
An outdoor Dog House is a small shed commonly built in the shape of a little house to keep a dog protected from the elements. It usually has enough space for a dog bed, water and food bowls.
A classifier for items in “Backyard Birding Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A Chicken Run is an outdoor enclosure with mesh, screen, or caged sides designed for chickens. It might also have a cover to further protect from the elements or predators.

A chicken coop is a structure or enclosure specifically designed to house and protect chickens and other poultry. It serves as a safe and comfortable living space, providing shelter from weather, temperature fluctuations, and potential predators. The primary purpose of a chicken coop is to ensure the well-being and safety of the chickens, while also providing a clean and organized environment for them to feed, nest, and roost.

A well-designed chicken coop typically includes features such as nesting boxes for egg-laying, roosting bars or perches for sleeping, and proper ventilation for maintaining air quality. It may also have feeders and waterers for easy access to food and water, and an outdoor run area where the chickens can roam, forage, and exercise during the day.

Chicken coops come in various sizes and styles, ranging from small, portable structures suitable for urban backyards to large, permanent installations for commercial poultry farming.
Aquarium stands are specially made stands for supporting the extra weight of aquariums. Some aquarium stands are open stands made of solid metal, while others are cabinet stands
Aquarium decor consists of ornaments that are placed into the aquarium to create a personal effect.

Aquarium water pumps are essential water circulation devices for freshwater and saltwater aquariums. These powerful and versatile water pumps are commonly used to drive different aquarium filtration units.
A terrarium is a tightly closed, clear glass or plastic container filled with small plants for smaller land animals like reptiles, amphibians or terrestrial invertebrates.

Live Aquatic plants are plants that have adapted to living in aquatic environments. They enhance water quality, help prevent algae growth by using nutrients produced by fish waste, uneaten food and organic debris, and produce oxygen during daylight hours, which is used by fish and helps stabilize pH. Lastly, Plants encourage many types of fish to spawn and give newly-hatched fry a place to hide while they grow.

A terrarium or aquarium substrate is used for multiple purposes in an enclosure. It facilitates waste removal and can maintain humidity. It allows the expression of natural behaviors such as burrowing and allows plants to grow as well.
Filter media is anything placed inside a filter that changes the quality of water flowing through it (e.g., cartridges, sponges, small balls, rings etc.).

A breeder net or box is a container used to temporarily hold tiny babies, eggs, or even sick fish that need to be isolated while they heal. Most breeder boxes float at the water surface or attach to the side of the aquarium so that the fry share the same water as the rest of the fish.

Good water quality is key to a healthy, beautiful aquarium. Tap water often contains disinfectants, such as chlorine and chloramines, these disinfectants are highly toxic to aquatic life. Water treatments and conditioners work quickly to make water conditions superior and safe for fish.
Aquarium starter kits contains the essentials that is required to set up a healthy home for the fishes.
An aquarium net is a net or mesh basket held open by a hoop to capture aquarium fish.
Aquarium Water Test Kits check pH levels and ammonia, as well as chlorine and chloramine, nitrites, nitrates, water hardness and more.
An aquarium gravel cleaner is used for the routine cleaning of the debris from the gravel in the aquarium.
Automatic fish feeders are designed to feed aquarium fish automatically at regular intervals and to maintain a consistent feeding schedule.

Fish tank dividers are used to separate areas of the aquarium where defined spaces are required. The ability to break up sections in the fish tank can come in handy for breeding purposes and segregating feuding fish.

Aquarium parts are the various components and accessories that are used to set up, maintain, and enhance the functionality and aesthetics of an aquarium. These parts ensure that the aquarium provides a healthy, stable, and suitable environment for the aquatic life it houses. Some common aquarium parts include: tank, filter, heater, thermometer, lighting, air pumps, substrate, decorations, water conditioner, siphon and gravel vacuum, algae scraper.
Terrarium heat lamps and mats are used to artificially create an environment temperature for those species that cannot adapt to other conditions than those found in their natural habitat.
An aquarium filter removes physical and soluble chemical waste products from an aquarium.

Aquarium lighting describes any type of artificial lighting that is used to illuminate an aquarium. Some types of aquaria such as reef aquariums and planted aquariums require specialized high intensity lighting to support photosynthetic life within the tank.
A reptile thermometer is an instrument used to measure the temperature of reptiles.
A classifier for items in “Reptile & Amphibian Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
An aquarium heater is a device used to warm the temperature of water in aquariums.
A terrarium cover is used especially for the unique needs of reptile environments. It promotes the healthy exchange of air needed to keep cold-blooded reptiles healthy and active.
An aquarium air pump is a device used to force air into an aquarium tubing. The tubing is placed into the aquarium to increase water agitation and for decorative purposes.
A classifier for items in “Aquatic Pet Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A fish bowl is a transparent bowl in which fishes and water-dwelling plants are kept and is also used for decorative purposes.
An aquarium is an establishment where aquatic organisms are kept and exhibited.

An aquarium hood helps to shield the light, projecting it downward to light up the tank instead of out into the surrounding room. Most hoods are made from plastic and have an opening for food, but need to be removed for routine tank maintenance.
Terrarium feeding dishes are feeding bowls used for the likes of reptiles and amphibians.
Items used to decorate a terrarium provides visual interest and place for reptiles to rest and hide.
An aquarium algae scraper removes algae and dirt from the aquarium walls.
Aquarium Thermometers record temperatures regularly to ensure the aquarium water temperature is stable and in the optimal range for your fish.
Terrarium habitat lighting is the lighting used in a terrarium environment, such that it suits their natural habitat.

An aquarium hydrometer is a required piece of equipment for anyone with a salt water aquarium. This device determines the specific gravity of salt water, information that is essential for the health of fish or reefs.

Flea & Tick Collars contain repellent chemicals that are continuously released from the collar and spread over the pet via the natural oils of the hair, coat and skin. These flea & tick killing chemicals then adhere to the hair and skin and provide continuous protection.
A pet wheelchair helps disabled, aging, paralyzed, or injured pets to walk.

Animal Dental Care Tools are items that are used to care for an animal's teeth, gums, etc. These instruments are usually used by professionals in veterinary medicine, but can also be used at home for care in between professional visits. Animal Dental Care Tools are not only instruments. They can be sprays, gels, water additives, all which help fight tartar and plaque build-up.
Pet Recovery Collars & Cones are plastic or fabric hoods or cones placed around the head to prevent an animal from licking at a surgery site, wound, or dressing.
Pet Digestive Remedies are medicines or treatments intended to treat or prevent a pet's stomach/digestive issues.

Poultry Conditioners are supplements for poultry like chickens, ducks, and geese. These supplements are usually added to feed in order to aid in the overall, general health of the animal and helps condition birds for performance & exhibition. It offers complete fortification for vigorous, healthy birds and brilliant high-quality plumage.
Pet ear care is used to prevent accumulation of dirt, wax and other debris that can lead to odor and inflammation due to mite infestation.
A pet wormer is a product that helps prevent and eliminate canine intestinal worm infections.
A cat hairball remedy helps a cat's natural digestive system, especially beneficial to indoor cat owners and for those that travel with their pets.
Pet Flea & Tick Treatments are products that prevent, treat, repell or kill fleas and ticks on the pet, and/or in the home or around the yard.

An animal acupuncture model is a representation or replica of an animal's body that is used for educational or demonstration purposes in the field of veterinary acupuncture. It is typically made of durable materials such as plastic or silicone and is designed to resemble the anatomy of specific animals, such as dogs, cats, horses, or other species commonly treated with acupuncture.

The model is usually marked with specific acupuncture points that correspond to the traditional Chinese medicine meridians and acupoints used in acupuncture therapy. These models are used by veterinary acupuncturists, students, and instructors to study and practice locating and needling these specific points.
Pet Milk Replacers are formulas that replace a mother animal's milk. This is usually used when the mother is not available to nurse.
A pet toothpaste is a paste for cleaning the teeth of a pet.
A pet relaxant is like a drug or therapeutic treatment that relaxes or relieves muscular or nervous tension of pets.

Pet Nursing Syringes are tubes with a nozzle and piston or bulb for sucking in and ejecting liquid in a thin stream, fitted with a hollow nipple intended to aid in the nursing/feeding/weaning of orphaned pets, livestock, etc.
Pet eye care is used to eliminate tear stains for pets and to provide soothing.
A pet thermometer is an instrument used to measure the temperature of pets.
Pet Nursing Kits are all items intended to aid in the nursing/feeding/weaning of orphaned pets, livestock, etc.

A Pet Flea Comb is a handheld tool that offers an affordable and nontoxic way to detect and remove fleas from your pet. It has very finely spaced teeth, and collects fleas, flea eggs and flea dirt as it combs through the pet's fur.

Pet Nursing Replacement Teats are items that resemble a nipple of the mammary gland of a female mammal, from which the milk is sucked by the young. It aids in the nursing/feeding/weaning of orphaned pets, livestock, etc.

Animal Supplements & Vitamins are products intended to add nutrients to an animal's diet. Vitamins are naturally-occurring nutrients in an animal's body whereas supplements are naturally-occurring or synthetic chemicals taken as a complement to their diet. Furthermore, vitamins include vitamin A, B, C, D, E, and K while supplements contain multiple ingredients such as multivitamins and dietary minerals. Both are usually in the form of a pill, capsule, tablet, powder, or liquid, and provide nutrients either created synthetically or extracted from food sources.
A pet toothbrush is an oral hygiene instrument used to clean the teeth and gums of pets.
A pet itch remedy provides relief from allergies and airborne pollutants that cause skin irritation and scratching.
A classifier for items in “Pet Health Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Pet Diapers are pieces of absorbent material wrapped around an animal's bottom and between its legs to absorb and retain urine and feces.
Pet Nursing Bottles & Bottle Sets are containers intended to aid in the nursing/feeding/weaning of orphaned pets, livestock, etc.
Cat treat is a snack for cats. It may not be a balanced diet but cats like it.
Bird food is the food given to domesticated pet birds, usually mixed seeds.
Food for squirrels and small outdoor wild animals.
Dog food is a type of food prepared for pet dogs. It could be dry food or wet food.
A sugar-water solution used to feed hummingbirds.
Wild bird feed is intended for undomesticated birds living in the wild.  For pet bird food, use the Bird Food product type.
Bird treat is a snack for birds. It may not be a balanced diet but birds like it.
Edible treats intended for chickens and/or poultry.
Cat food is a type of food prepared for cats. It could be dry food or wet food.
Dog treat is a snack for dogs. It may not be a balanced diet but dogs like it.
Food for small indoor animals - gerbils, hamsters, ferrets, etc.
Animal feed is food intended for domesticated animals or livestock typically found on a farm.
Food for chickens and turkeys and poultry.
Food intended for pet reptiles.
Fish food is a type of food prepared for fishes.
A sugar-water solution used to feed butterflies.
Small animal treat is a snack for small animals. It may not be a balanced diet but small animals like it.
Bird seed molded into blocks, often with gelatin or corn syrup, often placed into a feeder for birds or other small critters.

Hog Feeders are products that contain and/or dispense food for pigs (hogs, boars).;
NOTE: Does not include Automatic Pet Feeders and Waterers for other livestock like horses, cows & sheep.
Protective shields mounted to a bird feeder to stop squirrels from climbing up a bird feeder pole or jumping down directly onto a feeder from above.

Automatic Pet Feeders are devices that self-dispense food and/or water for animals. Electric & Smart versions are programmable and feed animals a predetermined quantity of food, water, treats or medication at specified times while the owner is absent or otherwise engaged. Non-electric Gravity versions rely on a free fall or gravity-based mechanism. The feeder bowl gets refilled with food or water through free fall motion as the animal "makes room" in the plate by eating or drinking. Feeder bags are used for small, caged animals, and are filled with hay, grass, etc and hung in the habitat.

Pet Bowls are containers (usually with a base) used to feed animals; an animal dish. They can be shallow or deep, rounded or differently shaped, ground level, elevated or mounted - as in a habitat or cage. They can be used for food or water, and sometimes both simultaneously, when the item has two containers side by side.

Containers designed to offer squirrels their favorite foods (nuts, corn, etc.). Most squirrel feeders are designed to be mounted instead of hung to provide a stable place to sit and eat. These are intended to keep squirrels preoccupied and away from bird feeders.

A pet water bottle is a specialized water container designed for pets, particularly small animals like rabbits, guinea pigs, or hamsters. It is a convenient way to provide a continuous supply of fresh water to these animals. The bottle is typically made of plastic and has a nozzle or spout at the top, which the pet can lick or bite to release water. The bottle is attached to the pet's enclosure, such as a cage or hutch, with a wire holder or suction cups. The water bottle is designed to be leak-proof, preventing any water from spilling and keeping the pet's living area clean and dry. It is important to regularly check and refill the water bottle to ensure that the pet has access to clean drinking water at all times.
Small projections on a device, hose or machine from which water or other fluid is dispensed in small amounts for a pig.

Pet Food Storage containers are used to hold animal food and treats at room temperature, in the refrigerator, or in the freezer. Their main purpose is to keep food fresh, and protected from pests and water damage.
Butterfly feeders are used to supply nectar to butterflies. They usually have some sort of container to hold liquid nectar and/or a space to leave pieces of fruit.

A feed scoop is a tool used for measuring and dispensing animal feed, such as grain or pellets. It is typically a small, lightweight scoop made of plastic or metal, with a handle for easy gripping. Feed scoops come in various sizes, allowing for accurate measurement of different quantities of feed. They are commonly used in barns, stables, and other animal care facilities to ensure that the correct amount of feed is given to each animal.
A container that is designed to be filled with sugar water / nectar and placed outdoors to attract hummingbirds.

A pet water fountain is a device that provides flowing water for pets to drink from. It typically consists of a water reservoir, a pump, and a water spout or multiple spouts. The pump circulates the water from the reservoir and pushes it through the spout, creating a continuous stream of fresh and oxygenated water for pets to drink. Pet water fountains are designed to encourage pets to drink more water, which can help prevent dehydration and promote better overall health. They are especially beneficial for cats, who are known for having a low thirst drive.
A net or bag designed to be filled with hay to hold hay bales or hay to feed horses, including slow feeding and regular feeding horses.

A birdfeeder, bird table, or tray feeder is a device placed outdoors to supply bird food to birds. The success of a bird feeder in attracting birds depends upon its placement and the kinds of foods offered, as different species have different preferences.

An animal that is kept as a pet and is alive. Examples of pet live animals include dogs, cats, birds, fish, reptiles, small mammals like hamsters or guinea pigs, and other domesticated animals that people keep as companions.
A pet food mat is a protective mat usually made of paper, plastic or cloth that helps to keep the pet dinning area free of spills and splashes.

Outdoor bird baths are basins used by birds to bathe outdoors. They can come with a stand (separate or attached), or by themselves. Some are powered, so as to heat the water during cold weather or to keep the water from freezing.

Bee Guards (also known as Nectar Guards) are small pieces of flexible plastic that attach to a feeding port. The center of each plastic tip is always closed, which prevents bees from getting to the food source the guard is there to protect. These are most commonly used in hummingbird feeders, so that the nectar/sugar water stays protected from bees, while simultaneously allowing hummingbirds to stick their beaks inside and gain access to the food source. Bee Guards prevent bees, hornets, flies and larger birds from polluting or wasting nectar.
Raised frames or pedestals on which, or in which, a birdbath is placed for support and to provide elevation.
A classifier for items in “Pet Feeding & Watering Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A special putty designed to strengthen hands for various health reasons
A classifier for items in "Physical Therapy Aids" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A physical therapy device that is intended to strengthen the hand(s) of the user.
Traction devices work to help put the cervical spine in the correct position/alignment, therefore relaxing tense neck and shoulder muscles.
A physical therapy device that is intended to help stretch the feet, ankles, and calves. This is helpful for issues like Plantar Fasciitis.
A drug that can be obtained only by means of a physician or veterinarian's prescription.

A general parent product type for all dietary supplements including cleanses, detoxes, greens supplements, and superfood supplements. Supplements that don't have their own product type can be assigned this general product type using the classification in the previous sentence.

This product type contains Vitamins. These vitamins can be single vitamins or they can be vitamins with a few additional vitamins for additional benefit. These include formula supplements, single ingredient supplements, and letter vitamins. ;Does not include minerals, multivitamins (which are really a mixture of vitamins & minerals), or other types of supplements.

Homeopathy is an alternative medicine based on the theory of treating 'like with like'. Homeopathy claims to stimulate healing responses to diseases by administering substances that mimic the symptoms of those diseases in healthy people. The effectiveness of homeopathic preparations is disputed within medical science.
Dietary supplement formulated with protein as its primary ingredient.
Dietary supplement consisting solely of minerals. This does not include anything with minerals plus another type of supplement, such as vitamins.
Vitamins and supplemental foods designed to support healthy breastfeeding in mothers.
Dietary supplements with essential fatty acids as the base (Omega3, Omega 6, Omega 9)

Menopause is a natural process with treatments that focus on symptomatic relief. Vaginal dryness is treated with topical lubricants or estrogens. Medications can reduce the severity and frequency of hot flashes. In special circumstances, oral hormone therapy may be used.
A dietary supplement consisting of an extract or concentration of herbs.
Dietary supplement consisting of fiber, from a variety of sources,  as the primary ingredient
A dietary Supplement whose primary or advertised ingredient is an amino acid, or a combination of amino acids.
Dietary supplement intended to augment or replace one of the body's naturally occurring hormones.
A dietary supplement of glucose, intended to correct low blood sugar. Used primarily by diabetics.
Dietary supplements that are typically a mixture of vitamins, minerals, and other supplements that are intended to give a total daily recommended value in one dose.
Supplements, usually consisting of bacteria and enzymes, intended to aid with digestive health.
These are a dietary supplement intended to help the consumer suppress his or her appetite mostly in an effort to lose weight or fat or both.
Dietary supplement that primarily consists of electrolytes, typically a powder hydration electrolyte solutions. This does not include general sports drinks (Gatorade).

Cloth face masks are pieces of fabric that wrap around the face to the back of the ears or the back of the head. The purpose is to reduce the spread of diseases/viruses as well as protect the wearer from allergens and pollution.

A hot water bottle is a container, usually made of rubber or similar material that is filled with hot water and sealed with a stopper. Hot water bottles are used to provide warmth and for the local application of heat to relieve pain and discomfort.
A classifier for items in "Bandages & Bandaging Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Wristbands commonly used to treat motion sickness, seasickness, and morning sickness from pregnancy based on accupressure.
A first aid kit or medical kit is a collection of supplies and equipment used to give immediate medical treatment, primarily to treat injuries and other mild or moderate medical conditions.
Jock Itch Treatment helps in curing the fungal infection in the skin of the genitals, inner thighs, and buttocks.
A solution used to calm and treat the skin after experiencing a rash or break in skin that has become irritated. Usually in a cream or gel form.
To remove adult lice without subjecting your scalp to harsh chemicals. Lice combs are most suitable for removing adult lice.
Casting tape is a self-adhering bandage/cohesive bandage or wrap that coheres to itself but does not adhere well to other surfaces. It's used for dressing wounds and wrapping casts.

Defibrillators restores a normal heartbeat by sending an electric pulse or shock to the heart. They are used to prevent or correct an arrhythmia, a heartbeat that is uneven or that is too slow or too fast. Defibrillators can also restore the heart's beating if the heart suddenly stops.

Splint is to prevent movement of the broken or dislocated bone. Splints reduce pain, and help prevent further damage to muscles, nerves, and blood vessels. Braces can be used to support and protect various parts of the body during the healing process, some braces compress swollen joints, helping to ease inflammation. Ex: Knee, ankle, elbow, feet, hands, etc.
An antiseptic is an antimicrobial substance or compound that is applied to living tissue to reduce the possibility of sepsis, infection or putrefaction.
A spray used on bedding and furniture or other surfaces around the house formulated specifically to kill and combat lice.
A classifier for items in "First Aid Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Various treatments used to prevent, combat, and heal fungus.

A finger cot is a medical device used to cover one or more fingers in situations where a full glove seems unnecessary. Like medical and rubber gloves, finger cots may be made from a variety of water-tight materials including latex, nitrile rubber, and vinyl.

Lice Treatment Kits is used to treat lice, which are tiny insects that can infest and irritate the scalp (head lice), the pubic area (crabs), or the body. This kit includes shampoo, Comb, bedbug & Dust mite spray.

An instant cold pack is a single-use device that consists of two bags; one containing water, inside a bag containing ammonium nitrate, calcium ammonium nitrate or urea. When the inner bag of water is broken by squeezing the package, it dissolves the solid in an endothermic process. When an injury or inflammation, such as tendonitis or bursitis occurs, tissues are damaged. Cold numbs the affected area, which can reduce pain and tenderness. Cold can also reduce swelling and inflammation.

Covering for the mouth and nose with ear loops that is intended to prevent some (or all) particulate material from transferring between the wearer and the outside world.  These face masks are often made of disposable materials and designed for medical or surgical use.
Used to absorb fluids and provide a semi-permeable barrier over a wound. They can also be used to apply ointments or rub cleansing fluids such as isopropyl alcohol onto a wound site or incision.
A burn care item is typically a gel that provides quick relief to cool burns and quickly relieve pain. It can also prevent a burn from progressing deeper into the skin and help prevent infection.

An adhesive bandage, also called a sticking plaster, medical plaster, or simply plaster in British English, is a small medical dressing used for injuries not serious enough to require a full-size bandage. They are also known by the genericized trademarks of Band-Aid or Elastoplast.
Poison oak and poison ivy cleanser is used to clean and decontaminate skin after exposure to poison ivy, oak and sumac, and can clean tools and clothing.
Lice Shampoo is used to treat lice, which are tiny insects that can infest and irritate the scalp (head lice), the pubic area (crabs), or the body.

A hernia belt or truss is designed to keep the contents of your hernia inside the abdominal wall. This is accomplished by the application of pressure over the hernia defect, much like you can do with your hand, when the hernia is uncomfortable. Many patients have used hernia belts safely as a bridge to hernia surgery.
Medical adhesive tape, or surgical tape, is used to attach bandages, gauze, and other dressings to the skin around wounds.
Liquid bandage is a topical skin treatment for minor wounds which binds to the skin to form a protective polymeric layer that keeps dirt and germs out and moisture in.
Disposable safety gloves are most commonly used safety products in the healthcare industry. These gloves are worn to prevent cross-contamination between patients and medical staff.

Feminine washes and douches are products intended to specifically clean the female genital area. These washes are usually made with more gentle materials than traditional soaps or body washes because of how sensitive the area is. They try not to affect the Ph of the body.
Guard or shield designed for men, designed to be placed within the underwear, for incontinence.

An incotinence cleaner or deodarant is a pH-balanced, non-fragranced moisturising cleanser suitable for use on sensitive skin around the genital area. Removes dried-on fluids. Soft, non-sticky skin feel for patient comfort. No-rinse formulation minimises skin rubbing and potential friction damage. A incontinence deodorant is a products that help control odors associated with urinary incontinence.
Flat absorbent pads that protect upholstery, sheets, wheelchairs and other surfaces. Available in washable and disposable styles in a variety of sizes.
A classifier for items in "Incontinence Aids" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Perineal cleansers are intended for cleaning the perineal area, typically of patients. These type of cleansers are advised to be used at least once daily to prevent infection.

A pantyliner (also pantiliner, panty liner or panty shield) is an absorbent piece of material used for feminine hygiene. It is worn in the gusset of a woman's panties. Some uses include: absorbency for daily vaginal discharge, light menstrual flow, tampon and menstrual cup backup, spotting, post-intercourse discharge, and urinary incontinence.

A menstrual cup is a menstrual hygiene device which is inserted into the vagina during menstruation. Its purpose is to collect menstrual fluid. Menstrual cups are usually made of flexible medical grade silicone, latex, or a thermoplastic isomer. They are shaped like a bell with a stem or a ring.
Feminine deodorants and sprays are intended to be used in the female genital region in order to deodorize. Most of these products can be used for anywhere on the body as well.

A tampon is a menstrual product designed to absorb blood and vaginal secretions by insertion into the vagina during menstruation. Unlike a pad, it is placed internally, inside of the vaginal canal. Once inserted correctly, a tampon is held in place by the vagina and expands as it soaks up menstrual blood.
Adult protective underwear may be helpful for a person who has incontinence. A person who has incontinence has trouble controlling urine or stool. This underwear helps absorb urine and catch stool.
Feminine wipes are clenasing cloths meant to clean the vaginal area. They can be used during menstruation or for everyday to protect from infection.
Pads or liners designed for women, designed to be placed within the underwear, for incontinence.

Vaginal moisturizers are a non-hormonal treatment designed to rehydrate your vaginal tissue and provide moisture using hydrating ingredients. They're often one of the first choices to help treat vaginal dryness related to hormonal changes and medications.
Yeast infections treatments consist of antifungal remedies. These can be either single dose or for use up to three days to cure mild infections.
Absorbent underwear worn during women's menstrual periods.
Sanitary napkins or pads absorbent pads worn in the underwear when menstruating, bleeding after birth, or recovery from other gynecologic surgery.

Reaching Aids are long handles that are sometimes fitted with a hand trigger at one end and grabber mechanism at the other that end. These items help people with limited mobility pick up items without needing to bend or overstretch.
A classifier for items in "Mobility Aids & Equipment" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Mobility Walkers are items that aid a person in walking by providing stability and support.;;Hemi Walkers are one-handed walkers that do not have wheels.;Standard Walkers do not have wheels and are just frames. ;Rolling Walkers are frames that may have 2, 3 or 4 wheels & usually come with brakes.;Rollators have 4 wheels, handlebars with brakes AND a built-in seat.
Wheelchair & Mobility Scooter Carriers are platforms that are attached to cars and trucks for the purpose of transporting wheelchairs and scooters.

Medical Supply Plate Guards are pieces of plastic, metal or similar material that are attached to a food plate (with clips or similar fastener) and serve as a bumper to prevent food from being pushed off the plate when eating. The plate guard is curved to prevent food from falling off the plate and can be used as a barrier to push food against when scooping food onto a spoon or fork, ideal for people that use only one hand when eating.
Wheelchair Cushions are cushions specifically designed to provide comfort and protection against injury for wheelchair users. They also aid in properly positioning the user in the correct posture.
A mobility scooter is an electric personal transporter used as mobility aid for people with physical impairment, mostly auxiliary to a powered wheelchair but configured like a motorscooter.

Key Turning & Grip Aids are devices that make it easier to grip and turn keys. They are very helpful for people with arthritis pain in fingers and hands or weak hand and grip strength. The item allows for the larger muscles in the hand and arm to do the work or help the fingers turn and grip keys.

Button Hook Dressing Aids are handheld tools that allow the user to button up shirts, blouses and jackets when they struggle or are unable to do it using their hands. The hook passes through the button hole and then is looped over the button and pulled back through the hole.

Wheelchair Bags & Baskets are products that allow the user to carry personal items, necessities, etc with them while using a wheelchair or scooter. These are usually attached to the wheelchair or scooter and can be detached easily.
A classifier for items in "Eating & Drinking Aids" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Transport Wheelchairs are lightweight, narrow mobility chairs that combine the functon of a traditional wheelchair with the maneuverability of a rollator or walker. They are meant to be pushed by someone other than the seated individual, as their small wheels make it impossible for the wheelchair user to propel themselves.
A classifier for items in "Dressing Aids" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Mobility Leg & Thigh Lifters are tools designed to offer support in lifting one, or both, of a patient's legs. They are designed to be used independently by a patient, so as to negate the need of additional assistance from a caregiver.
Dressing aid sticks are sticks designed to reduce bending, twisting and reaching while dressing, and can assist anyone with restrictive movement.
Measuring container for holding and dispensing the correct amount of medicine to a patient.

A wheeled mobility chair in which a person with limited mobility can become mobile and independent again. These wheelchairs can either be propelled by the person in the wheelchair or be pushed by a care giver.
Mobility Walker Flip Trays are open receptacles with a flat bottoms and low rims for holding, carrying, or exhibiting items. These trays are specifically designed to be mounted to mobility walkers.
Clothing Protectors & Adult Bibs are designed to protect the person's clothes from getting soiled, typically while eating. These items may be made up of fabric or disposable materials.
Pill Organizers are multicompartment compliance aids for storing scheduled doses of medications. These are also known as pill containers, dosette boxes, pillcases or pillboxes.

Mobility Aid Steps are designed to assist disabled or elderly people with mobility problems, negotiate steps around the home or reach into high cupboards. The steps can halve a step height enabling easier access in and around the home.

Lift chairs are medical devices designed to aid individuals with mobility impairments. These products enable a mobility impaired individual to safely rise, sit or recline in the chair and many models contain additional features designed to assist with other impairments.

A mobility ramp is an inclined plane installed in addition to or instead of stairs. Ramps permit wheelchair users, as well as people pushing strollers, carts, or other wheeled objects, to more easily access a building, or navigate between areas of different height.

Electric Wheelchairs are chairs fitted with wheels that are propelled by an electrically based power source, typically motors and batteries, and are used as a means of transport by a person who is unable to walk as a result of illness, injury, or disability.
A classifier for items in "Mobility Walker Accessories" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Mobility Walker Wheels are circular objects that revolve on an axle and are affixed on the end of a walker leg to enable the walker to move easily over the ground.

Mobility Lift Cushions are seat cushions that have a lifting mechanism in them that assist the seated person to stand up by gently pushing them up and out of the sitting position. They can be manual or motor powered. They are similar to the lifting chair, except these are the seats only, not the whole chair.

Mobility Walker Bags, Baskets & Carriers are products that allow the user to carry personal items, necessities, etc with them while using a walker. These are usually attached to the walker and can be detached easily.

Therapeutic Light Boxes mimic outdoor light. It's thought that this type of light may cause a chemical change in the brain that lifts the mood and eases other symptoms of SAD, such as being tired most of the time and sleeping too much. Generally, the light box should: Provide an exposure to 10,000 lux of light and produce as little UV light as possible.

Medical Alert Devices are systems that provide emergency monitoring in and out of the home. They are designed to signal an emergency requiring urgent attention and to call emergency medical personnel.
Sock Dressing Aids are assistive devices that allow the user to put on socks or stockings more easily despite pain and physical limitations.
Mobility Walker Glides & Balls are items that are installed on the ends of the legs of a mobility walker. These help the walker smoothly & quietly move across most surfaces.

Medical Supply Utensil Holders & Cuffs are items that help people hold & use utensils. They are designed to give persons with limited grip, hand strength, or dexterity controlled use of items such as eating utensils, toothbrushes, writing tools, and other small items.

Wheelchair Lap Trays are receptacles with a flat bottoms and low rims for holding, carrying, or exhibiting items and sometimes come with built in cup holder wells. These trays are specifically designed to be used by wheelchair riders.;Wheelchair Cup Holders are items that allow the wheelchair user to carry cups on their chairs.

Knee Walker Scooters are medical mobility devices that provide a safe, comfortable, and easy-to-maneuver alternative to crutches for those recovering from below the knee injury or surgery, which requires the foot and/or leg to be non-weight bearing during recovery.

Pill Crushers & Splitters are devices that can cut pills down to smaller sizes, or mash the pill into powder to aid in taking the medication or controlling the dosage. ;;Pill Crushers break tablets down to powder or small pieces using pressure or force. ;Pill Grinders reduce tablets down to fine powder using friction (as in a mill or with teeth).;Pill Splitters cut pills or tablets into equal parts, comprising some means of holding the tablet in place, a blade, and usually a compartment in which to store the unused part. The tablet is positioned, and the blade pressed down to split it.

Medical ID Bracelets have a person's medical information inscribed on it. It provides emergency health workers with information about any conditions or allergies a person may have, or other concerns that may be relevant to their care, in the event they become unconscious or otherwise incapacitated.
A hot or cold wax used to remove hair. It is sometimes included in a kit/bundle along with applicators and other pieces needed to completely remove the hair.
A classifier for items in "Hair Removal Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A process/treatment done prior to epliating (removing hair). This course of treatment often includes cleansing with a special soap, applying lotion, cream, or pre-wax oil and exfoliation of the skin.
Machine used to warm wax - primarily used with depilatory waxes (hair removal) and/or paraffin waxes.

A chemical, cosmetic preparation used to remove hair from the skin. Common active ingredients are salts of thioglycolic acid and thiolactic acids. These compounds break the disulfide bonds in keratin and also hydrolyze the hair so that it is easily removed.
A tool used to apply wax to the skin in order to remove hair. Common tools are wooden (popsicle) sticks, special spatulas, tongue depressors, etc.

A type of permanent hair removal technique that is done by a dermatologist. It disrupts hair growth. The process works by inserting an epilator device into the skin's hair follicles. It uses shortwave radio frequencies, chemical or heat energy in the hair follicles to stop new hair from growing. This damages your hair follicles to prevent growth and causes existing hairs to fall out - or can be pulled/removed with tweezers. You’ll still need multiple follow-up appointments for the best results.
Derma-planing tools consist of a scalpel blade used to exfoliate facial dead skin cells and fine hairs or peach fuzz to improve skin texture.

A skin freshener that is specially designed to soothe inflamed skin caused by hair removal treatment. It is a clear gel which instantly gives a cooling sensation on the irritated skin to reduce the stinging feeling. Usually oil-free so as to not clog pores, and also contains an active ingredient like menthol, cucumber or aloe vera.

A strip of material pre-cut to a determinate size, that is already loaded with hair removal wax. The strips are rubbed/pressed onto the skin and then peeled off. Usually, these do not require heating prior to application.

An epilator is an electrical device used to remove hair by mechanically grasping multiple hairs simultaneously and pulling them out. The way in which epilators pull out hair is similar to waxing, but unlike waxing, they do not remove cells from the epidermis.

This technical beauty tool is used to remove hair from the body. Specially problem areas. some of the devices are smaller that cater to a hard to reach area (to used for lip, side burns, bikini etc.). Most are used for general body hair. Epilators, Trimmers, Clippers.
https://editorial.walmart.com/catalog/pcf_product_details/canonical?product_id=4ZZYD5M1Z1OK&tenantId=0
The flashlight attaches to a standard cane and other mobility equipment to help ensure safe maneuvering in the dark.
Cane accessories are additional items that enhance the usage of the Cane. They can also be decorative accessories.
A device used primarily to aid walking, provide postural stability or support, or assist in maintaining a good posture.
Handgrips provide a stable gripping surface for the user. They also protect the hands and fingers from calluses, sores and minor abrasions.
Crutch tips are gripping pads attached to the bottom of the crutch. They help the crutch grip better on certain surfaces. They can also protect the flooring from the bottom of the crutch.

A crutch is a mobility aid that transfers weight from the legs to the upper body. It is often used by people who cannot use their legs to support their weight, for reasons ranging from short-term injuries to lifelong disabilities.
Crutch pads eliminate chafing, soreness, rashes and blisters while also reducing painful pressure on your armpits and hands.

Walking cane holders are small devices that hold walking canes and/or walking sticks. The can help the cane stand upright on the floor, clip to the edge of a table or other solid surface with and edge, or even hook to a belt for easy carrying.
Self Tan Removers washes away the fake tan before it has a chance to sink into the skin and react
A topical product applied on the skin that absorbs or reflects some of the sun's ultraviolet (UV) radiation and thus helps protect against sunburn.
A moisturizing lotion applied to the skin to soothe sunburn and avoid peeling. Some after skin care has a cooling effect on the skin.
Tanning oils are products designed to help people get a tan, typically quickly.
A product applied to the skin to give a temporary darker color. Is does not contain self-tanning chemicals- it's essentially a dye.
Lotions, sprays, or oils that use DHA to give skin the look of a sun tan. Body self-tanners are in larger containers and are formulated for the skin on legs, arms, etc.
A tanning bed, also known as a sun-bed, is a machine used to produce an artificial tan by using UV lights.
A lotion that uses DHA along with the skin's amino acids to give the look of a natural tan. Facial self-tanners are formulated especially for the sensitive skin of the face.

Airbrush Tanning is applied by a technician using a compressor and airbrush. These tanning solutions contain the active ingredient DHA that reacts with the outer layer of skin to produce a bronzing effect, similar to what a natural tan does.

Facial Sunscreens help to prevent sunburn and premature aging (such as wrinkles, leathery skin). Sunscreens also help to decrease the risk of skin cancer and also of sunburn-like skin reactions (sun sensitivity) caused by some medications.

A CPAP Tubing is a cylindrical hollow plastic tube that connects the CPAP machine to the CPAP mask. Air is compressed in the CPAP machine and then delivered through the hose to the mask. A heated hose prevents rainout by maintaining the air temperature as the air travels from the machine to the mask.

A nasal strip is a type of adhesive bandage with embedded plastic ribs or splints that is applied across the bridge of the nose and sides of the nostrils, to assist in keeping the airway open. They are believed to make breathing easier and for that reason are used during athletic exertion and as an aid to reduce congestion or to prevent snoring

Sleep Masks is a garment, usually of cloth, tied to one's head to cover the eyes to disable the wearer's sight. They block out light when sleeping, especially during air travel, or for those who sleep during the day, given that shutting out light allows the user to achieve a deeper level of sleep.
A classifier for items in "Sleep Aids" that do not have a dedicated PT.

A component of a CPAP Machine which is fit over the user's nose and/or mouth in order to supply increased air pressure to the user.
May or may not be sold together with headgear, and may come in different configurations and materials.
Filters which are made specifically for CPAP Machines, which filters the air intake of the cpap machine so that dust and foreign particles are not supplied to the user.
A type of cleaning machine that is used for sanitizing and disinfecting CPAP accessories such as CPAP mask and hose.
An ergonomically designed pillow which supports the neck and head to aid in keeping airways open for the purpose of reducing snoring.
The strap which connects to a CPAP mask and is fit around the user's head in order to keep the mask in place.

A CPAP machine is a device which aids individuals with obstructive sleep apnea to breathe more easily during sleep by increasing the air pressure in the individual's throat, preventing airway collapse when they breathe in.  
The fully connected device consists of an air intake system with filter, a humidification chamber, tubing and a mask which can come in varying styles and air delivery methods.  The CPAP machine may or may not be sold together with the aforementioned components.
A strap which cups the chin and wraps around the back of the head in order to prevent the opening of the jaw while sleeping and reduce/prevent snoring.
A pillow which is specifically designed to provide more comfort during CPAP use, and may contain features such as recessed sides or bottoms to accommodate a CPAP mask or tubing.
Hair trimmers with a small circular blade that spins inside the nose and ear to remove hair growth and follicles.
The head of an electric razor containing both the foil and the cutting blades.

A non-powered blade used for cutting facial or bodily hair.  May come in several different forms, such as a safety razor, straight razor, cartridge based razor with interchangeable blade cartridges, etc.

Hair-cutting shears are scissors that are specifically designed for cutting hair. They are also known as barber shears, hairdressing shears, or hair shears. They range in size from about 5 to 7 inches long and commonly have an appendage, known as a finger brace or tang, attached to one of the finger rings.
Grooming kit is a set of grooming tools which has brushes, combs, razors and various attachments.

Hair clipper guides also known as clipper combs, clipper guards, attachment guards, or attachment combs are tools that help to measure the length of hair while cutting They are designed to fit onto hair clipper's blades.
Replacement Blades for hair clippers.
A razor is a bladed tool primarily used in the removal of body hair through the act of shaving. Razor replacement heads are refills for your razor.
It is used for styling and shaping the hair in cuts like the shag cut and boy cut.

A hair clipper, a specialized tool used to cut head hair. Hair clippers work on the same principle as scissors, but are distinct from scissors themselves and razors. Trimmers normally have a more specified use dependent on location and length of hair desired.
Aftershave helps in reducing itching and swelling from skin damage and ingrown hairs. Closing pores to prevent bacteria, dirt, or chemicals from getting in.
A classifier for items in "Shaving Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Electric razors an electrical device for shaving, with oscillating or rotating blades behind a metal guard.
Cleaning solutions, meant for cleaning electric shaver blades.
Grooming tools, meant for chest and/or Intimate areas. They often are slightly larger than beard trimmers, with more attachments to accommodate body hair removal.
A tool suitable for a range of grooming needs such as haircutting, beard & stubble trimming, all-over body grooming, and personal trimming.
Cape designed to be worn at the time of cutting or styling hair.

Shaving cream and Balm creates a thin layer of protection between the blade and the skin, ensuring less friction and minimizing the risk of redness, razor burn, and irritation – and fewer nicks and cuts.
An set of items which contains various shaving related products such as aftershaves, manual shaving razors, electric shavers, shaving creams, shaving balms, etc.
Aftershave treatments are used to treat your skin after shaving to fix various issues; such as in grown hairs or razor bumps.
Small, weighted balls that are inserted into the vagina. They can be used to strengthen the pelvic floor muscles, which help control bladder flow and may improve sexual pleasure.
A tool used to perform the act of rinsing the rectum with intent to clean it.
Devices utilized in masturbation
Games intended to heighten the sexual atmosphere and promote foreplay.
Devices meant for massage or sexual stimulation.
Objects intended to be inserted into a person's anus for the purpose of sexual pleasure.
These are creams/gels applied prior to intercourse in order to desensitize the genital area to enhance endurance. These are most often used by men.

Doing Kegel exercises can help strengthen your pelvic floor muscles. This can help you tighten the vagina and manage or prevent physical problems such as incontinence. There are also kegel exercisers that are meant for sexual pleasure with a vibrating feature.
Small suction cups or a small vacuum applied to the clitoris, vagina, or entire vulva prior to sexual intercourse.
An object shaped like an erect penis used for sexual stimulation.
Devices that claim to enlarge or enhance a penis.
Ring fits around the base of the penis, or the penis and testicles, and applies pressure to the surrounding area.
These are creams intended to increase the blood flow to the genital area to enhance sensitivity and rates or orgasm.
Asthma inhalers are hand-held, portable devices that deliver medication to your lungs, whether medicated or natural.
Nasal irrigators are used to flush excess mucus and other debris from the nose and sinus passages.
A heating pad is a pad sued for warming of parts of the body in order to manage pain. It has localized application.
Product that can speed the healing and reduce recurrence of cold sores that are small blisters around the mouth caused by the herpes simplex virus.
Nicotine patch is a device that delivers nicotine to the body. It is used as an aid in nicotine replacement therapy, a process for smoking cessation and quitting smokeless tobacco.

A transdermal patch is a modern technique of pain management designed to treat chronic pain and other conditions. Also known as a skin patch, a transdermal patch is a medicated adhesive patch, which is placed on the skin to deliver regular doses of medication into the bloodstream through the skin.
Nicotine gum is a type of chewing gum that delivers nicotine to the body. It is used as an aid in nicotine replacement therapy, a process for smoking cessation and quitting smokeless tobacco.
A patch or wrap that uses heat when activated to relive pain or soreness on a targeted part of the body.
A product aimed to absorb and remove a poison if it's accidentally consumed.
A tens unit is a method of pain relief involving the use of a mild electric current. The electrodes are the actual adhesive patches that are attached to the users skins.

Medicines sold directly to a consumer without a requirement for a prescription from a healthcare professional, as opposed to prescription drugs, which may be supplied only to consumers possessing a valid prescription.
A small tube like device which may or may not contain nicotine, and replaces the oral fixation and hand/mouth habit of smoking a real cigarette without the smoke.  Aids in the cessation of smoking.
Products that are designed to lessen the appearance of a scar.
Retractor device that holds a patient's lips, cheek, and mouth in an open position.

Toothpaste is used to promote oral hygiene: it is an abrasive that aids in removing dental plaque and food from the teeth, assists in suppressing halitosis, and delivers active ingredients to help prevent tooth decay and gum disease.
Denture adhesives are pastes, powders or adhesive pads that may be placed in/on dentures to help them stay in place.
Dental restoration piece that covers only a tooth's front surface.

Gum stimulators are time-efficient, multipurpose instruments that improve overall oral health. They primarily stimulate the gum tissue to strengthen it against infection, but they also help with cavity prevention by assisting food and plaque removal.
A classifier for items in "Denture Care" that do not have a dedicated PT.
A retainer is a custom-made, removable or fixed appliance that helps teeth maintain their new position after braces have been removed. Retainers can also be used to treat minor orthodontic problems.

Night guards are also known as dental guards, mouth guards, nocturnal bite plates, or bite splints. They work by putting a barrier between your teeth. When you clench your jaw, the night guard helps to lighten the tension and give cushion to the muscles in the jaw.

Dental floss is a cord of thin filaments used in interdental cleaning to remove food and dental plaque from between teeth or places a toothbrush has difficulty reaching or is unable to reach. Its regular use as part of oral cleaning is designed to maintain oral health.
A floss pick is a specially designed, D-shaped piece of plastic with a handle that contains a short, taut piece of floss stretched between two posts.
Tongue scrapers have been touted as a way to reduce or eliminate bad breath (halitosis).

A manual toothbrush is a hand-held brush made out of hard plastic. The toothbrush has soft plastic bristles for cleaning the gums and between the teeth. Manual toothbrushes are manipulated by the person using it, moving the brush up and down over the teeth and gums to remove plaque, food, and debris.
Lip guard covers your brackets to protect your lips.
An electric toothbrush is a toothbrush that makes rapid automatic bristle motions, either back-and-forth oscillation or rotation-oscillation, in order to clean teeth.
Night guard & Retainer Cases, are to restore your retainer and nightguard when not in use.
Floss holder is a supplementary tool for flossing. It is suitable for parents or caregivers in helping children or individuals with special care needs to clean the adjacent surfaces of their teeth.

Mouthwash, mouth rinse, oral rinse, or mouth bath is a liquid which is held in the mouth passively or swirled around the mouth by contraction of the perioral muscles and/or movement of the head, and may be gargled, where the head is tilted back and the liquid bubbled at the back of the mouth.
Orthodontic Elastics are used during orthodontic treatment to help move the teeth and align the bite of the upper and lower teeth. Used in conjunction with braces.
A product used by mouth to improve and freshen one's breath (e.g., mouth spray, mint drops, mint strips, etc.).

An oral irrigator is a home dental care device which uses a stream of high-pressure pulsating water intended to remove dental plaque and food debris between teeth and below the gum line. Regular use of an oral irrigator is believed to improve gingival health.
A water flosser is a device that aims a stream of water at the teeth. It's also called an oral irrigator or a dental water jet.
A classifier for items in "Orthodontic Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Orthodontic Kits are a pre-assembled collection of ortho specific aids or tools that patients can use on a regular basis and contain everything they need to clean and maintain their braces between meals and snacks.
Teeth whitening removes all kinds of stains.
The Gum Stimulator rubber tip massages the gums and helps to dislodge food particles and dental plaque to clean between the teeth.

Denture cleanser is used to clean dentures when they are out of the mouth. It helps in controlling the growth of microorganisms on the dentures, especially Candida albicans, thereby preventing denture-related stomatitis.
The replacements heads are the new head for the electric toothbrush.
Toothbrush covers protect any manual toothbrush and helps keep the brush head hygienically clean. The toothbrush covers can be used at home, or outside the home for travel, work, school or camping.
Denture Repairs Kits help in fixing the breaks, also mend Cracks and replaces the loose teeth.
Oral sponges or foam swabs are used to maintain oral hygiene in hospital and long-term care patients who cannot tolerate brushing with a regular toothbrush.
A toothbrush sanitizer is a device used to disinfect the tooth brush by applying short-wavelength ultraviolet (UV-C) light to kill or inactivate microorganisms.

A mouth mirror or dentist's mirror is an instrument used in dentistry. The head of the mirror is usually round, and the most common sizes used are No. 4 and No. 5. A No. 2 is sometimes used when a smaller mirror is needed, such as when working on back teeth with a dental dam in place.

Interdental brushes help to prevent gum disease by getting rid of pieces of food and plaque from between your teeth. They have small bristled heads designed to clean between your teeth, and they come in different widths to suit the sizes of the gaps.

A dental floss pick is a small plastic tool with a curved end that holds a piece of dental floss. And there's a bonus—the other end of a floss pick features a small plastic pick that can be used instead of a wooden toothpick to remove large food particles that can get caught along the gum line or between the teeth.
Orthodontic wax is specially designed to relieve pain caused by orthodontic treatment. It creates a barrier which prevents further irritation and allows time for the mouth to heal.
Dentures Cases used for storing mouth guards, dental guard, false teeth, night guard, Invisalign, pacifiers, teethers, gum shields, bite guards.
Dental restoration that covers (or caps) a tooth or dental implant.  The crown typically encases the entire tooth including the top and sides.

A drink intended as a substitute for a solid food, a meal replacement beverage, usually with controlled quantities of calories and nutrients; could come in powdered form or pre-mixed  shakes, smoothies, etc..
