A meal replacement bar is intended as a substitute for a complete solid meal (often intended for weight management) and contains controlled quantities of calories, protein, and other nutrients.

Nutrition drinks, also known as meal replacement or protein shakes, are beverages designed to provide a balance of essential nutrients. They are typically used as a convenient and quick source of nutrition when regular meals are not possible or as a supplement to support specific dietary needs. Nutrition drinks often contain a combination of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals in varying proportions. They may also include additional ingredients like fiber, probiotics, antioxidants, or specific nutrients targeted for certain health conditions.

Nutrition bars, gels, and chews are food products designed to provide quick and convenient sources of energy and nutrients for athletes, fitness enthusiasts, and people on the go. 

1. Nutrition bars: These are small, portable bars that are typically made from a combination of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. They come in various flavors and are often fortified with vitamins and minerals. Nutrition bars can be consumed as a snack or meal replacement to provide sustained energy and support muscle recovery.

2. Gels: Energy gels are highly concentrated carbohydrate-based products that usually come in single-serving packets. They are designed to be consumed during endurance activities like long-distance running or cycling. Gels are quickly absorbed by the body and provide a rapid source of energy to sustain performance.

3. Chews: Energy chews are bite-sized, chewy candies that contain a combination of carbohydrates, electrolytes, and sometimes caffeine or other ingredients. They are often used by athletes during prolonged exercise to maintain energy levels and replenish electrolytes lost through sweat.

These products are specifically formulated to be easily digestible, convenient to carry, and provide a quick source of energy and nutrients. They can be useful during intense workouts or as a convenient snack option for individuals with busy lifestyles.
A classifier for items in "Weight Loss Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.

An otoscope or auriscope is a medical device which is used to look into the ears. Health care providers use otoscopes to screen for illness during regular check-ups and also to investigate ear symptoms. An otoscope potentially gives a view of the ear canal and tympanic membrane or eardrum.

Table paper is marketed for several purposes, from baby changing tables to examination and treatment tables in various branches of the medical field.  But the use is always to act as a hygienic barrier for the surfaces to which its applied.

A catheter is a thin tube made from medical grade materials serving a broad range of functions. Catheters are medical devices that can be inserted in the body to treat diseases or perform a surgical procedure. The typical use is to remove urine from the body during a surgical procedure.
An insulin pen/injector is an injection device with a needle that delivers insulin into the subcutaneous tissue (the tissue between your skin and muscle).

Stands designed to support the instrument trays (see product type 'Instrument Trays') utilized during surgery or other medical procedures. These may or may not be mobile, and may or may not be supplied with an instrument tray.
Rails mounted to a bed that assist a patient or user with sitting, standing, and laying down. They also keep the patient/user from falling out of the bed.

Skin prep pads are either a wipe that provides a protective barrier on the skin to protect it from medical tape and bandages OR a product that helps prep/clean the skin for a medical procedure, such as getting an injection.

These are accessories that are utilized with or attached to a stethoscope. The stethoscope is an acoustic medical device for auscultation, or listening to internal sounds of an animal or human body. It typically has a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the skin, and one or two tubes connected to two earpieces.

A non-rebreather mask is a device used in medicine to assist in the delivery of oxygen therapy. A NRB requires that the patient can breathe unassisted, but unlike a low-flow nasal cannula, the NRB allows for the delivery of higher concentrations of oxygen.
An enema is a procedure in which liquid or gas is injected into the rectum, typically to expel its contents, but also to introduce drugs or permit X-ray imaging.
A medical bag (doctor's bag, physician's bag) is a portable bag used by a physician or other medical professional to transport medical supplies and medicine.

Personal misters provide a means to carry a relatively small amount of liquid (usually water or a water solution) which can be dispensed as an aerosol over exposed skin in order to provide an evaporative cooling effect that mimics perspiration.

Instrument trays protect medical instruments in several ways. They hold instruments during the sterilization process in an autoclave, protecting them from damage. The trays are useful for transporting medical instruments from one location to another.

An overbed table a narrow rectangular table designed especially for hospital patients that spans the bed and is typically fitted with casters and a crank for adjusting the height and tilting the top. There are some made for home use as well.
A pet tick remover tool is used to remove ticks from pets.

A feeding tube is a medical device used to provide nutrition to people who cannot obtain nutrition by mouth, are unable to swallow safely, or need nutritional supplementation. The state of being fed by a feeding tube is called gavage, enteral feeding or tube feeding.

Urine drainage bags collect urine. Your bag will attach to a catheter (tube) that is inside your bladder. You may have a catheter and urine drainage bag because you have urinary incontinence (leakage), urinary retention (not being able to urinate), surgery that made a catheter necessary, or another health problem.

A respiration flow meter is a portable, inexpensive, hand-held device that measures your ability to push air out of your lungs. Air flow is measured by the amount of air that you can blow out in one "fast blast." Peak flow meters come in two ranges to measure the air pushed out of your lungs.
A gurney is a bed on wheels that is used in hospitals for moving patients and or injured people.

The stethoscope is a medical device for auscultation, or listening to internal sounds of an animal or human body. It typically has a small disc-shaped resonator that is placed against the skin, with either one or two tubes connected to two earpieces.
Spirometry is a standard test doctors use to measure how well your lungs are functioning. This tool is used to facilitate the test by measuring airflow into and out of the lungs.
A flexible tube with a light and camera attached to it, used to view the body's internal organs.
Chemical-filled pouch that will safely deactivate medicine before disposal.

A hospital bed or hospital cot is a bed specially designed for hospitalized patients or others in need of some form of health care. These beds have special features both for the comfort and well-being of the patient and for the convenience of health care workers.

A tongue depressor is a tool used in medical practice to depress the tongue to allow for examination of the mouth and throat. The most common modern tongue depressors are flat, thin, wooden blades, smoothed and rounded at both ends.

An oxygen concentrator is a device that concentrates the oxygen from a gas supply by selectively removing nitrogen to supply an oxygen-enriched product gas stream. They are used industrially and as medical devices for oxygen therapy.
A health care patient transfer board is used to help a patient to another seated position on a chair, bed or wheelchair. It is a long, smooth board usually about two feet long.

A patient lift may be either a sling lift or a sit-to-stand lift. This is an assistive device that allows patients in hospitals and nursing homes and people receiving home health care to be transferred between a bed and a chair or other similar resting places, by the use of electrical or hydraulic power.

In medicine, a nebulizer or nebuliser is a drug delivery device used to administer medication in the form of a mist inhaled into the lungs. They can also use only saline for additional benefits for the sinuses & lungs. Nebulizers are commonly used for the treatment of asthma, cystic fibrosis, COPD and other respiratory diseases or disorders.
Small hand tools used for grasping objects too small to be easily handled with the human fingers.

Ultrasound gel is a thick substance typically composed of water and propylene glycol, a synthetic compound often found in food and cosmetic or hygiene products. It has a sticky consistency, allowing it to be spread over the skin without dripping or running off. It is a medium that is used in many routine exams, treatments and procedures and it has a wide range of purposes.

A massage table is used by massage therapists to position the client to receive a massage. Most are made with client comfort and therapist ergonomics in mind. A typical table has an easily cleaned, heavily padded surface, and a face cradle that allows the client to breathe easily while lying face down.

A massage chair is a chair designed for massages. It can refer to two types of products. Traditional massage chairs allow a massage therapist to easily access the head, shoulders, and back of a massage recipient, while robotic massage chairs use electronic vibrators and motors to provide a massage.

A white noise machine, also known as a sound machine, can help you create a more relaxing bedroom or nursery environment that promotes healthy, high-quality sleep. In addition to white noise and other noise colors, these devices often produce ambient and natural sounds such as chirping birds and crashing waves.

These are covers that slip over the massage headrest to allow extra comfort for the person getting the massage as well as protect them from germs from anyone who may have gotten a massage before him/her. They can be reusable/washable or disposable, whichever is the preference of the massage therapist or facility. The sheets can absorb sweat, lotion, and excess oil used in a massage therapy.

Aromatherapy is a holistic healing treatment that uses natural plant extracts to promote health and well-being. Sometimes it's called essential oil therapy. Aromatherapy uses aromatic essential oils medicinally to improve the health of the body, mind, and spirit. ;;Essential oils are concentrated extracts harvested from plants, herbs, and trees, which are carefully steam distilled or cold pressed.
Massage Table Covers help protect the massage table and keep the experience sanitary for clients. These are typically like bed sheets and are changed out between clients.

A bolster is essentially a cushion to elevate a part of the body on a patient. They are used in massage therapy but also, yoga practices. They can help re-position the body in a more comfortable position, allowing a therapist to do what they do without sacrificing the patient's enjoyment. Often times they are placed under the knees when the client is face up and under the ankles when the client is face down. There are also bolsters used for pregnant clients.

A face cradle is a specialized attachment for a massage table which is designed to accommodate someone's face while he or she lies stomach-down on the table. There is a hole for the face to rest in, so the user can breathe freely while getting a massage.
Magnetic therapy is a pseudoscientific alternative medicine practice involving the weak static magnetic field produced by a permanent magnet which is placed on the body.

A stress ball or hand exercise ball is a malleable toy, usually not more than 7 centimetres in diameter. It is squeezed in the hand and manipulated by the fingers, ostensibly to relieve stress and muscle tension or to exercise the muscles of the hand. Despite the name, many stress balls are not spherical.
Massage oils & Lotions are substances used to reduce friction during massage therapy. They may also produce aromas that can further the relaxation and beneficial effects of massage.
Massage Table Carrying Cases used for transporting/carrying portable/foldable massage tables,
Massagers are devices that use varyng massage techniques to help relax the muscles and decrease muscle tension. These can vary from massage guns to a neck & shoulder massage device.
Like a foam roller, a massage ball can also be used to help release tension in achy muscles after long hours spent in the office or after a workout.
Massage Oil Warmers warm the massage oil, so that it's a more pleasant experience for the client/person who is getting a massage. It also makes the oil easier to spread.
A cold treatment room can make a massage service an unpleasant experience. Massage table warmers help the client relax and have a better massage experience.
A backscratcher is a tool used for relieving an itch in an area that cannot easily be reached just by one's own hands, the acnestis, typically the back.

A seat cushion massager worksis a massage device that is placed on a chair/seat. It uses nodes or rollers that work to stimulate the muscles to relieve tension and improve circulation. There is usually a heating element that will help loosen the muscles even further.
An at-home kit designed for testing common STDs and other sexual health related bacteria.
Lead Testing Kits are used for lead-detection in water and on surfaces such as painted surfaces, steel structures, vinyl and other plastics.
An at-home kit designed for general health, body function, and organ related testing (i.e., liver, kidney, thyroid, anemia, and blood panels function testing).

These are kits that include all of the materials necessary to take localized samples that can then be screened for the presence of mold within an environment (typically residential property).
Most often providing a prepaid mailer for shipping the samples to a specific laboratory for analysis.
HIV test looks for HIV antibodies in your blood or saliva.

These are kits that include all of the materials necessary to take biological samples that can then be used to provide a DNA profile of the subject.
Most often providing a prepaid mailer for shipping the samples to a specific laboratory for analysis.
An at-home designed kit for testing hormone levels.

A test that examines a bodily specimen (as of urine, saliva, blood, or hair) for the presence of one or more usually illegal or banned substances (such as cocaine, methamphetamine, alcohol, or anabolic steroids).
An at-home kit designed for testing various infectious diseases (aside from 'COVID' - has its own PT) such as STREP, FLU A, FLU B, RSV, Lyme disease, etc..
An at-home kit intended for seasonal, environmental, and food allergy testing.
An at-home kit designed for gut microbiome and bacteria testing.
Colo-rectal Disease Tests is an exam used to detect changes or abnormalities in the large intestine (colon) and rectum.

These are kits that include all of the materials necessary to take localized samples that can then be screened for the presence of Radon gas.
Most often providing a prepaid mailer for shipping the samples to a specific laboratory for analysis.
An at-home kit designed for testing for the COVID-19 coronavirus.
cholesterol test kits measure total cholesterol, and the more advanced options provide HDL and triglycerides readings as well

Urinary Tract Infection Test Strips are used to test if the user has a urinary tract infection, aka a UTI. They can measure calcium, blood, glucose, bilirubin, urobilinogen, ketones, leukocytes, creatinine, microalbumin, pH, ascorbic acid and protein.
Individual strips designed to detect the presence of alcohol in bodily fluids.

A blindfold is a garment, usually of cloth, tied to one's head to cover the eyes to disable the wearer's sight. While a properly fitted blindfold prevents sight even if the eyes are open, a poorly tied or trick blindfold may let the wearer see around or even through the blindfold.
Non-costume, medical eye patch often worn to cover a lost or injured eye.
A case in which contact lenses are stored. They help clean and keep the contacts moist so they don't dry out.
Repair kits that contain everything you'd need to make small repairs to glasses. Ex: screws, tweezers, screwdrivers, nose pads, etc.
Contact lens solution is designed to be used when rinsing, storing and cleaning your lenses. It works to kill bacteria and keep your contact lenses safe when they come into contact with your eyes.
Cleaners that are specifically formulated to clean eyeglass lenses. Some cleaners are formulated for various features, like anti-glare; specific ingredients can and cannot be used on the lenses.

Soft contact lenses are made of soft, flexible plastics that allow oxygen to pass through to the cornea—the clear dome that covers the colored part of the eye. This lens material may be easier to adjust to and provide better initial comfort than hard, or rigid gas permeable, contact lenses.

Liquid drops applied directly to the surface of the eye, particularly the human eye, usually in small amounts such as a single drop or a few drops. Eye drops usually contain saline to match the salinity of the eye. There are drops for dry eyes, allergies, pink eye, etc.
These are products you use to clean, disinfect, and store your contact lenses.
Eyeglasses that are specifically designed to help a user see text better while reading.
Batteries that are used in hearing aids
Eyeglass frames that do not contain any magnification in the lenses. These frames are for style only.
A case in which glasses are stored to protect them from scratches and other damage.

A device that allows for accurate eyedrop installation in a number of ways. It can hold the eye open and directs the drops. It can also clip into place and position the bottle at the correct angle over the eye.
A rigid gas-permeable lens, also known as an RGP lens, GP lens, or colloquially, a hard contact lens, is a rigid contact lens made of oxygen-permeable polymers.
Cleaning cloths that are used to specifically to clean eye glasses

A hearing aid is a device designed to improve hearing by making sound audible to a person with hearing loss. Hearing aids are classified as medical devices in most countries, and regulated by the respective regulations.

Eye ointments are medicines in an ointment form. They are used when the medicine needs to work directly in your eye to relieve or treat eye conditions. Eye ointments are used to treat conditions such as dry eyes or eye infections (such as conjunctivitis)
Devices that can be placed in the ear to amplify sounds.  Sound amplifiers make ALL sounds louder, unlike a hearing aids which amplify specific sounds based on their audio characteristics.
These are kits that contain all the items needed in order to clean hearing aids from cleaning wipes, tube cleaners, wax guards, cleaning brushes, etc.
Handheld devices designed to be used to place a contact lens over the lens of the eye.
Eyeglasses specially designed to be worn while looking at a computer screen.
Clear or tinted lens designed to be used as a visual aid positioned in front of the eyes, held in place by eyeglass frames.

Handheld magnifiers are small portable magnification devices that help people with low vision read a menu, food labels, and appliance dials. They come in a variety of sizes, with or without a handle. Patients can wear certain handheld magnifiers as a pendant around the neck for easy accessibility.
A Blood pressure monitor or blood pressure gauge, is a device used to measure blood pressure.

A breath alcohol monitor measure how much alcohol is in the air your breathe out. The device uses that measurement to estimate how much alcohol is in your blood. That number is known as your BAC, or blood alcohol content.
Ear Thermometer Replacement Lens Filters is used to assure accuracy and sanitary practice, change or clean lens filters after each use
Pulse oximetry is a test used to measure the oxygen level (oxygen saturation) of the blood.
Body Weight Scales measure weight by measuring the amount of force exerted on the load cell.
A classifier for items in "Health Monitors" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Body Fat Analyzers determine the amount of body fat that a persons body contains. Some Body Fat Analyzers also contains other fact of body composition such as muscle percentage, Body Mass Index (BMI) etc.
A medical thermometer (also called clinical thermometer) is used for measuring human or animal body temperature.

Cholesterol Monitors test for total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, TG, and blood glucose levels to determine whether your cholesterol is high and to estimate your risk of heart attacks and other forms of heart disease and diseases of the blood vessels.
This PT has been created to have a home for parts/pieces and accessories for health monitors.
Disposable probe covers for thermometers used to create a barrier between the thermometer and the person being tested, reducing the risk of cross-contamination.
Callus Remover Replacement Screens are replacement abbrasive materials that help smooth skin. They are usually used with a corn/callus trimmer or foot files.
A classifier for items in "Foot Care" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Orthotics products designed to help straighten bent toes, realign joints, and improve circulation. Used for both treatment and prevention
Moisturizing socks are socks that are specifically made with materials like gel and aloe vera the user wears (typically overnight) to soften the skin on the feet

Bunion pads generally come in two sizes. The first is a sock-like design that slips over most of the foot and covers the side of the big toe where the bunion is located. The second bunion pad model, often referred to as a bunion cushion, is usually a small gel cushion that can be placed over the bunion with an adhesive.

Foot soaks are mixtures of ingredients usually involving epsom salt crystals and other ingredients that are used in warm water to help soothem soften, and moisturize the feet. Foot Soaks also contain at-home foot spa baths and foot soak basins that foot soak products can be used in.

Moleskin is a heavy cotton fabric, woven and then sheared to create a short, soft pile on one side. The feel and appearance of its nap is similar to felt or chamois, but less plush than velour. It is typically used as adhesive pads stuck to the skin to prevent blisters.
Foot creams & lotions are moisturizers used to help condition feet with dry skin

Foot scrubs are a mixture of materials made into a scrub/creamy exfoliant paste that are used to soften and smooth skin on the feet. It can get in between the toes as well to help remove any dead skin.
Corn & Callus Remover Cushions are typically medicated pads that are placed onto corns/calluses to soften the skin and/or remove the rough skin.
Wart removers are items that are used to remove warts & skin tags. These can range from liquids to wart/skin tag removal devices.
Foot care products designed to reduce, eliminate, or prevent foot odor.
Foot arch supports are used to support foot arches to eliminate foot pain caused by health issues such as plantar fasciitis
Corn & Callus Trimmers are devices that are used to smooth rough/dry skin

A foot file is a handheld device made from gritty, exfoliating material like metal or emery that serves to remove tough, dead skin from the feet similar to how sandpaper smooths wood. A foot file can be used as part of regular foot care to help keep the feet and heels smooth as well as help remove calluses. Pumice stones can be naturally made using pumice or manmade using other materials that product the same results as a foot file.

An earplug is a device that is inserted in the ear canal to protect the user's ears from loud noises, intrusion of water, foreign bodies, dust or excessive wind. Since they reduce the sound volume, earplugs may prevent hearing loss and tinnitus, in some causes.

Ear drops are a form of topical medication for the ears used to treat infection, inflammation, impacted ear wax and local anesthesia. They are commonly used for short-term treatment and can be purchased with or without a prescription.
Earwax Removal Kits safely remove excessive earwax. They typically include some type of cleansing ear drops and a device to remove the wax.
Ear picks, also called ear scoops, or ear spoons, or earpicks, are a type of curette used to clean the ear canal of earwax.
Earwax removal candles are hollow cone candles made of wax-covered fabric. The warm “suction” is believed to remove earwax, improve hearing, and treat conditions like sinus infections and colds.
A classifier for items in "Ear Care" that do not have a dedicated PT.

Basal body temperature can be used as a way to predict fertility or as a part of a method of contraception, by helping you gauge the best days to have or avoid unprotected sex. Tracking your basal body temperature for either fertility or contraception is inexpensive and doesn't have any side effects.
Male fertility testing focuses on testing the leading causes of male infertility, which are abnormalities in a man's sperm or his sperm delivery (reproductive) system.

Charting your menstrual cycles, also known as fertility charting, is one of the best ways to learn about your body and your fertility. Fertility charting provides important insight into your reproductive health by helping you to determine if, and when, you are ovulating and which days of your cycle you are fertile.

Spermicides contain chemicals to stop sperm from getting to an egg. They come in several different forms: cream, gel, foam, film, and suppositories. Spermicides should be used with another birth control method, such as condoms or a diaphragm.
a medical test to determine whether a man may be the father of a particular child.

A pregnancy test is used to determine whether a female is pregnant or not. The two primary methods are testing for the female pregnancy hormone in blood or urine using a pregnancy test kit, and scanning with ultrasonography. Testing blood for hCG results in the earliest detection of pregnancy.
A condom is a sheath-shaped barrier device used during sexual intercourse to reduce the probability of pregnancy or a sexually transmitted infection. There are both male and female condoms
A contraceptive sponge is a soft, disk-shaped device made of polyurethane foam that contains spermicide. The contraceptive sponge is inserted in the vagina before sex to prevent pregnancy.

Personal lubricants are specialized lubricants used during sexual acts, such as intercourse and masturbation, to reduce friction to or between the penis and vagina, anus or other body parts or applied to sex toys to reduce friction or to ease penetration.

An ovulation home test is used by women. It helps determine the time in the menstrual cycle when getting pregnant is most likely. The test detects a rise in luteinizing hormone (LH) in the urine. A rise in this hormone signals the ovary to release the egg. Fertility testing is the process by which fertility is assessed, both generally and also to find the "fertile window" in the menstrual cycle.
Foot care products and treatments formulated specifically for people with diabetic conditions.

Compression gloves are used for patients with lymphedema, arthritis, carpal tunnel syndrome, and repetitive motion, these gloves provide compression and support for weak or aching hands and wrists. Compression Sleeves & Socks helps in increasing blood circulation and reduce the risk of developing blood clots or Deep Vien Thrombosis (DVT).
Blood glucose monitoring can help you identify and record changes in your blood sugar levels.

Blood glucose test strips (diabetes test strips) are a key component of blood glucose testing. These small disposable strips of plastic provide a very important role in helping people with diabetes to monitor and control their diabetes. They can be used in conjunction with blood glucose monitor.

A blood lancet, or simply lancet, is a small medical implement used for capillary blood sampling. A blood lancet, sometimes called a lance, is similar to a scalpel style lancet, but with a double-edged blade and a pointed end. It can even be a specialized type of sharp needle.
A classifier for items in "Diabetes Supplies" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Oil designed to use on beard or mustache.
Brushed designed specifically for use on beard or mustache.

Kits including beard grooming products like beard oil, beard shampoo, beard balm, beard combs & brushes, beard wash, beard apron, beard moisturizers, etc. 
(Does not include Shavers and razors)
Hair comb designed to use specifically on beard or mustache.
Beard wash is a beard care product which is specially designed for cleansing your beard and removing the bad (dirt, grime, dead skin cells) without removing the good (natural oils).
A balm intended for use on a mustache or beard to moisturize, condition, style and soften the facial hair.
A cleanser that does not need to be washed off, rinsed or otherwise removed. Can be a disinfectent, cleanser in wipe, foam or liquid form.
A commode liner is a (often absobent) cloth, plastic, or other type of liner used inside a bedside commode which makes clean up easier.

Toilet safety frames are an essential safety device for individuals with mobility issues or disabilities that require assistance with toileting. They typically fit around your toilet seat with back bar in front of your toilet tank and arm rests on the sides.

A tray or basin used for washing hair and draining into a sink or other recepticle (as in a hair salon). Also used for bedridden patients or people with limited mobility that are not able to use a full shower to wash their hair.
A sitz bath or hip bath is a bath in which a person sits in water up to the hips. It is used to relieve discomfort and pain in the lower part of the body.
A device used as a receptacle for the urine and/or feces of a person who is confined to a bed and therefore not able to use a toilet or chamber pot.
A toilet seat elevator assists users with bending or sitting difficulties by adding height to an existing toilet seat.
A sitting apparatus used inside a bathtub or shower so the user does not have to stand.

Made of a durable material, these covers can help to cover up broken bone casts, abrasions, burns, incisions, and more. They're a smart option to help keep your injury dry while you bathe, take a shower, or go swimming. Most cast covers are reusable and should last for the life of the cast or wound dressing.

A bedside commode is a movable toilet that does not use running water. It looks like a chair with a toilet seat and has a bucket or container underneath. The container can be removed for cleaning after the commode is used. A commode can be placed beside the bed if a person cannot get to the bathroom.

Bedpans and urinals are devices that allow people to have a bowel movement or urinate while they are in bed. A man uses a bedpan for a bowel movement but may prefer a urinal when he urinates. Women usually use a bedpan for bowel movements and urinating.
Bundled variety pack sets of consumable body care products like body wash, shampoo, etc.

These are refills for paraffin baths. A paraffin wax is intended to completely cover the hand (or other body parts such as the feet). Its warm temperature is meant to provide relief from arthritis pain, sore joints or sore muscles.
Paraffin Treatment Hand & Foot Mitts keeps hands and feet warm with the hot paraffin to nourish the skin.
Body powder absorbs moisture well and helps cut down on friction, making it useful for keeping skin dry and helping to prevent rashes.
Hand Creams and lotion are specifically formulated to work on hands. They are typically thicker because the hands need frequent hydration since people wash their hands frequently.
A classifier for items in "Bathing Accessories" that do not have a dedicated PT.
Bath oils helps to add a little more nourishment, luxury, and relaxation to bath time. They can also enhance skin hydration

Cotton pads are pads made of cotton which are used for medical or cosmetic purposes. For medical purposes, cotton pads are used to stop or prevent bleeding from minor punctures such as injections or venipuncture. They may be secured in place with tape. Cotton pads are also used in the application and the removal of makeup. Cotton pads are soft enough that they can be used to clean babies.
A small ball of cotton that can be used for a variety of purposes (such as removing makeup or cleaning a wound) and that is usually used once and then thrown away.

Mittens are the deluxe part of the manicure and essential to increase penetration of moisturizers applied to nails and skin for longer lasting benefits and softer, smoother skin. Softens cuticles, helps nails and skin retain natural moisture and helps prevent hangnails.

Cotton swabs or cotton buds are handheld cylinders that consist of one or two small wads of cotton wrapped around one or both ends of a short rod made of wood, rolled paper, or plastic. They are most commonly used for ear cleaning, although this is not recommended by physicians.
Bath soap is typically made up of moisturizers and cleansing agents that work together to soften skin and clean it

Bath salts are water-soluble, pulverized minerals that are added to water to be used for bathing. It is said that these salts are used to improve cleaning, enhance the enjoyment of bathing, and serve as a vehicle for cosmetic agents.
Non-invasive topical treatment / ointment (e.g., lotions, serums, creams, etc.,)  specifically formulated to prevent, reduce, and improve the appearance of stretch marks on the skin.
A toiletry bag is a portable container usually a pouch with a drawstring or zippered closure which holds body hygiene and toiletry.
A shower cap (also known as a bath cap) is a hat worn while showering or bathing to protect hair from becoming wet.

A paraffin wax bath is the container in which the paraffin wax is store prior to being used for a paraffin manicure or pedicure. Paraffin treatments are recommended for various medical and surgical hand problems and may be recommended by your hand specialist.
Scrubs off dead skin cells & embedded dirt to promote smoother and healthier skin
Body scrub is a treatment used to exfoliate and clean the skin on the body leaving it smoother and softer.
Maternity Skin Care helps in Moisturizes the skin and keeps overall appearance of skin hydrated, which could reduce the look of stretch marks.

A body wash is a liquid cleansing product for use on the body. A Shower gel is a specialized liquid product used for cleaning the body during showers. Not to be confused with liquid soaps, shower gels, in fact, do not contain saponified oil. Instead, it uses synthetic detergents derived from either petroleum or plant sources.

Hand sanitizers reduce bacteria on a surface by at least 99.9%, disinfectants kill a wider range of microorganisms (than sanitizers), and cleaners simply remove dirt, soils and impurities from surfaces.

Hand wipes are cleansing cloths that are usually moist, and intended to remove contaminants from the hands.  They may or may not contain a surfactant, antibacterial agent, and/or moisturizing element, and do not generally require the addition of water in order to function.
Petroleum jelly is a blend of mineral oils and waxes used as an ointment to moisturize and heal dry, cracked skin.

Body butter is a heavy moisturizer with a rich and luxurious texture that typically contains cocoa butter, shea butter, coconut oil, or another vegetable-based oil. Intended to be applied all over body, it's thicker than lotions and is extra effective at rejuvenating dry skin leaving it soft and supple.

Usually extracted from natural sources like plants, fruit, and seeds, body oil is a beauty treatment specifically formulated to be applied all over body to moisturize and improve the overall condition of the skin.
Mud therapy is used for giving coolness to body. It dilutes and absorbs the toxic substances of body and ultimately eliminates them from body.
The bath brush helps remove dead skin, toxins, while it stimulates blood circulation. It is excellent for use on the feet, knees, legs, among others, to leave a soft and glowing skin

In-shower body lotion is a moisturizer specifically formulated to be used on wet skin in the shower. After skin is cleansed with soap and rinsed off, in-shower body lotion is applied for a few minutes and washed off with water leaving skin hydrated and moisturized.
Pedicure sets are tools utilized to perform a pedicure. These tools are used by nail spas and can be utilized at home as well.
A bath bomb or bath fizzie is a consumer product used during bathing. It is a compacted mixture of wet and dry ingredients molded into any of several shapes and then dried.
Skin cream designed to prevent chafing (irritation that happens when your skin rubs against another part of the skin) during sports or physical exercise.
Bubble Bath products are used to create a layer of bubbles on top of a bath. They're great for adults and kids alike.

Soap labeled “hand soap” often has stronger ingredients, since it's meant to remove germs, grease, and dirt from hands. Body soap or body wash, by comparison, is generally milder than hand soap and gentler on sensitive skin.
A moisturizer to treat or prevent dry, rough, scaly, itchy skin and minor skin irritations
Tub tea is similar to bath salts or a bath soak, but contains loose, dried herbs and tea.
Loofahs help exfoliate and cleanse the skin. The poufs include an extra-long handle, which helps the sponges hang further from the faucet, allowing them to dry faster and reduce the risk of bacteria.

A deodorant is a substance applied to the body to prevent or mask body odor due to bacterial breakdown of perspiration in the armpits, groin, and feet, and in some cases vaginal secretions. A subclass of deodorants, called antiperspirants, prevents sweating itself, typically by blocking sweat glands.

Bath Pearls are filled with oil to cleanse and nourish the skin, while also adding a sweet fragrance to the room.
Bath Flakes are a highly concentrated form of magnesium chloride, a natural form of magnesium. They are an effective way to enjoy the benefits of a magnesium chloride in a bath, fully exposing and replenishing the body with this essential mineral
A stainless steel needle that is slightly thicker than a human hair. These are inserted through the skin at specific points on the body to control pain and other symptoms.

Ear seeds are seeds placed on your ear to serve as tiny acupressure devices. They’re a type of auriculotherapy, a traditional Chinese medicine technique that focuses on areas in your ear. They're thought to promote comfort and relaxation. People may use them to help with pain, vertigo, insomnia, substance abuse, and mental issues ranging from anxiety to grief. These seeds traditionally come from an herb called vaccaria but can also be made of ceramic or metal. They're placed on the outside of your ear over certain acupuncture points. They’re usually held in place by waterproof tape and stay on your ears for up to a week.

An acupuncture pen acts as a hybrid device that combines acupressure and acupuncture. Unlike traditional acupuncture treatment, acupuncture pens don't contain needles; Instead, they it uses electrical impulses to stimulate acupressure points.

In acupuncture, practitioners insert fine needles into the skin of a patient, at precise positions called acupuncture points. The model shows these points along lines called meridians, which are also shown on the model. Practitioners of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) believe that a vital energy or life force, called qi (pronounced ‘chee’), flows along the meridians. They also believe that disease is caused by an imbalance of qi, and that inserting the needles can rebalance qi and cure disease.

Acupressure rings are small (usually metal) rings made of little triangular shaped points that stimulate fingers. It applies the same principal as acupuncture but does not penetrate the skin. It provides relief by applying pressure to certain points on the body and thereby releasing tension.

Seitan is a wheat gluten is a food made from gluten, the main protein of wheat. It is made by washing wheat flour dough with water until all the starch granules have been removed, leaving the sticky insoluble gluten as an elastic mass, which is then cooked before being eaten.
A food made from fermented soybeans. It is made by a natural culturing and controlled fermentation process that binds soybeans into a cake form.

Tofu is a food derived from soya. It is made by curdling fresh soya milk, pressing it into a solid block and then cooling it, in much the same way that traditional dairy cheese is made by curdling and solidifying milk.
A savory liquid made of water in which meat, fish or vegetables have been simmered for a short period of time.
A primarily liquid food, generally served warm or hot, that is made by combining ingredients of meat and or vegetables with stock, milk, or water.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Snack Foods (All Crisps, Fruity Snack & Shelf Puddings)

productType.description: A brittle or chewy glazed usually salted yeast bread often shaped like a twisted knot.

Popcorn is a type of corn kernel that expands and puffs up when heated. It is a popular snack and is typically eaten by popping the kernels in oil or using a microwave. The heat causes the moisture inside the kernel to turn into steam, which builds pressure until the kernel eventually bursts, creating the characteristic fluffy and edible popcorn. It can be enjoyed plain or seasoned with various flavors such as butter, salt, caramel, cheese, or other spices. Popcorn is commonly consumed while watching movies or at various events and is available in many different forms, including pre-packaged bags, popcorn machines, or as a homemade snack.

Fruit leathers, also known as fruit roll-ups or fruit bars, are a type of dried fruit snack. They are made by pureeing or blending fruits and then spreading the mixture thinly onto a flat surface, such as a baking sheet or dehydrator tray. The fruit puree is then dried at a low temperature until it becomes a flexible, chewy sheet.
A snack box is an assortment of crisps, pretzels, nuts and sometimes candies all consolidated into 1 assortment box or package

Snack pudding, also known as instant pudding, is a type of dessert that typically comes in powder form and can be easily made by adding milk or water. The powder is mixed with the liquid, and then the mixture is refrigerated until it thickens into a creamy pudding consistency. Snack pudding is available in various flavors such as chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, and more. Gelatin, on the other hand, is a protein obtained from animal sources, usually from collagen found in the skin and bones of animals. It is processed into a powder or granules form that can be dissolved in hot water and then cooled to form a gel-like substance. Gelatin is commonly used as a thickening agent in various desserts, such as gelatin desserts (popularly known as Jello), fruit gels, mousses, and marshmallows.

A cracker is a flat, dry baked food typically made with flour. Flavorings or seasonings, such as salt, herbs, seeds, or cheese, may be added to the dough or sprinkled on top before baking. Crackers are often branded as a nutritious and convenient way to consume a staple food or cereal grain.
Processed fruit-flavored snack similar to gummi candies.

Seaweed and sea vegetables refer to a variety of marine plants that grow in the ocean. They are a type of algae and are often classified into three main categories: brown algae, red algae, and green algae.

Some common types of seaweed and sea vegetables include nori, kelp, wakame, dulse, and kombu. Nori is commonly used to wrap sushi rolls, while kelp is often used as a thickening agent in soups and stews. Wakame is a popular ingredient in Japanese miso soup, and dulse is often enjoyed as a snack.

Seaweed and sea vegetables can be found in various forms, including dried, powdered, or as a component in various food products such as snacks, condiments, and supplements. They can be added to dishes like salads, stir-fries, and soups, providing a unique flavor and texture.

Pork rind is the culinary term for the skin of a pig. It can be used in many different ways. It can be rendered, fried in fat, baked, or roasted to produce a kind of pork cracklings or scratchings; these are served in small pieces as a snack or side dish and can also be used as an appetizer.

Dried vegetables are vegetables that have been dehydrated to remove their water content, similar to dried fruit. This process helps to extend their shelf life and makes them more convenient for storage and use. Drying vegetables involves removing water from the vegetables, either through natural drying methods like sun drying or through the use of specialized dryers or ovens. Once dried, vegetables become lightweight and easy to store. Common types of dried vegetables include dried tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, carrots, and peppers. Dried vegetables can be rehydrated by soaking them in water or added directly to soups, stews, salads, or other dishes to add flavor and texture.

A snack party mix, also known as a snack mix or trail mix, is a combination of different bite-sized snacks that are mixed together to create a flavorful and satisfying snack. It typically includes a variety of ingredients such as pretzels, nuts, cereal, dried fruits, chocolate or candy pieces, and sometimes spices or seasonings.

A Food Gift Assortment is a collection or package of various food items that are presented as a gift. These assortments usually contain a variety of snacks, treats, or gourmet foods that are packaged together in an attractive way. Food gift assortments can be themed, such as a collection of chocolates, cheeses, nuts, or even a combination of different foods. They are often given as presents for birthdays, holidays, or other special occasions.

Puffed snacks are a type of snack food that have been made by subjecting grains or other ingredients to high heat and pressure, causing them to expand and become light and airy. These snacks are typically crispy and have a crunchy texture. The most common type of puffed snack is made from rice grains and is known as rice puffs or rice crisps. They are made by applying high heat and pressure to rice grains, causing them to undergo a process called extrusion. This process creates small, puffed grains that are light and crispy. Puffed snacks can also be made from other grains like corn, wheat, or oats. Corn puffs, for example, are made in a similar way to rice puffs, but using corn kernels instead. These snacks can have different flavors and seasonings added to them, such as cheese, barbecue, or salt.

Snack chips, also known as potato chips or crisps, are thin slices of potatoes that have been deep-fried or baked until they become crispy and crunchy. Snack chips typically have a salty or savory flavor, although there are also sweet and flavored varieties available. Some common flavors include plain/salted, barbecue, sour cream and onion, cheddar, and jalapeño. Potatoes are the primary ingredient in traditional snack chips, but there are also other types of chips made from different ingredients. For example, tortilla chips are made from corn, while vegetable chips are made from a combination of various vegetables like sweet potatoes, beets, or carrots.

Dried fruit is fruit that has been dehydrated by removing its water content, either naturally through sun drying or artificially through the use of specialized dryers or ovens. The process of drying fruit helps to preserve it for a longer period of time and also concentrates its flavor and sweetness. Common types of dried fruit include raisins, dates, apricots, prunes, figs, and cranberries. Dried fruit can be eaten on its own as a snack or used as an ingredient in baking, cooking, or adding flavor to dishes.

Rice cakes are a type of snack made from puffed rice grains that have been compacted into a round, flat shape. Rice cakes can be made from different types of rice, such as white rice, brown rice, or even flavored varieties like multigrain or wild rice. They are often gluten-free and can be enjoyed by individuals with dietary restrictions.

Crab sticks, krab sticks, imitation crab meat or seafood sticks are seafood made of starch and finely pulverized white fish (surimi), shaped and cured to resemble the leg meat of snow crab or Japanese spider crab.

Smoked fish refers to fish that has been preserved and flavored by the process of smoking. The smoking process involves exposing fish to smoke from burning wood or other materials, typically at low temperatures for an extended period of time. This method not only imparts a distinct smoky flavor but also helps to preserve the fish by reducing its moisture content. Various types of fish can be smoked, including salmon, trout, mackerel, herring, and whitefish.

Shrimp are slender with long muscular abdomens. They look somewhat like small lobsters, but not like crabs. The abdomens of crabs are small and short, whereas the abdomens of lobsters and shrimp are large and long.

 Prawns come from fresh water, and are much larger and meatier than shrimp, like a langoustine. Their meat is much sweeter than those of shrimp.
Crab meat or crabmeat is the meat found within a crab. It is used in many cuisines across the world, prized for its soft, delicate and sweet taste.

Fish are aquatic, craniate, gill-bearing animals that lack limbs with digits. The most widely-eaten fish include salmon, tuna, snapper, mackerel, cod, trout, carp, catfish and sardines. Most of these are caught in the sea or in lakes and rivers, but edible fish are also raised in ponds.

Lobsters are a family of large marine crustaceans. Lobsters have long bodies with muscular tails, and live in crevices or burrows on the sea floor. Three of their five pairs of legs have claws, including the first pair, which are usually much larger than the others.
Clams, a type of mollusks, that are for human consumption.
Used to classify seafood items that do not have their own, dedicated PT (e.g. squid, crawfish).
Seafood members of several families of bivalve mollusks from saltwater and freshwater habitats, intended for human consumption.
Oysters, a type of mollusks, that are for human consumption.

Scallops are a type of bivalve mollusk, meaning the interior muscle is surrounded by two shells similarly to oysters, mussels, and clams. Inside the shell, scallops have a white adductor muscle (the part we to eat) that opens and closes the shell, as well as a bright orange section called the coral.

Scallops are the shell-fish whose shells look like the logo for Shell oil. ... Scallops are generally sold already shucked — with the nuggets of flesh that we eat and also refer to as “Scallops” removed from the Scallop's shell. Those nuggets of flesh that we eat are actually the “adductor” muscles.

Dried fish refers to fish that has been preserved by removing most of its moisture content through the process of drying. It is a common method of preserving fish in many cultures around the world, particularly in regions with limited access to refrigeration or as a means of long-term storage.

Salt is a mineral substance that is composed mainly of sodium chloride (NaCl). It is one of the most commonly used and important seasonings in cooking. Salt is typically obtained from the sea or from salt mines, and it can come in various forms, such as table salt, kosher salt, sea salt, and Himalayan salt. Salt adds flavor to food and enhances its taste. It can also help to preserve and enhance the texture of certain foods. In addition to its culinary uses, salt is essential for maintaining the balance of fluids in the body and for various physiological functions. It is an important source of sodium, which is necessary for nerve function, muscle contraction, and fluid balance.

Mixed spices and seasonings refer to blends of various herbs, spices, and other flavor-enhancing ingredients that are combined to create a versatile and well-balanced seasoning mix. These blends are often used to add depth and complexity to dishes, and they can be used in a wide range of recipes.

Single herbs and spices refer to individual herbs or spices that are used to flavor food or for medicinal purposes. These are typically obtained from various parts of plants such as leaves, seeds, bark, roots, or flowers. Examples of single herbs and spices include basil, oregano, cinnamon, turmeric, cumin, ginger, and many more. They are often used in cooking to enhance the taste and aroma of dishes and can be used alone or in combination with other herbs and spices to create unique flavor profiles. Additionally, many herbs and spices have health benefits and are used in traditional medicine for their medicinal properties.

MSG stands for monosodium glutamate. It is a flavor enhancer commonly used in Asian cuisine and processed foods. MSG is made by fermenting starches or sugars and is typically added to dishes to enhance the umami taste, which is the savory or meaty flavor. It is known for its ability to enhance the flavors of other ingredients and make dishes taste more delicious. However, some people may be sensitive to MSG and experience symptoms like headaches, flushing, or sweating after consuming it.

A salt substitute is a product that is used as an alternative to regular salt (sodium chloride) in order to reduce sodium intake. Salt substitutes are typically designed for individuals who need to limit their sodium intake for health reasons, such as those with high blood pressure or heart conditions. Salt substitutes often contain a combination of ingredients that provide a salty taste without the high sodium content.

Pepper refers to both the spice and the plant from which it is derived. It is one of the most commonly used spices in the world and is known for its pungent and spicy flavor. Peppercorns, on the other hand, are the dried fruit berries of the pepper plant. They are typically ground into a powder to be used as a spice, but can also be used whole or cracked for a milder flavor. There are different types of peppercorns, including black, white, green, and pink, each with its own distinct flavor profile.

Lunch and deli meats refer to various types of processed and pre-packaged meats that are commonly used for making sandwiches or as additions to salads and other dishes. These meats are typically sliced thin.

Sausages and hot dogs are both types of processed meat products that are commonly consumed worldwide. Sausages are made by combining ground meat, such as pork, beef, chicken, or a mixture of meats, with various seasonings, spices, and other ingredients. The mixture is then typically stuffed into a casing, which can be made from natural materials like intestines or synthetic materials. Hot dogs, also known as frankfurters or wieners, are a specific type of sausage that is typically made from finely ground pork, beef, or a mixture of both. The meat is seasoned with various spices and flavorings, and then emulsified to create a smooth texture. Hot dogs are often encased in a thin, edible casing and are usually pre-cooked or smoked before being packaged.
Bacon is a type of salt-cured pork that is typically made from the belly or back cuts of a pig. It is a popular and widely consumed meat product in many cuisines around the world.

productTypeGroup.productTypeGroupName: Protein Snacks: Nuts, Nut Mixes, Dried Meats

productType.description: Jerky is a type of dried meat that has been cured and smoked or dehydrated to increase its shelf life. It is typically made from lean cuts of beef, but can also be made from other types of meat such as turkey, chicken, or pork. The meat is thinly sliced and marinated in a mixture of spices, salt, and sometimes sugar before being dried. The drying process removes most of the moisture from the meat, giving it a chewy and tough texture. Jerky is a popular snack and is often enjoyed for its high protein content and long shelf life.

Edible seeds are seeds that are safe and suitable for human consumption. Unlike nuts, which have a hard shell, edible seeds are typically found within the fruit or pod of a plant. They are often used in cooking, baking, and as toppings for various dishes. Some common examples of edible seeds include sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, chia seeds, flaxseeds, and hemp seeds. These seeds are known for their nutritional benefits and are often included in a healthy diet due to their high content of healthy fats, protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals.

Edible nuts are types of nuts that are safe and suitable for human consumption. They are typically enclosed in a hard shell, and their kernel or meat is the part that is eaten. Some examples of edible nuts include almonds, walnuts, pecans, cashews, hazelnuts, pistachios, and Brazil nuts. These nuts are often consumed as snacks, used in cooking and baking, or processed into various nut-based products like nut butter, oils, and flours.
A type of snack mix, typically a combination of granola, dried fruit, nuts, and sometimes candy.

Actual perishable food articles / ingredients and recipes to prepare the dishes that come as part of the subscription meal services for the customers to receive and easily cook (examples: Blue Apron, Hello Fresh, etc.)

Sandwiches, filled rolls, and wraps are types of food items that consist of various ingredients placed between two slices of bread, a roll, or a tortilla. These items are popular for their convenience, portability, and versatility. They can be filled with a variety of ingredients such as deli meats, cheeses, vegetables, spreads, and condiments. Sandwiches, filled rolls, and wraps can be customized to suit individual preferences and dietary restrictions. They are commonly found in cafes, delis, food trucks, and are also often made at home for quick and easy meals or snacks.

Pizza is a popular Italian dish that typically consists of a round, flat base of dough topped with various ingredients and baked in an oven. The dough is usually made from wheat flour, water, yeast, salt, and olive oil. It is rolled out into a thin or thick crust and then topped with tomato sauce, cheese (usually mozzarella), and a variety of toppings such as meats, vegetables, herbs, and spices.
A Japanese dish consisting of vinegared cold cooked rice in addition to various ingredients like  raw fish, vegetables, seaweed, etc..
A combination of various vegetables such as celery, onions and butter tossed with dried bread cubes, seasoning, and broth that is baked.
Edible frozen fruit, typically comes packaged.
Edible frozen vegetables, typically come packaged.

A pancake is a flat cake, thin, round, prepared from starch based batter that may contain eggs, milk and butter and cooked on a hot surface such as a griddle or frying pan, oftern frying with oil or butter

French toast is a dish made by soaking slices of bread in a mixture of beaten eggs, milk, and often sugar and cinnamon, then frying them until they are golden brown. It is typically served with toppings such as maple syrup, powdered sugar, fresh fruit, or whipped cream. French toast is a popular breakfast or brunch dish in many countries.

Packaged side dishes are pre-packaged food items that are intended to be served as accompaniments to a main course or meal. These side dishes are typically sold in supermarkets, grocery stores, or online, and offer convenience and quick meal solutions.

Packaged appetizers are pre-made food items that are typically small in size and meant to be served as starters or snacks before a meal. These appetizers are often found in the frozen or refrigerated sections of grocery stores and are designed to be convenient and easy to prepare.
A dish made from leavened batter or dough that is cooked between two plates known as a waffle iron that are patterned to give a characteristic size, shape, and surface impression.

A savory pie is a baked dish which is usually made of a pastry dough casing with a complete or partial cover also made of pastry and contains a filling of savory ingredients.

A quiche is a tart consisting of pastry crust filled with savory egg custard and pieces of cheese, meat, seafood and or vegetables.
Bite-sized breaded pizza pockets with an interior of tomato sauce, imitation cheese and various pizza toppings.
To be used for items that are a"meal" - meaning often it would include protein in addition to other foods rather than just one type of food.
Sausage on a stick that has been coated in a thick layer of cornmeal batter and deep fried.
A food made from a mixture of flour, water, and sometimes eggs that is formed into sheets or various shapes, then cooked by boiling.

Rice is a staple food and a cereal grain. Rice is typically cooked and consumed as a grain, but it can also be ground into flour or used to make rice-based products like rice cakes, rice vinegar, or rice bran oil. There are many varieties of rice, including white rice, brown rice, jasmine rice, basmati rice, and wild rice, each with its own distinct characteristics and culinary uses.
Asian-style pasta products comprising long, thin strands of dough, usually eaten with a sauce or in a soup.
Packaged and already prepared actual salads or salad leaves ready to be eaten upon opening.
Botanically grapes are berries that grow in clusters and vary from white, to purple, red, or black.
A large fruit of a plant of the gourd family, with smooth green skin, red pulp, and watery juice.
Edible fresh fruit.  Use this general PT to classify fruit that doesn't have its own specific fruit PT.
Fungal species that are either harvested wild or cultivated and used as food.
Edible fresh herbs used to add aroma and flavor to food and beverages.
An edible vegetable bulb with a pungent taste and smell, composed of several concentric layers, used in cooking.
A round, sweet, edible fruit grown on trees.
An edible typically oblong shaped fruit grown on trees with a pale green or brownish skin and firm juicy flesh.
Edible fresh vegetables. Use this general PT to classify vegetables that don't have their own specific vegetable PT.
A fruit with soft, pale green flesh that can be eaten which is botanically a large berry with a rough leathery skin, smooth oily edible flesh, and a large seed.
A long curved edible fruit that grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.

Ice cream is a creamy frozen dessert made from a mixture of milk or cream, sugar, and flavorings. It can be flavored with various ingredients like fruits, chocolates, nuts, or cookies. Ice cream is churned during the freezing process, which incorporates air and gives it a smooth and creamy texture. It typically has a higher fat content compared to other frozen desserts. Sorbet is a frozen dessert made from sweetened water or fruit juice. Frozen yogurt is a frozen dessert made with yogurt as its main ingredient. It is similar to ice cream but typically has a lower fat content and a tangy flavor due to the presence of yogurt cultures.

Ice cream wafers are thin, crispy, and often round or rectangular in shape. They are made from a sweet, flavored batter that is cooked until it becomes crispy. Ice cream cones, on the other hand, are conical-shaped containers made from a mixture of flour, sugar, and other ingredients. They are typically baked until they become crispy and can hold a scoop or multiple scoops of ice cream.
An ice cream novelty is a hand-held form of ice cream: an ice cream bar, a prepackaged cone or cup, a sandwich or any type of ice cream or ice on a stick.

An ice pop is a water or milk-based frozen snack on a stick. Unlike ice cream or sorbet, which are whipped while freezing to prevent ice crystal formation, an ice pop is "quiescently" frozen—frozen while at rest—and becomes a solid block of ice.
Ice is water that is frozen into a solid state.
A kit that includes not just one, but a variety of different foods / meals meant to be eaten in case of an emergency that often do not require refrigeration, cooking, water, or special preparation.

The Meal, Ready-to-Eat – commonly known as the MRE – is a self-contained, individual field ration in lightweight packaging bought by the United States military for its service members for use in combat or other field conditions where organized food facilities are not available. While MREs should be kept cool, they do not need to be refrigerated.
Food meant to be eaten in case of an emergency that often does not require refrigeration, cooking, water, or special preparation.
Bison is the culinary name for meat from Buffalo. Bison meat is generally a darker and leaner than beef. Overall the appearance is very similar.

Fresh and frozen meats refer to raw meat products that are either freshly sourced or have been frozen for preservation. Fresh meats are raw meat products that have not been previously frozen. They are typically sourced from animals and are sold in refrigerated sections of grocery stores or butcher shops. Frozen meats are raw meat products that have been subjected to freezing for preservation purposes. They are typically sold in the frozen section of grocery stores. These meats are often packaged in airtight plastic bags, vacuum-sealed, or placed in freezer-safe containers to prevent freezer burn and maintain their quality.
Turkey meat used as food.
Fresh or frozen poultry type meat. Do not use to classify chicken products, since Chicken has its own PT.

To be used to capture fresh or frozen, raw, precooked, or fully cooked chicken.
For deli chicken meat, use Lunch & Deli Meats PT. For chicken sausages or various shapes, use Sausages & Hot Links. For items that include chicken in additional to other various foods as part of the entire meal (e.g., chicken Alfredo pasta, chicken tenders + mac and cheese, etc. ), please use Packaged Meals.
Ground meat mixed with seasonings and other ingredients shaped into balls prior to being cooked.
Culinary name for meat from cattle.
Lamb, hogget, and mutton, generically sheep meat.
Culinary name for meat from a domestic pig.

Marmalade is a type of fruit preserve that is made from citrus fruits, such as oranges, lemons, or grapefruits. What sets marmalade apart from other fruit spreads is that it includes the peel or zest of the citrus fruit, giving it a distinctive and slightly bitter flavor.

Nut butter and spread refers to a category of spreads made from ground nuts. These spreads are typically used as toppings or fillings in various dishes, such as sandwiches, toast, or desserts. The most common types of nut butter include peanut butter, almond butter, cashew butter, and hazelnut spread.

A meat dip and spread is a type of appetizer or snack that typically involves a combination of cooked or cured meats and other ingredients that are blended or mixed together to create a flavorful dip or spread. These dips and spreads are often served with crackers, bread, or vegetables for dipping or spreading. They can be made with various types of meats such as chicken, beef, pork, or even seafood. Some popular examples include pâté, rillettes, and terrines.
A dip or spread made primarily with cheese.
A dip or spread made with mashed or pureed beans and other seasonings or ingredients.

Seafood dip and spread refers to a variety of creamy or chunky mixtures made with seafood as the primary ingredient. They are typically served as appetizers or party snacks, accompanied by crackers, bread, or chips. These dips and spreads can be made with various types of seafood such as crab, shrimp, lobster, smoked salmon, tuna, clams, oysters, scallops, or anchovies. The seafood is usually combined with other ingredients like cream cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, herbs, spices, and additional flavorings to create a flavorful and creamy dip or spread. They are often served chilled or at room temperature.

Jam, jelly, and preserves are all types of fruit spreads that are made by cooking fruit with sugar to create a thick and sweet mixture. Jam is made by crushing or chopping fruit into small pieces and then cooking it with sugar. The fruit is not strained, so it contains small pieces of fruit or fruit pulp. This gives jam a thicker consistency compared to jelly. Jelly has a firm and gelatinous texture. Preserves are made by cooking whole or large pieces of fruit with sugar. The fruit is not strained, so it contains chunks or pieces of fruit. Preserves have a thick and chunky texture, with a combination of fruit and syrup.
Guacamole is spread or dip made of mashed avocado and can include all or a combination of onions, garlic, salt, lime, chilis, cilantro and various seasonings.
A spread or dip made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic. There are variations of flavors and styles.

A vegetable dip is a savory and creamy mixture that is specifically designed to be paired with fresh vegetables for dipping. It is a popular appetizer or snack option that adds flavor and texture to raw or cooked vegetables. Vegetable dips can be made with a variety of ingredients, including sour cream, cream cheese, yogurt, mayonnaise, or a combination of these. They are often flavored with herbs, spices, and other seasonings to enhance the taste.
A thick mixture of blended ingredients used for dipping foods and to add flavor or texture that is meant to be eaten for dessert (e.g. Caramel Dip, Chocolate Dip, Marshmallow Dip).

Pate is a rich and smooth spread made from finely ground meat or fish, combined with fat, herbs, spices, and other flavorings. It is commonly served as an appetizer or can be used as a filling for sandwiches or as a topping for crackers or bread. Pâté can be made from various meats such as chicken, duck, pork, or liver, and can also be vegetarian or vegan, using ingredients like mushrooms, lentils, or vegetables as the base. It is often cooked and then blended until smooth, resulting in a creamy and indulgent texture. Pâté is popular in French cuisine but is enjoyed in many other cultures as well.

Olive dip and spread is a versatile and flavorful dish made with olives as the main ingredient. It can be used as a dip or spread on bread, crackers, or vegetables. The recipe usually includes a combination of olives, olive oil, garlic, herbs, and sometimes additional ingredients like capers, anchovies, or lemon juice. The ingredients are typically blended together to create a smooth and creamy consistency.

Sandwich spread is a spreadable condiment used in sandwiches. Sandwich spreads add flavor to solid sandwich filings (i.e. sandwich meats). They also add a little more moisture in case the sandwich filing or bread is too dry for a person's taste.;A spread is a food that is spread, generally with a knife, onto foods such as bread and crackers. Spreads are added to food to enhance the flavor or texture of the food, which may be considered bland without it .
A sweet spread made of fruit cooked to a paste, then lightly sweetened.

Salsa is a popular condiment and appetizer that is typically made from a combination of diced tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, and various seasonings. It is often served with tortilla chips or as a topping for dishes. Salsa dip can have different levels of spiciness, depending on the type and amount of chili peppers used. Some common ingredients found in salsa dip include tomatoes, onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and salt.

productTypeGroup.description: Kefir is a cultured, fermented beverage that tastes a great deal like a yogurt drink. It's made using “starter” grains, just as sourdough bread has a “starter.” This starter is a combination of yeasts, milk proteins, and bacteria.

productType.description: Milk is a nutrient-rich, white liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals. It is the primary source of nutrition for infant mammals before they are able to digest other types of food.
A dairy product made when heated milk is combined with bacteria, and left to sit for several hours at a warm temperature.
The content of the hard-shelled reproductive body produced by a bird, considered as food for human consumption.

Kefir and yogurt drinks are fermented dairy products that are consumed as beverages. They are both made by fermenting milk with beneficial bacteria, which helps to create their unique flavors and textures. Kefir is a tangy and slightly effervescent drink that originates from Eastern Europe. It is typically made by fermenting cow's, goat's, or sheep's milk with kefir grains, which are a combination of bacteria and yeast. Yogurt drinks, on the other hand, are made by fermenting milk with specific strains of bacteria, such as Lactobacillus bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus. 

Both kefir and yogurt drinks are consumed for their creamy texture, tangy taste, and potential health benefits. They are enjoyed as refreshing beverages or used as bases for smoothies and other recipes.
An emulsion of milk and/or cream, sugar, eggs, and alcohol.
Cheese is the fresh or matured product obtained by draining after coagulation of milk, cream, skimmed, or partly skimmed milk, or a combination of some or all of these products.
Cream cheese is a creamy mild-tasting fresh cheese that has the consistency of a spread.

Liquid, as the name states. They are just like your average, shell-covered eggs, but the difference between these and the eggs in a carton is that the liquid eggs have been pasteurized, homogenized and packed in a juice box. They don't have a shell and are sold in a pack

Dairy cream is a type of cream that is made from cow's milk. It is a rich and thick cream that has a high fat content, typically around 35-40%. It is commonly used in cooking and baking, as well as for making desserts and whipped cream. Dairy cream can be found in various forms, such as single cream, double cream, and whipping cream, each with different fat contents and uses. It adds a creamy and indulgent taste and texture to dishes and is a staple ingredient in many recipes.
Butter is made from churned milk or cream. Margarine is made by combining water and vegetable oils.
A cooking wine is a type of wine which is purely used while cooking and not to be consumed as a drink.
A cooking oil is a vegetable oil which is used purely for cooking.
Cooking spray is oil in a can, but not just oil; it also contains lecithin, which is an emulsifier, and a propellant such as nitrous oxide, carbon dioxide or propane.
A highly seasoned tomato sauce made with garlic and other ingredients, such as onions, parsley and other herbs.
Mustard is a pungent powder or paste prepared from ground mustard seeds. Used at the table as a condiment on meat.
Maple syrup is a syrup usually made from the xylem sap of sugar maple, red maple, or black maple trees, although it can also be made from other maple species.
Pizza sauce is a sauce made from tomatoes intended for use on a pizza.
Vinegar is acetic acid and water made by a two-step fermentation process that is used as a condiment or food preservative.
A dessert sauce or syrup is served or poured along with a dessert.
Steak sauce is normally brown in color, and often made from tomatoes, spices, vinegar, and raisins, and sometimes anchovies to add as a condiment for beef.
Honey from bees is used for food preparations as well as in garnishing.
Gravy is a sauce, made often from the juices that run naturally from meat or vegetables during cooking.
A concoction made of  ketchup, horseradish, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice served with seafood, particularly shrimp.
Syrups ranging in flavors from various fruit to caramel, hazelnuts, gingerbread, mint, etc.. These syrups can be used to add flavor to beverages or served with food.
Fish sauce is an amber-colored liquid used as a condiment in various cuisines.
a type of condiment made from chili peppers and other ingredients to add spice to food.

Tahini or tahina is a condiment made from toasted ground hulled sesame. It is served by itself or as a major ingredient in hummus, baba ghanoush, and halva. Tahini is used in the cuisines of the Levant and Eastern Mediterranean, the South Caucasus, as well as parts of North Africa.
Wasabi is Japanese horseradish and is a green paste used as condiment for sashimi (raw seafood) and sushi.

A fermented liquid condiment made from a combination of vinegar, molasses, anchovies, garlic, tamarind extract, chili pepper extract, sugar, and salt, along with other undisclosed "natural ingredients".

Ketchup is a table condiment or sauce. The unmodified term now typically refers to tomato ketchup, although original recipes used egg whites, mushrooms, oysters, grapes, mussels, or walnuts, among other ingredients.

A spread typically associated with cuisines of the Indian subcontinent. Chutneys are made in a wide variety of forms, such as a tomato relish, a ground peanut garnish, yogurt or curd, cucumber, spicy coconut, spicy onion or mint dipping sauce.
A sauce used as a marinade, basting, condiment, or topping for meat cooked in the barbecue cooking style.
A satay sauce is made of ground roasted peanuts and is used on grilled meat.
A relish is a cooked and pickled product made of chopped vegetables, fruits or herbs and is a food item typically used as a condiment to enhance a staple.
Small, oval fruits with a hard, inedible pit jarred or canned with or without the pit.
A root vegetable, cultivated and used worldwide as a spice and as a condiment.
A cucumbers that has been preserved in a solution (typically made from vinegar, water, and spices).
The un-ripened green flower buds of the plant consumed salted or pickled.
Mayonnaise is a thick creamy sauce made of egg yolks, oil and vinegar, often used as a condiment.
A liquid sauce made from a fermented paste of soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and Aspergillus oryzae or Aspergillus sojae molds.
Edible things that are added to a salad other than dressing, cheese, fresh produce or meat.
A condiment made of mayonnaise, chopped pickles and relish, caper, and herbs such as tarragon and dill. It is traditionally served with seafood dishes.
A sauce for salads, typically one consisting of oil and vinegar mixed together with herbs or other flavorings.
A marinade or simmering sauce is used to soak food items in order to enhance their flavors.
A classifier for items in "Condiments & Sauces" that does not have a dedicated PT.
An imitation maple syrup known as "Pancake Syrup" - usually made from high-fructose corn syrup and flavorings such as butterscotch, caramel, and vanilla.

Canned and jarred vegetables refer to vegetables that have been processed and preserved in cans or jars. These vegetables are typically cooked and then sealed in airtight containers to maintain their freshness and flavor for an extended period of time.

Dry beans and legumes refer to a variety of edible seeds that belong to the legume family, which are harvested and consumed in their dried form. These include beans like kidney beans, black beans, pinto beans, navy beans, and chickpeas, as well as lentils, split peas, and other legumes.
