Dry beans and legumes are typically sold in their dried form, where the moisture content has been removed. They are a nutritious source of plant-based protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals.

Canned/ Jarred beans are blanched, then sealed in cans with water and salt (as well as some additives that help the beans keep their color and texture) before being cooked at high heat under steam pressure.

Canned, jarred, and cup fruits are different forms of preserved fruits that are available for consumption. 

Canned fruits are fruits that have been processed and sealed in metal cans with syrup or juice. This preservation method helps to retain the flavor and texture of the fruits for an extended period of time. 

Jarred fruits, on the other hand, are fruits that have been preserved in glass jars with syrup, juice, or even alcohol. The fruits are typically packed in a liquid to maintain their freshness and taste. Jarred fruits can be used in similar ways as canned fruits, such as in desserts, salads, or as a standalone snack.

Cup fruits, also known as fruit cups or fruit cups in syrup, are individual serving-sized portions of fruits that come in plastic cups. These fruits are usually packed in syrup or fruit juice, making them a convenient and portable option for snacking.

Bean pastes are thick, smooth, and spreadable condiments made from cooked and mashed beans. They are commonly used in various cuisines, particularly in East Asian and Southeast Asian cooking. Bean pastes are typically made by cooking beans, such as soybeans, mung beans, or black beans, until they are soft and then mashing or pureeing them into a smooth consistency.

Applesauce and fruit sauces are both types of sauces made from fruits, particularly apples and other fruits, respectively. While they share similarities, there are some differences between the two. Applesauce is a sauce made from cooked and mashed apples. It is typically prepared by peeling, coring, and then cooking the apples until they become soft. The cooked apples are then mashed or pureed to achieve a smooth or chunky consistency, depending on personal preference. Fruit sauces, on the other hand, are typically cooked down with sugar or other sweeteners and may be thickened with cornstarch or other thickeners.
Whole coffee beans roasted in preparation for brewing.
Powdered tea refers to finely milled or fine powder tea.
Loose leaf tea is a pack of tea leaves packaged loosely in a canister or other container.

Tea bags are small, porous bags that contain tea leaves or tea dust. They are used to brew a cup of tea quickly and conveniently. The tea leaves are typically enclosed in a paper or fabric bag, which allows the water to flow through and extract the flavor and aroma of the tea. Tea bags are commonly used for making individual servings of tea, and they come in various shapes, sizes, and materials.
Instant coffee is a coffee powder which does not need any brewing and can be directly mixed with water or milk to make coffee.
A bottled coffee drink is a kind of cold coffee which is stored in small bottles or cans and sold loose or in crates.
A double strength brew that you would dilute with water before serving.
A tea pod is tea leaves specially prepared in a pre-packaged filter pouch used in a machine to make.
A coffee pod is ground coffee in a pre-packaged filter pouch that is used in a machine to make.
A bottled tea drink is tea which is stored in small bottles or cans and sold loose or in crates.
Coffee beans that have been roasted and ground for brewing.

Caviar and fish roe are both types of fish eggs that are considered delicacies in many culinary traditions. However, there are some differences between the two. Caviar refers specifically to the eggs of sturgeon fish, which are typically harvested from species like Beluga, Osetra, and Sevruga. Fish roe refers to the eggs or egg masses of various types of fish, including salmon, trout, herring, and cod, among others. Unlike caviar, fish roe can come from a variety of fish species. The taste, texture, and size of fish roe can vary depending on the type of fish it comes from.

Canned and packaged meat substitutes are plant-based alternatives to traditional meat products. They are typically made from ingredients like soy, wheat gluten, or vegetables, and are processed and packaged in a way that allows for long shelf life. These products often mimic the texture and taste of meat, making them a popular choice for vegetarians, vegans, and individuals looking to reduce their meat consumption. Canned and packaged meat substitutes can include items such as veggie burgers, meatless hot dogs, vegetarian deli slices, and canned vegetarian chili.

Canned and jarred poultry refers to various types of poultry, such as chicken or turkey, that are preserved and packaged in cans or jars. This preservation method allows for longer shelf life and convenient storage.

Canned and jarred seafood refers to various types of seafood that are preserved and packaged in cans or jars. This preservation method helps extend the shelf life of the seafood and allows for convenient storage and use.

Canned and jarred meats refer to various types of meats that are preserved and packaged in cans or jars. This preservation method helps extend the shelf life of the meat and allows for convenient storage and use.
Fudge is a type of confectionery which is usually made by mixing sugar, butter, and milk and heating it, then beating the mixture while it cools so that it acquires a smooth, creamy consistency.
A hard candy or lollipop is a candy prepared from one or more syrups boiled to high temperatures. After a syrup boiled to this temperature cools, it forms hard candy or lollipop.
Hard, round candy that is named for being difficult to bite through.
A gummy candy is a sweet which is made up of sweeteners, sour sugar and artificial colors.
Jelly beans are a small bean-shaped type of confectionery made of sugar with a hard candy shell and a gummy interior which come in a wide variety of flavors.
A spun sugar confection that resembles cotton. It usually contains small amounts of flavoring or food coloring.
A confection that features sugar as a principal ingredient. Addition of fruits will be glazed and coated with sugar are Fruit Candies.
Marzipan is a confection with a distinct strong but pleasing almond flavor and odor, consisting primarily of sugar or honey and almond meal, sometimes augmented with almond oil or extract.
A hard or soft candy that is characterized by its predominantly sour flavor.

Chewing gum is a soft, cohesive substance designed to be chewed without being swallowed. Modern chewing gum is composed of gum base, sweeteners, softeners/plasticizers, flavors, colors, and, typically, a hard or powdered polyisobutylene coating.
A type of chocolate confectionery traditionally made with a chocolate ganache center and coated in cocoa powder, coconut, or chopped nuts.

Halva is a type of confectionery originating from Iran and widely spread throughout the Middle East and India. The name is used for a broad variety of recipes, generally a thick paste made from flour, butter, liquid oil, saffron, rosewater, milk, cocoa powder, and sweetened with sugar.
Candies are filled with or coated with sweetened chocolate. Chocolate bars, either made of solid chocolate or other ingredients coated in chocolate
A candy made with caramelized sugar and nuts spread in thin sheets.
Taffy is a type of chewy candy, similar to toffee. Taffy is made by stretching or pulling a sticky mass of boiled sugar, butter or vegetable oil, flavorings, and coloring until fluffy.
A candy bar is a form of confectionery usually packaged in a bar or log form, often coated with chocolate, and sized as a snack for one person.
Chocolate-covered fruits include real and other candied fruits.
Liquorice is a confection usually flavoured and coloured black with the extract of the roots of the liquorice plant.
A type of sugar candy usually consisting of hard candy mounted on a stick and intended for sucking or licking.
A candy made of butter, sugar, karo syrup, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract.
The collection of chocolates and hard or soft candies together in a proportionate mix. The assortment may be a mix of fruit candy, taffy and any sort of chocolate assortment
Soft candy confection associated with Halloween and characterized by white, orange, and yellow layered colors.
Hard candy confection that is composed of large sugar crystals.

A mint is a candy characterized by the presence of mint flavoring or real mint oil, whether it be peppermint oil, spearmint oil, or another natural or artificial source; the sweets are often referred to as peppermints.
Chocolate-covered nuts include nuts covered with different chocolate types.
Candy that is chewy and available in a range of shapes and flavors.
Chocolate-covered snacks include snack elements like wafers, chips, crackers, popcorns etc. They are covered with various chocolate types.
Small candy confection composed of very small sugar crystals.
Toffee is a confection made by caramelizing sugar or molasses (creating inverted sugar) along with butter, and occasionally flour.
A nut or a chew can be any kind of nut like cashew nut, peanut, walnut etc.
Peppermint flavor, cane-shaped candy associated with Christmas and traditionally characterized by white and red color stripes, but there are also a variety of other flavors and colors.
Breakfast food consisting of rolled oats, nuts, and a sweetener that is often baked or toasted.  It can be eaten cold or warm and is often mixed with yogurt, fresh fruit, or dried fruit.

Breakfast bars and cereal bars are food products designed to provide a quick and convenient breakfast or snack option. They are often consumed on-the-go or when there is limited time for a sit-down meal. Breakfast bars are specifically formulated to provide a balanced and nutritious start to the day. Cereal bars are similar to breakfast bars, but they are typically made with a base of grains like oats or rice.

A grain is a small, hard, edible seed that is harvested from cereal plants. Examples of grains include wheat, rice, corn, oats, barley, and rye. Grains are a major staple food worldwide and are used in various forms, such as flour for baking, rice for cooking, and oats for breakfast cereals. They are rich in carbohydrates, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, making them an important part of a balanced diet.
Grain-based breakfast food that is often mixed with milk and eaten cold.
A thin rectangle often made of rice bran, molasses, flour, syrup, and shortening, which on one side usually has a coating of icing and filled with a flavored jelly.
Dried and ground into a coarse meal corn kernels with the hull and germ removed and then boiled.
Breakfast cereal eaten cold or hot that is made of uncooked rolled oats, fruit, and nuts.
Oat-based breakfast meal that is boiled in water or milk and typically eaten warm.

Snack bars are intended to provide quick and convenient source of snack food that might consist of grains or protein or fruits and nuts.  This is a general Product Type concept that includes a wide range of food products consumed as a snack in an easily portable bar form.
Cereal grains which are soaked or boiled in hot water and eaten warm, often with sweetener added.
A soda pop also called as soft drink is a beverage that typically contains water (often, but not always carbonated water) usually a sweetener and a flavoring agent.
Tonic water is a bitter carbonated soft drink that contains a small amount of quinine.

Sparkling water, also known as carbonated water or fizzy water, is water that has been infused with carbon dioxide gas under pressure. This creates bubbles and a fizzy sensation when the water is consumed. Sparkling water is often flavored with natural flavors or fruit extracts, but it can also be consumed plain. It is a popular alternative to sugary drinks and can be enjoyed on its own or used as a mixer in cocktails or mocktails. Sparkling water can be purchased in bottles or cans.
A pod used in a machine to make a hot chocolate-flavored drink.
Coconut water is the clear liquid inside young coconuts.
Plant milk is a general term for any milk-like product that is derived from a plant source.
Salt or sugar designed to be used to the rim of a drinking glass.
Non dairy creamers are either liquids or powders, intended as a substitute for regular milk.
Concentrated soda flavors in a syrup format.
Energy drinks contain stimulants, with caffeine as the primary source of “energy,” along with varying amounts of other ingredients.
A powdered instant drink mix to add to water or milk that is manufactured with protein, vitamins, minerals and sugar. Some breakfast drinks are already sold in a liquid form.

Bottled water is drinking water, packaged and sold in bottles, cans or packets. Flavored water is a category of beverages that are marketed as water, but which contain a wide variety of additional ingredients, ranging from natural or artificial flavors, sugar, sweeteners, vitamins, minerals, etc.
A cocktail mix is a set of non-alcoholic ingredients which can be mixed with alcohol to create cocktail drinks.
A concentrate used as an additive in the preparation of a drink. Commonly in liquid or powdered form.
A concentrated, usually sweetened, chocolate-flavored mix for creating a chocolate drink when mixed with water or milk.

Juice is a liquid that is naturally contained in fruit and vegetables. A frozen juice concentrate is a form of substance which has the majority of its base component removed. In this case, the liquid is removed since it's the base component.
A sport drink is a combination of concentrated salt and sugar to rehydrate the body, provide energy and replace electrolytes in the body.
Coffee substitutes are non-coffee products, usually without caffeine, that are used to imitate coffee.
A dense yeasted flour dough usually in the shape of a ring, made by boiling dough and then baking it.
Pizza Crust is an oven-baked, flat, disc-shaped bread used to make pizzas.

A small, round flat bread made from flour, egg, butter, sugar, salt and water. It is commonly sliced in half and toasted eaten with butter and or jam. Or as the bread for a savory meal such as an egg sandwich.
A baked or cooked dessert that is typically round, flat and sweet.
A small, usually round individual cake intended to serve one person. Its is baked in a paper or aluminum cup in a muffin pan.

A pie is a baked dish which is usually made of a pastry dough casing that covers or completely contains a filling of various sweet or savory ingredients. A tart is a baked dish consisting of a filling over a pastry base with an open top not covered with pastry.
A pastry is a baked food made with a dough of flour, water and shortening that may be savory or sweetened.
A tortilla is essentially a Mexican flatbread that is made with cornmeal or flour as the main ingredient that can be eaten hot or cold.

A sweet, baked, bread-like food, made with or without shortening, and usually containing flour, sugar, baking powder or soda, eggs, and liquid flavoring. A cake can have frosting or icing or without either.
A piece of baked or toasted bread, often cubed and seasoned, that is generally used to add texture and flavor to salads, soups, and stews.
A taco shell is either a tortilla that is hard (fried) or soft  covering which is used to prepare a Mexican dish called tacos.

A very thin, cooked pancake made from flour, eggs, butter, salt, milk and water. It is served with either sweet or savory fillings. It is a prepared pastry food product that is ready-to-eat (or heat-and-serve).
Bread is a food baked from a leavened, kneaded dough made with flour or meal, water, yeast, etc. Buns are usually small, sweet pieces of bread.
A long, thin, piece of bread that can be crisp or soft.
A pie is a baked dish which is usually made of a pastry dough casing with a complete or partial cover also made of pastry and contains a filling of various sweet or savory ingredients.
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes or other fruits.
Beer is an alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt flavored with hops.
An alcoholic beverage made from fermented apples.
A flavored alcoholic beverage is an alcoholic beverage normally containing different fruit flavors.
Liquor or Spirits is an alcoholic drink produced by distillation of grains, fruit, or vegetables that have gone through alcoholic fermentation.
A brown floury powder extracted from the carob bean, used as a substitute for chocolate.
Sugar is used at the table to sprinkle on foods and to sweeten hot drinks and in home baking to add sweetness and texture to cooked products.
An artificial sweetener is a food additive that duplicates the effect of sugar in taste, usually with less food energy.

A pie crust is the outside covering of a pie that will serve as a wrapping to keep the ingredients contained within the dessert. A Pie Crust is made from dough that is prepared with flour, shortening, butter, and water.

Marshmallow is a confection, typically consists of sugar, corn syrup, water, gelatin that has been softened in hot water, dextrose, vanilla flavorings, and sometimes coloring, whipped to a spongy consistency.
Baking cocoa is dry cocoa powder used in baking of confectionery.

Marzipan paste also known as almond paste is merely blanched almonds ground up in a food processor with sugar and a little corn syrup. The paste can be formed and colored like molding clay, making it versatile for decoration, or making confections.
Non-egg / artificial egg items to replace eggs in cooking and baking.
Pastry sprinkles & decoration are used to decorate cakes, cupcakes, cookies, candy, brownies.
A syrup or surup is a thick concentrated sugar solution.
Cubed bread that has been broken down into even small little bits and then toasted dry by being baked in the oven/toasted in a dry pan or toasted wet, with some sort of oil or fat.
A pie or cobbler filling refers to a fruit or savory filling poured into a large baking dish and covered with a batter, biscuit, or pie crust before being baked.
Lard is solidified animal fat and shortening is solidified form of various vegetable oils.
A food syrup which is made from the starch of corn and contains varying amounts of sugars: glucose, maltose and higher oligosaccharides, depending on the grade.
A cornstarch or cooking thickener is a edible product used to add thickness to a gravy without changing the flavor of the food.

A powdered egg is a fully dehydrated egg. Powdered eggs are made using spray drying in the same way that powdered milk is made. The major advantages of powdered eggs over fresh eggs are the reduced weight per volume of whole egg equivalent and the shelf life
Flour or meal combined with water, milk, etc. in a thick, pliable mass for baking into bread, pastry, etc.
Flour is finely ground form of any grain.

Yeasts and leaveners are ingredients used in baking to help dough or batter rise and become light and fluffy. Yeasts are microorganisms that produce carbon dioxide gas through fermentation, which causes the dough to rise. They are typically used in bread-making. Leaveners, on the other hand, are chemical agents that release gas when mixed with moisture and heat. They include baking powder, baking soda, and cream of tartar. Leaveners are commonly used in cakes, cookies, and quick breads.
Edible color used in food.
Extracts are made by drawing out the oils of a showcase ingredient and infusing them into a liquid base – generally alcohol. A few examples of extracts are vanilla extract or almond extract.
Small chunks of sweetened chocolate, used as an ingredient in a number of desserts and various other types of food such as trail mix or pancakes.
A flavored sweet topping used to coat and decorate cakes. Fondant & gum paste are different kinds of icing-like substance used to decorate or sculpt pastries.

Cheese wax is a special kind of wax specifically intended for preserving cheeses. It works as a seal, locking mold and bacteria out while keeping the cheese inside fresh. While cheese wax is paraffin-based, it's better suited to preserving cheese than regular paraffin wax.

Coatings and batters are commonly used in the culinary world to add a crispy and flavorful outer layer to food items. Coatings are typically dry mixtures of flour, breadcrumbs, cornmeal, or other similar ingredients. Batters, on the other hand, are wet mixtures made by combining flour, liquid (such as water, milk, or eggs), and sometimes leavening agents like baking powder or yeast.

Both coatings and batters are versatile and can be used on a variety of food items such as fish, chicken, vegetables, or even desserts like fried ice cream. They are commonly used in dishes like fried chicken, tempura, fish and chips, or onion rings.
Candy coating in a bag that is heated and poured over fruit, pretzels, etc. for a sweet snack.
Baking mixes are ready ingredients used for baking biscuits, brownies and muffins.
Coconut milk is the liquid that comes from the grated meat of a coconut.
Coconut flakes are finely shredded coconut.
Pectin is used as a thickening agent; a natural, jelling ingredient.

Condensed milk is cow's milk from which water has been removed.  It is most commonly called sweetened condensed milk because sugar is added to the evaporated milk. It is very thick, sweet, and canned.
Gingerbread house components packaged together and sold as a kit.
Baking soda sodium is an alkaline white powder that is commonly used in households for various purposes.
Evaporated milk also know as unsweetened condensed milk, is a shelf-stable canned milk product with about 60% of the water removed from fresh milk.

Solid baking chocolate, also referred to as bitter chocolate, cooking chocolate and unsweetened chocolate, is a type of chocolate that is prepared or manufactured for baking. It is used as an ingredient in desserts and in baked goods.
Baking powder is one of the most popular agents used in baking.
Heavy construction equipment designed to compress soil, gravel, and other base layer materials.
A woodworking tool that essentially makes a board of wood edge or face flat.

Powered, handheld screwdrivers intended for everyday tasks.  This is NOT the Product Type for professional or task-specific "driver" products.  DO NOT apply this Product Type to pistol grip, sheet rock, or "screw gun" driver products.
A power-tool that uses rapid oscillating movement to do an assortment of jobs; including, but not limited to, cutting, sanding, scraping, polishing, and grinding.
Hand-held power tool designed specifically to drive screws with an interchangeable "nose" and tip bit instead of a chuck.  This NOT the Product Type for handheld (powered) screwdrivers.
Handheld power tool with a fast-spinning motor tip that is used for grinding, sanding, honing and polishing a variety of materials.
An auger for boring large holes in ice, especially used in ice-fishing.
A power tool that polishes a surface.
A machine with a revolving vertical spindle and cutter for milling out the surface of wood.
A woodworking machine to trim boards to a consistent thickness throughout their length and flat on both surfaces.

A form of hammer used to drive nails into wood or other materials. It is usually driven by compressed air, electromagnetism, highly flammable gases such as butane or propane, or, for powder-actuated tools, a small explosive charge.
An electrically powered tool that uses a blade to cut material.

A power tool that can perform heavy-duty tasks such as drilling and chiseling hard materials. It is similar to a hammer drill in that it also pounds the drill bit in and out while it is spinning. However, rotary hammers use a piston mechanism instead of a special clutch.
Hand-held power tool designed to drill holes and drive screws, depending on the type of bit used.
A tool that produces a stream of sand projected by compressed air for engraving, cutting, or cleaning metal, glass or stone.
A power operated tool used to grind.
Bundle of multiple different types of power tools sold together as a set.
A power tool used to shape.
A power tool that cuts metal.
A powered handheld device that aids in accomplishing a task.

A tool that delivers a strong, sudden rotational force and forward thrust. The force can be delivered either by striking with a hammer in the case of manual impact drivers, or mechanically in the case of powered impact drivers.
Similar to the basic canister cleaner, wet/dry vacuum cleaners are designed to tackle liquid spills as well as dry dirt and dust.

A more heavy-duty version of a jackhammer. As its name suggests, its main job is to break up concrete. They operate perpendicular to the ground and can be powered hydraulically, pneumatically or electrically.
A power tool used to sand.

A tool that is fitted with a circular saw and helps you cut a circular hole into the surface of the wood pieces, which can then be joined together with the help of a wooden disc, which is also called a biscuit and slides into the holes of both wood pieces when they are placed together.

An alternative is the Festool Domino that uses a drill bit that slides back and forth in addition to spin for a domino shaped mortise.
A socket wrench power tool designed to deliver high torque output with minimal exertion by the user, by storing energy in a rotating mass, then delivering it suddenly to the output shaft.
Provides rapid hammer hits in combination with the drilling action (often used on concrete and masonry).
An electric, corded or cordless, ratchet designed to be used with a series of detachable sockets for tightening and loosening nuts of different sizes.
Hand powered device for nipping.
A tool for forming an internal screw thread.
Hand powered tool usually of hardened steel with cutting ridges for forming or smoothing surfaces especially of metal.
A device designed to bind or constrict or to press two or more parts together so as to hold them firmly.
A hexagon-shaped tool designed to be inserted and turn an item that has a hex socket.
Molds or molding material used in masonry applications.
A small board or metal sheet with a handle on the underside used to hold plaster.
A cutting tool having a sharp replaceable blade that can be retracted into a usually metal handle.
Muscle powered tools used to crimp electrical connectors or strip insulation from wires.

A hand manual tool designed to be used with a series of detachable sockets for tightening and loosening nuts of different sizes.
PT to capture items that are a stand-alone manual ratchet or a set of multiple ratchets only (no sockets).
Human powered tool that cuts or trims, often metal.
A brushed used in masonry applications.
A small pincers for holding small objects or for bending and cutting wire.
Any of various tools with two jaws for holding work that close usually by a screw, lever, or cam.
A pry bar is a hand tool used to pull two objects apart or gain mechanical advantage in lifting.
Tool used to fasten rivets.
A compact, portable device that has blades and extensions for many tools (such as knives, screwdrivers, pliers, scissors, openers, and saw blades) which can be folded into the handle.
A tool used to remove broken taps which have become stuck in the metal during the threading process.

A trowel is a small hand tool used for digging, applying, smoothing, or moving small amounts of viscous or particulate material. Common varieties include the masonry trowel, garden trowel, and float trowel.
Tool used to remove shaft-mounted parts where no spindle support is available.
A handheld device used to locate framing studs located behind the final walling surface, usually drywall.
A tool usually in the form of a short rod of steel that is variously shaped at one end for different operations.
A device used to maintain mechanically the correct positional relationship between a piece of work and the tool or between parts of work during assembly.
Hand Drills are portable drilling tools operated manually. Not to be confused with power drills that are held in the hand.
A tool with a magnetic head used to pick up nails and other metal objects on a job site.
Tools that used pressure to make a fabricated mechanical joint for joining or sealing copper tubing with a flare connection.
A tool with cutting ridges for forming or smoothing surfaces.
A device that holds a hand tool blade at the correct angle while sharpening the edge of the blade.
A classifier for items in “Hand Tools” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A manually powered tool that cuts.
A heavy usually steel-faced iron block on which metal is shaped.
A tool for shaping wood using muscle power to force the cutting blade over the wood surface.
A pointed tool for marking surfaces or piercing small holes.

Automotive filter wrenches come in multiple forms, including: strap wrenches, chain wrenches, cap wrenches (essentially large, thin-walled sockets), filter pliers, and 3-jaw wrenches.  They are primarily utilized for the removal of oil filters, however they may also be used for fuel filters for which there are often specific examples available.
A small pump for forcing grease under pressure into bearings.
A metal tool with a sharpened edge at one end used to chip, carve, or cut into a solid material (such as wood, stone, or metal).
An apparatus for smoothing a masonry surface.
A hand tool for holding, twisting, or turning an object.
A muscle powered tool used to grind.
A hand tool consisting of a solid head set crosswise on a handle and used for pounding.
A hollow internally threaded screw-cutting tool used for forming screw threads.
A collection of tools.
A tool used to drive in or down dirt or other ground material by a succession of light or medium blows.
A tool used for turning screws.

Group of tools used to drive nuts and bolts that typically include sockets and wrenches or sockets and ratchets - i.e., PT is to capture items that include a group of mixed wrench or ratchet tools and sockets.
A mechanical device used to bend pipe.
Nut splitters are utilized in situations where a nut (fastener) is damaged (usually rounded-off) and no longer viable for removal with standard tools (wrenches, sockets, etc.).
A tool used for pulling nails from wood.

A tool that attaches to a socket wrench, ratchet, or torque wrench in order to tighten or loosen a fastener nut or bolt by turning. 
PT to capture items that are one individual socket or a set of sockets only (no wrenches or ratchets)
A hand-held machine used to drive heavy metal staples into wood, plastic, or masonry.
Caulk Guns Are Devices That Help People Use Caulk, A Type Of Sealant, Effectively.
Hand Saws Are Used To Cut Pieces Of Wood Into Different Shapes.
Device used to detect motion, usually as a part of a security system or automatic lighting solution.
A single device that can both detect and alert to the presence of either smoke or carbon monoxide.
Tools used for the placement of cables.
Tool used to measure voltage.
A metal detector is an instrument that detects the nearby presence of metal.
A rotating machine that transforms electrical energy into mechanical energy.
The receptacle for the plug of an electrical device.
A switch that automatically interrupts the current of an overloaded electric circuit.

An electrical safety device that operates to provide overcurrent protection of an electrical circuit. Its essential component is a metal wire or strip that melts when too much current flows through it, thereby stopping or interrupting the current.
An instrument that can measure a variety of electrical parameters, from current and voltage to resistance
The main distribution point for electrical circuits in a structure.
The electrical tester measures voltage or current and it is suitable for both AC and DC voltage
Objects used to control the location and spacing of wires.
A classifier for items in “Electrical Equipment Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
An electromechanical device used to create an electrical connection between parts of an electrical circuit, or between different electrical circuits, thereby joining them into a larger circuit.
Device used to locate buried or hidden pipes or cables.
Devices that hold extension cords consisting of an often cylindrical reel drum that carries the wounded electrical cord within its capacity.
Device used to test the strength and connectivity of a particular type of cable or other wired assemblies.
Components that connect two runs of conduit or secure conduit to an electrical device.
A length of flexible electrical power cable with a plug on one end and one or more sockets on the other end.
An electrically operated switch. It consists of a set of input terminals for a single or multiple control signals, and a set of operating contact terminals.
Electrical test equipment sometimes known as a continuity tester and used to determine if an electrical path can be established between two points, i.e. if an electrical circuit can be made.
Sensors and alarms are devices which senses the activity and alarms, like people entering and leaving your house and can even turn lights on and off as doors are opened and closed etc.
Components of a home's electrical system that encase wire connections to protect them from short circuits.
An electrical component that can disconnect or connect the conducting path in an electrical circuit, interrupting the electric current or diverting it from one conductor to another.
A device placed in series with a load to limit the amount of current in an electrical circuit.
Objects used for the marking of cables.
Small strands of metal wires that are braided together used to provide low resistance path to electrical ground.
Devices the control the power to a light.
A flexible strand of metal employed as conductors in electric power transmission.
A device that senses smoke and provides an audible or visual alert.
Objects that connect electric equipment to the alternating current mains electricity power supply in buildings and at other sites.
Objects used to connect wires together.
A single device that can both detect and alert to the presence of only carbon monoxide.
An object used to detect either the presence or flow of water.

A raised, firm, flat, and horizontal surface. They are built for work in kitchens or other food preparation areas, bathrooms or lavatories, and workrooms in general. The surface is frequently installed upon and supported by cabinets, positioned at an ergonomic height for the user and the particular task for which it is designed.
Thin pieces of impervious material installed to prevent the passage of water into a structure from a joint or as part of a weather resistant barrier system.
A structural piece of stone, wood or metal jutting from a wall to carry a superincumbent weight.
A temporary or movable platform for workers (such as bricklayers, painters, or miners) to stand or sit on when working at a height above the floor or ground.
Metal (such as steel) that is embedded or secured to other materials so that the two materials act together in resisting forces.
A rectangular building unit composed of clay, concrete, other materials or other chemically cured construction blocks used to build walls, pavements and other elements in masonry construction.
A thin and often tapered or wedged piece of material used to level or plumb cabinets or other fixtures.
A narrow usually flat strip or thong of a flexible material used for securing, holding together, or wrapping structural components.
An object or vertical member of a railing or staircase.
Unfinished wood that has been processed into uniform and useful sizes.
Ornamental strips of material with various profiles used to cover transitions between surfaces.
The horizontal portion of a set of stairs on which a person walks.
A small thin piece of building material often with one end thicker than the other for laying in overlapping rows as a covering for the roof or sides of a building.
Material (such as boards or metal or plastic pieces) forming the exposed surface of outside walls of frame buildings
A narrow rail for grasping with the hand as a support.
A long slender usually cylindrical object used in building of a structure.
A long piece of heavy often squared timber suitable for use in construction
A board made of several plies of fiberboard, paper, or felt bonded to a hardened gypsum plaster core and used especially as wallboard.
Material used in a recess in the ground around a building to allow for installment of bigger windows in a basement either below ground or partially below ground.
Grids of material used to prevent people, vehicles, large objects or debris from falling into a storm drain.
Preframed Window & Door Screens are customised Window & Door Screens with standard measurements.
The underlying constructional system or structure that gives shape or strength to a window or door.
An opening in a wall, door, roof, or vehicle that allows the exchange of light and may also allow the passage of sound and sometimes air.
Material (such as fiberboard) with regularly spaced perforations into which hooks may be inserted for the storage or display of articles.
A vertical or inclined set of rungs or steps used for climbing or descending.
A drywall tool with a wide blade for spreading joint compound.
A decorative element that dresses-up and enhances the area around the ceiling canopy, where the wiring for a chandelier or other fixture enters the ceiling junction box.
A usually swinging or sliding barrier by which an entry is closed and opened.
Objects used to enhance the function or usability of a ladder.
Pre-assembled stairs.
A door used for the vehicle entrance of a garage.
Water cooling system is a method of heat removal from components and industrial equipment using water as a cooling agent.
The consumable or replaceable tip of a welding gun.
A hose used in the welding process.
A machine used to unite parts by heating and allowing the metals to flow together or by hammering or compressing with or without previous heating.

A tool that is used for soldering electronic components. A soldering pot typically consists of a bowl with a heating element, usually an electric stove, and a handle on the side. The item being soldered is placed in the center, and the heat from the element melts the solder connecting it to other pieces of metal.
A cart designed to be used to hold and store a welder and welding gas.
Systems able to mix two or more gases from gas cylinders to generate precise gas calibration standards, create gaseous atmospheres or produce gas mixes for research or production purposes.
Portable devices for emitting an unusually hot flame used to braze pieces of metal.

Accessory that can convert your fume extraction equipment into a source-capture configuration, act as ducting between two objects, or function as a heavy duty exhaust hose, redirecting fumes to an air filtration system or an exterior location where fumes can be vented.
Plasma cutters use an accelerated jet of hot plasma to cut or pierce through electrically conductive materials, typically sheet metals.
Fibrous material used for removing solder.
A metal or metallic alloy used when melted to join metallic surfaces.
A classifier for items in “Welding Supplies" that does not have a dedicated PT.
The tool used to melt solder when soldering.
A chemical cleaning agent, flowing agent, or purifying agent used in welding or brazing process.
Wire lengths connected to your welding machine to create an electric arc when an electrical current passes through them, and the arc generates enough heat to melt and fuse the metals.
A tool that uses gases to create a flame used to cut metal.
The detachable end of a soldering iron and is the critical part of the tool that gets in contact with the solder and the components being soldered.
A multipurpose power soldering device designed for electronic components soldering.
Welding Cable Connectors are removable cables from their welding machine and adjust the cable size to suit their needs
Personal protective equipment used by welders that have a dark glass eye shield that allows a welder to see the welding process without burning of the eyes.
Filler metals that fill in the gap between the two base metals being joined.
A metallic rod or stick of material that is used to melt down and create a bond between pieces of metal when welding.
A device which removes lingering gases and airborne residues from an area.
Flexible material mounted to the edges of a garage door to seal for air leaks.
Objects used to wrap or cover exposed pipes.
Nonconductive material used between surfaces so as to prevent transfer of electricity, heat, or sound.
Objects used, often temporarily in the winter, to improve the air sealing of a window or window opening.
Objects that help seal air leaks in areas of your home, such as doors, windows and attic access points.
Bag or carrying case designed to hold hand tools.
Sanding belt cleaners work to clean and dress sanding belts of all grits, freeing the belts of particles that lodge themselves between the abrasive grains, eventually causing a dull cut.
Durable cord connection from a hand tool to another anchor point, designed for improved safety and convenience.
Handles that can be added to shovels.
An object used to extend the reach of a drill bit.
A device positioned above an operator's workstation that will carry the weight of a tool so the operator doesn't have to.
An object used for the safe dispensing of blades.
Objects used to hold bits or drivers mounted in a drill.
Lathe tools are a category of cutting tool, designed for use on a lathe.  This includes boring bars, replaceable insert lathe tools, and solid lathe tools, amongst others.
A bench on which work especially of mechanics, machinists, and carpenters is performed.
Various items a person would use to aid in a home improvement project.
A usually tapered or cylindrical axle, spindle, or arbor inserted into a hole in a piece of work to support it during machining of a rotary tool.
Power Rotary Tool Chucks are specialized type of clamps used to hold an object with radial symmetry, especially a cylinder

Sanding belts, also known as abrasive belts, are looped sheets of sandpaper or abrasive grit used in belt sanders to grind down and remove material, or debur and buff out imperfections on wood, metal, and plastic surfaces.
Cylindrical Roller Bearings are designed to handle radial load at high performance and speed.
A structure with wheels or casters that an otherwise stationary tool can be placed so that it can be easily moved in a workshop.
Poles with a female connector on one end and a male on the other used to extend the reach of tools. The most common example is a pole used for painting to extend the reach of a paint roller.
Collets are used to hold a tool in a central position as it rotates. As the tool is inserted into the collet, the device expands and provides uniform pressure that holds the tool in place.
A collection of bits or drivers used with a drill.
Drill accessory tool that fastens a drill bit to a drilling device.
Protective covering for bladed tools.
A hose that extends from a collapsed state and is used with a dust extractor.
Power Rotary Tool Chuck Arbors is a double-ended shaft of steel, with one end machined to fit up into a machine's spindle, and the other end machined to fit into the back of a drill chuck.
A piece of a substance (such as metal or iron) that tapers to a thin edge and is used for breaking or raising hardened surfaces.
Support for the cutting tool used on a lathe.
A device that regulates pressure.
An open structure for supporting or holding sandpaper.
A device designed to provide a convenient way for workers to store and transport their tools on their person.
Objects used to sharpen the edges of steel tools such as knives through grinding and honing.
A tool that has been ground to a point to accurately position a workpiece on an axis.
Hard sided storage container for tools.

A block used to hold sandpaper. In its simplest form, it is a block of wood or cork with one smooth flat side. The user wraps the sandpaper around the block, and holds it in place. Fancier versions use clips, teeth or clamps to hold the paper in place.
Devices used to sharpen the cutting edge of a drill bit.
The cutting material used with hand powered tools.
Clamping jaws for a lathe designed for reverse chucking the workpiece.
A device for guiding a handsaw at the proper angle in making a miter joint in wood.

Abrasive Wheels & Discs are flat-coated abrasive circles that attach to a backing pad or arbor. These discs are used on smaller grinders and often come in diameters from 1.5-4 inches, ideal for tighter spaces.
The consumable cutting part of a power tool.
Conceptually a broad range of products that protect the eyes.  Typically this Product Type refers to goggles and shields.
A classifier for items in “Power & Hand Tool Accessories" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Handles for tools.
A tool used to change the size of the lathe spindle.
A frame on or in which a power tool may be placed for support.
A pair of pulleys attached to usually parallel shafts and connected by an encircling flexible belt (band) that can serve to transmit and modify rotary motion from one shaft to the other.
A rests mounted to the lathe bed and does not move with the lathe. They ensure concentricity, but limit the length of the supporting cut.
An abrasive material, often a mineral, that is used to shape or finish a workpiece through rubbing which leads to part of the workpiece being worn away by friction.
Masonry tool for cleaning bricks as well as dressing down and removing form marks from concrete.
Sharpening device designed for power tool and hand tool blades.

A trestle shaped frame support that helps to support a piece of material that is being cut either with a circular saw, hand saw, jigsaw, or some other tool, or simply helps to create a sturdy work surface for your materials.
Protective coverings that go over the top of your chimney to prevent downdrafts or rain from entering chimney.
A trough along the eaves to catch and carry off rainwater.
A classifier for items in “Roofing Supplies" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A substance applied to a roof.
A layer of material that is applied to the top of your roofing system.
An opening in a house roof or ship's deck that is covered with translucent or transparent material and that is designed to admit light.
An assemblage of members (such as beams) forming a rigid framework used to support a roof.
Plant material (such as straw) used as a sheltering cover especially of a house.
A rounded structure on top of a building's roof. Most cupolas have the shape of a dome, or even take the form of a small dome on top of a larger dome.
Material used on the underside of a part or member of a building.
Accessories used with a gutter system.
A system used to enhance the quality of air released from industrial and commercial processes by collecting dust and other impurities from air or gas.
An upright drilling machine in which the drill is pressed to the work by a hand lever or by power.
A machine in which work is rotated about a horizontal axis and shaped by a tool.
A mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume and stores it in a tank used to fill pneumatic tires and power pneumatic tools.
An arbor press is a small hand operated press. It is typically used to perform smaller jobs, such as staking, riveting, installing and removing bearings and other press fit work.
An hydraulic press is a machine press that utilizes a pressurized hydraulic cylinder in order to generate a compressive force.
The machine is used to mill flat surfaces, also used to mill irregular surfaces. Additionally, the milling machine can be used to drill, bore, cut gears, and produce slots into a workpiece.

A mechanical gasket in the shape of a torus; it is a loop of elastomer with a round cross-section, designed to be seated in a groove and compressed during assembly between two or more parts, forming a seal at the interface.
A plumbing apparatus or appliance that is designed to heat cold water and, in some cases, store hot water for future use.

A rubber or sometimes plastic seal that sits on top of the flush valve opening at the bottom of the toilet tank. It opens to allow water to flow from the tank to the bowl during flushing and then closes and seals the flush valve opening to allow the tank to refill.
Gas line tubing (often flexible) designed to connect appliances or gas-powered devices to a gas supply pipe or tank.
A pipe fitting that held the pipe content within itself by blocking the end parts.
Tool used to create a bevel on pipes or plumbing fixtures.
Photographic device used to inspect the inside of pipes.
A device that moves fluids, or sometimes slurries, by mechanical action, typically converted from electrical energy into hydraulic energy.
Protruding rims, edges, ribs, or collars used to make a connection between a pipe and a floor.
Devices integrated or attached to a pipe or plumbing fixture used to strain out debris or foreign objects.
A fitting or adapter is used in pipe systems to connect straight sections of pipe or tube, adapt to different sizes or shapes, and for other purposes such as regulating fluid flow.

A tubular section or hollow cylinder, usually but not necessarily of circular cross-section, used mainly to convey substances which can flow — liquids and gases, slurries, powders and masses of small solids.
Durable plastic piping used in plumbing environments.
A product designed to prevent the return flow of liquid or air.
Objects used at the base of a water heater to contain small leaks.
Objects used to connect water heaters to a water or power source or output.
A filtering appliance that removes calcium, magnesium and other hard minerals from the water.
The lever that activates the flushing system of a toilet.
An enclosed container for water.
A device that regulates, directs or controls the flow of a fluid by opening, closing, or partially obstructing various passageways.
A pump used to remove condensate from a pan or flow of another object.
An agent used to block the passage of fluids through openings in materials in an industrial setting.
Septic tank additive that treats wastewater using chemical or organic material to open drains, break down solids, and improve the efficiency of the overall septic system.
Pipe fitting used to reduce the size of the pipe.
Pumps that move water from one location to another.
A tool used to freeze a pipe and its contents to allow for repair of the pipe.
Valve plumbing part that diverts hot and cold water to the shower or tub.
A type of pump designed to move water in a loop from a source such as a hot water heater to a point of use and then back to the source.
A slender, flexible auger used to dislodge clogs in plumbing.
Devices used for cleaning drains.
Tool used to bore out pipes.
An underground chamber made of concrete, fiberglass, or plastic through which domestic wastewater flows for basic sewage treatment.
The handle used to flush a toilet.
Pneumatically powered tools used to clear drains.
Device used to support pipes off the ground or away from structures.

A plunger, force cup, plumber's friend or plumber's helper is a tool used to clear blockages in drains and pipes. It consists of a rubber suction cup attached to a stick usually made of wood or plastic. A different bellows-like design also exists, usually constructed of plastic.
Infrastructure designed to drain excess rain and ground water from impervious surfaces such as paved streets, car parks, parking lots, footpaths, sidewalks, and roofs.
A tap or valve used to draw off water (or other liquid) from the lowest part of a tank.
A flexible material used to seal joints or seams against leakage in various structures and piping.

Epoxy coating is a coating compound consisting of two distinct elements: an epoxy resin and a polyamine hardener. It is used for protecting pipelines, sealing warehouse floors, protects surfaces, strengthens materials, and protects from corrosion and decay.
Wall decor pieces that can be installed together to form decorative patterns and shapes.
A drop cloth is a protective sheet used to shield surfaces from paint, spills, and other materials.
General-purpose adhesive intended to for construction purposes (e.g. moulding, fixtures, tiling, flooring).
Samples of paint on a hard material.
A reusable paint application tool that is designed to be used with a paint roller cover. (To capture paint roller frames that come without paint roller cover).
A thin material, usually plastic, that is used to protect a surfaces often during a remodel or reconstruction.
A large sheet of strong, flexible, water-resistant or waterproof material, often cloth such as canvas or polyester coated with polyurethane, or made of plastics such as polyethylene.
A classifier for items in “Painting Supplies" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Solvents or tools used for the removal of wallpaper.
A liquid that is mixed with paint to make it easier to spread.
A set or a kit including paint rollers and additional accessories or tools - e.g., tray, roller frame, roller covers, etc..
Liquids used color, seal or otherwise finish raw wood.
Wallpaper is paper that is pasted in vertical strips over the walls of a room to provide a decorative or textured surface.
Brushes are a tool used for painting differrent types of surfaces by reaching into tight corners, form sharp lines.
Paint used for priming surfaces.
Tool used for smoothing wallpaper.
A coated abrasive that consists of sheets of paper or cloth with abrasive material glued to at least one face.
Paint strainers are disposable painting products designed with a fine mesh material.
A classifier for items in “Wallpaper Supplies" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Spray guns are used to apply paints and coatings to surfaces by way of a pressurized feed, be this by way of a compressed air source, or through pressurizing the coating itself by way of a pump.
A mixture of a pigment and a suitable liquid to form a closely adherent coating when spread on a household surface in a thin coat.
A class of reactive prepolymers and polymers which contain epoxide groups used to adhere objects.
An implement with a broad flat metal blade used especially for applying putty and for scraping.
Various miscellaneous one-off tools and accessories for paining that aren't covered by other existing PTs (e.g., edgers, cleaning tools, stir sticks, bucket openers, paint pads, etc.).
A roller frame covered in wool, sponge, synthetic fiber, or other absorbent material for applying paint to a surface, especially in interior decorating.
A composition of materials used to patch or repair holes in walls.
A liner intended to be used in a paint can.
A shallow container used to hold paint and allow a paint roller to be dipped in paint.
A pasty composition (as of lime, water, and sand) that hardens on drying and is used for coating walls, ceilings, and partitions.
Small amount or sample of household paint often sold with a color swatch.
A compound made of gypsum, clay, and latex resin that is used to seal wall joints or fill shallow holes.

Cylindrical in shape with hollow core cover made of wool, sponge, synthetic fiber, or other absorbent material designed to be placed on a roller frame for applying paint to a surface, especially in interior decorating.
A paint can that is empty.
Commonly used paint stored in a pressurized container and is released in an aerosol spray when depressing a valve button.
A heat gun is a device used to emit a stream of hot air, usually at temperatures between 100 and 550 °C, with some hotter models running around 760 °C, which can be held by hand.
A flexible ruler used to measure length or distance.
A weight, usually with a pointed tip on the bottom, suspended from a string and used as a vertical direction as a reference line, or plumb-line.

An instrument designed to indicate whether a surface is horizontal or vertical. 
or 
Device for establishing a horizontal plane, generally designed with a small glass tube containing an air bubble.
Object used to detect the laser emitted from a line laser device used in grade or or construction work.
A tool that measures with a laser.
Small device designed to measure the push or pull of a force and commonly displays the force units in newtons or pounds.
A device that measures pressure.
An instrument used to measure the dimensions of an object; namely, the diameter or depth of a hole.

Moisture meters are used to measure the percentage of water in a given substance. This information can be used to determine if the material is ready for use, unexpectedly wet or dry, or otherwise in need of further inspection. Wood and paper products are very sensitive to their moisture content.
A measuring instrument that can measure multiple electrical properties.
A water pressure gauge is a pressure measurement instrument that indicates the water pressure in a system.
A single wheel is attached to a handle and the device can be pushed or pulled along by a person walking used to measure distance.
An instrument that either measures an angle or allows an object to be rotated to a precise angular position.
Instruments that use chalk to layout straight lines in a construction environment.

A tool used in carpentry to lay out structures that are square, many of which are made of steel, but the name steel square refers to a specific long-armed square that has additional uses for measurement, especially of various angles.
A device that measures the amount of flow.
An instrument having at least one right angle and two straight edges used especially to lay out or test right angles.
Heavy duty crane which uses rotating horizontal beam to lift and hoist heavy loads.
Overhead device used to lift heavy objects.
Energy-powered lift which raises a mounted platform vertically in the air.
Personnel Lifts help to safely raise personnel high above ground level for applications such as maintenance work and warehouse stocking.
A stand with a roller head used to support material in a workshop.
Type of pry bar used specifically to break or open material pallets.
Rigging hardware that's used as a securement point during an overhead lift. A hoist ring functions like an eye bolt, but it also has the capability to swivel and pivot.
Plastic or steel drum used to transport chemicals or hazardous materials.
Wheeled carts with a flat deck that allows large or heavy materials to be efficiently loaded and unloaded onto or off of the trucks to move the materials from one place to another.
A device designed to bind or constrict or to press two or more parts together so as to hold them firmly while lifting.

Pallet trucks (pallet jacks) are wheeled dollies configured in a similar manner to the forks of a forklift, and containing a jacking mechanism.  The forks are inserted through (or under) a pallet, and then raised a minimal amount on integrated rollers in order to provide clearance between the pallet and the floor.  The pallet can then be transported from point to point with minimal effort.
A table used to transfer heavy loads, raise work pieces, and move items from the floor to elevated positions.
A small hand-propelled barrow consisting of a rectangular frame having at one end a pair of handles and at the other end a pair of small heavy wheels and a projecting edge to slide under a load.
Devices that aid the lifting or pulling of loads. They mount to a surface or suspend from equipment and have a grooved wheel (sheave) for guiding a rope or cable that's attached to the load.
Chain & Rope Fittings are rigging hardware that connects to chains, often known as chain fittings, includes: Shackles, such as anchor shackles and chain shackles with a rope at one end.
Device used for lifting a load by means of a drum or lift-wheel around which rope or chain wraps.
Replacement wheels for various types of material handling equipment.
Scale used to measure pallets at the shipping/receiving end of material transportation.
A device for grabbing and lifting loads by means of a device such as a hoist or crane.

A sheave or small wheel with a grooved rim and with or without the block in which it runs used singly with a rope or chain to change the direction and point of application of a pulling force and in various combinations to increase the applied force especially for lifting weights.

Loading Dock Bumpers or Steel-faced dock bumpers provide an additional layer of protection with friction of a parked trailer or truck. Heavy duty bumpers provide an extra cushion when heavy loads are in play.
A wheeled platform used for moving large or heavy objects.
A classifier for items in "Material Handling Products" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Heavy duty crane built within a gantry to lift and straddle an object.
Conveyor belting provides the surface upon which material is carried in a conveyor system.
An object that uses negative air pressure to lift.
Mobile supports for electrical cables or pneumatic and hydraulic lines that allow the cable to move with a hoist, trolley, or other mobile equipment without fouling.
A portable platform for handling, storing, or moving materials and packages in warehouses, factories, or vehicles.
A body having the property of attracting iron and producing a magnetic field external to itself used to lift objects.
Dock plates and boards bridge the gap between a trailer or shipping container and loading dock so loads can be moved safely over loading dock gaps, curbs, and other obstacles.
A band, plate, or loop of metal for binding objects together or for clamping an object in position.
A device that secures cargo using mechanical advantages.
An apparatus for lifting.
A wheeled carriage running on an overhead rail or track.
Panel Carriers are device which allows a person to carry sheets of drywall or plywood from one place to another.
Straps or rigging attached to or held by movers to assist with lifting or moving big, bulky or heavy objects.
Objects used to cover a pallet.
A pulley used in in conjunction with a lift, hoist or crane.
A tool used to raise and hold drywall into position when installing or a ceiling.

An attachment designed to fit onto straight mast and extendable-reach type forklifts to lift and move suspended loads, most typically over or under obstacles. A forklift job boom has a hook and shackle at the end of the jib for easy attachment to the load.
A self-propelled machine for hoisting and transporting heavy objects by means of steel fingers inserted under the load.
Dock levelers are attached to a dock face or installed into a loading dock pit to bridge the gap between incoming vehicles and warehouses.

Surrounding walls or wall panel enclosures (**sold separately** from the bathtub) that enclose a bathtub and prevent water from escaping.  Do not use this PT for products that include a bathtub, doors, etc. sold together as a packaged set; those products belong in the Bathtubs PT.
A bowl-shaped plumbing fixture for washing hands, dishwashing, and other purposes.
A nozzle attached to the main faucet via a hose that is mounted to the side of the main faucet.
The outlet for shower steam.
An apparatus containing a filter medium for a showerhead.
Shower stall and enclosure kit that typically includes a base and other necessary fixtures.
A fixture that consists usually of a water-flushed bowl and seat and is used for defecation and urination.
The devices used to control shower steam heads.
Stand-alone bathroom plumbing fixture designed to use water (often with spray or jet features) to wash the genital, perineum, and buttock areas.
Bidet device that attaches to a toilet or toilet seat and features a spray wand similar to a standard bidet.

Complete, ready-to-install shower drain and bottom base (or pan) unit that is installed on top of a bathroom subfloor. Do not use this PT for products that are a **complete set** with the shower base, enclosures, doors etc. sold together as a packaged set; those products belong in the Shower Stalls PT.

A toilet seat is a hinged unit consisting of a round or oval open seat, and usually a lid, which is bolted onto the bowl of a toilet used in a sitting position. The seat can be either for a flush toilet or a dry toilet.
A device for making, breaking, or changing the connections in an electrical circuit for a garbage disposal.
Wall-mounted material designed to cover the side of a bathroom vanity or counter surface.
A device used to create steam for use in a shower.
Trim fixture with handle that controls the mixture of hot and/or cold water to a shower.
The decorative plate at the base of a faucet.
A fixture for directing the spray of water in a bathroom shower that is either handheld or affixed to a wall.
The unobstructed vertical space between the water outlet and the flood level of a fixture.
A classifier for items in “Kitchen & Bath Fixtures Supplies" that does not have a dedicated PT.
Flexible water hose designed for use with a handheld shower head.
A fixed tub for bathing.
Vanity tops are countertops for the sinks which is a natural resistant to stains and scratches to a greater extent.

Surrounding shower walls or wall panel enclosures that prevent water from escaping (NOTE: this PT is for the wall panel enclosure sold **separately**).  Do not use this PT for products that are a **complete set**, ready-to-install product with the shower base, enclosures, doors etc. sold together as a packaged set; those products belong in the Shower Stalls PT.
Trim fixture with handle that controls the direction of water in a shower / bath combination.
A fixture for drawing or regulating the flow of liquid especially from a pipe.
The ball or rod shaped mechanism that is part of a toilet flush system.
A plumbing fixture used for urinating.
The base of sink.

Ready-to-install, complete shower stall package (i.e. shower kit) that may include a shower base and enclosures, but also might include doors, fixtures, and other hardware.  Do not use this PT for products that are *ONLY* a shower wall panel enclosure; those products belong in the Shower Enclosures PT.
A classifier for items in “Toilet Parts" that does not have a dedicated PT.
A bowl shaped fixture that is part of an object used for defecation and urination.
The door for a shower.
A receptacle for holding water that is part of an object used for defecation and urination.
An assortment of products used to reduce the decibel level heard when using a sink.
Toilet seat with a built-in bidet device.

Not a regular stand alone pump soap dispenser that is placed on top of countertops. Mounted soap dispensers are hardware fixtures, usually made out of metal and require installation either on the counter, wall, deck, etc..
Liner or mat designed to fit under a sink to catch drips and drops from leaky pipes, household cleaners, and the like.
An apparatus for to supply or impregnate water with air coming out of a faucet.
Set of internal replacement parts for a toilet tank usually consisting of a fill valve, flapper, and other accessories.
An automatic device for regulating temperature.
Material composing a duct -  a pipe, tube, or channel that conveys a substance.
Ventilation fans are used to circulate the air in the buildings or houses. This type of ventilation is known as mechanical ventilation in which fans or blowers are used to create movement of the air.
Devices such as a series of pipes or tubes for transferring heat from a fluid.
Air vent diverters, or deflectors, work by redirecting the air coming from the Heating, ventilation and air conditioning(HVAC) vents for optimal heating and cooling.
Electric motors used in furnaces.
A product used to mount a thermostat to a wall.
An electrical safety device that interrupts electric current when heated to a specific temperature.
Device that uses electricity to heat objects or ignite gas.
Rectangular, round and oval ducts that branch through the walls, floors and ceilings.
A product used to protect a thermostat.
A grating forming a barrier or screen of HVAC ducting.
A classifier for items in “Construction Heating & Cooling Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A building material that reflects thermal radiation and reduces heat transfer.
A space heater is a device used to heat a single, small- to medium-sized area. This type of heater can be contrasted with central heating, which distributes heat to multiple areas.
A cylindrical piece of wood.
Twine is a strong thread, light string or cord composed of two or more thinner strands twisted, and then twisted together (plied).
A piece of material prepared to be made into a key by a further operation.
Physical representations of alphanumeric characters used to display the address on a home or piece of real estate.

An Eye is a piece of fastening hardware with a loop at one end and an anchoring mechanism at the other.  The anchor is used to secure the eye to a structure, the loop then being utilized as a fixed point to which cables, chain, or rope may then be attached.
Strip of material that adheres to the door bottom for the purpose of sealing the bottom of the door against the floor.
A catch or fastening that closes or locks with a click.
Portable locks usually with a shackle that may be passed through an opening (such as a chain link, or hasp staple) to prevent use, theft, vandalism or harm.
A device for absorbing shock or preventing damage.
Product that consists of a handle and a locking mechanism for an entry door.
Items installed between the feet and floor of furniture that either effects the friction of movement.
Devices that are solid pieces or blocks of material that is longer than it is wide to help protect windows, doors, and other points of entry to a building from intruders.
Mechanical devices used to closed doors.
A doorstop is an object or device used to hold a door open or closed, or to prevent a door from opening too widely.

A barn door hardware kit contains the necessary components (or some portion of) to hang a door (commonly residential interior) in the same manner as commonly found on an agricultural barn.
They are generally designed to provide top-hanging, sliding functionality, with the door itself being suspended from some form of roller that runs on a track, attached to the wall above the door opening.
A group of yarns, plies, fibers, or strands that are twisted or braided together into a larger and stronger form.
A knob or handle that releases a door latch.
Rod couplers are hardware used to join lengths of equal size threaded rod.
Hardware intended to be used to hang framed objects on a wall.
A classifier for items in “Hardware” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Items used to signal for a garage door to open or to close.
A small chain or piece of hardware attached to the door frame, which attaches to a track on the door for security purposes.
Patch kit for fixing tears or punctures in various types of material.  The are often self-adhesive and easy to apply.
Handle used to open or close windows.
The portion of the door frame that runs along the bottom and sits directly on the foundation of your floor.
An elastic cord composed of one or more elastic strands forming a core, usually covered in a woven cotton or polypropylene sheath.
A wood or metal plate serving as a backing for a structural member.
Made of either wood or metal and it is the sloped cross piece that extends across the bottom of your door area.
An eyelet of firm material to strengthen or protect an opening or to insulate or protect something passed through it.
A relatively long rod that is threaded on both ends.
A piece of structural material that serves to strengthen something.
An overhanging member that projects from a structure (such as a wall) and is usually designed to support a vertical load or to strengthen an angle.
Piece of hardened material fastened, usually by screws, onto the frame of a doorway, and it is carefully aligned with the lockset in order to give the latch a place to sink into when the door closes.
A metal wire that is encased in a thin portion of paper or plastic and is utilized to tie the openings of packs.
A round piece of hardware for pulling or opening furniture or cabinet drawers.
A small and narrow device that's used for indexing and positioning of various components.
A fastener especially for a door or lid consisting of a hinged metal strap that fits over a staple and is secured by a pin or padlock.
The components necessary to replace a lock.
Also known as drawer runners, drawer slides are devices that allow for the horizontal movement of an attached drawer.
A jointed or flexible device on which a door, lid, or other swinging part turns.
Mechanical connection to keep a drawer or door closed at the users direction.
Optical security devices which fit through a door that allow the user visual access to the other side of the door.

A fastener that has a flexible tape section with teeth that engage with a pawl in the head to form a ratchet so that as the free end of the tape section is pulled the cable tie tightens and does not come undone.
A grating forming a barrier or screen mounted into a door.
A device that prevents a door or window from being opened to a certain point and is used for safety or security reasons.
A single ring or division of a chain.
A pin fitting into a hole in an abutting piece to prevent motion or slipping.
Mechanical fastening operated by a key or a combination.
Small framed openings with doors that are installed on an entry door to allow for the delivery of mail into the home.
Material mounted to the bottom of doors to prevent damage if kicked.
A pole or bar serving as a support or prop to a piece of furniture.
Hardware device to keep a door or drawer open.
A door knocker is an item of door furniture that allows people outside a house or other dwelling or building to alert those inside to their presence.
Kits that are used for touch-up repairs for furniture.

Counterweights or springs used to with windows. These were and are attached to the sashes using pulleys of either braided cord or, later, purpose-made chain. Three types of spring balances are called a tape or clock spring balance; channel or block-and-tackle balance, and a spiral or tube balance.
A piece of wood or other material for insertion into a mortise to make a joint.
A mesh material to be installed in window or door openings, specifically made to keep out gnats, no-see-um, sand flies, mosquitos, and other insects.
A series of usually metal links or rings connected to or fitted into one another and used for various purposes.
A piece of hardware for pulling or opening furniture or cabinet drawers.
A usually U-shaped fastener compatible with staple guns: a metal loop both ends of which are driven into a surface to hold the hook, hasp, or bolt of a lock, secure a rope, or fix a wire in place.
A garage door opener is a motorized device that opens and closes a garage door controlled by switches on the garage wall.
Component hardware pieces designed to hold something closed, attach two items together, etc.
An elastic body or device that recovers its original shape when released after being distorted.
A layer of material, usually only about 1/4- or 1/2-inch thick whose purpose of is to provide a smooth, flat surface for the floor covering.
The knee kicker carpet installer is the tool for stretching new carpet into the corners without leaving wrinkles or bulges
A tool with a larger rectangular head that’s connected by a spring-loaded lever to a series of telescoping tubes that terminate in a padded block.
ACID CLEANER is a water-based detergent for post-installation cleaning. It removes all the cement residues of grout, glue, paint, mortar, filler, plaster and building site dirt.
A collection of components necessary to build a secondary ceiling, hung below the main (structural) ceiling.
A heavy often tufted fabric used as a floor covering.
A thin piece of material typically used especially for covering floors or walls.
Interlocking floor mats (sometimes called interlocking tiles) that snap together without adhesives. They come in a variety of materials, sizes, colors, finishes, and thicknesses.
Flooring surface that is applied when it is in a fluid form, but hardens to form a decorative finish.
Various items used for flooring.
Hardware Adhesive, also known as glue, cement, mucilage, or paste, is a substance applied to one or both surfaces of two separate items that binds them together and resists their separation
Durable coating for a variety of flooring surfaces.  Coatings are designed to seal and refinish a surface and are available in many different forms: stain, acrylic, etc.
Panels or tiles used to cover a ceiling and provide thermal insulation or offer acoustic/aesthetic improvements to the room.
A classifier for items in “Flooring Supplies & Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.
A cement-based compound that evens out substrates leaving a smooth surface to bond to.
A thin mortar used for filling spaces such as the joints in masonry.

Biscuit is a small, flat oval of compressed wood that is glued into slots cut into the sides of two boards which are to be joined for alignment or in order to increase the strength of the resulting bond. A plug is a piece of material used to fill a hole.
A device that usually consists of a link with screw threads at both ends, that is turned to bring the ends closer together, and that is used for tightening a rod or stay.
A curved or bent device for catching, holding, or pulling.
A perforated block usually of metal that has an internal screw thread and is used on a bolt or screw for tightening or holding something.
Nails that are connected together in strips, so they can be fired out of a nail gun.
A circular band for holding or connecting material.
A collection of both nuts and bolts.
A radially sprung ring that is press fitted between two mating components to act as a frictional fastener.
A slender usually pointed and headed fastener designed to be pounded in.
A metal rod or pin for fastening objects together that usually has a head at one end and a screw thread at the other and is secured by a nut.
A fastener element that is inserted into an object to add a threaded hole.
A device or piece used to create or maintain a desired amount of space between two parts.
Hardware used to connect structural and non-structural elements.

A nail-shaped or rod-shaped piece with a spiral groove and a slotted or recessed head designed to be inserted into material by rotating (as with a screwdriver) and used for fastening pieces of solid material together.
A fastening device that will prevent a door from opening.
Specialty fasteners used joining separate pieces together.  Not intended for products that have their own PT.
A headed pin or bolt of metal used for uniting two or more pieces by passing the shank through a hole in each piece and then beating or pressing down the plain end so as to make a second head.
A flat thin ring or a perforated plate used in joints or assemblies to ensure tightness, prevent leakage, or relieve friction.
A piece of solid material (such as wood or metal) used especially for fastening things together or as a support by which one thing may be suspended from another.
A barrier that uses electric shocks to deter people and/or other animals.
A vertical element upholding a fence.
A covering that fits over the top of the posts on a deck or fence.
Designed to hold electric fencing materials in place so the wire or tape is effective in delivering a shock to livestock and not grounding out against a fence post.
