A classifier for items in “Decking & Fencing Hardware” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Pickets are vertical boards used in fences.
Supplies power to an electric fence.
A door, valve, or other device for controlling the passage on a deck or in a fence.
a wood or metal barrier structure of varying heights that acts as a boundary and is often used to prevent access between divided areas.
A leveling device drawn over freshly poured concrete.
Mechanical devices used to mix dry cement with water.
Apparatus used to emit with or as if with a vibratory motion on wet concrete.
A finishing tool used for a person to get onto the concrete and start the finishing process.
A long metal trough with rounded bottom and open ends used for conveying concrete to a lower elevation.
A classifier for items in “Concrete Supplies” that does not have a dedicated PT.
Mold or form designed to create a specific shape when used with concrete or mixed paving material.
Substances used to help concrete bond to other objects.
Liquids used to color, seal or otherwise finish concrete.

A powder of alumina, silica, lime, iron oxide, and magnesium oxide burned together in a kiln and finely pulverized and used as an ingredient of mortar and concrete. Also : any mixture used for a similar purpose
A plastic building material (such as a mixture of cement, lime, or gypsum plaster with sand and water) that hardens and is used in masonry or plastering.
A single tube with a power source. As the unit is pulled across concrete forms, the tube spins against the concrete.
A tool used to smooth and level freshly poured concrete surfaces.
A stiff, wooden or metal wedge or triangle, it is used to smooth and level the surface of wet concrete.
Substances used to intentionally create tiny air bubbles in concrete during mixing.

Powered devices that provide a high volume, low pressure movement of air.  Designed for the inflation of larger volume products, that do not require much more than atmospheric pressure to reach a functional state (air mattresses, inflatable watercraft, inflatable swimming pools, and so on).
The fittings are the components used for Air tools to maintain a constant flow of air and pressure within the hoses so that the performance of the air tools is not compromised

A pressure vessel for storage and containment of gases at above atmospheric pressure. This vessel can be attached directly to a air compressor pump for the formation an air compressor unit.  It can also be a portable tank used to transport compressed air for locations when power for an air compressor is not available.
The Air Inflation Coupler is used to connect compressed air tools to a compressed air line and allows the tool to be easily connected or disconnected to a hose or pipe while it is under pressure.
Devices used to remove contaminants from compressed air after compression has taken place.
Device attached to an air compressor via a hose used to control and direct the force of said compressed air.
Air hoses are used as to supply gases for various regulated applications, to supply compressed air at high pressures.
Mechanical device used to compress air. This is a component of an air compressor and not the entire air compressor.
Material used to reduce vibration of pneumatic tools when used.
A classifier for items in “Air Tool Accessories” that does not have a dedicated PT.

Air compressor pressure switches use air lines to monitor pressurized air as it moves to and from your air tank. The air compressor pressure switch measures the pressure inside the air tank and shuts off your compressor when it reaches the air pressure you need
Objects that safely and quietly vent pressurized air to atmosphere.
A product designed to help a customer organize their closet.
Items utilized to organize pantries, kitchen cabinets, bathroom cabinets, drawers, and any other cabinet organization needed.
A rack used for drying clothes after they have been washed.
A framework for holding or displaying clothes.
Hardware hook, or set of hooks designed for hanging a coat on a wall.

A clothes line, also spelt clothesline and also known as a washing line, is a device for hanging clothes on for the purpose of drying them. It is any type of rope, cord, or twine that has been stretched between two points, outside or indoors, above the level of the ground.

A clothes hanger, coat hanger, or coathanger, is a hanging device in the shape/contour of: Human shoulders designed to facilitate the hanging of a coat, jacket, sweater, shirt, blouse or dress in a manner that prevents wrinkles, with a lower bar for the hanging of trousers or skirts.
Used to protect your drawers & shelves from scratches, stains, and more.
A clothespin or clothes peg is a fastener used to hang up clothes for drying, usually on a clothes line. Clothespins come in many different designs.
A flat, horizontal plane used for items that are displayed.
Shelf products designed to be used in a storage locker.
Bathtub and shower organizers are utilized to organize items kept in the bathtub and shower spaces.
A storage compartment for clothes and valuables; usually it has a lock
Rack designed specifically for shoe storage.
Modular storage system with shelves, hooks, and other components designed for wall or ceiling mounted item organization.
Racks used to organize things.
The types of items to help the user with laundry organization.
An implement used to hang towels or washcloths.
Objects that hang and are utilized to help organize various items.

Sheds are used to store home and garden tools and equipment such as lawn tractors, and gardening supplies. In addition, sheds can be used to store items that are not suitable for indoor storage, such as petrol (gasoline), pesticides, or herbicides.
Storage cabinet featuring modular shelves and doors intended for use in a garage or utility setting.
A deck box is an outdoor-rated storage trunk or bench that helps contain clutter on your porch, deck, or patio.
A Sink Caddy is organizer for your dishwashing supplies readily at hand.
A type of plastic or wooden slatted container used for storage purposes.
These are items for storing various things. Typically for storing larger quantities of things. A chest is on the ground and typically has one opening at the top, but can also contain drawers.
Ceiling mounted / overhead storage designed for garage spaces.
A fly swatter is a device for killing insects that consists of a flat piece of perforated rubber or plastic or fine-mesh wire netting attached to a handle.
Objects used to prevent damage from moths.

An insect repellent is a substance applied to skin, clothing, or other surfaces which discourages insects (and arthropods in general) from landing or climbing on that surface. There are also numerous devices to repel insects and pests from candles to plug-in devices, and refills.

Bait is food which you put on a hook or in a trap in order to catch pests or exterminate the pest. In this PT we have traps-kill/no kill, baits to kill through poisoning, and pest killers such as spikes, sprays, concentrates, guns, vacuums
An animal trap designed primarily to catch and, usually, kill mice and rats.
Any of several types of electrically powered devices designed to kill  insects.
A specific type of laundry aid that removes stains from clothing
Sprays designed to eliminate wrinkles on fabric without ironing.

A dryer ball is a spherical laundry device for tumbling clothes dryers used as an alternative to fabric softener, reducing static electricity or softening clothing, or to accelerate the drying process.
Laundry detergent is a type of detergent used for cleaning dirty laundry. Laundry detergent is manufactured in powder, liquid, pack form.

A lint remover also known as a lint roller is a roll of one-sided adhesive paper on a cardboard or plastic barrel that is mounted on a central spindle, with an attached handle. The device facilitates the removal of lint or other small fibers from most materials such as clothing, upholstery and linen.
Sheets used in machine drying to soften fabrics and prevent static cling.
Washable mesh bag for delicates, bras, lingerie, and other items that need to be protected in the washer or dryer.
Substances that can be applied to fabrics for the purposes of removing unwanted stains.
Laundry scent boosters are dissolvable substances used in washing machines to enhance and extend the fragrance of clothes, towels and bedding.
A laundry additive designed to eliminate bacteria during the wash cycle.
Fabric treatment that adds stiffness and helps a garment stay wrinkle-free after pressing.

A fabric softener or fabric conditioner is a conditioner that is applied to laundry after it has been washed in a washing machine. A similar, more dilute preparation meant to be applied to dry fabric is known as a wrinkle releaser.
Fabric treatment that is used to add body and crispness to clothing.
Facial tissue and paper handkerchief refers to a class of soft, absorbent, disposable papers that are suitable for use on the face. They are disposable alternatives for cloth handkerchiefs.

A thin absorbent paper usually in a roll for use in drying or cleaning oneself after defecation and urination. Novelty Toilet Paper are custom toilet paper printed with jokes, stories or politician's image;For the purpose of this PT we are focused on Household Toilet Paper.
Storage bags that are disposable.

Flushable cleansing cloths are intended to be a more effective substitute for standard toilet papers.  Facial wipes, baby wipes, and feminine hygiene wipes currently have independent locations in the product type tree.
A paper towel is an absorbent, disposable towel made from paper.
Reusable fabric food storage wrap that is infused with beeswax and other oils.

Parchment paper, vegetable parchment, or, baking paper is a cellulose-based composite that has been processed to give it additional properties like non-stickiness, grease resistance, and resistance to humidity. It is commonly used in baking as a disposable non-stick, grease resistant surface.

A garbage bag or bin bag, or rubbish bag, or bin liner, or trash bag or refuse sack is a disposable bag used to contain solid waste. Such bags are useful to line the insides of waste containers to prevent the insides of the receptacle from becoming coated in waste material.
Materials used for cooking, wrapping,  and lining food when preparing or storing food
Cleaning Gloves are used to protect hands while performing household cleaning tasks such as dishwashing, or when using chemicals to clean surfaces.

Cleaning brushes are used to carry out cleaning tasks in the home such as Kitchens and Bathrooms. Cleaning brushes are used for scrubbing and can be used in places where it needs more abrasion than a sponge.
An implement that connects to a broom head or mop head for sweeping and mopping.
A typically cylindrical vessel for catching, holding, or carrying liquids or solids.

sponge is a cleaning aid made of soft, porous material typically used for cleaning surfaces, sponges are especially good at absorbing water.;A scrubbing pad or scourer is a small pad of metal or plastic used for scouring a surface. Some scouring pads have one side made of a soft sponge-like material and the other side more abrasive for scouring.

Surface scrapers are used to assist with cleaning content from pots, pans, bowls, dishes, and other kitchenware. Typically designed with a form that fits easily within the hand so pressure can be adequately applied to remove content that sticks to dishes and pans.
The head or end of the mop made of various materials, cotton, synthetic, foam, etc. which attaches to the mop handle for wet mopping or dry mopping.
A toilet brush is a tool used for cleaning the toilet bowl. The Toilet Bowl Holder holds the toilet brush, and may have a place to hold a plunger as well.
A spray bottle is a bottle that can squirt, spray or mist fluids.
A garbage can or wastebasket or waste container or dustbin or trash can is a type of container that is usually made out of metal or plastic.
Implement consisting of a mop head and mop handle, used for cleaning floors or other surfaces.

A cloth or wipes are used for household cleaning.

A cleaning cloth is a cloth used for cleaning surfaces typically made of microfiber or cotton.

Cleaning wipes are premoistened towels or towelettes that are used to clean the surface such as Stainless Steel Wipes, or Wipes to clean Glass and Mirrors.

Disinfectant Wipes are premoistened towelettes that contain a sanitizing or disinfecting formula to be used on surfaces to remove, dirt, bacteria, and viruses.
A squeegee is a tool with a flat, smooth rubber blade, used to remove or control the flow of liquid on a flat surface.

A dustpan is a flat handheld receptacle into which household dust and waste can be swept up and disposed. 

Dustpan and Brush sets are sets than contain the dustpan and the brush, which is used to sweep dirt and other messes into the dustpan.

A broom is a cleaning tool consisting of usually stiff fibers attached to, and roughly parallel to, a cylindrical handle, the broomstick. It is thus a variety of brush with a long handle. It is commonly used in combination with a dustpan.
The section of the broom made up of the bristles and held together by the cap
An implement used to remove dust from surfaces.
A container designed to hold the burning incense types safely and comfortably.
Ring-shaped diffusers that are placed on a light bulb and used to diffuse essential oils.
Incense is an aromatic biotic material that releases fragrant smoke when burnt.
Potpourri is a mixture of dried, naturally fragrant plant materials used to provide a gentle natural scent, commonly in residential settings. It is often placed in a decorative bowl.
Envelopes or packets  filled with fragranced vermiculite that diffuses through  paper or mesh.

Reed diffusers are liquid air fresheners in a narrow-necked bottle with long "sticks" inserted in to the liquid. These sticks, or reeds, absorb scented liquid from the container and release fragrance into the surrounding air.

An air freshener is designed to mask, remove unpleasant odors in the air and linen spray. They do so through a variety of delivery formats-sprays, plug-ins, stand alone, automatic dispensers, hanging bags, gel dispensers and beads. This PT includes refills for air freshener except plug in wall oil warmers.
Fragrance oils are synthetically made chemical scent compounds. Primarily used in candle making, soap making and home fragrance.
A candle is an ignitable wick embedded in wax, or another flammable solid substance such as tallow, that provides light, and in some cases, a fragrance.
Oil diffusers are devices that are used to disperse fragrance/essential oils into the surrounding air.
Wax warmers is a fragrance diffuser that uses a warmer to heat wax based home fragrance or aromatherapy oils using a tea light or electric heating source.  Not related to hair removal.
A plug-in fragrance warmer refill is used to refill plug in warmers which continuously disperse fragrance through the room, typically in oil form.
Wax melts are aromatic fragrances that are used in a wax warmer style diffuser.

productTypeGroup.description: Disposable tableware includes all disposable tableware such as: Disposable cups, Disposable Plates, Disposable Bowls, Disposable Trays, and Disposable Cutlery made of variuos material such as Paper, Plastic, Foam, and Bamboo. These products are  popular in both Residential and Commercial settings. Commercially, Fast food restaurants and in-flight meals utilize disposable tableware.  In residential settings, disposable product has proven to be very popular with consumers who prefer easy and quick cleanup after the party.

productType.description: Bowls that are made out of paper and designed for disposal after a single use.
Forks designed for disposal after a single use.
Disposable cups made out of foam.
Spoons designed for disposal after a single use.
Plates that are made out of paper and designed for disposal after a single use.
Trays to serve food designed for disposal after a single use.
Disposable cups made out of plastic. Not intended for reusable cups made from plastic.
Knives designed for disposal after a single use.
Disposable cups made out of paper.
Set including assorted disposable utensils.

productTypeGroup.description: The Cleaners Product Group Type covers a wide range of cleaning products for Commercial and Residential Use such as All Purpose Cleaners, Carpet Cleaners, Dish Soaps, Glass Cleaners. In addition, Sanitizing Wands are included in this Product Type Group.

productType.description: Detergent powder, liquid, or pods designed for washing dishes, utensils, and cookware in a dishwashing machine.
Cleaning product designed to remove pet stains and odor from carpet, fabric, and upholstery.
A liquid solution that is designed to unclog clogged or slow-running drains.
Urinal deodorizers also known as urinal cakes,are small disinfectant blocks that are added to urinals to control bacteria and reduce smell.
A cleaning solution used to clean bathroom surfaces.
Household Cleaners help in removing unwanted substances, such as dirt, infectious agents, and other impurities, from household object.
Handheld wand that uses ultraviolet (UV) light to eliminate bacteria, viruses, and other pathogens living on surfaces.
A cleaning solution used to clean kitchen surfaces.
Products designed to be applied to wood surfaces to restore shine.
Liquid chemical spray that will reduce the occurrence and growth of bacteria and viruses.
Liquid soap primarily used to hand wash dishes, utensils, and cookware.
Carpet cleaning products that are applied directly to the carpet. This classification in not intended to house carpet shampoos or cleaning solutions for carpet cleaning machines.
A cleaning solution used to clean glass surfaces.
Solution that can be applied to a fabric or solid material and will prevent water from penetrating the exterior.
Spray cleaner with disinfectant properties, which may also include deodorization or other features.
An all purpose cleaner is a cleaning solution used for everyday cleaning that can be used on a variety of surfaces and in a variety of rooms.
"default" classification object created to allow standard tagging as 'default' outside of the classification service.
Signage created for the exclusive in-store use by WMT businesses.
Lottery games in which numbers are chosen by the customer or randomly and the winning numbers are then drawn by a machine at a predetermined times and days.  If the numbers match, the player wins.
A lottery ticket or game where the fact of winning can be discovered immediately upon purchasing a lottery ticket.
Product Type specific for the redemption of winning lottery tickets.
The income derived from selling wireless products or plans.
The services delivered to an optical customer.
Automotive services that are performed on Walmart owned properties.
The services typically performed for customers that revolve around money such as check cashing or money movement.
A ticket for admission to concert or performance, sporting event, theme park and other events which ticket can be purchased in advance.
Pouches that carry pipes and pipe tobacco.
A tobacco pipe, often called simply a pipe, is a device specifically made to smoke tobacco. It comprises a chamber for the tobacco from which a thin hollow stem emerges, ending in a mouthpiece.
Fine-cut tobacco, used to make self-made cigarettes by hand rolling the tobacco into rolling paper or injecting it into filter tubes.
Prefilled or refillable cartridge for liquid substances which may include nicotine, cannabis (THC, CBD), flavoring, solvents, or other substances used in a vaping device or electronic cigarette.
Paper used for making cigarettes.
A device that produces a small flame, typically used to light cigarettes.
The hose connector component for a hookah smoking device.
Device designed to aid in packing, smoking, and emptying a tobacco pipe.
Lab equipment with two heated plates that are pressed together with enough force to facilitate an extraction.
A slim tubular device for holding a cigarette so that it can be smoked without direct contact with the fingers.
A mechanical device designed to cut one end off a cigar so that it may be properly smoked.
Pre-rolled cigarette paper similar to a finished cigarette but are without any tobacco or smoking material inside.
A portable carrier for cigars.
A machine that rolls cigarettes and packs in tobacco.
Cigarettes that usually do not contain any tobacco or nicotine, instead being composed of a mixture of various herbs and/or other plant material.
A battery for a vaping device or electronic cigarette.
A stand that holds a tobacco pipe.
An electronic device that simulates tobacco smoking.
A non-electrically powered case or enclosure for storing cigars in which the air is kept properly humidified.
Hookah coals are the fuel for your hookah and are what actually provide the heat in a hookah session that allow those billowy clouds of smoke to be produced from your flavored tobacco.
An instrument for heating or vaporizing and then smoking either tobacco, flavored tobacco, or sometimes cannabis, hashish, and opium.
A sturdy container used to store small numbers of cigarettes and prevent them from being crushed.
A receptacle for tobacco ash and cigarette butts.

A cigarette is a narrow cylinder containing a combustible material, typically tobacco, that is rolled into thin paper for smoking. The cigarette is ignited at one end, causing it to smolder; the resulting smoke is orally inhaled via the opposite end. Cigarette smoking is the most common method of tobacco consumption.
A electrically powered case or enclosure for storing cigars in which the air is kept properly humidified via a humidifier and hygrometer.
Tobacco that is chewed or held in the mouth, typically between the cheek and gums, rather than smoked.
Additional pieces that go with cigar humidors to enhance them.

A cigarette filter, also known as a filter tip, is a component of a cigarette, along with cigarette paper, capsules and adhesives. Filters were introduced in the early 1950s. Filters may be made from plastic cellulose acetate fiber, paper or activated charcoal.
Everything you need to try vaping for the first time.
A thin vinyl or rubber covering that covers the bulk of the outside of a vape pen to decorate or protect the device from scratches and other forms of light damage.
A piece of flexible wire in which tufted fabric is twisted and which is used to clean the stem of a tobacco pipe.
A rolled bundle of dried and fermented tobacco leaves made to be smoked.
The provision of care for a child by an institution or a person other than a parent or guardian.
Annual or semi-annual maintenance items that must be done before or during a specific season.
Services that clean items associated with home ownership.
A repair service for technical items such as computers or TVs
The termination or removal of unwanted insects, rodents, or other animals from a property
Services involved in the moving of households or companies.

Product insurance that is purchased at or near the time of product purchase and at regular recurring intervals to provided coverage for unexpected issues including defects, malfunctions & accidents for time periods longer than standard manufacturer warranties.
An offering or service included with the purchase of physical merchandise. For example, a month's subscription to a music, fitness, or streaming service.

A policy with the retailer that covers product failures, including those due to normal wear and tear.  Frequently a service plan (aka care plan) is a separate policy that is above and beyond the normal manufacturer's warranty.
An act or a variety of work done for others, especially for pay.
The servicing of an automobile at a customer's location.
The provision of care for an adult by an institution or a person other than a guardian.
Services to deliver a product to a customer's location. This is reserved for larger products that are not suitable to be delivered via USPS, UPS, or FedEx.
A home service that requires a person to survey the job and quote it individually.
Digital content accessed by the customer.

Product insurance that is purchased at or near the time of product purchase that provided coverage for unexpected issues including defects, malfunctions & accidents for time periods longer than standard manufacturer warranties.

A representation, especially in writing, made by a seller or company to a purchaser of a product or service that a refund, repair, or replacement will be made if the product or service proves defective or unsatisfactory, especially within a given time period.
A installation service for technical items such as computers or TVs
A service to assemble a product at a customers location.
Services to connect, mount, install, remodel or otherwise prepare a home product for use.

Gift card holders are any product specifically intended to carry a gift card for the purposes of presentation to the recipient.
These include envelopes, boxes, tins, sleeves, pouches, wallets, and so on.
Physical or digital cards that contain an amount of money available for use within a specific video game, online game, or gaming app.
Prepaid debit cards or vouchers that contain a specific amount of money available for use for a variety of purchases.
Photo Services that are offered through Walmart. This can be anything from standard photo prints to a blanket or a mug with your favorite picture on it.
This is a product type for the service of creating a customized cake.
Collectible objects and memorabilia that were originally intended for limited, short-term use.
Collectible and memorabilia coins that are **NOT** sold for their precious metal.
A autographed object that is collected by fanciers and worth far more than it was initially created for because of its rarity and/or popularity.
Items of precious metals in the form of bullion, coins, bars, ingots, etc.

Collectible buildings, also known as miniature buildings or architectural models, are small-scale replicas of real-life structures, fantasy or fictional buildings. These collectibles are often made from materials like metal, resin, plastic, or wood and are created with intricate details to resemble the original buildings.

A photo mint is a commemorative item that combines a photo and a metal or acrylic coin-like medallion. It typically features a photograph or image on one side and relevant information or text on the other side. Photo mints are often used to celebrate special events or honor individuals in various fields such as sports, entertainment, or military service. They are popular among collectors and can be displayed or stored in a protective case.

A trading card is a small card, usually made of cardboard, that features an image or picture on one side and information about the subject of the card on the other side. Trading cards  associated with sports, and can also be found in other areas such as entertainment (e.g., movies, TV shows, and video games), collectibles, and various hobbies. Trading cards are typically collected, bought, sold, and traded among enthusiasts.

Trading card sleeves and holders are protective accessories used to store and display trading cards. These sleeves and holders are designed to keep trading cards in good condition, preventing them from getting scratched, bent, or damaged.

Sleeves: Trading card sleeves are transparent plastic covers that fit over individual cards. They are typically made from materials like polypropylene or PVC. Sleeves come in different sizes to accommodate various card dimensions, such as standard size (2.5" x 3.5") for most trading cards or smaller sizes for mini cards. The sleeves often have a clear front side to showcase the card's image and a solid-colored or textured back side for added protection.

Holders: Trading card holders are more substantial and rigid protective containers that hold multiple cards. They are often made from materials like acrylic, plastic, or cardboard. Holders can be in the form of top-loaders, which are open at the top and allow easy insertion of cards, or screw-down holders, which tightly secure the cards with screws. Some holders also have built-in stands or display features for showcasing cards.
